This evil had been felt and lamented , at least three times a day , by [Isabella]109-isabella since [[her]109-isabella residence in [Bath]6-bath]1980-her residence in bath ; and [she]109-isabella was now fated to feel and lament it once more , for at the very moment of coming opposite to [Union Passage]21-union passage , and within view of [the two gentlemen who were proceeding through [the crowds]1982-the crowds , and threading the gutters of [that interesting alley]1983-that interesting alley]1981-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of that interesting alley , [they]1981-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of that interesting alley were prevented crossing by the approach of a gig , driven along on [bad pavement]1984-bad pavement by [a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of [himself]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse , [[his]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse companion]1986-his companion , and [his]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse horse]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse . “[0-i] Oh , these odious gigs ! ” said [Isabella]109-isabella , looking up . “[0-i] How [I]0-i detest them . ” But this detestation , though so just , was of short duration , for [she]109-isabella looked again and exclaimed , “[0-i] Delightful ! [mr . Morland]76-catherine and [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ! ” “[76-catherine] Good heaven ! ’ Tis [James]105-james ! ” was uttered at the same moment by [Catherine]76-catherine ; and , on catching [the young men]1987-the young men ’s eyes , the horse was immediately checked with a violence which almost threw [him]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse on [his]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse haunches , and [the servant]1988-the servant having now scampered up , [the gentlemen]260-the gentlemen jumped out , and the equipage was delivered to [his]1985-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse care . [Catherine]76-catherine , by whom this meeting was wholly unexpected , received [[her]109-isabella brother]355-her brother with the liveliest pleasure ; and [he]355-her brother , being of a very amiable disposition , and sincerely attached to [her]109-isabella , gave every proof on [his]355-her brother side of equal satisfaction , which [he]355-her brother could have leisure to do , while the bright eyes of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe were incessantly challenging [his]355-her brother notice ; and to [her]109-isabella [his]355-her brother devoirs were speedily paid , with a mixture of joy and embarrassment which might have informed [Catherine]76-catherine , had [she]109-isabella been more expert in the development of [other people]1692-other people ’s feelings , and less simply engrossed by [her]109-isabella own , that [[her]109-isabella brother]355-her brother thought [[her]109-isabella friend]1769-her friend quite as pretty as [she]109-isabella could do [herself]109-isabella . [John Thorpe]99-john [, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses , soon joined [them]1995-them , and from [him]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses [she]109-isabella directly received the amends which were [her]109-isabella due ; for while [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses slightly and carelessly touched the hand of [Isabella]109-isabella , on [her]109-isabella [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses bestowed a whole scrape and half a short bow . [He]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses was [a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form]1996-a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form , seemed fearful of being too handsome unless [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses wore the dress of [a groom]1997-a groom , and too much like [a gentleman]1839-a gentleman unless [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses were easy where [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses ought to be civil , and impudent where [he]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses might be allowed to be easy . [He]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses took out [his]1994-, who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses watch : “[105-james] How long do [you]420-you think [we]421-we have been running it from [Tetbury]23-tetbury , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not know the distance . ” [[Her]86-miss morland brother]355-her brother told [her]86-miss morland that it was twenty - three miles . “[0-i] _ Three_-and - twenty ! ” cried [Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , “[0-i] five - and - twenty if it is an inch . ” [Morland]86-miss morland remonstrated , pleaded the authority of road - books , [innkeepers]2000-innkeepers , and [milestones]2001-milestones ; but [[his]0-i friend]2002-his friend disregarded them all ; [he]0-i had a surer test of distance . “[0-i] [I]0-i know it must be five - and - twenty , ” said [he]0-i , “[0-i] by the time [we]421-we have been doing it . It is now half after one ; [we]421-we drove out of [the inn - yard]422-the inn - yard at [Tetbury]23-tetbury as the town clock struck eleven ; and [I]0-i defy [any man in [England]3-england]423-any man in england to make [my]0-i horse go less than ten miles an hour in harness ; that makes it exactly twenty - five . ” “[424-you] [You]424-you have lost an hour , ” said [Morland]86-miss morland ; “[424-you] it was only ten o’clock when [we]421-we came from [Tetbury]23-tetbury . ” “[424-you] Ten o’clock ! it was eleven , upon [my]0-i soul ! [i]0-i counted every stroke . [This brother of yours]425-this brother of yours would persuade [me]0-i out of [my]0-i senses , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ; do but look at [my]0-i horse ; did [you]424-you ever see an animal so made for speed in [your]424-you life ? ” ( [The servant]1988-the servant had just mounted [the carriage]2004-the carriage and was driving off . ) “[424-you] Such true blood ! three hours and and a half indeed coming only three and twenty miles ! look at that creature , and suppose it possible if [you]424-you can . ” “[426-he] [He]426-he _ does _ look very hot , to be sure . ” “[426-he] Hot ! [he]426-he had not turned a hair till [we]421-we came to [Walcot Church]24-walcot church ; but look at [his]426-he forehand ; look at [his]426-he loins ; only see how [he]426-he moves ; that horse _ can not _ go less than ten miles an hour : tie [his]426-he legs and [he]426-he will get on . What do [you]424-you think of [my]0-i gig , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ? A neat one , is not it ? Well hung ; [town]427-town - built ; [I]0-i have not had it a month . [It]428-it was built for [a Christchurch man]429-a christchurch man , [a friend of [mine]0-i]430-a friend of mine , [a very good sort of fellow]431-a very good sort of fellow ; [he]429-a christchurch man ran [it]428-it a few weeks , till , [I]0-i believe , it was convenient to have done with it . [I]0-i happened just then to be looking out for some light thing of the kind , though [I]0-i had pretty well determined on a curricle too ; but [I]0-i chanced to meet [him]429-a christchurch man on [Magdalen Bridge]25-magdalen bridge , as [he]429-a christchurch man was driving into [Oxford]11-oxford , last term : ‘ Ah ! thorpe , ’ said [he]429-a christchurch man , ‘ do [you]0-i happen to want such a little thing as this ? It is a capital one of the kind , but [I]0-i am cursed tired of it . ’ ‘ Oh ! d — , ’ said [I]0-i ; ‘ [I]0-i am [[your]0-i man]432-your man ; what do [you]0-i ask ? ’ And how much do [you]0-i think [he]429-a christchurch man did , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i can not guess at all . ” “[0-i] Curricle - hung , [you]0-i see ; seat , trunk , sword - case , splashing - board , lamps , silver moulding , all [you]0-i see complete ; the iron - work as good as new , or better . [He]429-a christchurch man asked fifty guineas ; [I]0-i closed with [him]429-a christchurch man directly , threw down the money , and [the carriage]2004-the carriage was [mine]0-i . ” “[0-i] And [I]0-i am sure , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , “[0-i] [I]0-i know so little of such things that [I]0-i can not judge whether it was cheap or dear . ” “[0-i] Neither one nor t’other ; [I]0-i might have got it for less , [I]0-i dare say ; but [I]0-i hate haggling , and poor [Freeman]118-freeman wanted cash . ” “[118-freeman] That was very good - natured of [you]0-i , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , quite pleased . “[0-i] Oh ! d — — it , when [one]305-one has the means of doing a kind thing by [a friend]1896-a friend , [I]0-i hate to be pitiful . ” An inquiry now took place into the intended movements of [the young ladies]2005-the young ladies ; and , on finding whither [they]2005-the young ladies were going , it was decided that [the gentlemen]260-the gentlemen should accompany [them]2005-the young ladies to [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings , and pay [their]2005-the young ladies respects to [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe . [James]105-james and [Isabella]109-isabella led the way ; and so well satisfied was [the latter]214-the latter with [her]98-mrs. thorpe lot , so contentedly was [she]98-mrs. thorpe endeavouring to ensure a pleasant walk to [him]214-the latter who brought the double recommendation of being [[[her]98-mrs. thorpe brother]355-her brother ’s friend , and [[her]98-mrs. thorpe friend]1769-her friend ’s brother]2010-her brother ’s friend , and her friend ’s brother , so pure and uncoquettish were [her]98-mrs. thorpe feelings , that , though [they]2005-the young ladies overtook and passed [the two offending young men]2012-the two offending young men in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , [she]98-mrs. thorpe was so far from seeking to attract [their]2012-the two offending young men notice , that [she]98-mrs. thorpe looked back at [them]2012-the two offending young men only three times . [John Thorpe]99-john kept of course with [Catherine]76-catherine , and , after a few minutes ’ silence , renewed the conversation about [his]0-i gig . “[436-you] [You]436-you will find , however , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , it would be reckoned a cheap thing by [some people]437-some people , for [I]0-i might have sold it for ten guineas more the next day ; [Jackson]119-jackson , of [Oriel]26-oriel , bid [me]0-i sixty at once ; [Morland]86-miss morland was with [me]0-i at the time . ” “[86-miss morland] Yes , ” said [Morland]86-miss morland , who overheard this ; “[86-miss morland] but [you]436-you forget that [your]436-you horse was included . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i horse ! oh , d — — it ! [i]0-i would not sell [my]0-i horse for a hundred . Are [you]436-you fond of [an open carriage]438-an open carriage , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ? ” “[436-you] Yes , very ; [I]0-i have hardly ever an opportunity of being in one ; but [I]0-i am particularly fond of it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am glad of it ; [I]0-i will drive [you]436-you out in [mine]0-i every day . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]436-you , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , in some distress , from a doubt of the propriety of accepting such an offer . “[436-you] [I]0-i will drive [you]436-you up [Lansdown Hill]27-lansdown hill to - morrow . ” “[436-you] Thank [you]436-you ; but will not [your]436-you horse want rest ? ” “[439-he] Rest ! [he]439-he has only come three and twenty miles to - day ; all nonsense ; nothing ruins horses so much as rest ; nothing knocks [them]440-them up so soon . No , no ; [I]0-i shall exercise mine at the average of four hours every day while [I]0-i am [here]1743-here . ” “[436-you] Shall [you]436-you indeed ! ” said [Catherine]76-catherine very seriously . “[436-you] That will be forty miles a day . ” “[436-you] Forty ! aye , fifty , for what [I]0-i care . Well , [I]0-i will drive [you]436-you up [Lansdown]28-lansdown to - morrow ; mind , [I]0-i am engaged . ” “[0-i] How delightful that will be ! ” cried [Isabella]109-isabella , turning round . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dearest]366-my dearest [Catherine]76-catherine , [I]0-i quite envy [you]76-catherine ; but [I]0-i am afraid , [brother]443-brother , [you]76-catherine will not have room for a third . ” “[0-i] A third indeed ! no , no ; [I]0-i did not come to [Bath]6-bath to drive [[my]0-i sisters]444-my sisters about ; that would be a good joke , faith ! [morland]76-catherine must take care of [you]76-catherine . ” This brought on a dialogue of civilities between [the other two]2013-the other two ; but [Catherine]76-catherine heard neither the particulars nor the result . [[Her]366-my dearest companion]2014-her companion ’s discourse now sunk from its hitherto animated pitch to nothing more than a short decisive sentence of praise or condemnation on the face of [every woman [they]2013-the other two met]2015-every woman they met ; and [Catherine]76-catherine , after listening and agreeing as long as [she]366-my dearest could , with all the civility and deference of [the youthful female mind]2016-the youthful female mind , fearful of hazarding an opinion of its own in opposition to that of [a self - assured man]2017-a self - assured man , especially where the beauty of [her]366-my dearest own sex is concerned , ventured at length to vary the subject by a question which had been long uppermost in [her]366-my dearest thoughts ; it was , “[76-catherine] Have [you]76-catherine ever read [Udolpho]110-udolpho , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ? ” “[110-udolpho] [Udolpho]110-udolpho ! oh , [Lord]445-lord ! not [I]0-i ; [I]0-i never read novels ; [I]0-i have something else to do . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , humbled and ashamed , was going to apologize for [her]366-my dearest question , but [he]0-i prevented [her]366-my dearest by saying , “[0-i] Novels are all so full of nonsense and stuff ; there has not been a tolerably decent one come out since [Tom Jones]121-tom jones , except [The Monk]122-the monk ; [I]0-i read that t’other day ; but as for all the others , they are the stupidest things in creation . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]76-catherine must like [Udolpho]110-udolpho , if [you]76-catherine were to read it ; it is so very interesting . ” “[0-i] Not [I]0-i , faith ! no , if [I]0-i read any , it shall be [Mrs. Radcliffe]123-mrs. radcliffe ’s ; [her]123-mrs. radcliffe novels are amusing enough ; they are worth reading ; some fun and nature in _ them _ . ” “[123-mrs. radcliffe] Udolpho was written by [Mrs. Radcliffe]123-mrs. radcliffe , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , with some hesitation , from the fear of mortifying [him]0-i . “[123-mrs. radcliffe] No , sure ; was it ? Aye , [I]0-i remember , so it was ; [I]0-i was thinking of that other stupid book , written by [that woman [they]447-they make such a fuss about , [she]446-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant who married [the French emigrant]448-the french emigrant]446-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant . ” “[108-camilla] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i mean [Camilla]108-camilla ? ” “[108-camilla] Yes , that ’s the book ; such unnatural stuff ! [an old man playing at see - saw]449-an old man playing at see - saw , [I]0-i took up the first volume once and looked it over , but [I]0-i soon found it would not do ; indeed [I]0-i guessed what sort of stuff it must be before [I]0-i saw it : as soon as [I]0-i heard [she]123-mrs. radcliffe had married [an emigrant]450-an emigrant , [I]0-i was sure [I]0-i should never be able to get through it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have never read it . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i had no loss , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i ; it is the horridest nonsense [you]0-i can imagine ; there is nothing in [the world]215-the world in it but [an old man]452-an old man ’s playing at see - saw and learning Latin ; upon [my]0-i soul there is not . ” This critique , the justness of which was unfortunately lost on poor [Catherine]76-catherine , brought [them]2018-them to the door of [[Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe ’s lodgings]2019-mrs. thorpe ’s lodgings , and the feelings of [the discerning and unprejudiced reader of [Camilla]108-camilla]2020-the discerning and unprejudiced reader of camilla gave way to the feelings of [the dutiful and affectionate son]2021-the dutiful and affectionate son , as [they]2018-them met [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , who had descried [them]2018-them from above , in [the passage]2022-the passage . “[124-mother] Ah , [Mother]124-mother ! How do [you]124-mother do ? ” said [he]0-i , giving [her]124-mother a hearty shake of the hand . “[124-mother] Where did [you]124-mother get that quiz of a hat ? It makes [you]124-mother look like [an old witch]453-an old witch . Here is [Morland]76-catherine and [I]0-i come to stay a few days with [you]124-mother , so [you]124-mother must look out for a couple of good beds somewhere near . ” And this address seemed to satisfy all the fondest wishes of [the mother]1874-the mother ’s heart , for [she]124-mother received [him]0-i with the most delighted and exulting affection . On [[his]0-i two younger sisters]2024-his two younger sisters [he]0-i then bestowed an equal portion of [his]0-i fraternal tenderness , for [he]0-i asked each of [them]2024-his two younger sisters how [they]2024-his two younger sisters did , and observed that [they]2024-his two younger sisters both looked very ugly . These manners did not please [Catherine]76-catherine ; but [he]0-i was [[James]105-james ’s friend]2025-james ’s friend and [[Isabella]109-isabella ’s brother]2026-isabella ’s brother ; and [her]124-mother judgment was further bought off by [Isabella]109-isabella ’s assuring [her]124-mother , when [they]2024-his two younger sisters withdrew to see the new hat , that [John]99-john thought [her]124-mother [the most charming girl in [the world]215-the world]2027-the most charming girl in the world , and by [John]99-john ’s engaging [her]124-mother before [they]2024-his two younger sisters parted to dance with [him]99-john that evening . Had [she]124-mother been older or vainer , such attacks might have done little ; but , where youth and diffidence are united , it requires uncommon steadiness of reason to resist the attraction of being called [the most charming girl in [the world]215-the world]2027-the most charming girl in the world , and of being so very early engaged as [a partner]254-a partner ; and the consequence was that , when [the two Morlands]2032-the two morlands , after sitting an hour with [the Thorpes]104-the thorpes , set off to walk together to [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen ’s , and [James]105-james , as the door was closed on [them]2032-the two morlands , said , “[76-catherine] Well , [Catherine]76-catherine , how do [you]76-catherine like [[my]0-i friend]454-my friend [Thorpe]99-john ? ” instead of answering , as [she]2033-she probably would have done , had there been no friendship and no flattery in the case , “[99-john] [I]0-i do not like [him]99-john at all , ” [she]2033-she directly replied , “[99-john] [I]0-i like [him]99-john very much ; [he]99-john seems very agreeable . ” “[99-john] [He]99-john is as good - natured [a fellow as ever lived]455-a fellow as ever lived ; a little of a rattle ; but that will recommend [him]99-john to [your]76-catherine sex , [I]0-i believe : and how do [you]76-catherine like [the rest of [the family]1904-the family]456-the rest of the family ? ” “[76-catherine] Very , very much indeed : [Isabella]109-isabella particularly . ” “[109-isabella] [I]0-i am very glad to hear [you]76-catherine say so ; [she]109-isabella is just [the kind of young woman [I]0-i could wish to see [you]76-catherine attached to]458-the kind of young woman i could wish to see you attached to ; [she]109-isabella has so much good sense , and is so thoroughly unaffected and amiable ; [I]0-i always wanted [you]76-catherine to know [her]109-isabella ; and [she]109-isabella seems very fond of [you]76-catherine . [She]109-isabella said the highest things in [your]76-catherine praise that could possibly be ; and the praise of [such a girl as [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe]459-such a girl as miss thorpe even [you]76-catherine , [Catherine]76-catherine , ” taking [her]109-isabella hand with affection , “[109-isabella] may be proud of . ” “[109-isabella] Indeed [I]0-i am , ” [she]109-isabella replied ; “[0-i] [I]0-i love [her]109-isabella exceedingly , and am delighted to find that [you]76-catherine like [her]109-isabella too . [You]76-catherine hardly mentioned anything of [her]109-isabella when [you]76-catherine wrote to [me]0-i after [your]76-catherine visit [there]1848-there . ” “[76-catherine] Because [I]0-i thought [I]0-i should soon see [you]76-catherine [myself]0-i . [I]0-i hope [you]76-catherine will be a great deal together while [you]76-catherine are in [Bath]6-bath . [She]109-isabella is [a most amiable girl]461-a most amiable girl ; such a superior understanding ! how fond all [the family]1904-the family are of [her]109-isabella ; [she]109-isabella is evidently [the general favourite]463-the general favourite ; and how much [she]109-isabella must be admired in such a place as this — is not [she]109-isabella ? ” “[109-isabella] Yes , very much indeed , [I]0-i fancy ; [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen thinks [her]109-isabella [the prettiest girl in [Bath]6-bath]464-the prettiest girl in bath . ” “[85-mr. allen] [I]0-i dare say [he]85-mr. allen does ; and [I]0-i do not know [any man who is [a better judge of beauty]466-a better judge of beauty than [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen]465-any man who is a better judge of beauty than mr. allen . [I]0-i need not ask [you]467-you whether [you]467-you are happy here , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine ; with such a companion and friend as [Isabella Thorpe]103-isabella , it would be impossible for [you]467-you to be otherwise ; and [the Allens]106-the allens , [I]0-i am sure , are very kind to [you]467-you ? ” “[106-the allens] Yes , very kind ; [I]0-i never was so happy before ; and now [you]467-you are come it will be more delightful than ever ; how good it is of [you]467-you to come so far on purpose to see _ [me]0-i _ . ” [James]105-james accepted this tribute of gratitude , and qualified [his]105-james conscience for accepting it too , by saying with perfect sincerity , “[76-catherine] Indeed , [Catherine]76-catherine , [I]0-i love [you]467-you dearly . ” Inquiries and communications concerning [brothers]2034-brothers and [sisters]1861-sisters , the situation of some , the growth of the rest , and other family matters now passed between [them]2036-them , and continued , with only one small digression on [James]105-james ’s part , in praise of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , till [they]2036-them reached [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , where [he]105-james was welcomed with great kindness by [Mr.]2037-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , invited by [the former]2038-the former to dine with [them]2036-them , and summoned by [the latter]214-the latter to guess the price and weigh the merits of a new muff and tippet . A pre - engagement in [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings prevented [his]105-james accepting the invitation of [one friend]2041-one friend , and obliged [him]105-james to hurry away as soon as [he]105-james had satisfied the demands of [the other]1863-the other . The time of [the two parties]2043-the two parties uniting in [the Octagon Room]2044-the octagon room being correctly adjusted , [Catherine]76-catherine was then left to the luxury of a raised , restless , and frightened imagination over the pages of [Udolpho]110-udolpho , lost from all worldly concerns of dressing and dinner , incapable of soothing [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s fears on the delay of [an expected dressmaker]2045-an expected dressmaker , and having only one minute in sixty to bestow even on the reflection of [her]110-udolpho own felicity , in being already engaged for the evening . CHAPTER 8 In spite of [Udolpho]110-udolpho and [the dressmaker]2046-the dressmaker , however , [the party from [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street]2047-the party from pulteney street reached [the Upper Rooms]1760-the upper rooms in very good time . [The Thorpes]104-the thorpes and [James Morland]105-james were there only two minutes before [them]104-the thorpes ; and [Isabella]103-isabella having gone through the usual ceremonial of meeting [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend with the most smiling and affectionate haste , of admiring the set of [her]103-isabella gown , and envying the curl of [her]103-isabella hair , [they]104-the thorpes followed [[their]104-the thorpes chaperons]2050-their chaperons , arm in arm , into [the ballroom]1764-the ballroom , whispering to [each other]1792-each other whenever a thought occurred , and supplying the place of many ideas by a squeeze of the hand or a smile of affection . The dancing began within a few minutes after [they]104-the thorpes were seated ; and [James]105-james , who had been engaged quite as long as [[his]105-james sister]356-his sister , was very importunate with [Isabella]103-isabella to stand up ; but [John]99-john was gone into [the card - room]1767-the card - room to speak to [a friend]1896-a friend , and nothing , [she]1896-a friend declared , should induce [her]1896-a friend to join the set before [[her]1896-a friend dear]1924-her dear [Catherine]76-catherine could join it too . “[0-i] [I]0-i assure [you]469-you , ” said [she]1896-a friend , “[0-i] [I]0-i would not stand up without [[your]469-you dear sister]470-your dear sister for [all the world]368-all the world ; for if [I]0-i did [we]472-they should certainly be separated the whole evening . ” [Catherine]76-catherine accepted this kindness with gratitude , and [they]472-they continued as [they]472-they were for three minutes longer , when [Isabella]103-isabella , who had been talking to [James]105-james on the other side of [her]473-my dear creature , turned again to [[his]0-i sister]356-his sister and whispered , “[473-my dear creature] [[My]0-i dear creature]473-my dear creature , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i must leave [you]473-my dear creature , [[your]473-my dear creature brother]474-your brother is so amazingly impatient to begin ; [I]0-i know [you]473-my dear creature will not mind [my]0-i going away , and [I]0-i dare say [John]99-john will be back in a moment , and then [you]473-my dear creature may easily find [me]0-i out . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , though a little disappointed , had too much good nature to make any opposition , and [the others]353-the others rising up , [Isabella]103-isabella had only time to press [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend ’s hand and say , “[0-i] Good - bye , [[my]0-i dear love]475-my dear love , ” before [they]2060-they hurried off . [The younger Miss Thorpes]104-the thorpes being also dancing , [Catherine]76-catherine was left to the mercy of [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , between whom [she]473-my dear creature now remained . [She]473-my dear creature could not help being vexed at the non - appearance of [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , for [she]473-my dear creature not only longed to be dancing , but was likewise aware that , as the real dignity of [her]473-my dear creature situation could not be known , [she]473-my dear creature was sharing with the scores of [other young ladies]2061-other young ladies still sitting down all the discredit of wanting [a partner]254-a partner . To be disgraced in the eye of [the world]215-the world , to wear the appearance of infamy while [her]473-my dear creature heart is all purity , [her]473-my dear creature actions all innocence , and the misconduct of another the true source of [her]473-my dear creature debasement , is one of those circumstances which peculiarly belong to [the heroine]2064-the heroine ’s life , and [her]473-my dear creature fortitude under it what particularly dignifies [her]473-my dear creature character . [Catherine]76-catherine had fortitude too ; [she]473-my dear creature suffered , but no murmur passed [her]473-my dear creature lips . From this state of humiliation , [she]473-my dear creature was roused , at the end of ten minutes , to a pleasanter feeling , by seeing , not [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , but [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , within three yards of the place where [they]2065-they sat ; [he]95-henry seemed to be moving that way , but [he]95-henry did not see [her]473-my dear creature , and therefore the smile and the blush , which [his]95-henry sudden reappearance raised in [Catherine]76-catherine , passed away without sullying [her]473-my dear creature heroic importance . [He]95-henry looked as handsome and as lively as ever , and was talking with interest to [a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman]2066-a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman , who leant on [his]95-henry arm , and whom [Catherine]76-catherine immediately guessed to be [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister ; thus unthinkingly throwing away a fair opportunity of considering [him]95-henry lost to [her]473-my dear creature forever , by being married already . But guided only by what was simple and probable , it had never entered [her]473-my dear creature head that [Mr. Tilney]95-henry could be married ; [he]95-henry had not behaved , [he]95-henry had not talked , like [the married men to whom [she]473-my dear creature had been used]2068-the married men to whom she had been used ; [he]95-henry had never mentioned [a wife]2069-a wife , and [he]95-henry had acknowledged [a sister]2070-a sister . From these circumstances sprang the instant conclusion of [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister ’s now being by [his]95-henry side ; and therefore , instead of turning of a deathlike paleness and falling in a fit on [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s bosom , [Catherine]76-catherine sat erect , in the perfect use of [her]473-my dear creature senses , and with cheeks only a little redder than usual . [Mr. Tilney]95-henry and [[his]95-henry companion]1986-his companion , who continued , though slowly , to approach , were immediately preceded by [a lady]2073-a lady , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe]2074-an acquaintance of mrs. thorpe ; and [this lady]2075-this lady stopping to speak to [her]473-my dear creature , [they]2076-they , as belonging to [her]473-my dear creature , stopped likewise , and [Catherine]76-catherine , catching [Mr. Tilney]95-henry ’s eye , instantly received from [him]95-henry the smiling tribute of recognition . [She]473-my dear creature returned it with pleasure , and then advancing still nearer , [he]95-henry spoke both to [her]473-my dear creature and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , by whom [he]95-henry was very civilly acknowledged . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very happy to see [you]0-i again , [sir]285-sir , indeed ; [I]0-i was afraid [you]0-i had left [Bath]6-bath . ” [He]95-henry thanked [her]473-my dear creature for [her]473-my dear creature fears , and said that [he]95-henry had quitted [it]6-bath for a week , on the very morning after [his]95-henry having had the pleasure of seeing [her]473-my dear creature . “[285-sir] Well , [sir]285-sir , and [I]0-i dare say [you]285-sir are not sorry to be back again , for it is just the place for [young people]478-young people — and indeed for [everybody else]479-everybody else too . [I]0-i tell [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , when [he]85-mr. allen talks of being sick of [it]6-bath , that [I]0-i am sure [he]85-mr. allen should not complain , for it is so very agreeable [a place]480-a place , that it is much better to be [here]1743-here than at [home]482-home at this dull time of year . [I]0-i tell [him]85-mr. allen [he]85-mr. allen is quite in luck to be sent [here]1743-here for [his]85-mr. allen health . ” “[0-i] And [I]0-i hope , [madam]279-madam , that [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen will be obliged to like [the place]284-the place , from finding [it]284-the place of service to [him]85-mr. allen . ” “[85-mr. allen] Thank [you]0-i , [sir]285-sir . [I]0-i have no doubt that [he]85-mr. allen will . [A neighbour of [ours]488-they]487-a neighbour of ours , [Dr. Skinner]125-dr. skinner , was here for [his]125-dr. skinner health last winter , and came away quite stout . ” “[125-dr. skinner] That circumstance must give great encouragement . ” “[285-sir] Yes , [sir]285-sir — and [Dr. Skinner]125-dr. skinner and [[his]125-dr. skinner family]1879-his family were here three months ; so [I]0-i tell [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen [he]85-mr. allen must not be in a hurry to get away . ” Here [they]488-they were interrupted by a request from [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , that [she]98-mrs. thorpe would move a little to accommodate [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes and [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney with seats , as [they]488-they had agreed to join [[their]488-they party]2077-their party . This was accordingly done , [Mr. Tilney]95-henry still continuing standing before [them]488-they ; and after a few minutes ’ consideration , [he]95-henry asked [Catherine]76-catherine to dance with [him]95-henry . This compliment , delightful as it was , produced severe mortification to [the lady]1834-the lady ; and in giving [her]1834-the lady denial , [she]1834-the lady expressed [her]1834-the lady sorrow on the occasion so very much as if [she]1834-the lady really felt it , that had [Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , who joined [her]1834-the lady just afterwards , been half a minute earlier , [he]95-henry might have thought [her]1834-the lady sufferings rather too acute . The very easy manner in which [he]95-henry then told [her]1834-the lady that [he]95-henry had kept [her]1834-the lady waiting did not by any means reconcile [her]1834-the lady more to [her]1834-the lady lot ; nor did the particulars which [he]95-henry entered into while [they]488-they were standing up , of the horses and dogs of [the friend whom [he]95-henry had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between [them]488-they]2079-the friend whom he had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between them , interest [her]1834-the lady so much as to prevent [her]1834-the lady looking very often towards that part of [the room where [she]1834-the lady had left [Mr. Tilney]95-henry]2080-the room where she had left mr. tilney . Of [her]1834-the lady dear Isabella , to whom [she]1834-the lady particularly longed to point out [that gentleman]2081-that gentleman , [she]1834-the lady could see nothing . [They]488-they were in different sets . [She]1834-the lady was separated from all [her]1834-the lady party , and away from all [her]1834-the lady acquaintance ; one mortification succeeded another , and from the whole [she]1834-the lady deduced this useful lesson , that to go previously engaged to a ball does not necessarily increase either the dignity or enjoyment of [a young lady]1707-a young lady . From such a moralizing strain as this , [she]1834-the lady was suddenly roused by a touch on the shoulder , and turning round , perceived [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes directly behind [her]1834-the lady , attended by [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney and [a gentleman]1839-a gentleman . “[85-mr. allen] [I]0-i beg [your]491-you pardon , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , ” said [she]1834-the lady , “[491-you] for this liberty — but [I]0-i can not anyhow get to [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , and [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe said [she]98-mrs. thorpe was sure [you]491-you would not have the least objection to letting in [this young lady]492-this young lady by [you]491-you . ” [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes could not have applied to any creature in [the room]1765-the room more happy to oblige [her]1834-the lady than [Catherine]76-catherine . [The young ladies]2005-the young ladies were introduced to [each other]1792-each other , [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney expressing a proper sense of such goodness , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland with the real delicacy of a generous mind making light of the obligation ; and [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes , satisfied with having so respectably settled [[her]126-mrs. hughes young charge]1931-her young charge , returned to [her]126-mrs. hughes party . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney had a good figure , a pretty face , and a very agreeable countenance ; and [her]126-mrs. hughes air , though it had not all the decided pretension , the resolute stylishness of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s , had more real elegance . [Her]126-mrs. hughes manners showed good sense and good breeding ; they were neither shy nor affectedly open ; and [she]126-mrs. hughes seemed capable of being young , attractive , and at a ball without wanting to fix the attention of [every man near [her]126-mrs. hughes]2088-every man near her , and without exaggerated feelings of ecstatic delight or inconceivable vexation on every little trifling occurrence . [Catherine]76-catherine , interested at once by [her]126-mrs. hughes appearance and [her]126-mrs. hughes relationship to [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , was desirous of being acquainted with [her]126-mrs. hughes , and readily talked therefore whenever [she]126-mrs. hughes could think of anything to say , and had courage and leisure for saying it . But the hindrance thrown in the way of a very speedy intimacy , by the frequent want of one or more of these requisites , prevented [their]2089-their doing more than going through the first rudiments of [an acquaintance]2090-an acquaintance , by informing [themselves]2089-their how well the other liked [Bath]6-bath , how much [she]126-mrs. hughes admired [[its]6-bath buildings]2091-its buildings and [surrounding country]2092-surrounding country , whether [she]126-mrs. hughes drew , or played , or sang , and whether [she]126-mrs. hughes was fond of riding on horseback . The two dances were scarcely concluded before [Catherine]76-catherine found [her]493-you arm gently seized by [her]493-you faithful Isabella , who in great spirits exclaimed , “[98-mrs. thorpe] At last [I]0-i have got [you]493-you . [[My]0-i dearest]366-my dearest creature , [I]0-i have been looking for [you]493-you this hour . What could induce [you]493-you to come into this set , when [you]493-you knew [I]0-i was in the other ? [I]0-i have been quite wretched without [you]493-you . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Isabella]103-isabella , how was it possible for [me]0-i to get at [you]493-you ? [I]0-i could not even see where [you]493-you were . ” “[0-i] So [I]0-i told [[your]493-you brother]474-your brother all the time — but [he]474-your brother would not believe [me]0-i . Do go and see for [her]497-her , [Mr. Morland]105-james , said [I]0-i — but all in vain — [he]474-your brother would not stir an inch . Was not it so , [Mr. Morland]105-james ? But [[you]493-you men]498-you men are all so immoderately lazy ! [i]0-i have been scolding [him]474-your brother to such a degree , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine would be quite amazed . [You]76-catherine know [I]0-i never stand upon ceremony with [such people]500-such people . ” “[76-catherine] Look at [that young lady with the white beads round [her]501-that young lady with the white beads round her head head]501-that young lady with the white beads round her head , ” whispered [Catherine]76-catherine , detaching [[her]253-my dear friend]1769-her friend from [James]105-james . “[76-catherine] It is [[Mr. Tilney]95-henry ’s sister]502-mr. tilney ’s sister . ” “[95-henry] Oh ! heavens ! [you]0-i do n’t say so ! let [me]0-i look at [her]501-that young lady with the white beads round her head this moment . What [a delightful girl]503-a delightful girl ! [i]0-i never saw anything half so beautiful ! but where is [[her]501-that young lady with the white beads round her head all - conquering brother]504-her all - conquering brother ? Is [he]504-her all - conquering brother in [the room]1765-the room ? Point [him]504-her all - conquering brother out to [me]0-i this instant , if [he]504-her all - conquering brother is . [I]0-i die to see [him]504-her all - conquering brother . [Mr. Morland]105-james , [you]105-james are not to listen . [We]506-we are not talking about [you]105-james . ” “[506-we] But what is all this whispering about ? What is going on ? ” “[506-we] There now , [I]0-i knew how it would be . [[You]105-james men]498-you men have such restless curiosity ! talk of the curiosity of [women]313-women , indeed ! ’ Tis nothing . But be satisfied , for [you]105-james are not to know anything at all of the matter . ” “[105-james] And is that likely to satisfy [me]0-i , do [you]105-james think ? ” “[105-james] Well , [I]0-i declare [I]0-i never knew anything like [you]105-james . What can it signify to [you]105-james , what [we]506-we are talking of . Perhaps [we]506-we are talking about [you]105-james ; therefore [I]0-i would advise [you]105-james not to listen , or [you]105-james may happen to hear something not very agreeable . ” In this commonplace chatter , which lasted some time , the original subject seemed entirely forgotten ; and though [Catherine]76-catherine was very well pleased to have it dropped for a while , [she]2094-she could not avoid a little suspicion at the total suspension of all [Isabella]103-isabella ’s impatient desire to see [Mr. Tilney]95-henry . When [the orchestra]2095-the orchestra struck up a fresh dance , [James]105-james would have led [[his]105-james fair partner]2096-his fair partner away , but [she]2094-she resisted . “[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]105-james , [Mr. Morland]105-james , ” [she]2094-she cried , “[0-i] [I]0-i would not do such a thing for all [the world]215-the world . How can [you]105-james be so teasing ; only conceive , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , what [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother wants [me]0-i to do . [He]474-your brother wants [me]0-i to dance with [him]474-your brother again , though [I]0-i tell [him]474-your brother that it is a most improper thing , and entirely against the rules . It would make [us]512-us the talk of [the place]284-the place , if [we]512-us were not to change [partners]514-partners . ” “[0-i] Upon [my]0-i honour , ” said [James]105-james , “[0-i] in these public assemblies , it is as often done as not . ” “[0-i] Nonsense , how can [you]0-i say so ? But when [[you]0-i [men]316-men]498-you men have a point to carry , [you]0-i never stick at anything . [My]0-i sweet [Catherine]76-catherine , do support [me]0-i ; persuade [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother how impossible it is . Tell [him]474-your brother that it would quite shock [you]76-catherine to see [me]0-i do such a thing ; now would not it ? ” “[474-your brother] No , not at all ; but if [you]76-catherine think it wrong , [you]76-catherine had much better change . ” “[76-catherine] There , ” cried [Isabella]103-isabella , “[76-catherine] [you]76-catherine hear what [[your]76-catherine sister]325-your sister says , and yet [you]76-catherine will not mind [her]325-your sister . Well , remember that it is not [my]0-i fault , if [we]519-we set all [the old ladies]520-the old ladies in [Bath]6-bath in a bustle . Come along , [[my]0-i dearest]366-my dearest [Catherine]76-catherine , for heaven ’s sake , and stand by [me]0-i . ” And off [they]519-we went , to regain [their]519-we former place . [John Thorpe]99-john , in the meanwhile , had walked away ; and [Catherine]76-catherine , ever willing to give [Mr. Tilney]95-henry an opportunity of repeating the agreeable request which had already flattered [her]366-my dearest once , made [her]366-my dearest way to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen and [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe as fast as [she]366-my dearest could , in the hope of finding [him]99-john still with [them]519-we — a hope which , when it proved to be fruitless , [she]366-my dearest felt to have been highly unreasonable . “[76-catherine] Well , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , ” said [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , impatient for praise of [[her]98-mrs. thorpe son]2097-her son , “[76-catherine] [I]0-i hope [you]253-my dear have had [an agreeable partner]523-an agreeable partner . ” “[523-an agreeable partner] Very agreeable , [madam]279-madam . ” “[279-madam] [I]0-i am glad of it . [John]99-john has charming spirits , has not [he]99-john ? ” “[99-john] Did [you]253-my dear meet [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ? ” said [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen . “[99-john] No , where is [he]99-john ? ” “[99-john] [He]99-john was with [us]526-us just now , and said [he]99-john was so tired of lounging about , that [he]99-john was resolved to go and dance ; so [I]0-i thought perhaps [he]99-john would ask [you]253-my dear , if [he]99-john met with [you]253-my dear . ” “[99-john] Where can [he]99-john be ? ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , looking round ; but [she]253-my dear had not looked round long before [she]253-my dear saw [him]99-john leading [a young lady]1707-a young lady to the dance . “[99-john] Ah ! [he]99-john has got [a partner]254-a partner ; [I]0-i wish [he]99-john had asked _ [you]253-my dear _ , ” said [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ; and after a short silence , [she]1707-a young lady added , “[99-john] [he]99-john is [a very agreeable young man]301-a very agreeable young man . ” “[99-john] Indeed [he]99-john is , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , ” said [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , smiling complacently ; “[88-mrs. allen] [I]0-i must say it , though [I]0-i _ am _ [[his]99-john mother]529-his mother , that there is not [a more agreeable young man in [the world]215-the world]530-a more agreeable young man in the world . ” This inapplicable answer might have been too much for the comprehension of many ; but it did not puzzle [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , for after only a moment ’s consideration , [she]1707-a young lady said , in a whisper to [Catherine]76-catherine , “[529-his mother] [I]0-i dare say [she]529-his mother thought [I]0-i was speaking of [[her]529-his mother son]2097-her son . ” [Catherine]76-catherine was disappointed and vexed . [She]86-miss morland seemed to have missed by so little the very object [she]86-miss morland had had in view ; and this persuasion did not incline [her]86-miss morland to a very gracious reply , when [John Thorpe]99-john came up to [her]86-miss morland soon afterwards and said , “[529-his mother] Well , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , [I]0-i suppose [you]86-miss morland and [I]0-i are to stand up and jig it together again . ” “[0-i] Oh , no ; [I]0-i am much obliged to [you]86-miss morland , [our]533-our two dances are over ; and , besides , [I]0-i am tired , and do not mean to dance any more . ” “[86-miss morland] Do not [you]86-miss morland ? Then let [us]533-our walk about and quiz [people]1782-people . Come along with [me]0-i , and [I]0-i will show [you]86-miss morland [the four greatest quizzers in [the room]1765-the room]535-the four greatest quizzers in the room ; [[my]0-i two younger sisters]537-my two younger sisters and [[their]537-my two younger sisters partners]538-their partners . [I]0-i have been laughing at [them]535-the four greatest quizzers in the room this half hour . ” Again [Catherine]76-catherine excused [herself]76-catherine ; and at last [he]0-i walked off to quiz [[his]0-i sisters]2099-his sisters by [himself]0-i . The rest of the evening [she]86-miss morland found very dull ; [Mr. Tilney]95-henry was drawn away from [their]2100-their party at tea , to attend that of [[his]95-henry partner]2101-his partner ; [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , though belonging to [it]2102-it , did not sit near [her]86-miss morland , and [James]105-james and [Isabella]103-isabella were so much engaged in conversing together that [the latter]214-the latter had no leisure to bestow more on [[her]214-the latter friend]1769-her friend than one smile , one squeeze , and one “[0-i] dearest [Catherine]76-catherine . ” CHAPTER 9 The progress of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s unhappiness from the events of the evening was as follows . It appeared first in a general dissatisfaction with everybody about [her]86-miss morland , while [she]86-miss morland remained in [the rooms]251-the rooms , which speedily brought on considerable weariness and a violent desire to go [home]482-home . This , on arriving in [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , took the direction of extraordinary hunger , and when that was appeased , changed into an earnest longing to be in bed ; such was the extreme point of [her]86-miss morland distress ; for when there [she]86-miss morland immediately fell into a sound sleep which lasted nine hours , and from which [she]86-miss morland awoke perfectly revived , in excellent spirits , with fresh hopes and fresh schemes . The first wish of [her]86-miss morland heart was to improve [her]86-miss morland acquaintance with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , and almost [her]86-miss morland first resolution , to seek [her]86-miss morland for that purpose , in [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room at noon . In [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , one so newly arrived in [Bath]6-bath must be met with , and that building [she]86-miss morland had already found so favourable for the discovery of female excellence , and the completion of female intimacy , so admirably adapted for secret discourses and unlimited confidence , that [she]86-miss morland was most reasonably encouraged to expect [another friend]2109-another friend from within [its]1820-the pump - room walls . [Her]86-miss morland plan for the morning thus settled , [she]86-miss morland sat quietly down to [her]86-miss morland book after breakfast , resolving to remain in the same place and the same employment till the clock struck one ; and from habitude very little incommoded by the remarks and ejaculations of [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , whose vacancy of mind and incapacity for thinking were such , that as [she]86-miss morland never talked a great deal , so [she]86-miss morland could never be entirely silent ; and , therefore , while [she]86-miss morland sat at [her]86-miss morland work , if [she]86-miss morland lost [her]86-miss morland needle or broke [her]86-miss morland thread , if [she]86-miss morland heard [a carriage]2110-a carriage in [the street]1894-the street , or saw a speck upon [her]86-miss morland gown , [she]86-miss morland must observe it aloud , whether there were anyone at leisure to answer [her]86-miss morland or not . At about half past twelve , a remarkably loud rap drew [her]86-miss morland in haste to the window , and scarcely had [she]86-miss morland time to inform [Catherine]76-catherine of there being two open carriages at the door , in the first only [a servant]2112-a servant , [[her]86-miss morland brother]355-her brother driving [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe in the second , before [John Thorpe]99-john came running [upstairs]1893-upstairs , calling out , “[76-catherine] Well , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , here [I]0-i am . Have [you]86-miss morland been waiting long ? [We]539-we could not come before ; [the old devil of a coachmaker]540-the old devil of a coachmaker was such an eternity finding out a thing fit to be got into , and now it is ten thousand to one but [they]541-they break down before [we]539-we are out of [the street]1894-the street . How do [you]86-miss morland do , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ? A famous ball last night , was not it ? Come , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , be quick , for [the others]353-the others are in a confounded hurry to be off . [They]353-the others want to get [their]353-the others tumble over . ” “[353-the others] What do [you]86-miss morland mean ? ” said [Catherine]76-catherine . “[353-the others] Where are [you]539-we all going to ? ” “[353-the others] Going to ? Why , [you]86-miss morland have not forgot [our]539-we engagement ! did not [we]539-we agree together to take a drive this morning ? What a head [you]86-miss morland have ! [we]539-we are going up [Claverton Down]30-claverton down . ” “[86-miss morland] Something was said about it , [I]0-i remember , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , looking at [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen for [her]86-miss morland opinion ; “[86-miss morland] but really [I]0-i did not expect [you]86-miss morland . ” “[0-i] Not expect [me]0-i ! that ’s a good one ! and what a dust [you]86-miss morland would have made , if [I]0-i had not come . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s silent appeal to [[her]86-miss morland friend]1769-her friend , meanwhile , was entirely thrown away , for [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , not being at all in the habit of conveying any expression [herself]88-mrs. allen by a look , was not aware of its being ever intended by [anybody else]394-anybody else ; and [Catherine]76-catherine , whose desire of seeing [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney again could at that moment bear a short delay in favour of a drive , and who thought there could be no impropriety in [her]86-miss morland going with [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , as [Isabella]103-isabella was going at the same time with [James]105-james , was therefore obliged to speak plainer . “[86-miss morland] Well , [ma’am]544-ma’am , what do [you]86-miss morland say to it ? Can [you]86-miss morland spare [me]0-i for an hour or two ? Shall [I]0-i go ? ” “[86-miss morland] Do just as [you]86-miss morland please , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , ” replied [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , with the most placid indifference . [Catherine]76-catherine took the advice , and ran off to get ready . In a very few minutes [she]86-miss morland reappeared , having scarcely allowed [the two others]2117-the two others time enough to get through a few short sentences in [her]86-miss morland praise , after [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe had procured [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s admiration of [his]120-mr. thorpe gig ; and then receiving [[her]86-miss morland friend]1769-her friend ’s parting good wishes , [they]2117-the two others both hurried [downstairs]2119-downstairs . “[86-miss morland] [[My]0-i dearest]366-my dearest creature , ” cried [Isabella]103-isabella , to whom the duty of friendship immediately called [her]86-miss morland before [she]86-miss morland could get into [the carriage]2004-the carriage , “[86-miss morland] [you]253-my dear have been at least three hours getting ready . [I]0-i was afraid [you]253-my dear were ill . What a delightful ball [we]547-we had last night . [I]0-i have a thousand things to say to [you]253-my dear ; but make haste and get in , for [I]0-i long to be off . ” [Catherine]76-catherine followed [her]103-isabella orders and turned away , but not too soon to hear [[her]86-miss morland friend]1769-her friend exclaim aloud to [James]105-james , “[374-a sweet girl] What [a sweet girl]374-a sweet girl [she]374-a sweet girl is ! [i]0-i quite dote on [her]374-a sweet girl . ” “[0-i] [You]253-my dear will not be frightened , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , ” said [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , as [he]0-i handed [her]253-my dear in , “[253-my dear] if [my]0-i horse should dance about a little at first setting off . [He]549-he will , most likely , give a plunge or two , and perhaps take the rest for a minute ; but [he]549-he will soon know [[his]549-he master]550-his master . [He]549-he is full of spirits , playful as can be , but there is no vice in [him]549-he . ” [Catherine]76-catherine did not think the portrait a very inviting one , but it was too late to retreat , and [she]253-my dear was too young to own [herself]253-my dear frightened ; so , resigning [herself]253-my dear to [her]253-my dear fate , and trusting to the animal ’s boasted knowledge of [its owner]2122-its owner , [she]253-my dear sat peaceably down , and saw [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe sit down by [her]253-my dear . Everything being then arranged , [the servant who stood at the horse]2123-the servant who stood at the horse ’s head was bid in an important voice “[127-old allen] to let [him]549-he go , ” and off [they]2124-they went in the quietest manner imaginable , without a plunge or a caper , or anything like one . [Catherine]76-catherine , delighted at so happy an escape , spoke [her]253-my dear pleasure aloud with grateful surprise ; and [[her]253-my dear companion]2014-her companion immediately made the matter perfectly simple by assuring [her]253-my dear that it was entirely owing to the peculiarly judicious manner in which [he]2014-her companion had then held the reins , and the singular discernment and dexterity with which [he]2014-her companion had directed [his]2014-her companion whip . [Catherine]76-catherine , though [she]253-my dear could not help wondering that with such perfect command of [his]2014-her companion horse , [he]2014-her companion should think it necessary to alarm [her]253-my dear with a relation of [its]549-he tricks , congratulated [herself]253-my dear sincerely on being under the care of so excellent [a coachman]2126-a coachman ; and perceiving that the animal continued to go on in the same quiet manner , without showing the smallest propensity towards any unpleasant vivacity , and ( considering its inevitable pace was ten miles an hour ) by no means alarmingly fast , gave [herself]253-my dear up to all the enjoyment of air and exercise of the most invigorating kind , in a fine mild day of February , with the consciousness of safety . A silence of several minutes succeeded [their]2127-their first short dialogue ; it was broken by [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ’s saying very abruptly , “[127-old allen] [Old Allen]127-old allen is as rich as [a Jew]551-a jew — is not [he]127-old allen ? ” [Catherine]76-catherine did not understand [him]2014-her companion — and [he]2014-her companion repeated [his]2014-her companion question , adding in explanation , “[127-old allen] [Old Allen]127-old allen , [the man [you]553-you are with]552-the man you are with . ” “[127-old allen] Oh ! [mr . Allen]88-mrs. allen , [you]88-mrs. allen mean . Yes , [I]0-i believe , [he]127-old allen is very rich . ” “[127-old allen] And [no children]554-no children at all ? ” “[0-i] No — not any . ” “[0-i] A famous thing for [his]127-old allen next heirs . [He]127-old allen is _ [[your]553-you _ godfather]555-your _ godfather , is not [he]127-old allen ? ” “[127-old allen] [[My]0-i godfather]556-my godfather ! no . ” “[127-old allen] But [you]88-mrs. allen are always very much with [them]557-them . ” “[88-mrs. allen] Yes , very much . ” “[88-mrs. allen] Aye , that is what [I]0-i meant . [He]127-old allen seems a good kind of old fellow enough , and has lived very well in [his]127-old allen time , [I]0-i dare say ; [he]127-old allen is not gouty for nothing . Does [he]127-old allen drink [his]127-old allen bottle a day now ? ” “[127-old allen] [His]127-old allen bottle a day ! no . Why should [you]88-mrs. allen think of such a thing ? [He]127-old allen is [a very temperate man]558-a very temperate man , and [you]88-mrs. allen could not fancy [him]127-old allen in liquor last night ? ” “[88-mrs. allen] [Lord]559-lord help [you]88-mrs. allen ! [[you]88-mrs. allen women]560-you women are always thinking of [men]316-men ’s being in liquor . Why , [you]88-mrs. allen do not suppose [a man]403-a man is overset by a bottle ? [I]0-i am sure of _ this_—that if [everybody]1780-everybody was to drink [their]1780-everybody bottle a day , there would not be half the disorders in [the world]215-the world there are now . It would be a famous good thing for [us]565-us all . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not believe it . ” “[0-i] Oh ! [lord]445-lord , it would be the saving of thousands . There is not the hundredth part of the wine consumed in [this kingdom]567-this kingdom that there ought to be . [Our]565-us foggy climate wants help . ” “[565-us] And yet [I]0-i have heard that there is a great deal of wine drunk in [Oxford]11-oxford . ” “[565-us] [Oxford]11-oxford ! there is no drinking at [Oxford]11-oxford now , [I]0-i assure [you]88-mrs. allen . [Nobody]396-nobody drinks [there]1848-there . [You]88-mrs. allen would hardly meet with [a man who goes beyond [his]570-a man who goes beyond his four pints at the utmost four pints at the utmost]570-a man who goes beyond his four pints at the utmost . Now , for instance , it was reckoned a remarkable thing , at the last party in [[my]0-i rooms]571-my rooms , that upon an average [we]565-us cleared about five pints a head . It was looked upon as something out of the common way . _ [Mine]0-i _ is famous good stuff , to be sure . [You]88-mrs. allen would not often meet with anything like it in [Oxford]11-oxford — and that may account for it . But this will just give [you]88-mrs. allen a notion of the general rate of drinking there . ” “[0-i] Yes , it does give a notion , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine warmly , “[0-i] and that is , that [you]88-mrs. allen all drink a great deal more wine than [I]0-i thought [you]88-mrs. allen did . However , [I]0-i am sure [James]105-james does not drink so much . ” This declaration brought on a loud and overpowering reply , of which no part was very distinct , except the frequent exclamations , amounting almost to oaths , which adorned it , and [Catherine]76-catherine was left , when it ended , with rather a strengthened belief of there being a great deal of wine drunk in [Oxford]11-oxford , and the same happy conviction of [[her]2128-she brother]355-her brother ’s comparative sobriety . [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ’s ideas then all reverted to the merits of [his]120-mr. thorpe own equipage , and [she]2128-she was called on to admire the spirit and freedom with which [his]120-mr. thorpe horse moved along , and the ease which [his]120-mr. thorpe paces , as well as the excellence of the springs , gave the motion of [the carriage]2004-the carriage . [She]2128-she followed [him]120-mr. thorpe in all [his]120-mr. thorpe admiration as well as [she]2128-she could . To go before or beyond [him]120-mr. thorpe was impossible . [His]120-mr. thorpe knowledge and [her]2128-she ignorance of the subject , [his]120-mr. thorpe rapidity of expression , and [her]2128-she diffidence of [herself]2128-she put that out of [her]2128-she power ; [she]2128-she could strike out nothing new in commendation , but [she]2128-she readily echoed whatever [he]120-mr. thorpe chose to assert , and it was finally settled between [them]2131-them without any difficulty that [his]120-mr. thorpe equipage was altogether the most complete of its kind in [England]3-england , [[his]120-mr. thorpe carriage]2132-his carriage the neatest , [his]120-mr. thorpe horse the best goer , and [himself]120-mr. thorpe the best coachman . “[572-her] [You]572-her do not really think , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , venturing after some time to consider the matter as entirely decided , and to offer some little variation on the subject , “[572-her] that [James]105-james ’s gig will break down ? ” “[120-mr. thorpe] Break down ! oh , [lord]445-lord ! did [you]572-her ever see such a little tittuppy thing in [your]572-her life ? There is not a sound piece of iron about it . The wheels have been fairly worn out these ten years at least — and as for the body ! upon [my]0-i soul , [you]572-her might shake it to pieces [yourself]572-her with a touch . It is the most devilish little rickety business [I]0-i ever beheld ! thank [God]128-god ! [we]574-we have got a better . [I]0-i would not be bound to go two miles in it for fifty thousand pounds . ” “[0-i] Good heavens ! ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , quite frightened . “[0-i] Then pray let [us]574-we turn back ; [they]575-they will certainly meet with an accident if [we]574-we go on . Do let [us]574-we turn back , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ; stop and speak to [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , and tell [him]419-my brother how very unsafe it is . ” “[120-mr. thorpe] Unsafe ! oh , [lord]445-lord ! what is there in that ? [They]575-they will only get a roll if it does break down ; and there is plenty of dirt ; it will be excellent falling . Oh , curse it ! [the carriage]2004-the carriage is safe enough , if [a man]403-a man knows how to drive [it]2004-the carriage ; a thing of that sort in good hands will last above twenty years after it is fairly worn out . Lord bless [you]572-her ! [i]0-i would undertake for five pounds to drive [it]2004-the carriage to [York]31-york and back again , without losing a nail . ” [Catherine]76-catherine listened with astonishment ; [she]572-her knew not how to reconcile two such very different accounts of the same thing ; for [she]572-her had not been brought up to understand the propensities of a rattle , nor to know to how many idle assertions and impudent falsehoods the excess of vanity will lead . [[Her]572-her own family]2133-her own family were [plain , matter - of - fact people who seldom aimed at wit of any kind]2134-plain , matter - of - fact people who seldom aimed at wit of any kind ; [[her]572-her father]205-her father , at the utmost , being contented with a pun , and [[her]572-her mother]211-her mother with a proverb ; [they]2133-her own family were not in the habit therefore of telling lies to increase [their]2133-her own family importance , or of asserting at one moment what [they]2133-her own family would contradict the next . [She]572-her reflected on the affair for some time in much perplexity , and was more than once on the point of requesting from [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe a clearer insight into [his]120-mr. thorpe real opinion on the subject ; but [she]572-her checked [herself]572-her , because it appeared to [her]572-her that [he]120-mr. thorpe did not excel in giving those clearer insights , in making those things plain which [he]120-mr. thorpe had before made ambiguous ; and , joining to this , the consideration that [he]120-mr. thorpe would not really suffer [[his]120-mr. thorpe sister]356-his sister and [[his]120-mr. thorpe friend]2002-his friend to be exposed to a danger from which [he]120-mr. thorpe might easily preserve [them]2133-her own family , [she]572-her concluded at last that [he]120-mr. thorpe must know [the carriage]2004-the carriage to be in fact perfectly safe , and therefore would alarm [herself]572-her no longer . By [him]120-mr. thorpe the whole matter seemed entirely forgotten ; and all the rest of [his]120-mr. thorpe conversation , or rather talk , began and ended with [himself]120-mr. thorpe and [his]120-mr. thorpe own concerns . [He]120-mr. thorpe told [her]572-her of horses which [he]120-mr. thorpe had bought for a trifle and sold for incredible sums ; of racing matches , in which [his]120-mr. thorpe judgment had infallibly foretold [the winner]2140-the winner ; of shooting parties , in which [he]120-mr. thorpe had killed more birds ( though without having one good shot ) than all [[his]120-mr. thorpe companions]2141-his companions together ; and described to [her]572-her some famous day ’s sport , with the fox - hounds , in which [his]120-mr. thorpe foresight and skill in directing the dogs had repaired the mistakes of [the most experienced huntsman]2142-the most experienced huntsman , and in which the boldness of [his]120-mr. thorpe riding , though it had never endangered [his]120-mr. thorpe own life for a moment , had been constantly leading [others]1832-others into difficulties , which [he]120-mr. thorpe calmly concluded had broken the necks of [many]2144-many . Little as [Catherine]76-catherine was in the habit of judging for [herself]76-catherine , and unfixed as were [her]572-her general notions of what [men]316-men ought to be , [she]572-her could not entirely repress a doubt , while [she]572-her bore with the effusions of [his]120-mr. thorpe endless conceit , of [his]120-mr. thorpe being altogether completely agreeable . It was a bold surmise , for [he]120-mr. thorpe was [[Isabella]103-isabella ’s brother]2026-isabella ’s brother ; and [she]572-her had been assured by [James]105-james that [his]120-mr. thorpe manners would recommend [him]120-mr. thorpe to all [her]572-her sex ; but in spite of this , the extreme weariness of [his]120-mr. thorpe company , which crept over [her]572-her before [they]2147-they had been out an hour , and which continued unceasingly to increase till [they]2147-they stopped in [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street again , induced [her]572-her , in some small degree , to resist such high authority , and to distrust [his]120-mr. thorpe powers of giving universal pleasure . When [they]2147-they arrived at [[Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s door]2148-mrs. allen ’s door , the astonishment of [Isabella]103-isabella was hardly to be expressed , on finding that it was too late in the day for [them]2147-they to attend [[her]572-her friend]1769-her friend into [the house]238-the house : “[0-i] Past three o’clock ! ” It was inconceivable , incredible , impossible ! and [she]572-her would neither believe [her]572-her own watch , nor [[her]572-her brother]355-her brother ’s , nor [the servant]1988-the servant ’s ; [she]572-her would believe no assurance of it founded on reason or reality , till [Morland]105-james produced [his]105-james watch , and ascertained the fact ; to have doubted a moment longer _ then _ , would have been equally inconceivable , incredible , and impossible ; and [she]572-her could only protest , over and over again , that no two hours and a half had ever gone off so swiftly before , as [Catherine]76-catherine was called on to confirm ; [Catherine]76-catherine could not tell a falsehood even to please [Isabella]103-isabella ; but [the latter]214-the latter was spared the misery of [[her]572-her friend]1769-her friend ’s dissenting voice , by not waiting for [her]572-her answer . [Her]572-her own feelings entirely engrossed [her]572-her ; [her]572-her wretchedness was most acute on finding [herself]572-her obliged to go directly [home]482-home . It was ages since [she]572-her had had a moment ’s conversation with [[her]572-her dearest]2156-her dearest [Catherine]76-catherine ; and , though [she]572-her had such thousands of things to say to [her]1769-her friend , it appeared as if [they]2157-they were never to be together again ; so , with smiles of most exquisite misery , and the laughing eye of utter despondency , [she]572-her bade [[her]572-her friend]1769-her friend adieu and went on . [Catherine]76-catherine found [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen just returned from all the busy idleness of the morning , and was immediately greeted with , “[0-i] Well , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , here [you]253-my dear are , ” a truth which [she]572-her had no greater inclination than power to dispute ; “[253-my dear] and [I]0-i hope [you]253-my dear have had a pleasant airing ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [ma’am]544-ma’am , [I]0-i thank [you]253-my dear ; [we]582-we could not have had a nicer day . ” “[98-mrs. thorpe] So [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe said ; [she]98-mrs. thorpe was vastly pleased at [your]253-my dear all going . ” “[98-mrs. thorpe] [You]253-my dear have seen [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , then ? ” “[98-mrs. thorpe] Yes , [I]0-i went to [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room as soon as [you]253-my dear were gone , and there [I]0-i met [her]98-mrs. thorpe , and [we]582-we had a great deal of talk together . [She]98-mrs. thorpe says there was hardly any veal to be got at market this morning , it is so uncommonly scarce . ” “[98-mrs. thorpe] Did [you]253-my dear see [anybody else of [our]582-we acquaintance]584-anybody else of our acquaintance ? ” “[253-my dear] Yes ; [we]582-we agreed to take a turn in [the Crescent]585-the crescent , and there [we]582-we met [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes , and [Mr.]586-mr. and [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney walking with [her]98-mrs. thorpe . ” “[253-my dear] Did [you]253-my dear indeed ? And did [they]587-they speak to [you]253-my dear ? ” “[587-they] Yes , [we]582-we walked along [the Crescent]585-the crescent together for half an hour . [They]587-they seem [very agreeable people]589-very agreeable people . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney was in a very pretty spotted muslin , and [I]0-i fancy , by what [I]0-i can learn , that [she]98-mrs. thorpe always dresses very handsomely . [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes talked to [me]0-i a great deal about [the family]1904-the family . ” “[126-mrs. hughes] And what did [she]126-mrs. hughes tell [you]253-my dear of [them]1904-the family ? ” “[126-mrs. hughes] Oh ! a vast deal indeed ; [she]126-mrs. hughes hardly talked of anything else . ” “[126-mrs. hughes] Did [she]126-mrs. hughes tell [you]253-my dear what part of Gloucestershire [they]1904-the family come from ? ” “[126-mrs. hughes] Yes , [she]126-mrs. hughes did ; but [I]0-i can not recollect now . But [they]1904-the family are [very good kind of people]591-very good kind of people , and very rich . [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney was a [Miss Drummond]130-miss drummond , and [she]129-mrs. tilney and [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes were [schoolfellows]592-schoolfellows ; and [Miss Drummond]130-miss drummond had a very large fortune ; and , when [she]130-miss drummond married , [[her]130-miss drummond father]205-her father gave [her]130-miss drummond twenty thousand pounds , and five hundred to buy wedding - clothes . [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes saw all the clothes after [they]1904-the family came from [the warehouse]594-the warehouse . ” “[126-mrs. hughes] And are [Mr.]595-mr. and [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney in [Bath]6-bath ? ” “[596-they] Yes , [I]0-i fancy [they]596-they are , but [I]0-i am not quite certain . Upon recollection , however , [I]0-i have a notion [they]596-they are both dead ; at least [the mother]1874-the mother is ; yes , [I]0-i am sure [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney is dead , because [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes told [me]0-i there was a very beautiful set of pearls that [Mr. Drummond]131-mr. drummond gave [[his]131-mr. drummond daughter]598-his daughter on [her]129-mrs. tilney wedding - day and that [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney has got now , for they were put by for [her]129-mrs. tilney when [[her]129-mrs. tilney mother]211-her mother died . ” “[92-miss tilney] And is [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , [[my]0-i partner]600-my partner , [the only son]601-the only son ? ” “[95-henry] [I]0-i can not be quite positive about that , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ; [I]0-i have some idea [he]95-henry is ; but , however , [he]95-henry is [a very fine young man]603-a very fine young man , [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes says , and likely to do very well . ” [Catherine]76-catherine inquired no further ; [she]253-my dear had heard enough to feel that [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen had no real intelligence to give , and that [she]253-my dear was most particularly unfortunate [herself]253-my dear in having missed such a meeting with [both brother]2159-both brother and [sister]2160-sister . Could [she]253-my dear have foreseen such a circumstance , nothing should have persuaded [her]253-my dear to go out with [the others]353-the others ; and , as it was , [she]253-my dear could only lament [her]253-my dear ill luck , and think over what [she]253-my dear had lost , till it was clear to [her]253-my dear that the drive had by no means been very pleasant and that [John Thorpe]99-john [himself]99-john was quite disagreeable . CHAPTER 10 [The Allens]106-the allens , [Thorpes]104-the thorpes , and [Morlands]78-the morlands all met in the evening at [the theatre]283-the theatre ; and , as [Catherine]76-catherine and [Isabella]103-isabella sat together , there was then an opportunity for [the latter]214-the latter to utter some few of the many thousand things which had been collecting within [her]253-my dear for communication in the immeasurable length of time which had divided [them]2164-them . “[126-mrs. hughes] Oh , heavens ! [[my]0-i beloved]604-my beloved [Catherine]76-catherine , have [I]0-i got [you]76-catherine at last ? ” was [her]253-my dear address on [Catherine]76-catherine ’s entering the box and sitting by [her]253-my dear . “[76-catherine] Now , [Mr. Morland]105-james , ” for [he]0-i was close to [her]253-my dear on the other side , “[105-james] [I]0-i shall not speak another word to [you]76-catherine all the rest of the evening ; so [I]0-i charge [you]76-catherine not to expect it . [My]0-i sweetest [Catherine]76-catherine , how have [you]76-catherine been this long age ? But [I]0-i need not ask [you]76-catherine , for [you]76-catherine look delightfully . [You]76-catherine really have done [your]76-catherine hair in a more heavenly style than ever ; [you]76-catherine mischievous creature , do [you]76-catherine want to attract [everybody]1780-everybody ? [I]0-i assure [you]76-catherine , [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother is quite in love with [you]76-catherine already ; and as for [Mr. Tilney]95-henry — but _ that _ is a settled thing — even _ [your]76-catherine _ modesty can not doubt [his]95-henry attachment now ; [his]95-henry coming back to [Bath]6-bath makes it too plain . Oh ! what would not [I]0-i give to see [him]95-henry ! [I]0-i really am quite wild with impatience . [[My]0-i mother]607-my mother says [he]95-henry is [the most delightful young man in [the world]215-the world]608-the most delightful young man in the world ; [she]607-my mother saw [him]95-henry this morning , [you]76-catherine know ; [you]76-catherine must introduce [him]95-henry to [me]0-i . Is [he]95-henry in [the house]238-the house now ? Look about , for heaven ’s sake ! [i]0-i assure [you]76-catherine , [I]0-i can hardly exist till [I]0-i see [him]95-henry . ” “[95-henry] No , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , “[95-henry] [he]95-henry is not [here]1743-here ; [I]0-i can not see [him]95-henry anywhere . ” “[95-henry] Oh , horrid ! am [I]0-i never to be acquainted with [him]95-henry ? How do [you]76-catherine like [my]0-i gown ? [I]0-i think it does not look amiss ; the sleeves were entirely [my]0-i own thought . Do [you]76-catherine know , [I]0-i get so immoderately sick of Bath ; [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother and [I]0-i were agreeing this morning that , though it is vastly well to be [here]1743-here for a few weeks , [we]614-we would not live [here]1743-here for millions . [We]614-we soon found out that [our]614-we tastes were exactly alike in preferring [the country]246-the country to [every other place]617-every other place ; really , [our]614-we opinions were so exactly the same , it was quite ridiculous ! there was not a single point in which [we]614-we differed ; [I]0-i would not have had [you]76-catherine by for [the world]215-the world ; [you]76-catherine are such a sly thing , [I]0-i am sure [you]76-catherine would have made some droll remark or other about it . ” “[76-catherine] No , indeed [I]0-i should not . ” “[76-catherine] Oh , yes [you]76-catherine would indeed ; [I]0-i know [you]76-catherine better than [you]76-catherine know [yourself]76-catherine .
