[You]76-catherine would have told [us]614-we that [we]614-we seemed born for [each other]1792-each other , or some nonsense of that kind , which would have distressed [me]0-i beyond conception ; [my]0-i cheeks would have been as red as [your]76-catherine roses ; [I]0-i would not have had [you]76-catherine by for [the world]215-the world . ” “[76-catherine] Indeed [you]76-catherine do [me]0-i injustice ; [I]0-i would not have made so improper a remark upon any account ; and besides , [I]0-i am sure it would never have entered [my]0-i head . ” [Isabella]103-isabella smiled incredulously and talked the rest of the evening to [James]105-james . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s resolution of endeavouring to meet [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney again continued in full force the next morning ; and till the usual moment of going to [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , [she]103-isabella felt some alarm from the dread of a second prevention . But nothing of that kind occurred , [no visitors]2166-no visitors appeared to delay [them]614-we , and [they]614-we all three set off in good time for [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , where the ordinary course of events and conversation took place ; [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , after drinking [his]85-mr. allen glass of water , joined [some gentlemen]2168-some gentlemen to talk over the politics of the day and compare the accounts of [their]614-we newspapers ; and [the ladies]1776-the ladies walked about together , noticing every new face , and almost every new bonnet in [the room]1765-the room . [The female part of [the Thorpe family]2172-the thorpe family]2171-the female part of the thorpe family , attended by [James Morland]105-james , appeared among [the crowd]1762-the crowd in less than a quarter of an hour , and [Catherine]76-catherine immediately took [her]103-isabella usual place by the side of [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend . [James]105-james , who was now in constant attendance , maintained a similar position , and separating [themselves]614-we from the rest of [[their]614-we party]2077-their party , [they]614-we walked in that manner for some time , till [Catherine]76-catherine began to doubt the happiness of a situation which , confining [her]103-isabella entirely to [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend and brother , gave [her]103-isabella very little share in the notice of either . [They]614-we were always engaged in some sentimental discussion or lively dispute , but [their]614-we sentiment was conveyed in such whispering voices , and [their]614-we vivacity attended with so much laughter , that though [Catherine]76-catherine ’s supporting opinion was not unfrequently called for by one or [the other]1863-the other , [she]103-isabella was never able to give any , from not having heard a word of the subject . At length however [she]103-isabella was empowered to disengage [herself]103-isabella from [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend , by the avowed necessity of speaking to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , whom [she]103-isabella most joyfully saw just entering [the room]1765-the room with [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes , and whom [she]103-isabella instantly joined , with a firmer determination to be acquainted , than [she]103-isabella might have had courage to command , had [she]103-isabella not been urged by the disappointment of the day before . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney met [her]103-isabella with great civility , returned [her]103-isabella advances with equal goodwill , and [they]2180-their continued talking together as long as [both parties]2181-both parties remained in [the room]1765-the room ; and though in all probability not an observation was made , nor an expression used by either which had not been made and used some thousands of times before , under that roof , in every Bath season , yet the merit of [their]2180-their being spoken with simplicity and truth , and without personal conceit , might be something uncommon . “[0-i] How well [[your]621-your brother]474-your brother dances ! ” was an artless exclamation of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s towards the close of [their]2180-their conversation , which at once surprised and amused [[her]103-isabella companion]2014-her companion . “[95-henry] [Henry]95-henry ! ” [she]103-isabella replied with a smile . “[95-henry] Yes , [he]95-henry does dance very well . ” “[95-henry] [He]95-henry must have thought it very odd to hear [me]0-i say [I]0-i was engaged the other evening , when [he]95-henry saw [me]0-i sitting down . But [I]0-i really had been engaged the whole day to [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe . ” [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney could only bow . “[120-mr. thorpe] [You]623-you can not think , ” added [Catherine]76-catherine after a moment ’s silence , “[120-mr. thorpe] how surprised [I]0-i was to see [him]95-henry again . [I]0-i felt so sure of [his]95-henry being quite gone away . ” “[0-i] When [Henry]95-henry had the pleasure of seeing [you]623-you before , [he]95-henry was in [Bath]1824-bath but for a couple of days . [He]95-henry came only to engage lodgings for [us]625-us . ” “[95-henry] _ That _ never occurred to [me]0-i ; and of course , not seeing [him]95-henry anywhere , [I]0-i thought [he]95-henry must be gone . Was not [the young lady [he]95-henry danced with]626-the young lady he danced with on Monday a [Miss Smith]132-miss smith ? ” “[132-miss smith] Yes , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes]627-an acquaintance of mrs. hughes . ” “[126-mrs. hughes] [I]0-i dare say [she]627-an acquaintance of mrs. hughes was very glad to dance . Do [you]623-you think [her]627-an acquaintance of mrs. hughes pretty ? ” “[623-you] Not very . ” “[623-you] [He]95-henry never comes to [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , [I]0-i suppose ? ” “[95-henry] Yes , sometimes ; but [he]95-henry has rid out this morning with [[my]0-i father]629-my father . ” [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes now joined [them]630-we , and asked [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney if [she]126-mrs. hughes was ready to go . “[95-henry] [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall have the pleasure of seeing [you]623-you again soon , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine . “[0-i] Shall [you]623-you be at the cotillion ball to - morrow ? ” “[623-you] Perhaps [we]630-we — Yes , [I]0-i think [we]630-we certainly shall . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am glad of it , for [we]630-we shall all be there . ” This civility was duly returned ; and [they]630-we parted — on [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s side with some knowledge of [[her]126-mrs. hughes new acquaintance]2184-her new acquaintance ’s feelings , and on [Catherine]76-catherine ’s , without the smallest consciousness of having explained them . [She]126-mrs. hughes went [home]482-home very happy . The morning had answered all [her]126-mrs. hughes hopes , and the evening of the following day was now the object of expectation , the future good . What gown and what head - dress [she]126-mrs. hughes should wear on the occasion became [her]126-mrs. hughes chief concern . [She]126-mrs. hughes can not be justified in it . Dress is at all times a frivolous distinction , and excessive solicitude about it often destroys its own aim . [Catherine]76-catherine knew all this very well ; [[her]126-mrs. hughes great aunt]2186-her great aunt had read [her]126-mrs. hughes a lecture on the subject only the Christmas before ; and yet [she]126-mrs. hughes lay awake ten minutes on Wednesday night debating between [her]126-mrs. hughes spotted and [her]126-mrs. hughes tamboured muslin , and nothing but the shortness of the time prevented [her]126-mrs. hughes buying a new one for the evening . This would have been an error in judgment , great though not uncommon , from which [one of the other sex]2187-one of the other sex rather than [her]126-mrs. hughes own , [a brother]2188-a brother rather than [a great aunt]2189-a great aunt , might have warned [her]126-mrs. hughes , for [man]2190-man only can be aware of the insensibility of [man]2190-man towards a new gown . It would be mortifying to the feelings of [many ladies]2192-many ladies , could [they]2192-many ladies be made to understand how little the heart of [man]2190-man is affected by what is costly or new in [their]2192-many ladies attire ; how little it is biased by the texture of [their]2192-many ladies muslin , and how unsusceptible of peculiar tenderness towards the spotted , the sprigged , the mull , or the jackonet . [Woman]2194-woman is fine for [her]2194-woman own satisfaction alone . [No man]2195-no man will admire [her]2194-woman the more , [no woman]2196-no woman will like [her]2194-woman the better for it . Neatness and fashion are enough for [the former]2038-the former , and a something of shabbiness or impropriety will be most endearing to [the latter]214-the latter . But not one of these grave reflections troubled the tranquillity of [Catherine]76-catherine . [She]126-mrs. hughes entered [the rooms]251-the rooms on Thursday evening with feelings very different from what had attended [her]126-mrs. hughes thither the Monday before . [She]126-mrs. hughes had then been exulting in [her]126-mrs. hughes engagement to [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , and was now chiefly anxious to avoid [his]120-mr. thorpe sight , lest [he]120-mr. thorpe should engage [her]126-mrs. hughes again ; for though [she]126-mrs. hughes could not , dared not expect that [Mr. Tilney]95-henry should ask [her]126-mrs. hughes a third time to dance , [her]126-mrs. hughes wishes , hopes , and plans all centred in nothing less . [Every young lady]2200-every young lady may feel for [[my]0-i heroine]2201-my heroine in this critical moment , for [every young lady]2200-every young lady has at some time or other known the same agitation . All have been , or at least all have believed [themselves]2200-every young lady to be , in danger from the pursuit of [someone whom [they]2200-every young lady wished to avoid]2203-someone whom they wished to avoid ; and all have been anxious for the attentions of [someone whom [they]2200-every young lady wished to please]2204-someone whom they wished to please . As soon as [they]2200-every young lady were joined by [the Thorpes]104-the thorpes , [Catherine]76-catherine ’s agony began ; [she]126-mrs. hughes fidgeted about if [John Thorpe]99-john came towards [her]126-mrs. hughes , hid [herself]126-mrs. hughes as much as possible from [his]99-john view , and when [he]99-john spoke to [her]126-mrs. hughes pretended not to hear [him]99-john . The cotillions were over , the country - dancing beginning , and [she]126-mrs. hughes saw nothing of [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys . “[0-i] Do not be frightened , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , ” whispered [Isabella]103-isabella , “[76-catherine] but [I]0-i am really going to dance with [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother again . [I]0-i declare positively it is quite shocking . [I]0-i tell [him]474-your brother [he]474-your brother ought to be ashamed of [himself]474-your brother , but [you]76-catherine and [John]99-john must keep [us]633-us in countenance . Make haste , [[my]0-i dear creature]473-my dear creature , and come to [us]633-us . [John]99-john is just walked off , but [he]99-john will be back in a moment . ” [Catherine]76-catherine had neither time nor inclination to answer . [The others]353-the others walked away , [John Thorpe]99-john was still in view , and [she]473-my dear creature gave [herself]473-my dear creature up for lost . That [she]473-my dear creature might not appear , however , to observe or expect [him]99-john , [she]473-my dear creature kept [her]473-my dear creature eyes intently fixed on [her]473-my dear creature fan ; and a self - condemnation for [her]473-my dear creature folly , in supposing that among [such a crowd]2206-such a crowd [they]633-us should even meet with [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys in any reasonable time , had just passed through [her]473-my dear creature mind , when [she]473-my dear creature suddenly found [herself]473-my dear creature addressed and again solicited to dance , by [Mr. Tilney]95-henry [himself]95-henry . With what sparkling eyes and ready motion [she]473-my dear creature granted [his]95-henry request , and with how pleasing a flutter of heart [she]473-my dear creature went with [him]95-henry to the set , may be easily imagined . To escape , and , as [she]473-my dear creature believed , so narrowly escape [John Thorpe]99-john , and to be asked , so immediately on [his]95-henry joining [her]473-my dear creature , asked by [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , as if [he]95-henry had sought [her]473-my dear creature on purpose!—it did not appear to [her]473-my dear creature that life could supply any greater felicity . Scarcely had [they]2207-they worked [themselves]2207-they into the quiet possession of a place , however , when [her]473-my dear creature attention was claimed by [John Thorpe]99-john , who stood behind [her]473-my dear creature . “[99-john] Heyday , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ! ” said [he]95-henry . “[86-miss morland] What is the meaning of this ? [I]0-i thought [you]86-miss morland and [I]0-i were to dance together . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder [you]86-miss morland should think so , for [you]86-miss morland never asked [me]0-i . ” “[86-miss morland] That is a good one , by [Jove]134-jove ! [i]0-i asked [you]86-miss morland as soon as [I]0-i came into [the room]1765-the room , and [I]0-i was just going to ask [you]86-miss morland again , but when [I]0-i turned round , [you]86-miss morland were gone ! this is a cursed shabby trick ! [i]0-i only came for the sake of dancing with _ [you]86-miss morland _ , and [I]0-i firmly believe [you]86-miss morland were engaged to [me]0-i ever since Monday . Yes ; [I]0-i remember , [I]0-i asked [you]86-miss morland while [you]86-miss morland were waiting in [the lobby]636-the lobby for [your]86-miss morland cloak . And here have [I]0-i been telling all [my]0-i acquaintance that [I]0-i was going to dance with [the prettiest girl in [the room]1765-the room]637-the prettiest girl in the room ; and when [they]639-they see [you]86-miss morland standing up with [somebody else]640-somebody else , [they]639-they will quiz [me]0-i famously . ” “[639-they] Oh , no ; [they]639-they will never think of _ [me]0-i _ , after such a description as that . ” “[639-they] By heavens , if [they]639-they do not , [I]0-i will kick [them]639-they out of [the room]1765-the room for blockheads . What chap have [you]0-i there ? ” [Catherine]76-catherine satisfied [his]0-i curiosity . “[95-henry] [Tilney]95-henry , ” [he]0-i repeated . “[135-hum] [Hum]135-hum — [I]0-i do not know [him]95-henry . [A good figure of a man]642-a good figure of a man ; well put together . Does [he]95-henry want a horse ? Here is [a friend of [mine]0-i]430-a friend of mine , [Sam Fletcher]136-sam fletcher , has got one to sell that would suit [anybody]216-anybody . A famous clever animal for [the road]645-the road — only forty guineas . [I]0-i had fifty minds to buy it [myself]0-i , for it is one of [my]0-i maxims always to buy a good horse when [I]0-i meet with [one]305-one ; but it would not answer [my]0-i purpose , it would not do for the field . [I]0-i would give any money for [a real good hunter]647-a real good hunter . [I]0-i have three now , the best that ever were backed . [I]0-i would not take eight hundred guineas for [them]648-them . [Fletcher]136-sam fletcher and [I]0-i mean to get [a house in [Leicestershire]32-leicestershire]649-a house in leicestershire , against the next season . It is so d — — uncomfortable , living at [an inn]1742-an inn . ” This was the last sentence by which [he]0-i could weary [Catherine]76-catherine ’s attention , for [he]0-i was just then borne off by the resistless pressure of a long string of [passing ladies]2208-passing ladies . [[Her]600-my partner partner]1844-her partner now drew near , and said , “[2081-that gentleman] [That gentleman]2081-that gentleman would have put [me]0-i out of patience , had [he]2081-that gentleman stayed with [you]0-i half a minute longer . [He]2081-that gentleman has no business to withdraw the attention of [[my]0-i partner]600-my partner from [me]0-i . [We]653-we have entered into a contract of mutual agreeableness for the space of an evening , and all [our]653-we agreeableness belongs solely to [each other]1792-each other for that time . [Nobody]396-nobody can fasten [themselves]396-nobody on the notice of one , without injuring the rights of [the other]1863-the other . [I]0-i consider a country - dance as an emblem of marriage . Fidelity and complaisance are the principal duties of both ; and [those men who do not choose to dance or marry]657-those men who do not choose to dance or marry [themselves]657-those men who do not choose to dance or marry , have no business with [the partners or wives of [[their]657-those men who do not choose to dance or marry neighbours]1796-their neighbours]658-the partners or wives of their neighbours . ” “[660-their] But [they]660-their are such very different things ! ” “[660-their] — That [you]0-i think [they]660-their can not be compared together . ” “[660-their] To be sure not . [People that marry]661-people that marry can never part , but must go and keep [house]662-house together . [People that dance]663-people that dance only stand opposite each other in [a long room]664-a long room for half an hour . ” “[663-people that dance] And such is [your]0-i definition of matrimony and dancing . Taken in that light certainly , [their]660-their resemblance is not striking ; but [I]0-i think [I]0-i could place [them]660-their in such a view . [You]0-i will allow , that in both , [man]2190-man has the advantage of choice , [woman]2194-woman only the power of refusal ; that in both , it is an engagement between [man]2190-man and [woman]2194-woman , formed for the advantage of each ; and that when once entered into , [they]660-their belong exclusively to [each other]1792-each other till the moment of its dissolution ; that it is [their]660-their duty , [each]670-each to endeavour to give [the other]1863-the other no cause for wishing that [he]2190-man or [she]672-she had bestowed [themselves]660-their elsewhere , and [their]660-their best interest to keep [their]660-their own imaginations from wandering towards the perfections of [[their]660-their neighbours]1796-their neighbours , or fancying that [they]660-their should have been better off with [anyone else]674-anyone else . [You]0-i will allow all this ? ” “[0-i] Yes , to be sure , as [you]0-i state it , all this sounds very well ; but still they are so very different . [I]0-i can not look upon [them]660-their at all in the same light , nor think the same duties belong to [them]660-their . ” “[0-i] In one respect , there certainly is a difference . In marriage , [the man]675-the man is supposed to provide for the support of [the woman]676-the woman , [the woman]676-the woman to make [the home]678-the home agreeable to [the man]675-the man ; [he]675-the man is to purvey , and [she]676-the woman is to smile . But in dancing , [their]660-their duties are exactly changed ; the agreeableness , the compliance are expected from [him]675-the man , while [she]676-the woman furnishes the fan and the lavender water . _ That _ , [I]0-i suppose , was the difference of duties which struck [you]0-i , as rendering the conditions incapable of comparison . ” “[0-i] No , indeed , [I]0-i never thought of that . ” “[0-i] Then [I]0-i am quite at a loss . One thing , however , [I]0-i must observe . This disposition on [your]0-i side is rather alarming . [You]0-i totally disallow any similarity in the obligations ; and may [I]0-i not thence infer that [your]0-i notions of the duties of the dancing state are not so strict as [[your]0-i partner]341-your partner might wish ? Have [I]0-i not reason to fear that if [the gentleman who spoke to [you]0-i]681-the gentleman who spoke to you just now were to return , or if [any other gentleman]682-any other gentleman were to address [you]0-i , there would be nothing to restrain [you]0-i from conversing with [him]675-the man as long as [you]0-i chose ? ” “[120-mr. thorpe] [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe is such [a very particular friend of [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ’s]683-a very particular friend of my brother ’s , that if [he]120-mr. thorpe talks to [me]0-i , [I]0-i must talk to [him]120-mr. thorpe again ; but there are hardly [three young men in [the room]1765-the room besides [him]120-mr. thorpe that [I]0-i have any acquaintance with]685-three young men in the room besides him that i have any acquaintance with . ” “[685-three young men in the room besides him that i have any acquaintance with] And is that to be [my]0-i only security ? Alas , alas ! ” “[0-i] Nay , [I]0-i am sure [you]0-i can not have a better ; for if [I]0-i do not know [anybody]216-anybody , it is impossible for [me]0-i to talk to [them]216-anybody ; and , besides , [I]0-i do not _ want _ to talk to [anybody]216-anybody . ” “[0-i] Now [you]0-i have given [me]0-i a security worth having ; and [I]0-i shall proceed with courage . Do [you]0-i find [Bath]1824-bath as agreeable as when [I]0-i had the honour of making the inquiry before ? ” “[0-i] Yes , quite — more so , indeed . ” “[0-i] More so ! take care , or [you]0-i will forget to be tired of it at the proper time . [You]0-i ought to be tired at the end of six weeks . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i should be tired , if [I]0-i were to stay [here]1743-here six months . ” “[0-i] [Bath]1824-bath , compared with [London]12-london , has little variety , and so [everybody]1780-everybody finds out every year . ‘ For six weeks , [I]0-i allow [Bath]6-bath is pleasant enough ; but beyond _ that _ , it is [the most tiresome place in [the world]215-the world]693-the most tiresome place in the world . ’ [You]0-i would be told so by [people of all descriptions , who come regularly every winter]695-people of all descriptions , who come regularly every winter , lengthen [their]695-people of all descriptions , who come regularly every winter six weeks into ten or twelve , and go away at last because [they]695-people of all descriptions , who come regularly every winter can afford to stay no longer . ” “[1692-other people] Well , [other people]1692-other people must judge for [themselves]1692-other people , and [those who go to [London]12-london]697-those who go to london may think nothing of [Bath]6-bath . But [I]0-i , who live in [[a small retired village]698-a small retired village in [the country]246-the country]699-a small retired village in the country , can never find greater sameness in such a place as this than in [[my]0-i own [home]482-home]701-my own home ; for [here]1743-here are a variety of amusements , a variety of things to be seen and done all day long , which [I]0-i can know nothing of there . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are not fond of [the country]246-the country . ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i am . [I]0-i have always lived [there]1848-there , and always been very happy . But certainly there is much more sameness in a country life than in a Bath life . One day in [the country]246-the country is exactly like another . ” “[0-i] But then [you]0-i spend [your]0-i time so much more rationally in [the country]246-the country . ” “[0-i] Do [I]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i not ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not believe there is much difference . ” “[0-i] Here [you]0-i are in pursuit only of amusement all day long . ” “[0-i] And so [I]0-i am at [home]482-home — only [I]0-i do not find so much of it . [I]0-i walk about here , and so [I]0-i do [there]1848-there ; but [here]1743-here [I]0-i see a variety of people in [every street]711-every street , and there [I]0-i can only go and call on [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen . ” [Mr. Tilney]95-henry was very much amused . “[88-mrs. allen] Only go and call on [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ! ” [he]95-henry repeated . “[88-mrs. allen] What a picture of intellectual poverty ! however , when [you]0-i sink into this abyss again , [you]0-i will have more to say . [You]0-i will be able to talk of [Bath]6-bath , and of all that [you]0-i did [here]1743-here . ” “[0-i] Oh ! yes . [I]0-i shall never be in want of something to talk of again to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , or [anybody else]394-anybody else . [I]0-i really believe [I]0-i shall always be talking of [Bath]1824-bath , when [I]0-i am at [home]482-home again — [I]0-i _ do _ like it so very much . If [I]0-i could but have [Papa]137-papa and [Mamma]138-mamma , and the rest of [them]716-them here , [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i should be too happy ! [james]105-james ’s coming ( [[my]0-i eldest brother]717-my eldest brother ) is quite delightful — and especially as it turns out that [the very family [we]719-their are just got so intimate with]718-the very family we are just got so intimate with are [[his]105-james intimate friends]720-his intimate friends already . Oh ! who can ever be tired of [Bath]6-bath ? ” “[721-those who bring such fresh feelings of every sort] Not [those who bring such fresh feelings of every sort]721-those who bring such fresh feelings of every sort to it as [you]722-her do . But [papas and mammas]723-papas and mammas , and [brothers]2034-brothers , and [intimate friends]725-intimate friends are a good deal gone by , to [most of [the frequenters of [Bath]6-bath]727-the frequenters of bath]726-most of the frequenters of bath — and the honest relish of balls and plays , and everyday sights , is past with [them]716-them . ” Here [their]719-their conversation closed , the demands of the dance becoming now too importunate for a divided attention . Soon after [their]719-their reaching the bottom of the set , [Catherine]76-catherine perceived [herself]76-catherine to be earnestly regarded by [a gentleman who stood among [the lookers - on]2211-the lookers - on , immediately behind [[her]722-her partner]1844-her partner]2210-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner . [He]2210-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner was [a very handsome man , of a commanding aspect , past the bloom]2213-a very handsome man , of a commanding aspect , past the bloom , but not past the vigour of life ; and with [his]2210-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner eye still directed towards [her]722-her , [she]722-her saw [him]2210-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner presently address [Mr. Tilney]95-henry in a familiar whisper . Confused by [his]2210-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner notice , and blushing from the fear of its being excited by something wrong in [her]722-her appearance , [she]722-her turned away [her]722-her head . But while [she]722-her did so , [the gentleman]1837-the gentleman retreated , and [[her]722-her partner]1844-her partner , coming nearer , said , “[728-you] [I]0-i see that [you]728-you guess what [I]0-i have just been asked . [That gentleman]2081-that gentleman knows [your]728-you name , and [you]728-you have a right to know [his]2081-that gentleman . It is [General Tilney]139-general tilney , [[my]0-i father]629-my father . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s answer was only “[139-general tilney] Oh!”—but it was an “[629-my father] Oh ! ” expressing everything needful : attention to [his]2081-that gentleman words , and perfect reliance on [their]731-a family truth . With real interest and strong admiration did [her]722-her eye now follow [the General]2216-the general , as [he]2216-the general moved through [the crowd]1762-the crowd , and “[629-my father] How handsome [a family]731-a family [they]731-a family are ! ” was [her]722-her secret remark . In chatting with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney before the evening concluded , a new source of felicity arose to [her]722-her . [She]722-her had never taken a country walk since [her]722-her arrival in [Bath]6-bath . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , to whom [all the commonly frequented environs]2218-all the commonly frequented environs were familiar , spoke of [them]731-a family in terms which made [her]722-her all eagerness to know [them]731-a family too ; and on [her]722-her openly fearing that [she]722-her might find [nobody]396-nobody to go with [her]722-her , it was proposed by [the brother and sister]2220-the brother and sister that [they]733-they should join in a walk , some morning or other . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall like it , ” [she]722-her cried , “[0-i] beyond anything in [the world]215-the world ; and do not let [us]733-they put it off — let [us]733-they go to - morrow . ” This was readily agreed to , with only a proviso of [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s , that it did not rain , which [Catherine]76-catherine was sure it would not . At twelve o’clock , [they]733-they were to call for [her]722-her in [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street ; and “[139-general tilney] Remember — twelve o’clock , ” was [her]722-her parting speech to [[her]722-her new friend]1884-her new friend . Of [her]722-her other , [her]722-her older , [[her]722-her more established friend]2222-her more established friend , [Isabella]103-isabella , of whose fidelity and worth [she]722-her had enjoyed a fortnight ’s experience , [she]722-her scarcely saw anything during the evening . Yet , though longing to make [her]722-her acquainted with [her]722-her happiness , [she]722-her cheerfully submitted to the wish of [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , which took [them]733-they rather early away , and [her]722-her spirits danced within [her]722-her , as [she]722-her danced in [her]722-her chair all the way [home]482-home . CHAPTER 11 The morrow brought a very sober - looking morning , the sun making only a few efforts to appear , and [Catherine]76-catherine augured from it everything most favourable to [her]722-her wishes . A bright morning so early in the year , [she]722-her allowed , would generally turn to rain , but a cloudy one foretold improvement as the day advanced . [She]722-her applied to [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen for confirmation of [her]722-her hopes , but [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , not having [his]85-mr. allen own skies and barometer about [him]85-mr. allen , declined giving any absolute promise of sunshine . [She]722-her applied to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s opinion was more positive . “[734-she] [She]734-she had no doubt in [the world]215-the world of its being a very fine day , if the clouds would only go off , and the sun keep out . ” At about eleven o’clock , however , a few specks of small rain upon the windows caught [Catherine]76-catherine ’s watchful eye , and “[734-she] Oh ! dear , [I]0-i do believe it will be wet , ” broke from [her]722-her in a most desponding tone . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought how it would be , ” said [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen . “[0-i] No walk for [me]0-i to - day , ” sighed [Catherine]76-catherine ; “[0-i] but perhaps it may come to nothing , or it may hold up before twelve . ” “[0-i] Perhaps it may , but then , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , it will be so dirty . ” “[0-i] Oh ! that will not signify ; [I]0-i never mind dirt . ” “[0-i] No , ” replied [[her]734-she friend]1769-her friend very placidly , “[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i never mind dirt . ” After a short pause , “[0-i] It comes on faster and faster ! ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , as [she]734-she stood watching at a window . “[0-i] So it does indeed . If it keeps raining , [the streets]737-the streets will be very wet . ” “[0-i] There are four umbrellas up already . How [I]0-i hate the sight of an umbrella ! ” “[0-i] They are disagreeable things to carry . [I]0-i would much rather take a chair at any time . ” “[0-i] It was such a nice - looking morning ! [i]0-i felt so convinced it would be dry ! ” “[216-anybody] [Anybody]216-anybody would have thought so indeed . There will be [very few people in [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room]739-very few people in the pump - room , if it rains all the morning . [I]0-i hope [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen will put on [his]85-mr. allen greatcoat when [he]85-mr. allen goes , but [I]0-i dare say [he]85-mr. allen will not , for [he]85-mr. allen had rather do anything in [the world]215-the world than walk out in a greatcoat ; [I]0-i wonder [he]85-mr. allen should dislike it , it must be so comfortable . ” The rain continued — fast , though not heavy . [Catherine]76-catherine went every five minutes to the clock , threatening on each return that , if it still kept on raining another five minutes , [she]253-my dear would give up the matter as hopeless . The clock struck twelve , and it still rained . “[0-i] [You]0-i will not be able to go , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not quite despair yet . [I]0-i shall not give it up till a quarter after twelve . This is just the time of day for it to clear up , and [I]0-i do think it looks a little lighter . There , it is twenty minutes after twelve , and now [I]0-i _ shall _ give it up entirely . Oh ! that [we]743-we had such weather here as [they]744-they had at [Udolpho]110-udolpho , or at least in [Tuscany]34-tuscany and [the south of [France!—the]35-france!—the]745-the south of france!—the night that [poor St. Aubin]140-poor st. aubin died!—such beautiful weather ! ” At half past twelve , when [Catherine]76-catherine ’s anxious attention to the weather was over and [she]253-my dear could no longer claim any merit from its amendment , the sky began voluntarily to clear . A gleam of sunshine took [her]253-my dear quite by surprise ; [she]253-my dear looked round ; the clouds were parting , and [she]253-my dear instantly returned to the window to watch over and encourage the happy appearance . Ten minutes more made it certain that a bright afternoon would succeed , and justified the opinion of [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , who had “[747-them] always thought it would clear up . ” But whether [Catherine]76-catherine might still expect [[her]253-my dear friends]2225-her friends , whether there had not been too much rain for [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to venture , must yet be a question . It was too dirty for [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen to accompany [[her]253-my dear husband]2226-her husband to [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room ; [he]2226-her husband accordingly set off by [himself]2226-her husband , and [Catherine]76-catherine had barely watched [him]2226-her husband down [the street]1894-the street when [her]253-my dear notice was claimed by the approach of [the same two open carriages]2229-the same two open carriages , containing [the same three people that had surprised [her]253-my dear so much a few mornings back]2230-the same three people that had surprised her so much a few mornings back . “[103-isabella] [Isabella]103-isabella , [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , and [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , [I]0-i declare ! [they]747-them are coming for [me]0-i perhaps — but [I]0-i shall not go — [I]0-i can not go indeed , for [you]748-you know [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney may still call . ” [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen agreed to it . [John Thorpe]99-john was soon with [them]747-them , and [his]99-john voice was with [them]747-them yet sooner , for on the stairs [he]99-john was calling out to [Miss Morland]86-miss morland to be quick . “[92-miss tilney] Make haste ! make haste ! ” as [he]99-john threw open the door . “[92-miss tilney] Put on [your]748-you hat this moment — there is no time to be lost — [we]749-we are going to [Bristol]36-bristol . How d’ye do , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ? ” “[88-mrs. allen] To [Bristol]36-bristol ! is not that a great way off ? But , however , [I]0-i can not go with [you]748-you to - day , because [I]0-i am engaged ; [I]0-i expect [some friends]750-some friends every moment . ” This was of course vehemently talked down as no reason at all ; [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen was called on to second [him]99-john , and [the two others]2117-the two others walked in , to give [their]2117-the two others assistance . “[0-i] [My]0-i sweetest [Catherine]76-catherine , is not this delightful ? [We]749-we shall have a most heavenly drive . [You]76-catherine are to thank [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother and [me]0-i for the scheme ; it darted into [our]749-we heads at breakfast - time , [I]0-i verily believe at the same instant ; and [we]749-we should have been off two hours ago if it had not been for this detestable rain . But it does not signify , the nights are moonlight , and [we]749-we shall do delightfully . Oh ! [i]0-i am in such ecstasies at the thoughts of a little country air and quiet ! so much better than going to [the Lower Rooms]1826-the lower rooms . [We]749-we shall drive directly to [Clifton]37-clifton and dine [there]1848-there ; and , as soon as dinner is over , if there is time for it , go on to [Kingsweston]38-kingsweston . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i doubt [our]749-we being able to do so much , ” said [Morland]76-catherine . “[754-you] [[You]754-you croaking fellow]755-you croaking fellow ! ” cried [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe . “[755-you croaking fellow] [We]749-we shall be able to do ten times more . [Kingsweston]38-kingsweston ! aye , and [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle too , and anything else [we]749-we can hear of ; but here is [[your]754-you sister]325-your sister says [she]325-your sister will not go . ” “[325-your sister] [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle ! ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine . “[325-your sister] What is that ? ” “[325-your sister] [The finest place in [England]3-england]757-the finest place in england — worth going fifty miles at any time to see . ” “[325-your sister] What , is it really [a castle]758-a castle , [an old castle]759-an old castle ? ” “[325-your sister] The oldest in [the kingdom]760-the kingdom . ” “[325-your sister] But is it like what [one]305-one reads of ? ” “[305-one] Exactly — the very same . ” “[305-one] But now really — are there [towers]762-towers and [long galleries]763-long galleries ? ” “[305-one] By dozens . ” “[305-one] Then [I]0-i should like to see [it]39-blaize castle ; but [I]0-i cannot — [I]0-i can not go . ” “[0-i] Not go ! [my]0-i beloved creature , what do [you]0-i mean ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not go , because”—looking down as [she]764-she spoke , fearful of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s smile—“I[0-i] expect [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney and [[her]764-she brother]355-her brother to call on [me]0-i to take [a country walk]766-a country walk . [They]767-they promised to come at twelve , only it rained ; but now , as it is so fine , [I]0-i dare say [they]767-they will be here soon . ” “[767-they] Not [they]767-they indeed , ” cried [Thorpe]103-isabella ; “[767-they] for , as [we]768-we turned into [Broad Street]40-broad street , [I]0-i saw [them]767-they — does [he]355-her brother not drive [a phaeton with bright chestnuts]769-a phaeton with bright chestnuts ? ” “[355-her brother] [I]0-i do not know indeed . ” “[355-her brother] Yes , [I]0-i know [he]355-her brother does ; [I]0-i saw [him]355-her brother . [You]0-i are talking of [the man [you]0-i danced with last night]770-the man you danced with last night , are not [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i saw [him]355-her brother at that moment turn up [the Lansdown Road]41-the lansdown road , driving [a smart - looking girl]771-a smart - looking girl . ” “[0-i] Did [you]0-i indeed ? ” “[0-i] Did upon [my]0-i soul ; knew [him]355-her brother again directly , and [he]355-her brother seemed to have got some very pretty cattle too . ” “[355-her brother] It is very odd ! but [I]0-i suppose [they]772-they thought it would be too dirty for a walk . ” “[772-they] And well [they]772-they might , for [I]0-i never saw so much dirt in [my]0-i life . Walk ! [You]773-you could no more walk than [you]773-you could fly ! it has not been so dirty the whole winter ; it is ankle - deep everywhere . ” [Isabella]103-isabella corroborated it : “[0-i] [[My]0-i dearest]366-my dearest [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine can not form an idea of the dirt ; come , [you]76-catherine must go ; [you]76-catherine can not refuse going now . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should like to see [the castle]775-the castle ; but may [we]776-we go all over [it]775-the castle ? May [we]776-we go up every staircase , and into [every suite of rooms]777-every suite of rooms ? ” “[92-miss tilney] Yes , yes , every hole and corner . ” “[92-miss tilney] But then , if [they]772-they should only be gone out for an hour till it is dryer , and call by and by ? ” “[76-catherine] Make [yourself]76-catherine easy , there is no danger of that , for [I]0-i heard [Tilney]92-miss tilney hallooing to [a man who was just passing by on horseback]778-a man who was just passing by on horseback , that [they]772-they were going as far as [Wick Rocks]42-wick rocks . ” “[92-miss tilney] Then [I]0-i will . Shall [I]0-i go , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ? ” “[88-mrs. allen] Just as [you]76-catherine please , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear . ” “[88-mrs. allen] [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , [you]88-mrs. allen must persuade [her]780-her to go , ” was the general cry . [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen was not inattentive to it : “[88-mrs. allen] Well , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , ” said [she]780-her , “[88-mrs. allen] suppose [you]253-my dear go . ” And in two minutes [they]772-they were off . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s feelings , as [she]253-my dear got into [the carriage]2004-the carriage , were in a very unsettled state ; divided between regret for the loss of one great pleasure , and the hope of soon enjoying another , almost its equal in degree , however unlike in kind . [She]253-my dear could not think [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys had acted quite well by [her]253-my dear , in so readily giving up [their]133-the tilneys engagement , without sending [her]253-my dear any message of excuse . It was now but an hour later than the time fixed on for the beginning of [their]772-they walk ; and , in spite of what [she]253-my dear had heard of the prodigious accumulation of dirt in the course of that hour , [she]253-my dear could not from [her]253-my dear own observation help thinking that [they]772-they might have gone with very little inconvenience . To feel [herself]253-my dear slighted by [them]772-they was very painful . On the other hand , the delight of exploring [an edifice like [Udolpho]110-udolpho]2233-an edifice like udolpho , as [her]253-my dear fancy represented [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle to be , was such a counterpoise of good as might console [her]253-my dear for almost anything . [They]772-they passed briskly down [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , and through [Laura Place]43-laura place , without the exchange of many words . [Thorpe]103-isabella talked to [his]783-his horse , and [she]253-my dear meditated , by turns , on broken promises and broken arches , phaetons and false hangings , Tilneys and trap - doors . As [they]772-they entered [Argyle Buildings]44-argyle buildings , however , [she]253-my dear was roused by this address from [[her]253-my dear companion]2014-her companion , “[253-my dear] Who is [that girl who looked at [you]783-his so hard as [she]782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by went by]782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by ? ” “[782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by] Who ? Where ? ” “[782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by] On the right - hand pavement — [she]782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by must be almost out of sight now . ” [Catherine]76-catherine looked round and saw [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney leaning on [[her]253-my dear brother]355-her brother ’s arm , walking slowly down [the street]1894-the street . [She]253-my dear saw [them]784-them both looking back at [her]253-my dear . “[782-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by] Stop , stop , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , ” [she]253-my dear impatiently cried ; “[120-mr. thorpe] it is [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ; it is indeed . How could [you]120-mr. thorpe tell [me]0-i [they]784-them were gone ? Stop , stop , [I]0-i will get out this moment and go to [them]784-them . ” But to what purpose did [she]253-my dear speak ? [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe only lashed [his]120-mr. thorpe horse into a brisker trot ; [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys , who had soon ceased to look after [her]253-my dear , were in a moment out of sight round the corner of [Laura Place]43-laura place , and in another moment [she]253-my dear was [herself]253-my dear whisked into [the marketplace]2237-the marketplace . Still , however , and during the length of [another street]2238-another street , [she]253-my dear entreated [him]120-mr. thorpe to stop . “[0-i] Pray , pray stop , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe . [I]0-i can not go on . [I]0-i will not go on . [I]0-i must go back to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney . ” But [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe only laughed , smacked [his]120-mr. thorpe whip , encouraged [his]120-mr. thorpe horse , made odd noises , and drove on ; and [Catherine]76-catherine , angry and vexed as [she]253-my dear was , having no power of getting away , was obliged to give up the point and submit . [Her]253-my dear reproaches , however , were not spared . “[92-miss tilney] How could [you]120-mr. thorpe deceive [me]0-i so , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ? How could [you]120-mr. thorpe say that [you]120-mr. thorpe saw [them]785-them driving up [the Lansdown Road]786-the lansdown road ? [I]0-i would not have had it happen so for [the world]215-the world . [They]785-them must think it so strange , so rude of [me]0-i ! to go by [them]785-them , too , without saying a word ! [you]120-mr. thorpe do not know how vexed [I]0-i am ; [I]0-i shall have no pleasure at [Clifton]37-clifton , nor in anything else . [I]0-i had rather , ten thousand times rather , get out now , and walk back to [them]785-them . How could [you]120-mr. thorpe say [you]120-mr. thorpe saw [them]785-them driving out in [a phaeton]788-a phaeton ? ” [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe defended [himself]120-mr. thorpe very stoutly , declared [he]120-mr. thorpe had never seen [two men]2239-two men so much alike in [his]120-mr. thorpe life , and would hardly give up the point of its having been [Tilney]92-miss tilney [himself]120-mr. thorpe . [Their]2239-two men drive , even when this subject was over , was not likely to be very agreeable . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s complaisance was no longer what it had been in [their]2239-two men former airing . [She]2240-she listened reluctantly , and [her]2240-she replies were short . [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle remained [her]2240-she only comfort ; towards _ that _ , [she]2240-she still looked at intervals with pleasure ; though rather than be disappointed of the promised walk , and especially rather than be thought ill of by [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys , [she]2240-she would willingly have given up all the happiness which [its]39-blaize castle walls could supply — the happiness of a progress through [a long suite of lofty rooms]2241-a long suite of lofty rooms , exhibiting the remains of magnificent furniture , though now for many years deserted — the happiness of being stopped in [their]2239-two men way along [narrow , winding vaults]2242-narrow , winding vaults , by a low , grated door ; or even of having [their]2239-two men lamp , [their]2239-two men only lamp , extinguished by a sudden gust of wind , and of being left in total darkness . In the meanwhile , [they]2239-two men proceeded on [their]2239-two men journey without any mischance , and were within view of [the town of Keynsham]2243-the town of keynsham , when [a halloo from [Morland]76-catherine , who was behind [them]2239-two men , made [[his]76-catherine friend]2002-his friend]2244-a halloo from morland , who was behind them , made his friend pull up , to know what was the matter . [The others]353-the others then came close enough for conversation , and [Morland]76-catherine said , “[120-mr. thorpe] [We]789-we had better go back , [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ; it is too late to go on to - day ; [[your]120-mr. thorpe sister]325-your sister thinks so as well as [I.]791-i. [We]789-we have been exactly an hour coming from [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , very little more than seven miles ; and , [I]0-i suppose , [we]789-we have at least eight more to go . It will never do . [We]789-we set out a great deal too late . [We]789-we had much better put it off till another day , and turn round . ” “[789-we] It is all one to [me]0-i , ” replied [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe rather angrily ; and instantly turning [his]120-mr. thorpe horse , [they]789-we were on [their]789-we way back to [Bath]6-bath . “[789-we] If [[your]120-mr. thorpe brother]474-your brother had not got such a d — — beast to drive , ” said [he]0-i soon afterwards , “[789-we] [we]789-we might have done it very well . [My]0-i horse would have trotted to [Clifton]37-clifton within the hour , if left to [himself]474-your brother , and [I]0-i have almost broke [my]0-i arm with pulling [him]474-your brother in to that cursed broken - winded jade ’s pace . [Morland]76-catherine is [a fool]793-a fool for not keeping a horse and gig of [his]76-catherine own . ” “[76-catherine] No , [he]76-catherine is not , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine warmly , “[76-catherine] for [I]0-i am sure [he]76-catherine could not afford it . ” “[76-catherine] And why can not [he]76-catherine afford it ? ” “[76-catherine] Because [he]76-catherine has not money enough . ” “[76-catherine] And whose fault is that ? ” “[396-nobody] [Nobody]396-nobody ’s , that [I]0-i know of . ” [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe then said something in the loud , incoherent way to which [he]120-mr. thorpe had often recourse , about its being a d — — thing to be miserly ; and that if [people who rolled in money]2247-people who rolled in money could not afford things , [he]120-mr. thorpe did not know who could , which [Catherine]76-catherine did not even endeavour to understand . Disappointed of what was to have been the consolation for [her]2248-her first disappointment , [she]2248-her was less and less disposed either to be agreeable [herself]2248-her or to find [[her]2248-her companion]2014-her companion so ; and [they]2250-they returned to [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street without [her]2248-her speaking twenty words . As [she]2248-her entered [the house]238-the house , [the footman]2252-the footman told [her]2248-her that [a gentleman and lady]2253-a gentleman and lady had called and inquired for [her]2248-her a few minutes after [her]2248-her setting off ; that , when [he]2252-the footman told [them]2253-a gentleman and lady [she]2248-her was gone out with [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , [the lady]1834-the lady had asked whether any message had been left for [her]2248-her ; and on [his]2252-the footman saying no , had felt for a card , but said [she]2248-her had none about [her]2248-her , and went away . Pondering over these heart - rending tidings , [Catherine]76-catherine walked slowly [upstairs]1893-upstairs . At the head of [them]2253-a gentleman and lady [she]795-she was met by [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , who , on hearing the reason of [their]2253-a gentleman and lady speedy return , said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am glad [[your]795-she brother]474-your brother had so much sense ; [I]0-i am glad [you]795-she are come back . It was a strange , wild scheme . ” [They]2253-a gentleman and lady all spent the evening together at [Thorpe ’s]97-miss thorpe . [Catherine]76-catherine was disturbed and out of spirits ; but [Isabella]103-isabella seemed to find a pool of commerce , in the fate of which [she]103-isabella shared , by private partnership with [Morland]76-catherine , a very good equivalent for the quiet and country air of [an inn at [Clifton]37-clifton]2256-an inn at clifton . [Her]103-isabella satisfaction , too , in not being at [the Lower Rooms]46-the lower rooms was spoken more than once . “[0-i] How [I]0-i pity [the poor creatures that are going [there]1848-there]797-the poor creatures that are going there ! how glad [I]0-i am that [I]0-i am not amongst [them]797-the poor creatures that are going there ! [i]0-i wonder whether it will be a full ball or not ! [they]797-the poor creatures that are going there have not begun dancing yet . [I]0-i would not be there for [all the world]368-all the world . It is so delightful to have an evening now and then to oneself . [I]0-i dare say it will not be a very good ball . [I]0-i know [the Mitchells]142-the mitchells will not be [there]1848-there . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i pity [everybody]1780-everybody that is . But [I]0-i dare say , [Mr. Morland]105-james , [you]105-james long to be at [it]802-it , do not [you]105-james ? [I]0-i am sure [you]105-james do . Well , pray do not let [anybody here]803-anybody here be a restraint on [you]105-james . [I]0-i dare say [we]804-we could do very well without [you]105-james ; but [[you]105-james men]498-you men think [yourselves]105-james of such consequence . ” [Catherine]76-catherine could almost have accused [Isabella]103-isabella of being wanting in tenderness towards [herself]103-isabella and [her]103-isabella sorrows , so very little did [they]133-the tilneys appear to dwell on [her]103-isabella mind , and so very inadequate was the comfort [she]103-isabella offered . “[105-james] Do not be so dull , [[my]0-i dearest]366-my dearest creature , ” [she]103-isabella whispered . “[105-james] [You]105-james will quite break [my]0-i heart . It was amazingly shocking , to be sure ; but [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys were entirely to blame . Why were not [they]133-the tilneys more punctual ? It was dirty , indeed , but what did that signify ? [I]0-i am sure [John]99-john and [I]0-i should not have minded it . [I]0-i never mind going through anything , where [a friend]1896-a friend is concerned ; that is [my]0-i disposition , and [John]99-john is just the same ; [he]99-john has amazing strong feelings . Good heavens ! what a delightful hand [you]105-james have got ! kings , [I]0-i vow ! [i]0-i never was so happy in [my]0-i life ! [i]0-i would fifty times rather [you]105-james should have them than [myself]0-i . ” And now [I]88-mrs. allen may dismiss [[my]88-mrs. allen heroine]2201-my heroine to the sleepless couch , which is [[the true heroine]2258-the true heroine ’s portion]2259-the true heroine ’s portion ; to a pillow strewed with thorns and wet with tears . And lucky may [she]2201-my heroine think [herself]2201-my heroine , if [she]2201-my heroine get another good night ’s rest in the course of the next three months . CHAPTER 12 “[88-mrs. allen] [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine the next morning , “[88-mrs. allen] will there be any harm in [my]0-i calling on [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to - day ? [I]0-i shall not be easy till [I]0-i have explained everything . ” “[0-i] Go , by all means , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ; only put on a white gown ; [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney always wears white . ” [Catherine]76-catherine cheerfully complied , and being properly equipped , was more impatient than ever to be at [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , that [she]2201-my heroine might inform [herself]2201-my heroine of [[General Tilney]139-general tilney ’s lodgings]2261-general tilney ’s lodgings , for though [she]2201-my heroine believed they were in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , [she]2201-my heroine was not certain of [the house]238-the house , and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s wavering convictions only made it more doubtful . To [Milsom Street]2263-milsom street [she]2201-my heroine was directed , and having made [herself]2201-my heroine perfect in the number , hastened away with eager steps and a beating heart to pay [her]2201-my heroine visit , explain [her]2201-my heroine conduct , and be forgiven ; tripping lightly through [the church - yard]414-the church - yard , and resolutely turning away [her]2201-my heroine eyes , that [she]2201-my heroine might not be obliged to see [[her]2201-my heroine beloved]2265-her beloved [Isabella]103-isabella and [[her]2201-my heroine dear family]2266-her dear family , who , [she]2201-my heroine had reason to believe , were in [a shop hard by]2267-a shop hard by . [She]2201-my heroine reached [the house]238-the house without any impediment , looked at the number , knocked at the door , and inquired for [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney . [The man]675-the man believed [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to be at [home]482-home , but was not quite certain . Would [she]2201-my heroine be pleased to send up [her]2201-my heroine name ? [She]2201-my heroine gave [her]2201-my heroine card . In a few minutes [the servant]1988-the servant returned , and with a look which did not quite confirm [his]675-the man words , said [he]675-the man had been mistaken , for that [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney was walked out . [Catherine]76-catherine , with a blush of mortification , left [the house]238-the house . [She]2201-my heroine felt almost persuaded that [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney _ was _ at [home]482-home , and too much offended to admit [her]2201-my heroine ; and as [she]2201-my heroine retired down [the street]1894-the street , could not withhold one glance at the drawing - room windows , in expectation of seeing [her]2201-my heroine there , but [no one]1822-no one appeared at them . At the bottom of [the street]1894-the street , however , [she]2201-my heroine looked back again , and then , not at a window , but issuing from the door , [she]2201-my heroine saw [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney [herself]92-miss tilney . [She]2201-my heroine was followed by [a gentleman , whom [Catherine]76-catherine believed to be [[her]2201-my heroine father]205-her father , and [they]2279-they turned up towards [Edgar ’s Buildings]47-edgar ’s buildings]2277-a gentleman , whom catherine believed to be her father , and they turned up towards edgar ’s buildings . [Catherine]76-catherine , in deep mortification , proceeded on [her]2201-my heroine way . [She]2201-my heroine could almost be angry [herself]2201-my heroine at such angry incivility ; but [she]2201-my heroine checked the resentful sensation ; [she]2201-my heroine remembered [her]2201-my heroine own ignorance . [She]2201-my heroine knew not how such an offence as [hers]2201-my heroine might be classed by the laws of worldly politeness , to what a degree of unforgivingness it might with propriety lead , nor to what rigours of rudeness in return it might justly make [her]2201-my heroine amenable . Dejected and humbled , [she]2201-my heroine had even some thoughts of not going with [the others]353-the others to [the theatre]283-the theatre that night ; but it must be confessed that [they]2279-they were not of long continuance , for [she]2201-my heroine soon recollected , in the first place , that [she]2201-my heroine was without any excuse for staying at [home]482-home ; and , in the second , that it was a play [she]2201-my heroine wanted very much to see . To [the theatre]283-the theatre accordingly [they]353-the others all went ; [no Tilneys]133-the tilneys appeared to plague or please [her]2201-my heroine ; [she]2201-my heroine feared that , amongst the many perfections of [the family]1904-the family , a fondness for plays was not to be ranked ; but perhaps it was because [they]353-the others were habituated to the finer performances of the [London]12-london stage , which [she]2201-my heroine knew , on [Isabella]103-isabella ’s authority , rendered everything else of the kind “[92-miss tilney] quite horrid . ” [She]2201-my heroine was not deceived in [her]2201-my heroine own expectation of pleasure ; the comedy so well suspended [her]2201-my heroine care that [no one]1822-no one , observing [her]2201-my heroine during the first four acts , would have supposed [she]2201-my heroine had any wretchedness about [her]2201-my heroine . On the beginning of the fifth , however , the sudden view of [Mr. Henry Tilney]95-henry and [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father , joining a party in [the opposite box]2287-the opposite box , recalled [her]2201-my heroine to anxiety and distress . [The stage]2288-the stage could no longer excite genuine merriment — no longer keep [her]2201-my heroine whole attention . Every other look upon an average was directed towards the opposite box ; and , for the space of two entire scenes , did [she]2201-my heroine thus watch [Henry Tilney]95-henry , without being once able to catch [his]95-henry eye . No longer could [he]95-henry be suspected of indifference for a play ; [his]95-henry notice was never withdrawn from the stage during two whole scenes . At length , however , [he]95-henry did look towards [her]2201-my heroine , and [he]95-henry bowed — but such a bow ! no smile , no continued observance attended it ; [his]95-henry eyes were immediately returned to [their]2289-their former direction . [Catherine]76-catherine was restlessly miserable ; [she]2201-my heroine could almost have run round to the box in which [he]95-henry sat and forced [him]95-henry to hear [her]2201-my heroine explanation . Feelings rather natural than heroic possessed [her]2201-my heroine ; instead of considering [her]2201-my heroine own dignity injured by this ready condemnation — instead of proudly resolving , in conscious innocence , to show [her]2201-my heroine resentment towards [him]95-henry who could harbour a doubt of it , to leave to [him]95-henry all the trouble of seeking an explanation , and to enlighten [him]95-henry on the past only by avoiding [his]95-henry sight , or flirting with [somebody else]640-somebody else — [she]2201-my heroine took to [herself]2201-my heroine all the shame of misconduct , or at least of its appearance , and was only eager for an opportunity of explaining its cause . The play concluded — the curtain fell — [Henry Tilney]95-henry was no longer to be seen where [he]95-henry had hitherto sat , but [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father remained , and perhaps [he]95-henry might be now coming round to [[their]2292-their box]2293-their box . [She]2201-my heroine was right ; in a few minutes [he]95-henry appeared , and , making [his]95-henry way through the then thinning rows , spoke with like calm politeness to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen and [[her]2201-my heroine friend]1769-her friend . Not with such calmness was [he]95-henry answered by [the latter]214-the latter : “[92-miss tilney] Oh ! [mr . Tilney]92-miss tilney , [I]0-i have been quite wild to speak to [you]92-miss tilney , and make [my]0-i apologies . [You]92-miss tilney must have thought [me]0-i so rude ; but indeed it was not [my]0-i own fault , was it , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ? Did not [they]809-they tell [me]0-i that [Mr. Tilney]95-henry and [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister were gone out in a phaeton together ? And then what could [I]0-i do ? But [I]0-i had ten thousand times rather have been with [you]92-miss tilney ; now had not [I]0-i , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ? ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear , [you]92-miss tilney tumble [my]0-i gown , ” was [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s reply . [Her]253-my dear assurance , however , standing sole as it did , was not thrown away ; it brought a more cordial , more natural smile into [his]0-i countenance , and [he]0-i replied in a tone which retained only a little affected reserve : “[92-miss tilney] [We]812-we were much obliged to [you]92-miss tilney at any rate for wishing [us]812-we a pleasant walk after [our]812-we passing [you]92-miss tilney in [Argyle Street]48-argyle street : [you]92-miss tilney were so kind as to look back on purpose . ” “[92-miss tilney] But indeed [I]0-i did not wish [you]92-miss tilney a pleasant walk ; [I]0-i never thought of such a thing ; but [I]0-i begged [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe so earnestly to stop ; [I]0-i called out to [him]120-mr. thorpe as soon as ever [I]0-i saw [you]92-miss tilney ; now , [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , did not — Oh ! [you]92-miss tilney were not there ; but indeed [I]0-i did ; and , if [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe would only have stopped , [I]0-i would have jumped out and run after [you]92-miss tilney . ” Is there a Henry in [the world]215-the world who could be insensible to such a declaration ? [Henry Tilney]95-henry at least was not . With a yet sweeter smile , [he]95-henry said everything that need be said of [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister ’s concern , regret , and dependence on [Catherine]76-catherine ’s honour . “[813-she] Oh , do not say [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney was not angry , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , “[813-she] because [I]0-i know [she]813-she was ; for [she]813-she would not see [me]0-i this morning when [I]0-i called ; [I]0-i saw [her]813-she walk out of [the house]238-the house the next minute after [my]0-i leaving [it]238-the house ; [I]0-i was hurt , but [I]0-i was not affronted . Perhaps [you]815-you did not know [I]0-i had been [there]1848-there . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was not within at the time ; but [I]0-i heard of it from [Eleanor]143-eleanor , and [she]813-she has been wishing ever since to see [you]815-you , to explain the reason of such incivility ; but perhaps [I]0-i can do it as well . It was nothing more than that [[my]0-i father]629-my father — [they]818-they were just preparing to walk out , and [he]629-my father being hurried for time , and not caring to have it put off — made a point of [her]813-she being denied . That was all , [I]0-i do assure [you]815-you . [She]813-she was very much vexed , and meant to make [her]813-she apology as soon as possible . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s mind was greatly eased by this information , yet a something of solicitude remained , from which sprang the following question , thoroughly artless in itself , though rather distressing to [the gentleman]1837-the gentleman : “[813-she] But , [Mr. Tilney]95-henry , why were _ [you]95-henry _ less generous than [[your]95-henry sister]325-your sister ? If [she]813-she felt such confidence in [my]0-i good intentions , and could suppose it to be only a mistake , why should _ [you]95-henry _ be so ready to take offence ? ” “[0-i] [Me]0-i ! [i]0-i take offence ! ” “[0-i] Nay , [I]0-i am sure by [your]95-henry look , when [you]95-henry came into the box , [you]95-henry were angry . ” “[95-henry] [I]0-i angry ! [i]0-i could have no right . ” “[0-i] Well , [nobody]396-nobody would have thought [you]95-henry had no right who saw [your]95-henry face . ” [He]95-henry replied by asking [her]813-she to make room for [him]95-henry , and talking of the play . [He]95-henry remained with [them]2299-them some time , and was only too agreeable for [Catherine]76-catherine to be contented when [he]95-henry went away . Before [they]2299-them parted , however , it was agreed that the projected walk should be taken as soon as possible ; and , setting aside the misery of [his]95-henry quitting [their]2299-them box , [she]813-she was , upon the whole , left [one of the happiest creatures in [the world]215-the world]2300-one of the happiest creatures in the world . While talking to [each other]1792-each other , [she]813-she had observed with some surprise that [John Thorpe]99-john , who was never in the same part of [the house]238-the house for ten minutes together , was engaged in conversation with [General Tilney]139-general tilney ; and [she]813-she felt something more than surprise when [she]813-she thought [she]813-she could perceive [herself]813-she the object of [their]2299-them attention and discourse . What could [they]2299-them have to say of [her]813-she ? [She]813-she feared [General Tilney]139-general tilney did not like [her]813-she appearance : [she]813-she found it was implied in [his]139-general tilney preventing [her]813-she admittance to [[his]139-general tilney daughter]598-his daughter , rather than postpone [his]139-general tilney own walk a few minutes . “[95-henry] How came [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe to know [[your]120-mr. thorpe father]821-your father ? ” was [her]813-she anxious inquiry , as [she]813-she pointed [them]2299-them out to [[her]813-she companion]2014-her companion . [He]2014-her companion knew nothing about it ; but [[his]2014-her companion father]2286-his father , like [every military man]2307-every military man , had a very large acquaintance . When the entertainment was over , [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe came to assist [them]2299-them in getting out . [Catherine]76-catherine was the immediate object of [his]120-mr. thorpe gallantry ; and , while [they]2299-them waited in [the lobby]636-the lobby for a chair , [he]120-mr. thorpe prevented the inquiry which had travelled from [her]813-she heart almost to the tip of [her]813-she tongue , by asking , in a consequential manner , whether [she]813-she had seen [him]120-mr. thorpe talking with [General Tilney]139-general tilney : “[120-mr. thorpe] [He]822-him is [a fine old fellow]823-a fine old fellow , upon [my]0-i soul ! stout , active — looks as young as [[his]822-him son]824-his son . [I]0-i have a great regard for [him]822-him , [I]0-i assure [you]825-you : [a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived]826-a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived . ” “[0-i] But how came [you]0-i to know [him]822-him ? ” “[0-i] Know [him]822-him ! there are [few people much about [town]427-town that [I]0-i do not know]827-few people much about town that i do not know . [I]0-i have met [him]822-him forever at [the Bedford]49-the bedford ; and [I]0-i knew [his]822-him face again to - day the moment [he]822-him came into [the billiard - room]829-the billiard - room . [One of the best players [we]831-we have]830-one of the best players we have , by the by ; and [we]831-we had a little touch together , though [I]0-i was almost afraid of [him]822-him at first : the odds were five to four against [me]0-i ; and , if [I]0-i had not made one of the cleanest strokes that perhaps ever was made in [this world]832-this world — [I]0-i took [his]822-him ball exactly — but [I]0-i could not make [you]833-her understand it without a table ; however , [I]0-i _ did _ beat [him]822-him . [A very fine fellow]834-a very fine fellow ; as rich as [a Jew]551-a jew . [I]0-i should like to dine with [him]822-him ; [I]0-i dare say [he]822-him gives famous dinners . But what do [you]833-her think [we]831-we have been talking of ? [You]833-her . Yes , by heavens ! and [the General]2216-the general thinks [you]833-her [the finest girl in [Bath]6-bath]837-the finest girl in bath . ” “[2216-the general] Oh ! nonsense ! how can [you]833-her say so ? ” “[2216-the general] And what do [you]833-her think [I]0-i said?”—lowering [his]822-him voice—“well[838-general] done , [General]838-general , said [I]0-i ; [I]0-i am quite of [your]833-her mind . ” Here [Catherine]76-catherine , who was much less gratified by [his]822-him admiration than by [General Tilney]139-general tilney ’s , was not sorry to be called away by [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen . [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , however , would see [her]833-her to [her]833-her chair , and , till [she]833-her entered [it]2309-it , continued the same kind of delicate flattery , in spite of [her]833-her entreating [him]120-mr. thorpe to have done . That [General Tilney]139-general tilney , instead of disliking , should admire [her]833-her , was very delightful ; and [she]833-her joyfully thought that there was not one of [the family whom [she]833-her need now fear to meet]2310-the family whom she need now fear to meet . The evening had done more , much more , for [her]833-her than could have been expected . CHAPTER 13 Monday , Tuesday , Wednesday , Thursday , Friday , and Saturday have now passed in review before [the reader]1720-the reader ; the events of each day , its hopes and fears , mortifications and pleasures , have been separately stated , and the pangs of Sunday only now remain to be described , and close the week . The Clifton scheme had been deferred , not relinquished , and on the afternoon ’s Crescent of this day , it was brought forward again . In a private consultation between [Isabella]103-isabella and [James]105-james , the former of whom had particularly set [her]103-isabella heart upon going , and [the latter]214-the latter no less anxiously placed [his]214-the latter upon pleasing [her]833-her , it was agreed that , provided the weather were fair , the party should take place on the following morning ; and [they]2313-they were to set off very early , in order to be at [home]482-home in good time . The affair thus determined , and [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ’s approbation secured , [Catherine]76-catherine only remained to be apprised of it . [She]833-her had left [them]2313-they for a few minutes to speak to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney . In that interval the plan was completed , and as soon as [she]833-her came again , [her]833-her agreement was demanded ; but instead of the gay acquiescence expected by [Isabella]103-isabella , [Catherine]76-catherine looked grave , was very sorry , but could not go . The engagement which ought to have kept [her]833-her from joining in the former attempt would make it impossible for [her]833-her to accompany [them]2313-they now . [She]833-her had that moment settled with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to take [their]2313-they proposed walk to - morrow ; it was quite determined , and [she]833-her would not , upon any account , retract . But that [she]833-her _ must _ and _ should _ retract , was instantly the eager cry of both [the Thorpes]2315-the thorpes ; [they]2313-they must go to [Clifton]37-clifton to - morrow , [they]2313-they would not go without [her]103-isabella , it would be nothing to put off a mere walk for one day longer , and [they]2313-they would not hear of a refusal . [Catherine]76-catherine was distressed , but not subdued . “[0-i] Do not urge [me]0-i , [Isabella]103-isabella . [I]0-i am engaged to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney . [I]0-i can not go . ” This availed nothing . The same arguments assailed [her]833-her again ; [she]833-her must go , [she]833-her should go , and [they]2313-they would not hear of a refusal . “[0-i] It would be so easy to tell [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney that [you]92-miss tilney had just been reminded of a prior engagement , and must only beg to put off the walk till Tuesday . ” “[103-isabella] No , it would not be easy . [I]0-i could not do it . There has been no prior engagement . ” But [Isabella]103-isabella became only more and more urgent , calling on [her]103-isabella in the most affectionate manner , addressing [her]103-isabella by the most endearing names . [She]103-isabella was sure [her]103-isabella dearest , sweetest [Catherine]76-catherine would not seriously refuse such a trifling request to [a friend who loved [her]833-her so dearly]2316-a friend who loved her so dearly . [She]103-isabella knew [her]103-isabella beloved [Catherine]76-catherine to have so feeling a heart , so sweet a temper , to be so easily persuaded by those [she]103-isabella loved . But all in vain ; [Catherine]76-catherine felt [herself]76-catherine to be in the right , and though pained by such tender , such flattering supplication , could not allow it to influence [her]833-her . [Isabella]103-isabella then tried another method . [She]103-isabella reproached [her]103-isabella with having more affection for [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , though [she]103-isabella had known [her]103-isabella so little a while , than for [[her]103-isabella best and oldest friends]2317-her best and oldest friends , with being grown cold and indifferent , in short , towards [herself]103-isabella . “[0-i] [I]0-i can not help being jealous , [Catherine]76-catherine , when [I]0-i see [myself]0-i slighted for [strangers]839-strangers , [I]0-i , who love [you]76-catherine so excessively ! when once [my]0-i affections are placed , it is not in the power of anything to change them . But [I]0-i believe [my]0-i feelings are stronger than [anybody]216-anybody ’s ; [I]0-i am sure they are too strong for [my]0-i own peace ; and to see [myself]0-i supplanted in [your]76-catherine friendship by [strangers]839-strangers does cut [me]0-i to the quick , [I]0-i own . [These Tilneys]133-the tilneys seem to swallow up everything else . ” [Catherine]76-catherine thought this reproach equally strange and unkind . Was it the part of [a friend]1896-a friend thus to expose [her]1896-a friend feelings to the notice of [others]1832-others ? [Isabella]103-isabella appeared to [her]1896-a friend ungenerous and selfish , regardless of everything but [her]103-isabella own gratification . These painful ideas crossed [her]103-isabella mind , though [she]103-isabella said nothing . [Isabella]103-isabella , in the meanwhile , had applied [her]103-isabella handkerchief to [her]103-isabella eyes ; and [Morland]76-catherine , miserable at such a sight , could not help saying , “[133-the tilneys] Nay , [Catherine]76-catherine . [I]0-i think [you]76-catherine can not stand out any longer now . The sacrifice is not much ; and to oblige [such a friend]842-such a friend — [I]0-i shall think [you]76-catherine quite unkind , if [you]76-catherine still refuse . ” This was the first time of [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother ’s openly siding against [her]103-isabella , and anxious to avoid [his]355-her brother displeasure , [she]103-isabella proposed a compromise . If [they]2321-they would only put off [their]2321-they scheme till Tuesday , which [they]2321-they might easily do , as it depended only on [themselves]2321-they , [she]103-isabella could go with [them]2321-they , and [everybody]1780-everybody might then be satisfied . But “[0-i] No , no , no ! ” was the immediate answer ; “[0-i] that could not be , for [Thorpe]103-isabella did not know that [he]843-he might not go to [town]427-town on Tuesday . ” [Catherine]76-catherine was sorry , but could do no more ; and a short silence ensued , which was broken by [Isabella]103-isabella , who in a voice of cold resentment said , “[103-isabella] Very well , then there is an end of the party . If [Catherine]76-catherine does not go , [I]0-i can not . [I]0-i can not be [the only woman]845-the only woman . [I]0-i would not , upon any account in [the world]215-the world , do so improper a thing . ” “[76-catherine] [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine must go , ” said [James]105-james . “[76-catherine] But why can not [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe drive [one of [[his]120-mr. thorpe other sisters]848-his other sisters]847-one of his other sisters ? [I]0-i dare say either of [them]848-his other sisters would like to go . ” “[0-i] Thank [ye]76-catherine , ” cried [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , “[0-i] but [I]0-i did not come to [Bath]6-bath to drive [[my]0-i sisters]444-my sisters about , and look like [a fool]793-a fool . No , if [you]76-catherine do not go , d — — [me]0-i if [I]0-i do . [I]0-i only go for the sake of driving [you]76-catherine . ” “[0-i] That is a compliment which gives [me]0-i no pleasure . ” But [her]2323-she words were lost on [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe , who had turned abruptly away . [The three others]2324-the three others still continued together , walking in a most uncomfortable manner to poor [Catherine]76-catherine ; sometimes not a word was said , sometimes [she]2323-she was again attacked with supplications or reproaches , and [her]2323-she arm was still linked within [Isabella]103-isabella ’s , though [their]2324-the three others hearts were at war . At one moment [she]2323-she was softened , at another irritated ; always distressed , but always steady . “[0-i] [I]0-i did not think [you]76-catherine had been so obstinate , [Catherine]76-catherine , ” said [James]105-james ; “[76-catherine] [you]76-catherine were not used to be so hard to persuade ; [you]76-catherine once were [the kindest , best - tempered of [[my]0-i sisters]444-my sisters]851-the kindest , best - tempered of my sisters . ” “[76-catherine] [I]0-i hope [I]0-i am not less so now , ” [she]2323-she replied , very feelingly ; “[76-catherine] but indeed [I]0-i can not go .
