If [I]0-i am wrong , [I]0-i am doing what [I]0-i believe to be right . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suspect , ” said [Isabella]103-isabella , in a low voice , “[0-i] there is no great struggle . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s heart swelled ; [she]2323-she drew away [her]2323-she arm , and [Isabella]103-isabella made no opposition . Thus passed a long ten minutes , till [they]853-we were again joined by [Thorpe]103-isabella , who , coming to [them]853-we with a gayer look , said , “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i have settled the matter , and now [we]853-we may all go to - morrow with a safe conscience . [I]0-i have been to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , and made [your]854-your excuses . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i have not ! ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine . “[0-i] [I]0-i have , upon [my]0-i soul . Left [her]855-her this moment . Told [her]855-her [you]0-i had sent [me]0-i to say that , having just recollected a prior engagement of going to [Clifton]37-clifton with [us]853-we to - morrow , [you]0-i could not have the pleasure of walking with [her]855-her till [Tuesday]144-tuesday . [She]855-her said very well , [Tuesday]144-tuesday was just as convenient to [her]855-her ; so there is an end of all [our]853-we difficulties . A pretty good thought of [mine]0-i — hey ? ” [Isabella]103-isabella ’s countenance was once more all smiles and good humour , and [James]105-james too looked happy again . “[0-i] A most heavenly thought indeed ! now , [my]0-i sweet [Catherine]76-catherine , all [our]853-we distresses are over ; [you]76-catherine are honourably acquitted , and [we]853-we shall have a most delightful party . ” “[0-i] This will not do , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine ; “[0-i] [I]0-i can not submit to this . [I]0-i must run after [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney directly and set [her]855-her right . ” [Isabella]103-isabella , however , caught hold of one hand , [Thorpe]103-isabella of the other , and remonstrances poured in from [all three]2325-all three . [Even James]105-james was quite angry . When everything was settled , when [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney [herself]92-miss tilney said that Tuesday would suit [her]855-her as well , it was quite ridiculous , quite absurd , to make any further objection . “[0-i] [I]0-i do not care . [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe had no business to invent any such message . If [I]0-i had thought it right to put it off , [I]0-i could have spoken to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney [myself]0-i . This is only doing it in a ruder way ; and how do [I]0-i know that [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe has — [He]120-mr. thorpe may be mistaken again perhaps ; [he]120-mr. thorpe led [me]0-i into one act of rudeness by [his]120-mr. thorpe mistake on Friday . Let [me]0-i go , [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ; [Isabella]103-isabella , do not hold [me]0-i . ” [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe told [her]103-isabella it would be in vain to go after [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys ; [they]856-them were turning the corner into [Brock Street]50-brock street , when [he]120-mr. thorpe had overtaken [them]856-them , and were at [home]482-home by this time . “[103-isabella] Then [I]0-i will go after [them]856-them , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine ; “[0-i] wherever [they]856-them are [I]0-i will go after [them]856-them . It does not signify talking . If [I]0-i could not be persuaded into doing what [I]0-i thought wrong , [I]0-i never will be tricked into it . ” And with these words [she]103-isabella broke away and hurried off . [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe would have darted after [her]103-isabella , but [Morland]76-catherine withheld [him]120-mr. thorpe . “[857-her] Let [her]857-her go , let [her]857-her go , if [she]857-her will go . ” “[857-her] [She]857-her is as obstinate as — ” [Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe never finished the simile , for it could hardly have been a proper one . [Away]145-away walked [Catherine]76-catherine in great agitation , as fast as [the crowd]1762-the crowd would permit [her]103-isabella , fearful of being pursued , yet determined to persevere . As [she]103-isabella walked , [she]103-isabella reflected on what had passed . It was painful to [her]103-isabella to disappoint and displease [them]1762-the crowd , particularly to displease [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother ; but [she]103-isabella could not repent [her]103-isabella resistance . Setting [her]103-isabella own inclination apart , to have failed a second time in [her]103-isabella engagement to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , to have retracted a promise voluntarily made only five minutes before , and on a false pretence too , must have been wrong . [She]103-isabella had not been withstanding [them]1762-the crowd on selfish principles alone , [she]103-isabella had not consulted merely [her]103-isabella own gratification ; _ that _ might have been ensured in some degree by the excursion itself , by seeing [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle ; no , [she]103-isabella had attended to what was due to [others]1832-others , and to [her]103-isabella own character in [their]1832-others opinion . [Her]103-isabella conviction of being right , however , was not enough to restore [her]103-isabella composure ; till [she]103-isabella had spoken to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney [she]103-isabella could not be at ease ; and quickening [her]103-isabella pace when [she]103-isabella got clear of [the Crescent]14-the crescent , [she]103-isabella almost ran over the remaining ground till [she]103-isabella gained the top of [Milsom Street]15-milsom street . So rapid had been [her]103-isabella movements that in spite of [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys ’ advantage in the outset , [they]133-the tilneys were but just turning into [[their]133-the tilneys lodgings]2330-their lodgings as [she]103-isabella came within view of [them]133-the tilneys ; and [the servant]1988-the servant still remaining at the open door , [she]103-isabella used only the ceremony of saying that [she]103-isabella must speak with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney that moment , and hurrying by [him]92-miss tilney proceeded [upstairs]1893-upstairs . Then , opening the first door before [her]103-isabella , which happened to be the right , [she]103-isabella immediately found [herself]103-isabella in [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room with [General Tilney]139-general tilney , [[his]139-general tilney son]824-his son , and [daughter]2335-daughter . [Her]103-isabella explanation , defective only in being — from [her]103-isabella irritation of nerves and shortness of breath — no explanation at all , was instantly given . “[857-her] [I]0-i am come in a great hurry — It was all a mistake — [I]0-i never promised to go — [I]0-i told [them]858-them from the first [I]0-i could not go.—I ran away in a great hurry to explain it.—I did not care what [you]859-you thought of me.—I would not stay for [the servant]1988-the servant . ” The business , however , though not perfectly elucidated by this speech , soon ceased to be a puzzle . [Catherine]76-catherine found that [John Thorpe]99-john _ had _ given the message ; and [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney had no scruple in owning [herself]92-miss tilney greatly surprised by it . But whether [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother had still exceeded [her]103-isabella in resentment , [Catherine]76-catherine , though [she]103-isabella instinctively addressed [herself]103-isabella as much to [one]305-one as to [the other]1863-the other in [her]103-isabella vindication , had no means of knowing . Whatever might have been felt before [her]103-isabella arrival , [her]103-isabella eager declarations immediately made every look and sentence as friendly as [she]103-isabella could desire . The affair thus happily settled , [she]103-isabella was introduced by [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to [[her]103-isabella father]205-her father , and received by [him]205-her father with such ready , such solicitous politeness as recalled [Thorpe]99-john ’s information to [her]103-isabella mind , and made [her]103-isabella think with pleasure that [he]99-john might be sometimes depended on . To such anxious attention was [the General]2216-the general ’s civility carried , that not aware of [her]103-isabella extraordinary swiftness in entering [the house]238-the house , [he]205-her father was quite angry with [the servant whose neglect had reduced [her]103-isabella to open the door of [the apartment]2343-the apartment [herself]103-isabella]2342-the servant whose neglect had reduced her to open the door of the apartment herself . “[859-you] What did [William]102-william mean by it ? [He]102-william should make a point of inquiring into the matter . ” And if [Catherine]76-catherine had not most warmly asserted [his]102-william innocence , it seemed likely that [William]102-william would lose the favour of [[his]102-william master]550-his master forever , if not [his]102-william place , by [her]103-isabella rapidity . After sitting with [them]2345-them a quarter of an hour , [she]103-isabella rose to take leave , and was then most agreeably surprised by [General Tilney]139-general tilney ’s asking [her]103-isabella if [she]205-her father would do [[his]205-her father daughter]598-his daughter the honour of dining and spending the rest of the day with [her]103-isabella . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney added [her]103-isabella own wishes . [Catherine]76-catherine was greatly obliged ; but it was quite out of [her]103-isabella power . [Mr.]2347-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen would expect [her]103-isabella back every moment . [The General]2216-the general declared [he]2216-the general could say no more ; the claims of [Mr.]2349-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen were not to be superseded ; but on some other day [he]2216-the general trusted , when longer notice could be given , [they]861-they would not refuse to spare [her]103-isabella to [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend . “[102-william] Oh , no ; [Catherine]76-catherine was sure [they]861-they would not have the least objection , and [she]862-she should have great pleasure in coming . ” [The General]2216-the general attended [her]103-isabella [himself]2216-the general to [the street]1894-the street - door , saying everything gallant as [they]861-they went [downstairs]2119-downstairs , admiring the elasticity of [her]103-isabella walk , which corresponded exactly with the spirit of [her]103-isabella dancing , and making [her]103-isabella one of the most graceful bows [she]103-isabella had ever beheld , when [they]861-they parted . [Catherine]76-catherine , delighted by all that had passed , proceeded gaily to [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , walking , as [she]103-isabella concluded , with great elasticity , though [she]103-isabella had never thought of it before . [She]103-isabella reached [home]482-home without seeing anything more of [the offended party]2355-the offended party ; and now that [she]103-isabella had been triumphant throughout , had carried [her]103-isabella point , and was secure of [her]103-isabella walk , [she]103-isabella began ( as the flutter of [her]103-isabella spirits subsided ) to doubt whether [she]103-isabella had been perfectly right . A sacrifice was always noble ; and if [she]103-isabella had given way to [their]861-they entreaties , [she]103-isabella should have been spared the distressing idea of [a friend]1896-a friend displeased , [a brother]2188-a brother angry , and a scheme of great happiness to both destroyed , perhaps through [her]103-isabella means . To ease [her]103-isabella mind , and ascertain by the opinion of [an unprejudiced person]2358-an unprejudiced person what [her]103-isabella own conduct had really been , [she]103-isabella took occasion to mention before [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen the half - settled scheme of [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother and [the Thorpes]2315-the thorpes for the following day . [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen caught at it directly . “[862-she] Well , ” said [he]85-mr. allen , “[862-she] and do [you]863-you think of going too ? ” “[863-you] No ; [I]0-i had just engaged [myself]0-i to walk with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney before [they]864-they told [me]0-i of it ; and therefore [you]863-you know [I]0-i could not go with [them]864-they , could [I]0-i ? ” “[0-i] No , certainly not ; and [I]0-i am glad [you]863-you do not think of it . These schemes are not at all the thing . [Young men]1976-young men and women driving about [the country]246-the country in [open carriages]867-open carriages ! now and then it is very well ; but going to [inns]868-inns and [public places]869-public places together ! it is not right ; and [I]0-i wonder [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe should allow it . [I]0-i am glad [you]863-you do not think of going ; [I]0-i am sure [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland would not be pleased . [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , are not [you]863-you of [my]0-i way of thinking ? Do not [you]863-you think these kind of projects objectionable ? ” “[863-you] Yes , very much so indeed . [Open carriages]867-open carriages are nasty things . A clean gown is not five minutes ’ wear in them . [You]863-you are splashed getting in and getting out ; and the wind takes [your]863-you hair and [your]863-you bonnet in every direction . [I]0-i hate [an open carriage]438-an open carriage [myself]0-i . ” “[863-you] [I]0-i know [you]863-you do ; but that is not the question . Do not [you]863-you think it has an odd appearance , if [young ladies]1726-young ladies are frequently driven about in [them]867-open carriages by [young men]1976-young men , to whom [they]1726-young ladies are not even related ? ” “[863-you] Yes , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , a very odd appearance indeed . [I]0-i can not bear to see it . ” “[0-i] [Dear madam]875-dear madam , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , “[0-i] then why did not [you]875-dear madam tell [me]0-i so before ? [I]0-i am sure if [I]0-i had known it to be improper , [I]0-i would not have gone with [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe at all ; but [I]0-i always hoped [you]875-dear madam would tell [me]0-i , if [you]875-dear madam thought [I]0-i was doing wrong . ” “[875-dear madam] And so [I]0-i should , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , [you]875-dear madam may depend on it ; for as [I]0-i told [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland at parting , [I]0-i would always do the best for [you]875-dear madam in [my]0-i power . But one must not be over particular . [Young people]478-young people _ will _ be [young people]478-young people , as [[your]875-dear madam good mother]879-your good mother says [herself]879-your good mother . [You]875-dear madam know [I]0-i wanted [you]875-dear madam , when [we]880-we first came , not to buy that sprigged muslin , but [you]875-dear madam would . [Young people]478-young people do not like to be always thwarted . ” “[478-young people] But this was something of real consequence ; and [I]0-i do not think [you]875-dear madam would have found [me]0-i hard to persuade . ” “[875-dear madam] As far as it has gone hitherto , there is no harm done , ” said [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen ; “[875-dear madam] and [I]0-i would only advise [you]875-dear madam , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , not to go out with [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe any more . ” “[0-i] That is just what [I]0-i was going to say , ” added [[his]0-i wife]1799-his wife . [Catherine]76-catherine , relieved for [herself]76-catherine , felt uneasy for [Isabella]103-isabella , and after a moment ’s thought , asked [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen whether it would not be both proper and kind in [her]103-isabella to write to [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , and explain the indecorum of which [she]103-isabella must be as insensible as [herself]103-isabella ; for [she]103-isabella considered that [Isabella]103-isabella might otherwise perhaps be going to [Clifton]37-clifton the next day , in spite of what had passed . [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen , however , discouraged [her]103-isabella from doing any such thing . “[0-i] [You]875-dear madam had better leave [her]883-her alone , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ; [she]883-her is old enough to know what [she]883-her is about , and if not , has [a mother]885-a mother to advise [her]883-her . [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe is too indulgent beyond a doubt ; but , however , [you]875-dear madam had better not interfere . [She]98-mrs. thorpe and [[your]875-dear madam brother]474-your brother choose to go , and [you]875-dear madam will be only getting ill will . ” [Catherine]76-catherine submitted , and though sorry to think that [Isabella]103-isabella should be doing wrong , felt greatly relieved by [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen ’s approbation of [her]103-isabella own conduct , and truly rejoiced to be preserved by [his]85-mr. allen advice from the danger of falling into such an error [herself]103-isabella . [Her]103-isabella escape from being one of [the party to [Clifton]37-clifton]2362-the party to clifton was now an escape indeed ; for what would [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys have thought of [her]103-isabella , if [she]103-isabella had broken [her]103-isabella promise to [them]133-the tilneys in order to do what was wrong in itself , if [she]103-isabella had been guilty of one breach of propriety , only to enable [her]103-isabella to be guilty of another ? CHAPTER 14 The next morning was fair , and [Catherine]76-catherine almost expected another attack from [the assembled party]2363-the assembled party . With [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen to support [her]103-isabella , [she]103-isabella felt no dread of the event : but [she]103-isabella would gladly be spared a contest , where victory itself was painful , and was heartily rejoiced therefore at neither seeing nor hearing anything of [them]133-the tilneys . [The Tilneys]133-the tilneys called for [her]103-isabella at the appointed time ; and no new difficulty arising , no sudden recollection , no unexpected summons , no impertinent intrusion to disconcert [their]133-the tilneys measures , [[my]0-i heroine]2201-my heroine was most unnaturally able to fulfil [her]103-isabella engagement , though it was made with [the hero]1741-the hero [himself]1741-the hero . [They]133-the tilneys determined on walking round [Beechen Cliff]51-beechen cliff , [that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice render [it]51-beechen cliff so striking an object from almost every opening in [Bath]6-bath]2366-that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice render it so striking an object from almost every opening in bath . “[0-i] [I]0-i never look at it , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , as [they]133-the tilneys walked along [the side of [the river]2368-the river]2367-the side of the river , “[0-i] without thinking of [the south of [France]52-france]887-the south of france . ” “[888-you] [You]888-you have been abroad then ? ” said [Henry]95-henry , a little surprised . “[888-you] Oh ! no , [I]0-i only mean what [I]0-i have read about . It always puts [me]0-i in mind of [the country that [Emily]147-emily and [[her]147-emily father]205-her father travelled through]889-the country that emily and her father travelled through , in [The Mysteries of [Udolpho]110-udolpho]891-the mysteries of udolpho . But [you]888-you never read novels , [I]0-i dare say ? ” “[0-i] Why not ? ” “[892-they] Because [they]892-they are not clever enough for [you]888-you — [gentlemen]311-gentlemen read better books . ” “[311-gentlemen] [The person]894-the person , be it [gentleman]895-gentleman or [lady , who has not pleasure in a good novel]896-lady , who has not pleasure in a good novel , must be intolerably stupid . [I]0-i have read all [Mrs. Radcliffe]123-mrs. radcliffe ’s works , and most of them with great pleasure . The Mysteries of [Udolpho]110-udolpho , when [I]0-i had once begun it , [I]0-i could not lay down again ; [I]0-i remember finishing it in two days — [my]0-i hair standing on end the whole time . ” “[888-you] Yes , ” added [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , “[888-you] and [I]0-i remember that [you]888-you undertook to read it aloud to [me]0-i , and that when [I]0-i was called away for only five minutes to answer a note , instead of waiting for [me]0-i , [you]888-you took the volume into [the Hermitage Walk]53-the hermitage walk , and [I]0-i was obliged to stay till [you]888-you had finished it . ” “[888-you] Thank [you]888-you , [Eleanor]143-eleanor — a most honourable testimony . [You]888-you see , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , the injustice of [your]888-you suspicions . Here was [I]0-i , in [my]0-i eagerness to get on , refusing to wait only five minutes for [[my]0-i sister]322-my sister , breaking the promise [I]0-i had made of reading it aloud , and keeping [her]322-my sister in suspense at a most interesting part , by running away with the volume , which , [you]888-you are to observe , was [her]322-my sister own , particularly [her]322-my sister own . [I]0-i am proud when [I]0-i reflect on it , and [I]0-i think it must establish [me]0-i in [your]888-you good opinion . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am very glad to hear it indeed , and now [I]0-i shall never be ashamed of liking [Udolpho]110-udolpho [myself]0-i . But [I]0-i really thought before , [young men]1976-young men despised novels amazingly . ” “[1976-young men] It is _ amazingly ; _ it may well suggest _ amazement _ if [they]1976-young men do — for [they]1976-young men read nearly as many as [women]313-women . [I]0-i [myself]0-i have read hundreds and hundreds . Do not imagine that [you]888-you can cope with [me]0-i in a knowledge of [Julias]148-julias and [Louisas]149-louisas . If [we]900-we proceed to particulars , and engage in the never - ceasing inquiry of ‘ Have [you]888-you read this ? ’ and ‘ Have [you]888-you read that ? ’ [I]0-i shall soon leave [you]888-you as far behind [me]0-i as — what shall [I]0-i say?—I want an appropriate simile.—as far as [[your]888-you friend]901-your friend [Emily]147-emily [herself]147-emily left poor Valancourt when [she]147-emily went with [[her]147-emily aunt]902-her aunt into [Italy]54-italy . Consider how many years [I]0-i have had the start of [you]888-you . [I]0-i had entered on [my]0-i studies at [Oxford]11-oxford , while [you]888-you were [a good little girl]903-a good little girl working [your]888-you sampler at [home]482-home ! ” “[888-you] Not very good , [I]0-i am afraid . But now really , do not [you]888-you think [Udolpho]110-udolpho the nicest book in [the world]215-the world ? ” “[110-udolpho] The nicest — by which [I]0-i suppose [you]888-you mean the neatest . That must depend upon the binding . ” “[95-henry] [Henry]95-henry , ” said [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , “[95-henry] [you]95-henry are very impertinent . [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , [he]906-he is treating [you]95-henry exactly as [he]906-he does [[his]906-he sister]356-his sister . [He]906-he is forever finding fault with [me]0-i , for some incorrectness of language , and now [he]906-he is taking the same liberty with [you]95-henry . The word ‘ nicest , ’ as [you]95-henry used it , did not suit [him]906-he ; and [you]95-henry had better change it as soon as [you]95-henry can , or [we]908-we shall be overpowered with [Johnson]150-johnson and [Blair]151-blair all the rest of the way . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , “[0-i] [I]0-i did not mean to say anything wrong ; but it _ is _ a nice book , and why should not [I]0-i call it so ? ” “[0-i] Very true , ” said [Henry]95-henry , “[0-i] and this is a very nice day , and [we]908-we are taking a very nice walk , and [you]95-henry are [two very nice young ladies]909-two very nice young ladies . Oh ! it is a very nice word indeed ! it does for everything . Originally perhaps it was applied only to express neatness , propriety , delicacy , or refinement — [people]1782-people were nice in [their]1782-people dress , in [their]1782-people sentiments , or [their]1782-people choice . But now every commendation on every subject is comprised in that one word . ” “[86-miss morland] While , in fact , ” cried [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister , “[86-miss morland] it ought only to be applied to [you]95-henry , without any commendation at all . [You]95-henry are more nice than wise . Come , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , let [us]908-we leave [him]911-him to meditate over [our]908-we faults in the utmost propriety of diction , while [we]908-we praise [Udolpho]110-udolpho in whatever terms [we]908-we like best . It is a most interesting work . [You]95-henry are fond of that kind of reading ? ” “[95-henry] To say the truth , [I]0-i do not much like any other . ” “[95-henry] Indeed ! ” “[95-henry] That is , [I]0-i can read poetry and plays , and things of that sort , and do not dislike travels . But history , real solemn history , [I]0-i can not be interested in . Can [you]95-henry ? ” “[95-henry] Yes , [I]0-i am fond of history . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were too . [I]0-i read it a little as a duty , but it tells [me]0-i nothing that does not either vex or weary [me]0-i . The quarrels of [popes]912-popes and [kings]913-kings , with wars or pestilences , in every page ; [the men]378-the men all so good for nothing , and hardly [any women]915-any women at all — it is very tiresome : and yet [I]0-i often think it odd that it should be so dull , for a great deal of it must be invention . The speeches that are put into [the heroes]916-the heroes ’ mouths , [their]916-the heroes thoughts and designs — the chief of all this must be invention , and invention is what delights [me]0-i in other books . ” “[917-historians] [Historians]917-historians , [you]95-henry think , ” said [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , “[95-henry] are not happy in [their]917-historians flights of fancy . [They]917-historians display imagination without raising interest . [I]0-i am fond of history — and am very well contented to take the false with the true . In the principal facts [they]917-historians have sources of intelligence in former histories and records , which may be as much depended on , [I]0-i conclude , as anything that does not actually pass under [one]305-one ’s own observation ; and as for the little embellishments [you]95-henry speak of , they are embellishments , and [I]0-i like them as such . If a speech be well drawn up , [I]0-i read it with pleasure , by whomsoever it may be made — and probably with much greater , if the production of [Mr. Hume]152-mr. hume or [Mr. Robertson]153-mr. robertson , than if the genuine words of [Caractacus]154-caractacus , [Agricola]155-agricola , or [Alfred the Great]156-alfred the great . ” “[95-henry] [You]95-henry are fond of history ! and so are [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen and [[my]0-i father]629-my father ; and [I]0-i have [two brothers who do not dislike it]920-two brothers who do not dislike it . So many instances within [[my]0-i small circle of [friends]922-friends]921-my small circle of friends is remarkable ! at this rate , [I]0-i shall not pity [the writers of history]923-the writers of history any longer . If [people]1782-people like to read [their]1782-people books , it is all very well , but to be at so much trouble in filling great volumes , which , as [I]0-i used to think , [nobody]396-nobody would willingly ever look into , to be labouring only for the torment of [little boys]926-little boys and [girls]927-girls , always struck [me]0-i as a hard fate ; and though [I]0-i know it is all very right and necessary , [I]0-i have often wondered at [the person]894-the person ’s courage that could sit down on purpose to do it . ” “[0-i] That [little boys]926-little boys and [girls]927-girls should be tormented , ” said [Henry]95-henry , “[0-i] is what [no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state]931-no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state can deny ; but in behalf of [[our]932-our most distinguished historians]933-our most distinguished historians , [I]0-i must observe that [they]933-our most distinguished historians might well be offended at being supposed to have no higher aim , and that by [their]933-our most distinguished historians method and style , [they]933-our most distinguished historians are perfectly well qualified to torment [readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life]934-readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life . [I]0-i use the verb ‘ to torment , ’ as [I]0-i observed to be [your]935-you own method , instead of ‘ to instruct , ’ supposing [them]933-our most distinguished historians to be now admitted as synonymous . ” “[935-you] [You]935-you think [me]0-i foolish to call instruction a torment , but if [you]935-you had been as much used as [myself]0-i to hear [poor little children]936-poor little children first learning [their]936-poor little children letters and then learning to spell , if [you]935-you had ever seen how stupid [they]936-poor little children can be for a whole morning together , and how tired [[my]0-i poor mother]937-my poor mother is at the end of it , as [I]0-i am in the habit of seeing almost every day of [my]0-i life at [home]482-home , [you]935-you would allow that to _ torment _ and to _ instruct _ might sometimes be used as synonymous words . ” “[935-you] Very probably . But [historians]917-historians are not accountable for the difficulty of learning to read ; and even [you]935-you [yourself]935-you , who do not altogether seem particularly friendly to very severe , very intense application , may perhaps be brought to acknowledge that it is very well worth - while to be tormented for two or three years of [one]305-one ’s life , for the sake of being able to read all the rest of it . Consider — if reading had not been taught , [Mrs. Radcliffe]123-mrs. radcliffe would have written in vain — or perhaps might not have written at all . ” [Catherine]76-catherine assented — and a very warm panegyric from [her]123-mrs. radcliffe on [that lady]2370-that lady ’s merits closed the subject . [The Tilneys]133-the tilneys were soon engaged in another on which [she]123-mrs. radcliffe had nothing to say . [They]133-the tilneys were viewing [the country]246-the country with the eyes of [persons accustomed to drawing]2372-persons accustomed to drawing , and decided on its capability of being formed into pictures , with all the eagerness of real taste . Here [Catherine]76-catherine was quite lost . [She]123-mrs. radcliffe knew nothing of drawing — nothing of taste : and [she]123-mrs. radcliffe listened to [them]133-the tilneys with an attention which brought [her]123-mrs. radcliffe little profit , for [they]133-the tilneys talked in phrases which conveyed scarcely any idea to [her]123-mrs. radcliffe . The little which [she]123-mrs. radcliffe could understand , however , appeared to contradict the very few notions [she]123-mrs. radcliffe had entertained on the matter before . It seemed as if a good view were no longer to be taken from [the top of [an high hill]2374-an high hill]2373-the top of an high hill , and that a clear blue sky was no longer a proof of a fine day . [She]123-mrs. radcliffe was heartily ashamed of [her]123-mrs. radcliffe ignorance . A misplaced shame . Where [people]1782-people wish to attach , [they]1782-people should always be ignorant . [To come with a well - informed mind]2376-to come with a well - informed mind is to come with an inability of administering to the vanity of [others]1832-others , which [a sensible person]2378-a sensible person would always wish to avoid . [A woman]2379-a woman especially , if [she]2379-a woman have the misfortune of knowing anything , should conceal it as well as [she]2379-a woman can . The advantages of natural folly in [a beautiful girl]2380-a beautiful girl have been already set forth by the capital pen of [a sister author]2381-a sister author ; and to [her]123-mrs. radcliffe treatment of the subject [I]123-mrs. radcliffe will only add , in justice to [men]316-men , that though to the larger and more trifling part of the sex , imbecility in [females]2383-females is a great enhancement of [their]2383-females personal charms , there is a portion of [them]2383-females too reasonable and too well informed [themselves]2383-females to desire anything more in [woman]2194-woman than ignorance . But [Catherine]76-catherine did not know [her]123-mrs. radcliffe own advantages — did not know that [a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind]2385-a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind , can not fail of attracting [a clever young man]2386-a clever young man , unless circumstances are particularly untoward . In the present instance , [she]123-mrs. radcliffe confessed and lamented [her]123-mrs. radcliffe want of knowledge , declared that [she]123-mrs. radcliffe would give anything in [the world]215-the world to be able to draw ; and a lecture on the picturesque immediately followed , in which [his]2386-a clever young man instructions were so clear that [she]123-mrs. radcliffe soon began to see beauty in everything admired by [him]2386-a clever young man , and [her]123-mrs. radcliffe attention was so earnest that [he]2386-a clever young man became perfectly satisfied of [her]123-mrs. radcliffe having a great deal of natural taste . [He]2386-a clever young man talked of foregrounds , distances , and second distances — side - screens and perspectives — lights and shades ; and [Catherine]76-catherine was so hopeful [a scholar]2388-a scholar that when [they]2389-they gained [the top of [Beechen Cliff]51-beechen cliff]2390-the top of beechen cliff , [she]123-mrs. radcliffe voluntarily rejected [the whole city of]2391-the whole city of [Bath]6-bath as unworthy to make part of [a landscape]2392-a landscape . Delighted with [her]123-mrs. radcliffe progress , and fearful of wearying [her]123-mrs. radcliffe with too much wisdom at once , [Henry]95-henry suffered the subject to decline , and by an easy transition from a piece of rocky fragment and the withered oak which [he]95-henry had placed near [its]95-henry summit , to oaks in general , to [forests]2393-forests , the enclosure of [them]2393-forests , [waste lands]2394-waste lands , crown lands and government , [he]95-henry shortly found [himself]95-henry arrived at politics ; and from politics , it was an easy step to silence . The general pause which succeeded [his]95-henry short disquisition on [the state of [the nation]2396-the nation]2395-the state of the nation was put an end to by [Catherine]76-catherine , who , in rather a solemn tone of voice , uttered these words , “[123-mrs. radcliffe] [I]0-i have heard that something very shocking indeed will soon come out in [London]12-london . ” [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , to whom this was chiefly addressed , was startled , and hastily replied , “[0-i] Indeed ! and of what nature ? ” “[0-i] That [I]0-i do not know , nor who is [the author]197-the author . [I]0-i have only heard that it is to be more horrible than anything [we]942-we have met with yet . ” “[0-i] Good heaven ! where could [you]0-i hear of such a thing ? ” “[0-i] [A particular friend of mine]373-a particular friend of mine had an account of it in a letter from [London]12-london yesterday . It is to be uncommonly dreadful . [I]0-i shall expect murder and everything of the kind . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i speak with astonishing composure ! but [I]0-i hope [[your]0-i friend]901-your friend ’s accounts have been exaggerated ; and if such a design is known beforehand , proper measures will undoubtedly be taken by [government]945-government to prevent its coming to effect . ” “[945-government] Government , ” said [Henry]95-henry , endeavouring not to smile , “[945-government] neither desires nor dares to interfere in such matters . There must be murder ; and [government]945-government cares not how much . ” [The ladies]1776-the ladies stared . [He]0-i laughed , and added , “[0-i] Come , shall [I]0-i make [you]947-you understand [each other]1792-each other , or leave [you]947-you to puzzle out an explanation as [you]947-you can ? No — [I]0-i will be noble . [I]0-i will prove [myself]0-i [a man]403-a man , no less by the generosity of [my]0-i soul than the clearness of [my]0-i head . [I]0-i have no patience with such of [my]0-i sex as disdain to let [themselves]950-themselves sometimes down to the comprehension of [yours]947-you . Perhaps the abilities of [women]313-women are neither sound nor acute — neither vigorous nor keen . Perhaps [they]313-women may want observation , discernment , judgment , fire , genius , and wit . ” “[86-miss morland] [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , do not mind what [he]0-i says ; but have the goodness to satisfy [me]0-i as to this dreadful riot . ” “[0-i] Riot ! what riot ? ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Eleanor]143-eleanor , the riot is only in [your]143-eleanor own brain . The confusion there is scandalous . [Miss Morland]86-miss morland has been talking of nothing more dreadful than a new publication which is shortly to come out , in three duodecimo volumes , two hundred and seventy - six pages in each , with a frontispiece to the first , of two tombstones and a lantern — do [you]143-eleanor understand ? And [you]143-eleanor , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland — [[my]0-i stupid sister]953-my stupid sister has mistaken all [your]143-eleanor clearest expressions . [You]143-eleanor talked of expected horrors in [London]12-london — and instead of instantly conceiving , as [any rational creature]954-any rational creature would have done , that such words could relate only to a circulating library , [she]86-miss morland immediately pictured to [herself]86-miss morland [a mob of [three thousand men]956-three thousand men assembling in [St. George ’s Fields]55-st. george ’s fields]955-a mob of three thousand men assembling in st. george ’s fields , [the Bank]957-the bank attacked , [the Tower]958-the tower threatened , [the streets of [London]12-london]959-the streets of london flowing with blood , [a detachment of the [Twelfth Light Dragoons]56-twelfth light dragoons ( the hopes of [the nation]2396-the nation]960-a detachment of the twelfth light dragoons ( the hopes of the nation ) called up from [Northampton]57-northampton to quell [the insurgents]962-the insurgents , and [the gallant Captain Frederick Tilney]77-captain tilney , in the moment of charging at the head of [[his]77-captain tilney troop]963-his troop , knocked off [his]77-captain tilney horse by a brickbat from an upper window . Forgive [her]86-miss morland stupidity . The fears of [the sister]964-the sister have added to the weakness of [the woman]676-the woman ; but [she]86-miss morland is by no means [a simpleton in general]966-a simpleton in general . ” [Catherine]76-catherine looked grave . “[86-miss morland] And now , [Henry]95-henry , ” said [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , “[95-henry] that [you]95-henry have made [us]967-us understand [each other]1792-each other , [you]95-henry may as well make [Miss Morland]86-miss morland understand [yourself]95-henry — unless [you]95-henry mean to have [her]86-miss morland think [you]95-henry intolerably rude to [[your]95-henry sister]325-your sister , and [a great brute in [your]95-henry opinion of [women in general]971-women in general]970-a great brute in your opinion of women in general . [Miss Morland]86-miss morland is not used to [your]95-henry odd ways . ” “[86-miss morland] [I]0-i shall be most happy to make [her]86-miss morland better acquainted with [them]972-them . ” “[0-i] No doubt ; but that is no explanation of the present . ” “[0-i] What am [I]0-i to do ? ” “[95-henry] [You]95-henry know what [you]95-henry ought to do . Clear [your]95-henry character handsomely before [her]86-miss morland . Tell [her]86-miss morland that [you]95-henry think very highly of the understanding of [women]313-women . ” “[95-henry] [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , [I]0-i think very highly of the understanding of [all the women in [the world]215-the world]974-all the women in the world — especially of those — whoever [they]974-all the women in the world may be — with whom [I]0-i happen to be in company . ” “[0-i] That is not enough . Be more serious . ” “[86-miss morland] [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , [no one]1822-no one can think more highly of the understanding of [women]313-women than [I]0-i do . In [my]0-i opinion , nature has given [them]313-women so much that [they]313-women never find it necessary to use more than half . ” “[978-we] [We]978-we shall get nothing more serious from [him]0-i now , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland . [He]0-i is not in a sober mood . But [I]0-i do assure [you]95-henry that [he]0-i must be entirely misunderstood , if [he]0-i can ever appear to say an unjust thing of [any woman]979-any woman at all , or [an unkind one of [me]0-i]980-an unkind one of me . ” It was no effort to [Catherine]76-catherine to believe that [Henry Tilney]95-henry could never be wrong . [His]95-henry manner might sometimes surprise , but [his]95-henry meaning must always be just : and what [she]86-miss morland did not understand , [she]86-miss morland was almost as ready to admire , as what [she]86-miss morland did . The whole walk was delightful , and though it ended too soon , its conclusion was delightful too ; [[her]86-miss morland friends]2225-her friends attended [her]86-miss morland into [the house]238-the house , and [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , before [they]2225-her friends parted , addressing [herself]92-miss tilney with respectful form , as much to [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen as to [Catherine]76-catherine , petitioned for the pleasure of [her]86-miss morland company to dinner on the day after the next . No difficulty was made on [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s side , and the only difficulty on [Catherine]76-catherine ’s was in concealing the excess of [her]86-miss morland pleasure . The morning had passed away so charmingly as to banish all [her]86-miss morland friendship and natural affection , for no thought of [Isabella]103-isabella or [James]105-james had crossed [her]86-miss morland during [their]2225-her friends walk . When [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys were gone , [she]86-miss morland became amiable again , but [she]86-miss morland was amiable for some time to little effect ; [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen had no intelligence to give that could relieve [her]86-miss morland anxiety ; [she]86-miss morland had heard nothing of any of [them]2225-her friends . Towards the end of the morning , however , [Catherine]76-catherine , having occasion for some indispensable yard of ribbon which must be bought without a moment ’s delay , walked out into [the town]1819-the town , and in [Bond Street]58-bond street overtook the second [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe as [she]86-miss morland was loitering towards [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings between [two of [the sweetest girls in [the world]215-the world]2403-the sweetest girls in the world , who had been [[her]86-miss morland dear friends]2405-her dear friends]2402-two of the sweetest girls in the world , who had been her dear friends all the morning . From [her]86-miss morland , [she]86-miss morland soon learned that the party to [Clifton]37-clifton had taken place . “[0-i] [They]981-they set off at eight this morning , ” said [Miss Anne]157-anne , “[981-they] and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not envy [them]981-they [their]981-they drive . [I]0-i think [you]982-you and [I]0-i are very well off to be out of the scrape . It must be the dullest thing in [the world]215-the world , for there is not a soul at [Clifton]37-clifton at this time of year . [Belle]103-isabella went with [[your]982-you brother]474-your brother , and [John]99-john drove [Maria]158-maria . ” [Catherine]76-catherine spoke the pleasure [she]982-you really felt on hearing this part of the arrangement . “[99-john] Oh ! yes , ” rejoined [the other]1863-the other , “[99-john] [Maria]158-maria is gone . [She]158-maria was quite wild to go . [She]158-maria thought it would be something very fine . [I]0-i can not say [I]0-i admire [her]158-maria taste ; and for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i was determined from the first not to go , if [they]985-they pressed [me]0-i ever so much . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , a little doubtful of this , could not help answering , “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]982-you could have gone too . It is a pity [you]982-you could not all go . ” “[982-you] Thank [you]982-you ; but it is quite a matter of indifference to [me]0-i . Indeed , [I]0-i would not have gone on any account . [I]0-i was saying so to [Emily]147-emily and [Sophia]159-sophia when [you]982-you overtook [us]986-us . ” [Catherine]76-catherine was still unconvinced ; but glad that [Anne]157-anne should have the friendship of an [Emily]147-emily and [a Sophia]2407-a sophia to console [her]157-anne , [she]157-anne bade [her]157-anne adieu without much uneasiness , and returned [home]482-home , pleased that the party had not been prevented by [her]157-anne refusing to join it , and very heartily wishing that it might be too pleasant to allow either [James]105-james or [Isabella]103-isabella to resent [her]157-anne resistance any longer . CHAPTER 15 Early the next day , a note from [Isabella]103-isabella , speaking peace and tenderness in every line , and entreating the immediate presence of [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend on a matter of the utmost importance , hastened [Catherine]76-catherine , in the happiest state of confidence and curiosity , to [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings . [The two youngest Miss Thorpes]2411-the two youngest miss thorpes were by [themselves]2411-the two youngest miss thorpes in [the parlour]2412-the parlour ; and , on [Anne]157-anne ’s quitting it to call [[her]157-anne sister]1732-her sister , [Catherine]76-catherine took the opportunity of asking [the other]1863-the other for some particulars of [their]2411-the two youngest miss thorpes yesterday ’s party . [Maria]158-maria desired no greater pleasure than to speak of it ; and [Catherine]76-catherine immediately learnt that it had been altogether the most delightful scheme in [the world]215-the world , that [nobody]396-nobody could imagine how charming it had been , and that it had been more delightful than [anybody]216-anybody could conceive . Such was the information of the first five minutes ; the second unfolded thus much in detail — that [they]2411-the two youngest miss thorpes had driven directly to [the York Hotel]2418-the york hotel , ate some soup , and bespoke an early dinner , walked down to [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , tasted the water , and laid out some shillings in purses and spars ; thence adjourned to eat ice at [a pastry - cook]2420-a pastry - cook ’s , and hurrying back to [the hotel]1746-the hotel , swallowed [their]2411-the two youngest miss thorpes dinner in haste , to prevent being in the dark ; and then had a delightful drive back , only the moon was not up , and it rained a little , and [Mr. Morland]105-james ’s horse was so tired [he]105-james could hardly get it along . [Catherine]76-catherine listened with heartfelt satisfaction . It appeared that [Blaize Castle]39-blaize castle had never been thought of ; and , as for all the rest , there was nothing to regret for half an instant . [Maria]158-maria ’s intelligence concluded with a tender effusion of pity for [[her]158-maria sister]1732-her sister [Anne]157-anne , whom [she]158-maria represented as insupportably cross , from being excluded the party . “[159-sophia] [She]987-she will never forgive [me]0-i , [I]0-i am sure ; but , [you]988-you know , how could [I]0-i help it ? [John]99-john would have [me]0-i go , for [he]99-john vowed [he]99-john would not drive [her]987-she , because [she]987-she had such thick ankles . [I]0-i dare say [she]987-she will not be in good humour again this month ; but [I]0-i am determined [I]0-i will not be cross ; it is not a little matter that puts [me]0-i out of temper . ” [Isabella]103-isabella now entered [the room]1765-the room with so eager a step , and a look of such happy importance , as engaged all [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend ’s notice . [Maria]158-maria was without ceremony sent away , and [Isabella]103-isabella , embracing [Catherine]76-catherine , thus began : “[76-catherine] Yes , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , it is so indeed ; [your]76-catherine penetration has not deceived [you]76-catherine . Oh , that arch eye of [yours]76-catherine ! it sees through everything . ” [Catherine]76-catherine replied only by a look of wondering ignorance . “[76-catherine] Nay , [[my]0-i beloved]604-my beloved , [sweetest friend]991-sweetest friend , ” continued [the other]1863-the other , “[76-catherine] compose [yourself]76-catherine . [I]0-i am amazingly agitated , as [you]76-catherine perceive . Let [us]992-us sit down and talk in comfort . Well , and so [you]76-catherine guessed it the moment [you]76-catherine had [my]0-i note ? [Sly creature]993-sly creature ! oh ! [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine alone , who know [my]0-i heart , can judge of [my]0-i present happiness . [[Your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother is [the most charming of [men]316-men]996-the most charming of men . [I]0-i only wish [I]0-i were more worthy of [him]474-your brother . But what will [[your]76-catherine excellent father]998-your excellent father and [mother]206-mother say ? Oh ! heavens ! when [I]0-i think of [them]1000-them [I]0-i am so agitated ! ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s understanding began to awake : an idea of the truth suddenly darted into [her]103-isabella mind ; and , with the natural blush of so new an emotion , [she]103-isabella cried out , “[0-i] Good heaven ! [my]0-i dear [Isabella]103-isabella , what do [you]103-isabella mean ? Can [you]103-isabella — can [you]103-isabella really be in love with [James]105-james ? ” This bold surmise , however , [she]103-isabella soon learnt comprehended but half the fact . The anxious affection , which [she]103-isabella was accused of having continually watched in [Isabella]103-isabella ’s every look and action , had , in the course of [their]2426-their yesterday ’s party , received the delightful confession of an equal love . [Her]103-isabella heart and faith were alike engaged to [James]105-james . Never had [Catherine]76-catherine listened to anything so full of interest , wonder , and joy . [[Her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother and [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend engaged ! new to such circumstances , the importance of it appeared unspeakably great , and [she]103-isabella contemplated it as one of those grand events , of which the ordinary course of life can hardly afford a return . The strength of [her]103-isabella feelings [she]103-isabella could not express ; the nature of them , however , contented [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend . The happiness of having [such a sister]2430-such a sister was [their]2426-their first effusion , and [the fair ladies]2431-the fair ladies mingled in embraces and tears of joy . Delighting , however , as [Catherine]76-catherine sincerely did , in the prospect of the connection , it must be acknowledged that [Isabella]103-isabella far surpassed [her]103-isabella in tender anticipations . “[1001-you] [You]1001-you will be so infinitely dearer to [me]0-i , [[my]0-i [Catherine]76-catherine]1002-my catherine , than either [Anne]157-anne or [Maria]158-maria : [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i shall be so much more attached to [[my]0-i dear [Morland]76-catherine ’s family]1003-my dear morland ’s family than to [my]0-i own . ” This was a pitch of friendship beyond [Catherine]76-catherine . “[1001-you] [You]1001-you are so like [[your]1001-you dear brother]1004-your dear brother , ” continued [Isabella]103-isabella , “[1004-your dear brother] that [I]0-i quite doted on [you]1001-you the first moment [I]0-i saw [you]1001-you . But so it always is with [me]0-i ; the first moment settles everything . The very first day that [Morland]76-catherine came to [us]1005-us last Christmas — the very first moment [I]0-i beheld [him]76-catherine — [my]0-i heart was irrecoverably gone . [I]0-i remember [I]0-i wore [my]0-i yellow gown , with [my]0-i hair done up in braids ; and when [I]0-i came into [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room , and [John]99-john introduced [him]76-catherine , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i never saw [anybody so handsome]1007-anybody so handsome before . ” Here [Catherine]76-catherine secretly acknowledged the power of love ; for , though exceedingly fond of [[her]114-miss andrews brother]355-her brother , and partial to all [his]355-her brother endowments , [she]114-miss andrews had never in [her]114-miss andrews life thought [him]355-her brother handsome . “[0-i] [I]0-i remember too , [Miss Andrews]114-miss andrews drank tea with [us]1008-us that evening , and wore [her]114-miss andrews puce - coloured sarsenet ; and [she]114-miss andrews looked so heavenly that [I]0-i thought [[your]1009-you brother]474-your brother must certainly fall in love with [her]114-miss andrews ; [I]0-i could not sleep a wink all night for thinking of it . Oh ! catherine , the many sleepless nights [I]0-i have had on [[your]1009-you brother]474-your brother ’s account ! [i]0-i would not have [you]1009-you suffer half what [I]0-i have done ! [i]0-i am grown wretchedly thin , [I]0-i know ; but [I]0-i will not pain [you]1009-you by describing [my]0-i anxiety ; [you]1009-you have seen enough of it . [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i have betrayed [myself]0-i perpetually — so unguarded in speaking of [my]0-i partiality for [the church]1012-the church ! but [my]0-i secret [I]0-i was always sure would be safe with _ [you]1009-you _ . ” [Catherine]76-catherine felt that nothing could have been safer ; but ashamed of an ignorance little expected , [she]1009-you dared no longer contest the point , nor refuse to have been as full of arch penetration and affectionate sympathy as [Isabella]103-isabella chose to consider [her]1009-you . [[Her]1009-you brother]355-her brother , [she]1009-you found , was preparing to set off with all speed to [Fullerton]4-fullerton , to make known [his]355-her brother situation and ask consent ; and here was a source of some real agitation to the mind of [Isabella]103-isabella . [Catherine]76-catherine endeavoured to persuade [her]103-isabella , as [she]1009-you was [herself]1009-you persuaded , that [[her]1009-you father]205-her father and [mother]206-mother would never oppose [[their]1013-parents son]2436-their son ’s wishes . “[1009-you] It is impossible , ” said [she]1009-you , “[1009-you] for [parents]1013-parents to be more kind , or more desirous of [[their]1013-parents children]1014-their children ’s happiness ; [I]0-i have no doubt of [their]1013-parents consenting immediately . ” “[76-catherine] [Morland]76-catherine says exactly the same , ” replied [Isabella]103-isabella ; “[76-catherine] and yet [I]0-i dare not expect it ; [my]0-i fortune will be so small ; [they]1013-parents never can consent to it . [[Your]0-i brother]474-your brother , who might marry [anybody]216-anybody ! ” Here [Catherine]76-catherine again discerned the force of love . “[474-your brother] Indeed , [Isabella]103-isabella , [you]103-isabella are too humble . The difference of fortune can be nothing to signify . ” “[76-catherine] Oh ! [my]0-i sweet [Catherine]76-catherine , in _ [your]76-catherine _ generous heart [I]0-i know it would signify nothing ; but [we]1017-we must not expect such disinterestedness in many . As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i only wish [our]1017-we situations were reversed . Had [I]0-i the command of [millions]1018-millions , were [[I]0-i mistress of [the whole world]1020-the whole world]1019-i mistress of the whole world , [[your]76-catherine brother]474-your brother would be [my]0-i only choice . ” This charming sentiment , recommended as much by sense as novelty , gave [Catherine]76-catherine a most pleasing remembrance of [all the heroines of [her]2438-her acquaintance]2437-all the heroines of her acquaintance ; and [she]2438-her thought [[her]2438-her friend]1769-her friend never looked more lovely than in uttering the grand idea . “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [they]1022-they will consent , ” was [her]2438-her frequent declaration ; “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [they]1022-they will be delighted with [you]76-catherine . ” “[1022-they] For [my]0-i own part , ” said [Isabella]103-isabella , “[1022-they] [my]0-i wishes are so moderate that the smallest income in nature would be enough for [me]0-i . Where [people]1782-people are really attached , poverty itself is wealth ; grandeur [I]0-i detest : [I]0-i would not settle in [London]12-london for [the universe]1024-the universe . [A cottage in [some retired village]1026-some retired village]1025-a cottage in some retired village would be ecstasy . There are [some charming little villas about [Richmond]59-richmond]1027-some charming little villas about richmond . ” “[76-catherine] [Richmond]59-richmond ! ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine . “[76-catherine] [You]76-catherine must settle near [Fullerton]4-fullerton . [You]76-catherine must be near [us]1028-we . ” “[76-catherine] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i shall be miserable if [we]1028-we do not . If [I]0-i can but be near _ [you]76-catherine _ , [I]0-i shall be satisfied . But this is idle talking ! [i]0-i will not allow [myself]0-i to think of such things , till [we]1028-we have [[your]76-catherine father]821-your father ’s answer . [Morland]76-catherine says that by sending it to - night to [Salisbury]9-salisbury , [we]1028-we may have it to - morrow . To - morrow ? [I]0-i know [I]0-i shall never have courage to open the letter . [I]0-i know it will be the death of [me]0-i . ” A reverie succeeded this conviction — and when [Isabella]103-isabella spoke again , it was to resolve on the quality of [her]103-isabella wedding - gown . [Their]1028-we conference was put an end to by [the anxious young lover]2440-the anxious young lover [himself]2440-the anxious young lover , who came to breathe [his]2440-the anxious young lover parting sigh before [he]2440-the anxious young lover set off for [Wiltshire]5-wiltshire . [Catherine]76-catherine wished to congratulate [him]2440-the anxious young lover , but knew not what to say , and [her]103-isabella eloquence was only in [her]103-isabella eyes . From [them]1028-we , however , the eight parts of speech shone out most expressively , and [James]105-james could combine them with ease . Impatient for the realization of all that [he]105-james hoped at [home]482-home , [his]105-james adieus were not long ; and they would have been yet shorter , had [he]105-james not been frequently detained by the urgent entreaties of [his]105-james fair one that [he]105-james would go . Twice was [he]105-james called almost from the door by [her]103-isabella eagerness to have [him]105-james gone . “[0-i] Indeed , [Morland]105-james , [I]0-i must drive [you]105-james away . Consider how far [you]105-james have to ride . [I]0-i can not bear to see [you]105-james linger so . For heaven ’s sake , waste no more time . There , go , go — [I]0-i insist on it . ” [The two friends , with hearts now more united than ever]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever , were inseparable for the day ; and in schemes of sisterly happiness the hours flew along . [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe and [[her]98-mrs. thorpe son]2097-her son , who were acquainted with everything , and who seemed only to want [Mr. Morland]105-james ’s consent , to consider [Isabella]103-isabella ’s engagement as the most fortunate circumstance imaginable for [[their]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever family]2444-their family , were allowed to join [[their]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever counsels]2445-their counsels , and add [their]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever quota of significant looks and mysterious expressions to fill up the measure of curiosity to be raised in [the unprivileged younger sisters]2446-the unprivileged younger sisters . To [Catherine]76-catherine ’s simple feelings , this odd sort of reserve seemed neither kindly meant , nor consistently supported ; and its unkindness [she]103-isabella would hardly have forborne pointing out , had its inconsistency been less [[their]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever friend]2447-their friend ; but [Anne]157-anne and [Maria]158-maria soon set [her]103-isabella heart at ease by the sagacity of [their]2442-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever “[0-i] [I]0-i know what ” ; and the evening was spent in a sort of war of wit , a display of family ingenuity , on one side in the mystery of an affected secret , on the other of undefined discovery , all equally acute . [Catherine]76-catherine was with [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend again the next day , endeavouring to support [her]103-isabella spirits and while away the many tedious hours before the delivery of the letters ; a needful exertion , for as the time of reasonable expectation drew near , [Isabella]103-isabella became more and more desponding , and before the letter arrived , had worked [herself]103-isabella into a state of real distress . But when it did come , where could distress be found ? “[0-i] [I]0-i have had no difficulty in gaining the consent of [[my]0-i kind parents]1030-my kind parents , and am promised that everything in [their]1030-my kind parents power shall be done to forward [my]0-i happiness , ” were the first three lines , and in one moment all was joyful security . The brightest glow was instantly spread over [Isabella]103-isabella ’s features , all care and anxiety seemed removed , [her]103-isabella spirits became almost too high for control , and [she]103-isabella called [herself]103-isabella without scruple the happiest of [mortals]2449-mortals . [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , with tears of joy , embraced [[her]98-mrs. thorpe daughter]1729-her daughter , [[her]98-mrs. thorpe son]2097-her son , [[her]98-mrs. thorpe visitor]2452-her visitor , and could have embraced [half the inhabitants of [Bath]6-bath]2453-half the inhabitants of bath with satisfaction . [Her]103-isabella heart was overflowing with tenderness . It was “[99-john] dear [John]99-john ” and “[76-catherine] dear [Catherine]76-catherine ” at every word ; “[157-anne] dear [Anne]157-anne and dear [Maria]158-maria ” must immediately be made [sharers]2454-sharers in [their]2454-sharers felicity ; and [two “[76-catherine] dears ”]2455-two “ dears ” at once before the name of [Isabella]103-isabella were not more than [that beloved child]2456-that beloved child had now well earned . [John]99-john [himself]99-john was [no skulker in joy]2457-no skulker in joy . [He]99-john not only bestowed on [Mr. Morland]105-james the high commendation of being [one of [the finest fellows in [the world]215-the world]2459-the finest fellows in the world]2458-one of the finest fellows in the world , but swore off many sentences in [his]105-james praise . The letter , whence sprang all this felicity , was short , containing little more than this assurance of success ; and every particular was deferred till [James]105-james could write again . But for particulars [Isabella]103-isabella could well afford to wait . The needful was comprised in [Mr. Morland]105-james ’s promise ; [his]105-james honour was pledged to make everything easy ; and by what means [their]2461-their income was to be formed , whether [landed property]2462-landed property were to be resigned , or funded money made over , was a matter in which [her]103-isabella disinterested spirit took no concern . [She]103-isabella knew enough to feel secure of an honourable and speedy establishment , and [her]103-isabella imagination took a rapid flight over its attendant felicities . [She]103-isabella saw [herself]103-isabella at the end of a few weeks , the gaze and admiration of [every new acquaintance at [Fullerton]4-fullerton]2463-every new acquaintance at fullerton , the envy of [every valued old friend in [Putney]60-putney]2464-every valued old friend in putney , with [a carriage]2110-a carriage at [her]103-isabella command , a new name on [her]103-isabella tickets , and a brilliant exhibition of hoop rings on [her]103-isabella finger . When the contents of the letter were ascertained , [John Thorpe]99-john , who had only waited [its]2466-its arrival to begin [his]99-john journey to [London]12-london , prepared to set off . “[99-john] Well , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , ” said [he]0-i , on finding [her]86-miss morland alone in [the parlour]2412-the parlour , “[86-miss morland] [I]0-i am come to bid [you]86-miss morland good - bye . ” [Catherine]76-catherine wished [him]0-i a good journey . Without appearing to hear [her]86-miss morland , [he]0-i walked to the window , fidgeted about , hummed a tune , and seemed wholly self - occupied . “[0-i] Shall not [you]0-i be late at Devizes ? ” said [Catherine]76-catherine . [He]0-i made no answer ; but after a minute ’s silence burst out with , “[0-i] A famous good thing this marrying scheme , upon [my]0-i soul ! a clever fancy of [Morland]76-catherine ’s and [Belle]103-isabella ’s . What do [you]0-i think of it , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ? _ [I]0-i _ say it is no bad notion . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i think it a very good one . ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i ? That ’s honest , by heavens ! [i]0-i am glad [you]0-i are [no enemy to matrimony]1031-no enemy to matrimony , however . Did [you]0-i ever hear the old song , ‘ Going to One Wedding Brings on Another ? ’ [I]0-i say , [you]0-i will come to [Belle]103-isabella ’s wedding , [I]0-i hope . ” “[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i have promised [[your]0-i sister]325-your sister to be with [her]325-your sister , if possible . ” “[0-i] And then [you]0-i know”—twisting [himself]0-i about and forcing [a foolish laugh—“I]2468-a foolish laugh—“i[0-i] say , then [you]0-i know , [we]1033-we may try the truth of this same old song . ” “[1033-we] May [we]1033-we ? But [I]0-i never sing . Well , [I]0-i wish [you]0-i a good journey . [I]0-i dine with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney to - day , and must now be going [home]482-home . ” “[0-i] Nay , but there is no such confounded hurry . Who knows when [we]1033-we may be together again ? Not but that [I]0-i shall be down again by the end of a fortnight , and a devilish long fortnight it will appear to [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Then why do [you]0-i stay away so long ? ” replied [Catherine]76-catherine — finding that [he]0-i waited for an answer . “[0-i] That is kind of [you]0-i , however — kind and good - natured . [I]0-i shall not forget it in a hurry . But [you]0-i have more good nature and all that , than [anybody living]1035-anybody living , [I]0-i believe . A monstrous deal of good nature , and it is not only good nature , but [you]0-i have so much , so much of everything ; and then [you]0-i have such — upon [my]0-i soul , [I]0-i do not know [[anybody]216-anybody like [you]0-i]1037-anybody like you . ” “[0-i] Oh ! dear , there are [a great many people]1038-a great many people like [me]0-i , [I]0-i dare say , only a great deal better . [[My]0-i father]629-my father and [mother]206-mother will be very glad to see [you]0-i . ” “[206-mother] And [I]0-i hope — [I]0-i hope , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , _ [you]0-i _ will not be sorry to see [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Oh ! dear , not at all . There are [very few people [I]0-i am sorry to see]1041-very few people i am sorry to see . [Company]1042-company is always cheerful . ” “[1042-company] That is just [my]0-i way of thinking . Give [me]0-i but a little cheerful company , let [me]0-i only have [the company of [the people [I]0-i love]1044-the people i love]1043-the company of the people i love , let [me]0-i only be where [I]0-i like and with whom [I]0-i like , and [the devil take the rest]1045-the devil take the rest , say [I.]0-i And [I]0-i am heartily glad to hear [you]0-i say the same . But [I]0-i have a notion , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , [you]0-i and [I]0-i think pretty much alike upon most matters . ” “[1046-we] Perhaps [we]1046-we may ; but it is more than [I]0-i ever thought of . And as to _ most matters _ , to say the truth , there are not many that [I]0-i know [my]0-i own mind about . ” “[0-i] By [Jove]134-jove , no more do [I.]134-jove It is not [my]0-i way to bother [my]0-i brains with what does not concern [me]0-i . [My]0-i notion of things is simple enough . Let [me]0-i only have [the girl]1047-the girl [I]0-i like , say [I]0-i , with [a comfortable house over [my]0-i head]1048-a comfortable house over my head , and what care [I]0-i for all the rest ? Fortune is nothing . [I]0-i am sure of a good income of [my]0-i own ; and if [she]1047-the girl had not a penny , why , so much the better . ” “[1047-the girl] Very true . [I]0-i think like [you]1049-her there . If there is a good fortune on one side , there can be no occasion for any on the other . No matter which has it , so that there is enough . [I]0-i hate the idea of one great fortune looking out for another . And to marry for money [I]0-i think the wickedest thing in existence . Good day . [We]1050-we shall be very glad to see [you]1049-her at [Fullerton]4-fullerton , whenever it is convenient . ” And away [she]1049-her went . It was not in the power of all [his]0-i gallantry to detain [her]1049-her longer . With such news to communicate , and such a visit to prepare for , [her]1049-her departure was not to be delayed by anything in [his]0-i nature to urge ; and [she]1049-her hurried away , leaving [him]0-i to the undivided consciousness of [his]0-i own happy address , and [her]1049-her explicit encouragement . The agitation which [she]1049-her had [herself]1049-her experienced on first learning [[her]1049-her brother]355-her brother ’s engagement made [her]1049-her expect to raise no inconsiderable emotion in [Mr.]2470-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , by the communication of the wonderful event . How great was [her]1049-her disappointment ! the important affair , which many words of preparation ushered in , had been foreseen by [them]1050-we both ever since [[her]1049-her brother]355-her brother ’s arrival ; and all that [they]1050-we felt on the occasion was comprehended in a wish for [the young people]2472-the young people ’s happiness , with a remark , on [the gentleman]1837-the gentleman ’s side , in favour of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s beauty , and on [the lady]1834-the lady ’s , of [her]1834-the lady great good luck . It was to [Catherine]76-catherine the most surprising insensibility . The disclosure , however , of the great secret of [James]105-james ’s going to [Fullerton]4-fullerton the day before , did raise some emotion in [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen . [She]1049-her could not listen to that with perfect calmness , but repeatedly regretted the necessity of its concealment , wished [she]1049-her could have known [his]105-james intention , wished [she]1049-her could have seen [him]105-james before [he]105-james went , as [she]1049-her should certainly have troubled [him]105-james with [her]1049-her best regards to [[his]105-james father]2286-his father and [mother]206-mother , and [her]1049-her kind compliments to [all the Skinners]2477-all the skinners . CHAPTER 16 [Catherine]76-catherine ’s expectations of pleasure from [her]1049-her visit in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street were so very high that disappointment was inevitable ; and accordingly , though [she]1049-her was most politely received by [General Tilney]139-general tilney , and kindly welcomed by [[his]139-general tilney daughter]598-his daughter , though [Henry]95-henry was at [home]482-home , and [no one else of the party]2480-no one else of the party , [she]1049-her found , on [her]1049-her return , without spending many hours in the examination of [her]1049-her feelings , that [she]1049-her had gone to [her]1049-her appointment preparing for happiness which it had not afforded . Instead of finding [herself]1049-her improved in acquaintance with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , from the intercourse of the day , [she]1049-her seemed hardly so intimate with [her]1049-her as before ; instead of seeing [Henry Tilney]95-henry to greater advantage than ever , in the ease of a family party , [he]95-henry had never said so little , nor been so little agreeable ; and , in spite of [[their]2481-their father]2482-their father ’s great civilities to [her]1049-her — in spite of [his]95-henry thanks , invitations , and compliments — it had been a release to get away from [him]95-henry . It puzzled [her]1049-her to account for all this . It could not be [General Tilney]139-general tilney ’s fault . That [he]95-henry was perfectly agreeable and good - natured , and altogether [a very charming man]2483-a very charming man , did not admit of a doubt , for [he]95-henry was tall and handsome , and [[Henry]95-henry ’s father]2484-henry ’s father . _ [He]95-henry _ could not be accountable for [[his]95-henry children]2485-his children ’s want of spirits , or for [her]1049-her want of enjoyment in [his]95-henry company . The former [she]1049-her hoped at last might have been accidental , and the latter [she]1049-her could only attribute to [her]1049-her own stupidity . [Isabella]103-isabella , on hearing the particulars of the visit , gave a different explanation : “[1050-we] It was all pride , pride , insufferable haughtiness and pride ! [she]1051-her had long suspected [the family]1904-the family to be very high , and this made it certain . Such insolence of behaviour as [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s [she]1051-her had never heard of in [her]1051-her life ! not to do the honours of [[her]1051-her house]1053-her house with common good breeding ! to behave to [[her]1051-her guest]1054-her guest with such superciliousness ! hardly even to speak to [her]1051-her ! ” “[103-isabella] But it was not so bad as that , [Isabella]103-isabella ; there was no superciliousness ; [she]1051-her was very civil . ” “[1051-her] Oh , do n’t defend [her]1051-her ! and then [the brother]1055-the brother , [he]1055-the brother , who had appeared so attached to [you]103-isabella ! good heavens ! well , [some people]437-some people ’s feelings are incomprehensible . And so [he]1055-the brother hardly looked once at [you]103-isabella the whole day ? ” “[1055-the brother] [I]0-i do not say so ; but [he]1055-the brother did not seem in good spirits . ” “[1055-the brother] How contemptible ! of all things in [the world]215-the world inconstancy is [my]0-i aversion . Let [me]0-i entreat [you]103-isabella never to think of [him]1055-the brother again , [[my]0-i dear [Catherine]76-catherine]1058-my dear catherine ; indeed [he]1055-the brother is unworthy of [you]103-isabella . ” “[1055-the brother] Unworthy ! [i]0-i do not suppose [he]1055-the brother ever thinks of [me]0-i . ” “[1055-the brother] That is exactly what [I]0-i say ; [he]1055-the brother never thinks of [you]103-isabella . Such fickleness ! Oh ! how different to [[your]103-isabella brother]474-your brother and to [mine]0-i ! [i]0-i really believe [John]99-john has the most constant heart . ” “[99-john] But as for [General Tilney]139-general tilney , [I]0-i assure [you]139-general tilney it would be impossible for [anybody]216-anybody to behave to [me]0-i with greater civility and attention ; it seemed to be [his]1055-the brother only care to entertain and make [me]0-i happy . ” “[1055-the brother] Oh ! [i]0-i know no harm of [him]1055-the brother ; [I]0-i do not suspect [him]1055-the brother of pride . [I]0-i believe [he]1055-the brother is [a very gentleman - like man]1061-a very gentleman - like man . [John]99-john thinks very well of [him]1055-the brother , and [John]99-john ’s judgment — ” “[99-john] Well , [I]0-i shall see how [they]1062-they behave to [me]0-i this evening ; [we]1063-we shall meet [them]1062-they at [the rooms]251-the rooms . ” “[0-i] And must [I]0-i go ? ” “[0-i] Do not [you]0-i intend it ? [I]0-i thought it was all settled . ” “[0-i] Nay , since [you]0-i make such a point of it , [I]0-i can refuse [you]0-i nothing . But do not insist upon [my]0-i being very agreeable , for [my]0-i heart , [you]0-i know , will be some forty miles off . And as for dancing , do not mention it , [I]0-i beg ; _ that _ is quite out of the question . [Charles Hodges]160-charles hodges will plague [me]0-i to death , [I]0-i dare say ; but [I]0-i shall cut [him]160-charles hodges very short . Ten to one but [he]160-charles hodges guesses the reason , and that is exactly what [I]0-i want to avoid , so [I]0-i shall insist on [his]160-charles hodges keeping [his]160-charles hodges conjecture to [himself]160-charles hodges . ” [Isabella]103-isabella ’s opinion of [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys did not influence [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend ; [she]103-isabella was sure there had been no insolence in the manners either of [brother]443-brother or [sister]2160-sister ; and [she]103-isabella did not credit there being any pride in [their]133-the tilneys hearts . The evening rewarded [her]103-isabella confidence ; [she]103-isabella was met by [one]305-one with the same kindness , and by [the other with the same attention]2490-the other with the same attention , as heretofore : [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney took pains to be near [her]103-isabella , and [Henry]95-henry asked [her]103-isabella to dance . Having heard the day before in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street that [[their]133-the tilneys elder brother]2491-their elder brother , [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , was expected almost every hour , [she]103-isabella was at no loss for the name of [a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom [she]103-isabella had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to [their]133-the tilneys party]2492-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party . [She]103-isabella looked at [him]2491-their elder brother with great admiration , and even supposed it possible that [some people]437-some people might think [him]2491-their elder brother handsomer than [[his]2491-their elder brother brother]2494-his brother , though , in [her]103-isabella eyes , [his]2491-their elder brother air was more assuming , and [his]2491-their elder brother countenance less prepossessing . [His]2491-their elder brother taste and manners were beyond a doubt decidedly inferior ; for , within [her]103-isabella hearing , [he]2491-their elder brother not only protested against every thought of dancing [himself]2491-their elder brother , but even laughed openly at [Henry]95-henry for finding it possible . From the latter circumstance it may be presumed that , whatever might be [[our]2495-our heroine]1758-our heroine ’s opinion of [him]2491-their elder brother , [his]2491-their elder brother admiration of [her]103-isabella was not of a very dangerous kind ; not likely to produce animosities between [the brothers]2497-the brothers , nor persecutions to [the lady]1834-the lady . _ [He]2491-their elder brother _ can not be [the instigator of [the three villains in [horsemen]1978-horsemen ’s greatcoats]2500-the three villains in horsemen ’s greatcoats , by whom [she]103-isabella will hereafter be forced into a traveling - chaise and four , which will drive off with incredible speed]2499-the instigator of the three villains in horsemen ’s greatcoats , by whom she will hereafter be forced into a traveling - chaise and four , which will drive off with incredible speed . [Catherine]76-catherine , meanwhile , undisturbed by presentiments of such an evil , or of any evil at all , except that of having but a short set to dance down , enjoyed [her]103-isabella usual happiness with [Henry Tilney]95-henry , listening with sparkling eyes to everything [he]95-henry said ; and , in finding [him]95-henry irresistible , becoming so [herself]103-isabella .
