At the end of the first dance , [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney came towards [them]2497-the brothers again , and , much to [Catherine]76-catherine ’s dissatisfaction , pulled [[his]77-captain tilney brother]2494-his brother away . [They]2497-the brothers retired whispering together ; and , though [her]103-isabella delicate sensibility did not take immediate alarm , and lay it down as fact , that [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney must have heard some malevolent misrepresentation of [her]103-isabella , which [he]77-captain tilney now hastened to communicate to [[his]77-captain tilney brother]2494-his brother , in the hope of separating [them]2497-the brothers forever , [she]103-isabella could not have [[her]103-isabella partner]1844-her partner conveyed from [her]103-isabella sight without very uneasy sensations . [Her]103-isabella suspense was of full five minutes ’ duration ; and [she]103-isabella was beginning to think it a very long quarter of an hour , when [they]2497-the brothers both returned , and an explanation was given , by [Henry]95-henry ’s requesting to know , if [she]103-isabella thought [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend , [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , would have any objection to dancing , as [[his]2494-his brother brother]2494-his brother would be most happy to be introduced to [her]103-isabella . [Catherine]76-catherine , without hesitation , replied that [she]103-isabella was very sure [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe did not mean to dance at all . The cruel reply was passed on to the other , and [he]474-your brother immediately walked away . “[1065-your] [[Your]1065-your brother]474-your brother will not mind it , [I]0-i know , ” said [she]103-isabella , “[474-your brother] because [I]0-i heard [him]474-your brother say before that [he]474-your brother hated dancing ; but it was very good - natured in [him]474-your brother to think of it . [I]0-i suppose [he]474-your brother saw [Isabella]103-isabella sitting down , and fancied [she]103-isabella might wish for [a partner]254-a partner ; but [he]474-your brother is quite mistaken , for [she]103-isabella would not dance upon any account in [the world]215-the world . ” [Henry]95-henry smiled , and said , “[474-your brother] How very little trouble it can give [you]0-i to understand the motive of [other people]1692-other people ’s actions . ” “[0-i] Why ? What do [you]0-i mean ? ” “[0-i] With [you]0-i , it is not , How is [such a one likely to be influenced]1070-such a one likely to be influenced , What is the inducement most likely to act upon [such a person]1071-such a person ’s feelings , age , situation , and probable habits of life considered — but , How should _ [I]0-i _ be influenced , What would be _ [my]0-i _ inducement in acting so and so ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not understand [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] Then [we]1072-we are on very unequal terms , for [I]0-i understand [you]0-i perfectly well . ” “[0-i] [Me]0-i ? Yes ; [I]0-i can not speak well enough to be unintelligible . ” “[0-i] Bravo ! an excellent satire on modern language . ” “[0-i] But pray tell [me]0-i what [you]0-i mean . ” “[0-i] Shall [I]0-i indeed ? Do [you]0-i really desire it ? But [you]0-i are not aware of the consequences ; it will involve [you]0-i in a very cruel embarrassment , and certainly bring on a disagreement between [us]1072-we . ” “[0-i] No , no ; it shall not do either ; [I]0-i am not afraid . ” “[0-i] Well , then , [I]0-i only meant that [your]0-i attributing [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ’s wish of dancing with [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe to good nature alone convinced [me]0-i of [your]0-i being superior in good nature [yourself]0-i to [all the rest of [the world]215-the world]1074-all the rest of the world . ” [Catherine]76-catherine blushed and disclaimed , and [the gentleman]1837-the gentleman ’s predictions were verified . There was a something , however , in [his]1837-the gentleman words which repaid [her]97-miss thorpe for the pain of confusion ; and that something occupied [her]97-miss thorpe mind so much that [she]97-miss thorpe drew back for some time , forgetting to speak or to listen , and almost forgetting where [she]97-miss thorpe was ; till , roused by the voice of [Isabella]103-isabella , [she]97-miss thorpe looked up and saw [her]103-isabella with [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney preparing to give [them]2508-them hands across . [Isabella]103-isabella shrugged [her]103-isabella shoulders and smiled , the only explanation of this extraordinary change which could at that time be given ; but as it was not quite enough for [Catherine]76-catherine ’s comprehension , [she]103-isabella spoke [her]103-isabella astonishment in very plain terms to [[her]103-isabella partner]1844-her partner . “[0-i] [I]0-i can not think how it could happen ! [isabella]103-isabella was so determined not to dance . ” “[103-isabella] And did [Isabella]103-isabella never change [her]103-isabella mind before ? ” “[103-isabella] Oh ! but , because — And [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother ! after what [you]0-i told [him]474-your brother from [me]0-i , how could [he]474-your brother think of going to ask [her]103-isabella ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not take surprise to [myself]0-i on that head . [You]0-i bid [me]0-i be surprised on [[your]0-i friend]901-your friend ’s account , and therefore [I]0-i am ; but as for [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , [his]474-your brother conduct in the business , [I]0-i must own , has been no more than [I]0-i believed [him]474-your brother perfectly equal to . The fairness of [[your]0-i friend]901-your friend was an open attraction ; [her]901-your friend firmness , [you]0-i know , could only be understood by [yourself]0-i . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are laughing ; but , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i , [Isabella]103-isabella is very firm in general . ” “[103-isabella] It is as much as should be said of [anyone]1080-anyone . To be always firm must be to be often obstinate . When properly to relax is the trial of judgment ; and , without reference to [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , [I]0-i really think [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe has by no means chosen ill in fixing on the present hour . ” [The friends]2510-the friends were not able to get together for any confidential discourse till all the dancing was over ; but then , as [they]2510-the friends walked about [the room]1765-the room arm in arm , [Isabella]103-isabella thus explained [herself]0-i : “[0-i] [I]0-i do not wonder at [your]0-i surprise ; and [I]0-i am really fatigued to death . [He]419-my brother is such a rattle ! amusing enough , if [my]0-i mind had been disengaged ; but [I]0-i would have given [the world]215-the world to sit still . ” “[0-i] Then why did not [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Oh ! [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ! it would have looked so particular ; and [you]253-my dear know how [I]0-i abhor doing that . [I]0-i refused [him]419-my brother as long as [I]0-i possibly could , but [he]419-my brother would take no denial . [You]253-my dear have no idea how [he]419-my brother pressed [me]0-i . [I]0-i begged [him]419-my brother to excuse [me]0-i , and get [some other partner]1084-some other partner — but no , not [he]419-my brother ; after aspiring to [my]0-i hand , there was [nobody else in [the room]1765-the room [he]419-my brother could bear to think of]1085-nobody else in the room he could bear to think of ; and it was not that [he]419-my brother wanted merely to dance , [he]419-my brother wanted to be with [me]0-i . Oh ! such nonsense ! [i]0-i told [him]419-my brother [he]419-my brother had taken a very unlikely way to prevail upon [me]0-i ; for , of all things in [the world]215-the world , [I]0-i hated fine speeches and compliments ; and so — and so then [I]0-i found there would be no peace if [I]0-i did not stand up . Besides , [I]0-i thought [Mrs. Hughes]126-mrs. hughes , who introduced [him]419-my brother , might take it ill if [I]0-i did not : and [[your]1088-your dear brother]1004-your dear brother , [I]0-i am sure [he]419-my brother would have been miserable if [I]0-i had sat down the whole evening . [I]0-i am so glad it is over ! [my]0-i spirits are quite jaded with listening to [his]419-my brother nonsense : and then , being such [a smart young fellow]1090-a smart young fellow , [I]0-i saw every eye was upon [us]1091-us . ” “[0-i] [He]419-my brother is very handsome indeed . ” “[419-my brother] Handsome ! yes , [I]0-i suppose [he]419-my brother may . [I]0-i dare say [people]1782-people would admire [him]419-my brother in general ; but [he]419-my brother is not at all in [my]0-i style of beauty . [I]0-i hate a florid complexion and dark eyes in [a man]403-a man . However , [he]419-my brother is very well . Amazingly conceited , [I]0-i am sure . [I]0-i took [him]419-my brother down several times , [you]1094-you know , in [my]0-i way . ” When [the young ladies]2005-the young ladies next met , [they]2005-the young ladies had a far more interesting subject to discuss . [James Morland]105-james ’s second letter was then received , and the kind intentions of [[his]105-james father]2286-his father fully explained . A living , of which [Mr. Morland]105-james was [himself]105-james patron and incumbent , of about four hundred pounds yearly value , was to be resigned to [[his]105-james son]824-his son as soon as [he]105-james should be old enough to take it ; no trifling deduction from the family income , no niggardly assignment to [one of [ten children]2516-ten children]2515-one of ten children . An estate of at least equal value , moreover , was assured as [his]105-james future inheritance . [James]105-james expressed [himself]105-james on the occasion with becoming gratitude ; and the necessity of waiting between two and three years before [they]2005-the young ladies could marry , being , however unwelcome , no more than [he]105-james had expected , was borne by [him]105-james without discontent . [Catherine]76-catherine , whose expectations had been as unfixed as [her]2517-her ideas of [[her]2517-her father]205-her father ’s income , and whose judgment was now entirely led by [[her]2517-her brother]355-her brother , felt equally well satisfied , and heartily congratulated [Isabella]103-isabella on having everything so pleasantly settled . “[0-i] It is very charming indeed , ” said [Isabella]103-isabella , with a grave face . “[0-i] [Mr. Morland]105-james has behaved vastly handsome indeed , ” said [the gentle Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , looking anxiously at [[her]98-mrs. thorpe daughter]1729-her daughter . “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish [I]0-i could do as much . [One]305-one could not expect more from [him]105-james , [you]1096-you know . If [he]105-james finds [he]105-james _ can _ do more by and by , [I]0-i dare say [he]105-james will , for [I]0-i am sure [he]105-james must be [an excellent good - hearted man]1097-an excellent good - hearted man . Four hundred is but a small income to begin on indeed , but [your]1096-you wishes , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Isabella]103-isabella , are so moderate , [you]1096-you do not consider how little [you]1096-you ever want , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear . ” “[1096-you] It is not on [my]0-i own account [I]0-i wish for more ; but [I]0-i can not bear to be the means of injuring [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Morland]105-james , making [him]105-james sit down upon an income hardly enough to find one in the common necessaries of life . For [myself]0-i , it is nothing ; [I]0-i never think of [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]1096-you never do , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear ; and [you]1096-you will always find [your]1096-you reward in the affection it makes [everybody]1780-everybody feel for [you]1096-you . There never was [a young woman so beloved as [you]1096-you are by everybody that knows [you]1096-you]1103-a young woman so beloved as you are by everybody that knows you ; and [I]0-i dare say when [Mr. Morland]105-james sees [you]1096-you , [[my]0-i dear child]1104-my dear child — but do not let [us]1105-us distress [[our]1105-us dear]1106-our dear [Catherine]76-catherine by talking of such things . [Mr. Morland]105-james has behaved so very handsome , [you]1096-you know . [I]0-i always heard [he]105-james was [a most excellent man]1107-a most excellent man ; and [you]1096-you know , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , [we]1105-us are not to suppose but what , if [you]1096-you had had a suitable fortune , [he]105-james would have come down with something more , for [I]0-i am sure [he]105-james must be [a most liberal - minded man]1109-a most liberal - minded man . ” “[105-james] [Nobody]396-nobody can think better of [Mr. Morland]105-james than [I]0-i do , [I]0-i am sure . But [everybody]1780-everybody has [their]1780-everybody failing , [you]1096-you know , and [everybody]1780-everybody has a right to do what [they]1780-everybody like with [their]1780-everybody own money . ” [Catherine]76-catherine was hurt by these insinuations . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very sure , ” said [she]1096-you , “[0-i] that [[my]0-i father]629-my father has promised to do as much as [he]629-my father can afford . ” [Isabella]103-isabella recollected [herself]103-isabella . “[629-my father] As to that , [[my]0-i sweet]1114-my sweet [Catherine]76-catherine , there can not be a doubt , and [you]1096-you know [me]0-i well enough to be sure that a much smaller income would satisfy [me]0-i . It is not the want of more money that makes [me]0-i just at present a little out of spirits ; [I]0-i hate money ; and if [our]1115-we union could take place now upon only fifty pounds a year , [I]0-i should not have a wish unsatisfied . Ah ! [[my]0-i [Catherine]76-catherine]1002-my catherine , [you]1096-you have found [me]0-i out . There ’s the sting . The long , long , endless two years and a half that are to pass before [[your]1096-you brother]474-your brother can hold the living . ” “[103-isabella] Yes , yes , [[my]0-i darling]1118-my darling [Isabella]103-isabella , ” said [Mrs. Thorpe]98-mrs. thorpe , “[103-isabella] [we]1115-we perfectly see into [your]103-isabella heart . [You]103-isabella have no disguise . [We]1115-we perfectly understand the present vexation ; and [everybody]1780-everybody must love [you]103-isabella the better for such a noble honest affection . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s uncomfortable feelings began to lessen . [She]1002-my catherine endeavoured to believe that the delay of the marriage was the only source of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s regret ; and when [she]1002-my catherine saw [her]103-isabella at [their]1115-we next interview as cheerful and amiable as ever , endeavoured to forget that [she]103-isabella had for a minute thought otherwise . [James]105-james soon followed [his]105-james letter , and was received with the most gratifying kindness . CHAPTER 17 [The Allens]106-the allens had now entered on the sixth week of [their]1115-we stay in [Bath]6-bath ; and whether it should be the last was for some time a question , to which [Catherine]76-catherine listened with a beating heart . To have [her]1002-my catherine acquaintance with [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys end so soon was an evil which nothing could counterbalance . [Her]1002-my catherine whole happiness seemed at stake , while the affair was in suspense , and everything secured when it was determined that [the lodgings]2521-the lodgings should be taken for another fortnight . What this additional fortnight was to produce to [her]1002-my catherine beyond the pleasure of sometimes seeing [Henry Tilney]95-henry made but a small part of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s speculation . Once or twice indeed , since [James]105-james ’s engagement had taught [her]1002-my catherine what _ could _ be done , [she]1002-my catherine had got so far as to indulge in a secret “[1780-everybody] perhaps , ” but in general the felicity of being with [him]105-james for the present bounded [her]1002-my catherine views : the present was now comprised in another three weeks , and [her]1002-my catherine happiness being certain for that period , the rest of [her]1002-my catherine life was at such a distance as to excite but little interest . In the course of the morning which saw this business arranged , [she]1002-my catherine visited [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , and poured forth [her]1002-my catherine joyful feelings . It was doomed to be a day of trial . No sooner had [she]1002-my catherine expressed [her]1002-my catherine delight in [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen ’s lengthened stay than [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney told [her]1002-my catherine of [[her]1002-my catherine father]205-her father ’s having just determined upon quitting [Bath]6-bath by the end of another week . Here was a blow ! the past suspense of the morning had been ease and quiet to the present disappointment . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s countenance fell , and in a voice of most sincere concern [she]1002-my catherine echoed [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s concluding words , “[1780-everybody] By the end of another week ! ” “[1780-everybody] Yes , [[my]0-i father]629-my father can seldom be prevailed on to give the waters what [I]0-i think a fair trial . [He]629-my father has been disappointed of [some friends]750-some friends ’ arrival whom [he]629-my father expected to meet here , and as [he]629-my father is now pretty well , is in a hurry to get [home]482-home . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry for it , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine dejectedly ; “[0-i] if [I]0-i had known this before — ” “[0-i] Perhaps , ” said [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney in an embarrassed manner , “[0-i] [you]0-i would be so good — it would make [me]0-i very happy if — ” The entrance of [[her]1002-my catherine father]205-her father put a stop to the civility , which [Catherine]76-catherine was beginning to hope might introduce a desire of [[their]2524-their corresponding]2525-their corresponding . After addressing [her]1002-my catherine with [his]0-i usual politeness , [he]0-i turned to [[his]0-i daughter]598-his daughter and said , “[0-i] Well , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , may [I]0-i congratulate [you]143-eleanor on being successful in [your]143-eleanor application to [[your]143-eleanor fair friend]1123-your fair friend ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was just beginning to make the request , [sir]285-sir , as [you]285-sir came in . ” “[0-i] Well , proceed by all means . [I]0-i know how much [your]143-eleanor heart is in it . [[My]0-i daughter]1125-my daughter , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , ” [he]0-i continued , without leaving [[his]0-i daughter]598-his daughter time to speak , “[1125-my daughter] has been forming a very bold wish . [We]1126-we leave [Bath]6-bath , as [she]1123-your fair friend has perhaps told [you]143-eleanor , on Saturday se’nnight . A letter from [[my]0-i steward]1127-my steward tells [me]0-i that [my]0-i presence is wanted at [home]482-home ; and being disappointed in [my]0-i hope of seeing [the Marquis of [Longtown]61-longtown]1129-the marquis of longtown and [General Courteney]161-general courteney here , [some of [[my]0-i very old friends]1131-my very old friends]1130-some of my very old friends , there is nothing to detain [me]0-i longer in [Bath]6-bath . And could [we]1126-we carry [our]1126-we selfish point with [you]143-eleanor , [we]1126-we should leave it without a single regret . Can [you]143-eleanor , in short , be prevailed on to quit this scene of public triumph and oblige [[your]143-eleanor friend]901-your friend [Eleanor]143-eleanor with [your]143-eleanor company in [Gloucestershire]10-gloucestershire ? [I]0-i am almost ashamed to make the request , though its presumption would certainly appear greater to every creature in [Bath]6-bath than [yourself]143-eleanor . Modesty such as [yours]143-eleanor — but not for [the world]215-the world would [I]0-i pain it by open praise . If [you]143-eleanor can be induced to honour [us]1126-we with a visit , [you]143-eleanor will make [us]1126-we happy beyond expression . ’ Tis true , [we]1126-we can offer [you]143-eleanor nothing like the gaieties of [this lively place]1134-this lively place ; [we]1126-we can tempt [you]143-eleanor neither by amusement nor splendour , for [our]1126-we mode of living , as [you]143-eleanor see , is plain and unpretending ; yet no endeavours shall be wanting on [our]1126-we side to make [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey not wholly disagreeable . ” [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey ! these were thrilling words , and wound up [Catherine]76-catherine ’s feelings to the highest point of ecstasy . [Her]2528-her grateful and gratified heart could hardly restrain its expressions within the language of tolerable calmness . To receive so flattering an invitation ! to have [her]2528-her company so warmly solicited ! everything honourable and soothing , every present enjoyment , and every future hope was contained in it ; and [her]2528-her acceptance , with only the saving clause of [Papa]137-papa and [Mamma]138-mamma ’s approbation , was eagerly given . “[0-i] [I]0-i will write [home]482-home directly , ” said [she]2528-her , “[0-i] and if [they]1136-they do not object , as [I]0-i dare say [they]1136-they will not — ” [General Tilney]139-general tilney was not less sanguine , having already waited on [[her]2528-her excellent friends]2529-her excellent friends in [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , and obtained [their]1136-they sanction of [his]139-general tilney wishes . “[1136-they] Since [they]1136-they can consent to part with [you]0-i , ” said [he]139-general tilney , “[1136-they] [we]1137-we may expect philosophy from all [the world]215-the world . ” [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney was earnest , though gentle , in [her]2528-her secondary civilities , and the affair became in a few minutes as nearly settled as this necessary reference to [Fullerton]4-fullerton would allow . The circumstances of the morning had led [Catherine]76-catherine ’s feelings through the varieties of suspense , security , and disappointment ; but they were now safely lodged in perfect bliss ; and with spirits elated to rapture , with [Henry]95-henry at [her]2528-her heart , and [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey on [her]2528-her lips , [she]2528-her hurried [home]482-home to write [her]2528-her letter . [Mr.]2531-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland , relying on the discretion of [the friends to whom [they]2532-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter had already entrusted [[their]2532-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter daughter]2533-their daughter]2532-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter , felt no doubt of the propriety of an acquaintance which had been formed under [their]2532-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter eye , and sent therefore by return of post [their]2532-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter ready consent to [her]2528-her visit in [Gloucestershire]10-gloucestershire . This indulgence , though not more than [Catherine]76-catherine had hoped for , completed [her]2528-her conviction of being favoured beyond [every other human creature]2534-every other human creature , in [friends]922-friends and fortune , circumstance and chance . Everything seemed to cooperate for [her]2528-her advantage . By the kindness of [[her]2528-her first friends]2536-her first friends , [the Allens]106-the allens , [she]2528-her had been introduced into scenes where pleasures of every kind had met [her]2528-her . [Her]2528-her feelings , [her]2528-her preferences , had each known the happiness of a return . Wherever [she]2528-her felt attachment , [she]2528-her had been able to create it . The affection of [Isabella]103-isabella was to be secured to [her]2528-her in [a sister]2070-a sister . [The Tilneys]133-the tilneys , [they]133-the tilneys , by whom , above all , [she]2528-her desired to be favourably thought of , outstripped even [her]2528-her wishes in the flattering measures by which [their]133-the tilneys intimacy was to be continued . [She]2528-her was to be [[their]133-the tilneys chosen visitor]2538-their chosen visitor , [she]2528-her was to be for weeks under the same roof with [the person whose society [she]2528-her mostly prized]2539-the person whose society she mostly prized — and , in addition to all the rest , this roof was to be the roof of [an abbey]2540-an abbey ! [her]2528-her passion for ancient edifices was next in degree to [her]2528-her passion for [Henry Tilney]95-henry — and [castles]2541-castles and [abbeys]2542-abbeys made usually the charm of those reveries which [his]95-henry image did not fill . To see and explore either the ramparts and keep of the one , or [the cloisters of the other]2543-the cloisters of the other , had been for many weeks a darling wish , though to be more than [the visitor of an hour]2544-the visitor of an hour had seemed too nearly impossible for desire . And yet , this was to happen . With all the chances against [her]2528-her of [house]662-house , [hall]2546-hall , place , [park]2547-park , [court]2548-court , and [cottage]2549-cottage , [Northanger]62-northanger turned up [an abbey]2540-an abbey , and [she]2528-her was to be [its inhabitant]2551-its inhabitant . [[Its]2540-an abbey long , damp passages]2552-its long , damp passages , [[its]2540-an abbey narrow cells and [ruined chapel]2554-ruined chapel]2553-its narrow cells and ruined chapel , were to be within [her]2528-her daily reach , and [she]2528-her could not entirely subdue the hope of some traditional legends , some awful memorials of [an injured and ill - fated nun]2555-an injured and ill - fated nun . It was wonderful that [[her]2528-her friends]2225-her friends should seem so little elated by the possession of [such a home]2557-such a home , that the consciousness of it should be so meekly borne . The power of early habit only could account for it . A distinction to which [they]2225-her friends had been born gave no pride . [Their]2225-her friends superiority of abode was no more to [them]2225-her friends than [their]2225-her friends superiority of [person]2558-person . Many were the inquiries [she]2528-her was eager to make of [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ; but so active were [her]2528-her thoughts , that when these inquiries were answered , [she]2528-her was hardly more assured than before , of [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey having been [a richly endowed convent]2559-a richly endowed convent at the time of the Reformation , of [its]2540-an abbey having fallen into the hands of [an ancestor of [the Tilneys]133-the tilneys]2560-an ancestor of the tilneys on [its]2540-an abbey dissolution , of a large portion of [the ancient building]2561-the ancient building still making a part of [the present dwelling]2562-the present dwelling although the rest was decayed , or of [its]2540-an abbey standing low in [a valley]2563-a valley , sheltered from [the north and east by rising woods of oak]2564-the north and east by rising woods of oak . CHAPTER 18 With a mind thus full of happiness , [Catherine]76-catherine was hardly aware that two or three days had passed away , without [her]2528-her seeing [Isabella]103-isabella for more than a few minutes together . [She]2528-her began first to be sensible of this , and to sigh for [her]2528-her conversation , as [she]2528-her walked along [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room one morning , by [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ’s side , without anything to say or to hear ; and scarcely had [she]2528-her felt a five minutes ’ longing of friendship , before the object of it appeared , and inviting [her]2528-her to a secret conference , led the way to a seat . “[1136-they] This is [[my]0-i favourite place]1139-my favourite place , ” said [she]2528-her as [they]2566-they sat down on a bench between the doors , which commanded a tolerable view of [everybody entering at either]2567-everybody entering at either ; “[1136-they] [it]1140-it is so out of the way . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , observing that [Isabella]103-isabella ’s eyes were continually bent towards one door or the other , as in eager expectation , and remembering how often [she]2528-her had been falsely accused of being arch , thought the present a fine opportunity for being really so ; and therefore [gaily]163-gaily said , “[1136-they] Do not be uneasy , [Isabella]103-isabella , [James]105-james will soon be [here]1743-here . ” “[105-james] Psha ! [[my]0-i dear creature]473-my dear creature , ” [she]2528-her replied , “[105-james] do not think [me]0-i such a simpleton as to be always wanting to confine [him]105-james to [my]0-i elbow . It would be hideous to be always together ; [we]1143-we should be the jest of [the place]284-the place . And so [you]473-my dear creature are going to [Northanger]62-northanger ! [i]0-i am amazingly glad of it . [It]62-northanger is one of [the finest old places in [England]3-england]1145-the finest old places in england , [I]0-i understand . [I]0-i shall depend upon a most particular description of [it]62-northanger . ” “[473-my dear creature] [You]473-my dear creature shall certainly have the best in [my]0-i power to give . But who are [you]473-my dear creature looking for ? Are [[your]473-my dear creature sisters]1146-your sisters coming ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am not looking for [anybody]216-anybody . [One]164-one ’s eyes must be somewhere , and [you]473-my dear creature know what a foolish trick [I]0-i have of fixing [mine]0-i , when [my]0-i thoughts are an hundred miles off . [I]0-i am amazingly absent ; [I]0-i believe [I]0-i am [the most absent creature in [the world]215-the world]1148-the most absent creature in the world . [Tilney]92-miss tilney says it is always the case with minds of a certain stamp . ” “[92-miss tilney] But [I]0-i thought , [Isabella]103-isabella , [you]103-isabella had something in particular to tell [me]0-i ? ” “[103-isabella] Oh yes , and so [I]0-i have . But here is a proof of what [I]0-i was saying . [My]0-i poor head , [I]0-i had quite forgot it . Well , the thing is this : [I]0-i have just had a letter from [John]99-john ; [you]473-my dear creature can guess the contents . ” “[99-john] No , indeed , [I]0-i can not . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i sweet love]1150-my sweet love , do not be so abominably affected . What can [he]99-john write about , but [yourself]473-my dear creature ? [You]473-my dear creature know [he]99-john is over head and ears in love with [you]473-my dear creature . ” “[99-john] With _ [me]0-i _ , [dear Isabella]103-isabella ! ” “[99-john] Nay , [my]0-i sweetest [Catherine]76-catherine , this is being quite absurd ! modesty , and all that , is very well in its way , but really a little common honesty is sometimes quite as becoming . [I]0-i have no idea of being so overstrained ! it is fishing for compliments . [His]99-john attentions were such as [a child]1151-a child must have noticed . And it was but half an hour before [he]99-john left [Bath]6-bath that [you]473-my dear creature gave [him]99-john the most positive encouragement . [He]99-john says so in this letter , says that [he]99-john as good as made [you]473-my dear creature an offer , and that [you]473-my dear creature received [his]99-john advances in the kindest way ; and now [he]99-john wants [me]0-i to urge [his]99-john suit , and say all manner of pretty things to [you]473-my dear creature . So it is in vain to affect ignorance . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , with all the earnestness of truth , expressed [her]473-my dear creature astonishment at such a charge , protesting [her]473-my dear creature innocence of every thought of [Mr. Thorpe]120-mr. thorpe ’s being in love with [her]473-my dear creature , and the consequent impossibility of [her]473-my dear creature having ever intended to encourage [him]99-john . “[99-john] As to any attentions on [his]99-john side , [I]0-i do declare , upon [my]0-i honour , [I]0-i never was sensible of [them]1152-them for a moment — except just [his]99-john asking [me]0-i to dance the first day of [his]99-john coming . And as to making [me]0-i an offer , or anything like it , there must be some unaccountable mistake . [I]0-i could not have misunderstood a thing of that kind , [you]473-my dear creature know ! and , as [I]0-i ever wish to be believed , [I]0-i solemnly protest that no syllable of such a nature ever passed between [us]1153-us . The last half hour before [he]99-john went away ! it must be all and completely a mistake — for [I]0-i did not see [him]99-john once that whole morning . ” “[0-i] But _ that _ [you]473-my dear creature certainly did , for [you]473-my dear creature spent the whole morning in [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings — it was the day [[your]473-my dear creature father]821-your father ’s consent came — and [I]0-i am pretty sure that [you]473-my dear creature and [John]99-john were alone in [the parlour]2412-the parlour some time before [you]473-my dear creature left [the house]238-the house . ” “[473-my dear creature] Are [you]473-my dear creature ? Well , if [you]473-my dear creature say it , it was so , [I]0-i dare say — but for the life of [me]0-i , [I]0-i can not recollect it . [I]0-i _ do _ remember now being with [you]473-my dear creature , and seeing [him]99-john as well as the rest — but that [we]1158-we were ever alone for five minutes — However , it is not worth arguing about , for whatever might pass on [his]99-john side , [you]473-my dear creature must be convinced , by [my]0-i having no recollection of it , that [I]0-i never thought , nor expected , nor wished for anything of the kind from [him]99-john . [I]0-i am excessively concerned that [he]99-john should have any regard for [me]0-i — but indeed it has been quite unintentional on [my]0-i side ; [I]0-i never had the smallest idea of it . Pray undeceive [him]99-john as soon as [you]473-my dear creature can , and tell [him]99-john [I]0-i beg [his]99-john pardon — that is — [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i ought to say — but make [him]99-john understand what [I]0-i mean , in the properest way . [I]0-i would not speak disrespectfully of [a brother of yours]1159-a brother of yours , [Isabella]103-isabella , [I]0-i am sure ; but [you]473-my dear creature know very well that if [I]0-i could think of [one man]1160-one man more than another—_he _ is not [the person]894-the person . ” [Isabella]103-isabella was silent . “[894-the person] [[My]0-i dear friend]1162-my dear friend , [you]1162-my dear friend must not be angry with [me]0-i . [I]0-i can not suppose [[your]473-my dear creature brother]474-your brother cares so very much about [me]0-i . And , [you]1162-my dear friend know , [we]1164-we shall still be [sisters]1861-sisters . ” “[1162-my dear friend] Yes , yes ” ( with a blush ) , “[1162-my dear friend] there are more ways than one of [our]1164-we being [sisters]1861-sisters . But where am [I]0-i wandering to ? Well , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , the case seems to be that [you]1162-my dear friend are determined against [poor John]99-john — is not it so ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i certainly can not return [his]99-john affection , and as certainly never meant to encourage it . ” “[0-i] Since that is the case , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i shall not tease [you]1162-my dear friend any further . [John]99-john desired [me]0-i to speak to [you]1162-my dear friend on the subject , and therefore [I]0-i have . But [I]0-i confess , as soon as [I]0-i read [his]99-john letter , [I]0-i thought it a very foolish , imprudent business , and not likely to promote the good of either ; for what were [you]1162-my dear friend to live upon , supposing [you]1162-my dear friend came together ? [You]1162-my dear friend have both of [you]1162-my dear friend something , to be sure , but it is not a trifle that will support [a family]731-a family nowadays ; and after all that [romancers]1169-romancers may say , there is no doing without money . [I]0-i only wonder [John]99-john could think of it ; [he]99-john could not have received [my]0-i last . ” “[1162-my dear friend] [You]1162-my dear friend _ do _ acquit [me]0-i , then , of anything [wrong?—You]1162-my dear friend are convinced that [I]0-i never meant to deceive [[your]1162-my dear friend brother]474-your brother , never suspected [him]474-your brother of liking [me]0-i till this moment ? ” “[1162-my dear friend] Oh ! as to that , ” answered [Isabella]103-isabella laughingly , “[1162-my dear friend] [I]0-i do not pretend to determine what [your]1162-my dear friend thoughts and designs in time past may have been . All that is best known to [yourself]1162-my dear friend . A little harmless flirtation or so will occur , and [one]305-one is often drawn on to give more encouragement than [one]305-one wishes to stand by . But [you]1162-my dear friend may be assured that [I]0-i am [the last person in [the world]215-the world]1173-the last person in the world to judge [you]1162-my dear friend severely . All those things should be allowed for in youth and high spirits . What one means one day , [you]1162-my dear friend know , [one]305-one may not mean the next . Circumstances change , opinions alter . ” “[1162-my dear friend] But [my]0-i opinion of [[your]1162-my dear friend brother]474-your brother never did alter ; it was always the same . [You]1162-my dear friend are describing what never happened . ” “[1162-my dear friend] [[My]0-i dearest]366-my dearest [Catherine]76-catherine , ” continued [the other]1863-the other without at all listening to [her]1162-my dear friend , “[0-i] [I]0-i would not for all [the world]215-the world be the means of hurrying [you]76-catherine into an engagement before [you]76-catherine knew what [you]76-catherine were about . [I]0-i do not think anything would justify [me]0-i in wishing [you]76-catherine to sacrifice all [your]76-catherine happiness merely to oblige [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , because [he]419-my brother is [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , and who perhaps after all , [you]76-catherine know , might be just as happy without [you]76-catherine , for [people]1782-people seldom know what [they]1782-people would be at , [young men]1976-young men especially , [they]1976-young men are so amazingly changeable and inconstant . What [I]0-i say is , why should [a brother]2188-a brother ’s happiness be dearer to [me]0-i than [a friend]1896-a friend ’s ? [You]76-catherine know [I]0-i carry [my]0-i notions of friendship pretty high . But , above all things , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , do not be in a hurry . Take [my]0-i word for it , that if [you]76-catherine are in too great a hurry , [you]76-catherine will certainly live to repent it . [Tilney]92-miss tilney says there is nothing [people]1782-people are so often deceived in as the state of [their]1782-people own affections , and [I]0-i believe [he]92-miss tilney is very right . Ah ! here [he]92-miss tilney comes ; never mind , [he]92-miss tilney will not see [us]1187-us , [I]0-i am sure . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , looking up , perceived [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ; and [Isabella]103-isabella , earnestly fixing [her]103-isabella eye on [him]92-miss tilney as [she]103-isabella spoke , soon caught [his]92-miss tilney notice . [He]92-miss tilney approached immediately , and took the seat to which [her]103-isabella movements invited [him]92-miss tilney . [His]92-miss tilney first address made [Catherine]76-catherine start . Though spoken low , [she]103-isabella could distinguish , “[92-miss tilney] What ! always to be watched , in person or by proxy ! ” “[92-miss tilney] Psha , nonsense ! ” was [Isabella]103-isabella ’s answer in the same half whisper . “[92-miss tilney] Why do [you]0-i put such things into [my]0-i head ? If [I]0-i could believe it — [my]0-i spirit , [you]0-i know , is pretty independent . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [your]0-i heart were independent . That would be enough for [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i heart , indeed ! what can [you]0-i have to do with hearts ? [[You]0-i men]498-you men have none of [you]0-i any hearts . ” “[0-i] If [we]1189-we have not hearts , [we]1189-we have eyes ; and [they]1190-they give [us]1189-we torment enough . ” “[1190-they] Do [they]1190-they ? [I]0-i am sorry for it ; [I]0-i am sorry [they]1190-they find anything so disagreeable in [me]0-i . [I]0-i will look another way . [I]0-i hope this pleases [you]0-i ” ( turning [her]2569-her back on [him]0-i ) ; “[0-i] [I]0-i hope [your]0-i eyes are not tormented now . ” “[0-i] Never more so ; for the edge of a blooming cheek is still in view — at once too much and too little . ” [Catherine]76-catherine heard all this , and quite out of countenance , could listen no longer . Amazed that [Isabella]103-isabella could endure it , and jealous for [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother , [she]103-isabella rose up , and saying [she]103-isabella should join [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen , proposed [their]2571-their walking . But for this [Isabella]103-isabella showed no inclination . [She]103-isabella was so amazingly tired , and it was so odious to parade about [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room ; and if [she]103-isabella moved from [her]103-isabella seat [she]103-isabella should miss [[her]103-isabella sisters]2573-her sisters ; [she]103-isabella was expecting [[her]103-isabella sisters]2573-her sisters every moment ; so that [[her]103-isabella dearest]2156-her dearest [Catherine]76-catherine must excuse [her]103-isabella , and must sit quietly down again . But [Catherine]76-catherine could be stubborn too ; and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen just then coming up to propose [their]2571-their returning [home]482-home , [she]103-isabella joined [her]103-isabella and walked out of [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , leaving [Isabella]103-isabella still sitting with [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney . With much uneasiness did [she]103-isabella thus leave [them]2571-their . It seemed to [her]103-isabella that [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney was falling in love with [Isabella]103-isabella , and [Isabella]103-isabella unconsciously encouraging [him]77-captain tilney ; unconsciously it must be , for [Isabella]103-isabella ’s attachment to [James]105-james was as certain and well acknowledged as [her]103-isabella engagement . To doubt [her]103-isabella truth or good intentions was impossible ; and yet , during the whole of [their]2571-their conversation [her]103-isabella manner had been odd . [She]103-isabella wished [Isabella]103-isabella had talked more like [her]103-isabella usual self , and not so much about money , and had not looked so well pleased at the sight of [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney . How strange that [she]103-isabella should not perceive [his]77-captain tilney admiration ! [catherine]76-catherine longed to give [her]103-isabella a hint of it , to put [her]103-isabella on [her]103-isabella guard , and prevent all the pain which [her]103-isabella too lively behaviour might otherwise create both for [him]77-captain tilney and [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother . The compliment of [John Thorpe]99-john ’s affection did not make amends for this thoughtlessness in [[his]77-captain tilney sister]356-his sister . [She]103-isabella was almost as far from believing as from wishing it to be sincere ; for [she]103-isabella had not forgotten that [he]77-captain tilney could mistake , and [his]77-captain tilney assertion of the offer and of [her]103-isabella encouragement convinced [her]103-isabella that [his]77-captain tilney mistakes could sometimes be very egregious . In vanity , therefore , [she]103-isabella gained but little ; [her]103-isabella chief profit was in wonder . That [he]77-captain tilney should think it worth [his]77-captain tilney while to fancy [himself]77-captain tilney in love with [her]103-isabella was a matter of lively astonishment . [Isabella]103-isabella talked of [his]77-captain tilney attentions ; _ [she]103-isabella _ had never been sensible of any ; but [Isabella]103-isabella had said many things which [she]103-isabella hoped had been spoken in haste , and would never be said again ; and upon this [she]103-isabella was glad to rest altogether for present ease and comfort . CHAPTER 19 A few days passed away , and [Catherine]76-catherine , though not allowing [herself]76-catherine to suspect [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend , could not help watching [her]103-isabella closely . The result of [her]103-isabella observations was not agreeable . [Isabella]103-isabella seemed an altered creature . When [she]103-isabella saw [her]103-isabella , indeed , surrounded only by [[their]2581-their immediate friends]2582-their immediate friends in [[Edgar]117-edgar ’s Buildings]415-edgar ’s buildings or [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , [her]103-isabella change of manners was so trifling that , had it gone no farther , it might have passed unnoticed . A something of languid indifference , or of that boasted absence of mind which [Catherine]76-catherine had never heard of before , would occasionally come across [her]103-isabella ; but had nothing worse appeared , _ that _ might only have spread a new grace and inspired a warmer interest . But when [Catherine]76-catherine saw [her]103-isabella in public , admitting [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ’s attentions as readily as they were offered , and allowing [him]77-captain tilney almost an equal share with [James]105-james in [her]103-isabella notice and smiles , the alteration became too positive to be passed over . What could be meant by such unsteady conduct , what [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend could be at , was beyond [her]103-isabella comprehension . [Isabella]103-isabella could not be aware of the pain [she]103-isabella was inflicting ; but it was a degree of wilful thoughtlessness which [Catherine]76-catherine could not but resent . [James]105-james was [the sufferer]2585-the sufferer . [She]103-isabella saw [him]105-james grave and uneasy ; and however careless of [his]105-james present comfort [the woman]676-the woman might be who had given [him]105-james [her]676-the woman heart , to _ [her]676-the woman _ it was always an object . For poor [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney too [she]103-isabella was greatly concerned . Though [his]77-captain tilney looks did not please [her]103-isabella , [his]77-captain tilney name was a passport to [her]103-isabella goodwill , and [she]103-isabella thought with sincere compassion of [his]77-captain tilney approaching disappointment ; for , in spite of what [she]103-isabella had believed [herself]103-isabella to overhear in [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room , [his]77-captain tilney behaviour was so incompatible with a knowledge of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s engagement that [she]103-isabella could not , upon reflection , imagine [him]77-captain tilney aware of it . [He]77-captain tilney might be jealous of [[her]103-isabella brother]355-her brother as [a rival]2589-a rival , but if more had seemed implied , the fault must have been in [her]103-isabella misapprehension . [She]103-isabella wished , by a gentle remonstrance , to remind [Isabella]103-isabella of [her]103-isabella situation , and make [her]103-isabella aware of this double unkindness ; but for remonstrance , either opportunity or comprehension was always against [her]103-isabella . If able to suggest a hint , [Isabella]103-isabella could never understand it . In this distress , the intended departure of [the Tilney family]2590-the tilney family became [her]103-isabella chief consolation ; [their]2590-the tilney family journey into [Gloucestershire]10-gloucestershire was to take place within a few days , and [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ’s removal would at least restore peace to every heart but [his]77-captain tilney own . But [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney had at present no intention of removing ; [he]77-captain tilney was not to be of [the party to [Northanger]62-northanger]2591-the party to northanger ; [he]77-captain tilney was to continue at [Bath]6-bath . When [Catherine]76-catherine knew this , [her]103-isabella resolution was directly made . [She]103-isabella spoke to [Henry Tilney]95-henry on the subject , regretting [[his]0-i brother]2494-his brother ’s evident partiality for [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , and entreating [him]95-henry to make known [her]103-isabella prior engagement . “[0-i] [[My]0-i brother]419-my brother does know it , ” was [Henry]95-henry ’s answer . “[419-my brother] Does [he]419-my brother ? Then why does [he]419-my brother stay [here]1743-here ? ” [He]95-henry made no reply , and was beginning to talk of something else ; but [she]103-isabella eagerly continued , “[0-i] Why do not [you]0-i persuade [him]419-my brother to go away ? The longer [he]419-my brother stays , the worse it will be for [him]419-my brother at last . Pray advise [him]419-my brother for [his]419-my brother own sake , and for [everybody]1780-everybody ’s sake , to leave [Bath]6-bath directly . Absence will in time make [him]419-my brother comfortable again ; but [he]419-my brother can have no hope [here]1743-here , and it is only staying to be miserable . ” [Henry]95-henry smiled and said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother would not wish to do that . ” “[0-i] Then [you]0-i will persuade [him]419-my brother to go away ? ” “[0-i] Persuasion is not at command ; but pardon [me]0-i , if [I]0-i can not even endeavour to persuade [him]419-my brother . [I]0-i have [myself]0-i told [him]419-my brother that [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe is engaged . [He]419-my brother knows what [he]419-my brother is about , and must be [[his]419-my brother own master]1196-his own master . ” “[419-my brother] No , [he]419-my brother does not know what [he]419-my brother is about , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine ; “[419-my brother] [he]419-my brother does not know the pain [he]419-my brother is giving [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother . Not that [James]105-james has ever told [me]0-i so , but [I]0-i am sure [he]419-my brother is very uncomfortable . ” “[419-my brother] And are [you]0-i sure it is [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ’s doing ? ” “[0-i] Yes , very sure . ” “[0-i] Is it [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ’s attentions to [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , or [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s admission of [them]1200-them , that gives the pain ? ” “[97-miss thorpe] Is not it the same thing ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [Mr. Morland]105-james would acknowledge a difference . [No man]2195-no man is offended by [another man]1202-another man ’s admiration of [the woman [he]1202-another man loves]1203-the woman he loves ; it is [the woman only who can make it a torment]1204-the woman only who can make it a torment . ” [Catherine]76-catherine blushed for [[her]103-isabella friend]1769-her friend , and said , “[103-isabella] [Isabella]103-isabella is wrong . But [I]0-i am sure [she]103-isabella can not mean to torment , for [she]103-isabella is very much attached to [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother . [She]103-isabella has been in love with [him]419-my brother ever since [they]1206-they first met , and while [[my]0-i father]629-my father ’s consent was uncertain , [she]103-isabella fretted [herself]103-isabella almost into a fever . [You]0-i know [she]103-isabella must be attached to [him]419-my brother . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understand : [she]103-isabella is in love with [James]105-james , and flirts with [Frederick]77-captain tilney . ” “[103-isabella] Oh no , not flirts . [A woman]2379-a woman in love with [one man]1160-one man can not flirt with [another]1210-another . ” “[2379-a woman] It is probable that [she]103-isabella will neither love so well , nor flirt so well , as [she]103-isabella might do either singly . [The gentlemen]260-the gentlemen must each give up a little . ” After a short pause , [Catherine]76-catherine resumed with , “[260-the gentlemen] Then [you]0-i do not believe [Isabella]103-isabella so very much attached to [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can have no opinion on that subject . ” “[0-i] But what can [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother mean ? If [he]474-your brother knows [her]103-isabella engagement , what can [he]474-your brother mean by [his]474-your brother behaviour ? ” “[474-your brother] [You]0-i are [a very close questioner]1214-a very close questioner . ” “[474-your brother] Am [I]0-i ? [I]0-i only ask what [I]0-i want to be told . ” “[0-i] But do [you]0-i only ask what [I]0-i can be expected to tell ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i think so ; for [you]0-i must know [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother ’s heart . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i brother]419-my brother ’s heart , as [you]0-i term it , on the present occasion , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i [I]0-i can only guess at . ” “[0-i] Well ? ” “[0-i] Well ! nay , if it is to be guesswork , let [us]1217-us all guess for [ourselves]1217-us . To be guided by second - hand conjecture is pitiful . [The premises]1218-the premises are before [you]0-i . [[My]0-i brother]419-my brother is [a lively and perhaps sometimes a thoughtless young man]1220-a lively and perhaps sometimes a thoughtless young man ; [he]419-my brother has had about a week ’s acquaintance with [[your]0-i friend]901-your friend , and [he]419-my brother has known [her]901-your friend engagement almost as long as [he]419-my brother has known [her]901-your friend . ” “[901-your friend] Well , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , after some moments ’ consideration , “[0-i] _ [you]0-i _ may be able to guess at [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother ’s intentions from all this ; but [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i can not . But is not [[your]0-i father]821-your father uncomfortable about it ? Does not [he]821-your father want [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney to go away ? Sure , if [[your]0-i father]821-your father were to speak to [him]821-your father , [he]821-your father would go . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , ” said [Henry]95-henry , “[0-i] in this amiable solicitude for [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother ’s comfort , may [you]0-i not be a little mistaken ? Are [you]0-i not carried a little too far ? Would [he]821-your father thank [you]0-i , either on [his]821-your father own account or [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s , for supposing that [her]97-miss thorpe affection , or at least [her]97-miss thorpe good behaviour , is only to be secured by [her]97-miss thorpe seeing nothing of [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ? Is [he]821-your father safe only in solitude ? Or is [her]97-miss thorpe heart constant to [him]821-your father only when unsolicited by [anyone else]674-anyone else ? [He]821-your father can not think this — and [you]0-i may be sure that [he]821-your father would not have [you]0-i think it . [I]0-i will not say , ‘ Do not be uneasy , ’ because [I]0-i know that [you]0-i are so , at this moment ; but be as little uneasy as [you]0-i can . [You]0-i have no doubt of the mutual attachment of [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother and [[your]0-i friend]901-your friend ; depend upon it , therefore , that real jealousy never can exist between [them]1230-their ; depend upon it that no disagreement between [them]1230-their can be of any duration . [Their]1230-their hearts are open to each other , as neither heart can be to [you]0-i ; [they]1230-their know exactly what is required and what can be borne ; and [you]0-i may be certain that [one]305-one will never tease [the other]1863-the other beyond what is known to be pleasant . ” Perceiving [her]2594-her still to look doubtful and grave , [he]77-captain tilney added , “[77-captain tilney] Though [Frederick]77-captain tilney does not leave [Bath]6-bath with [us]1233-us , [he]77-captain tilney will probably remain but a very short time , perhaps only a few days behind [us]1233-us . [His]77-captain tilney leave of absence will soon expire , and [he]77-captain tilney must return to [[his]77-captain tilney regiment]1234-his regiment . And what will then be [their]1230-their acquaintance ? [The mess - room]1235-the mess - room will drink [Isabella Thorpe]103-isabella for a fortnight , and [she]103-isabella will laugh with [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother over poor [Tilney]77-captain tilney ’s passion for a month . ” [Catherine]76-catherine would contend no longer against comfort . [She]2594-her had resisted its approaches during the whole length of a speech , but it now carried [her]2594-her captive . [Henry Tilney]95-henry must know best . [She]2594-her blamed [herself]2594-her for the extent of [her]2594-her fears , and resolved never to think so seriously on the subject again . [Her]2594-her resolution was supported by [Isabella]103-isabella ’s behaviour in [their]1230-their parting interview . [The Thorpes]104-the thorpes spent the last evening of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s stay in [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street , and nothing passed between [the lovers]2595-the lovers to excite [her]2594-her uneasiness , or make [her]2594-her quit [them]2595-the lovers in apprehension . [James]105-james was in excellent spirits , and [Isabella]103-isabella most engagingly placid . [Her]2594-her tenderness for [[her]2594-her friend]1769-her friend seemed rather the first feeling of [her]2594-her heart ; but that at such a moment was allowable ; and once [she]2594-her gave [[her]2594-her lover]1693-her lover a flat contradiction , and once [she]2594-her drew back [her]2594-her hand ; but [Catherine]76-catherine remembered [Henry]95-henry ’s instructions , and placed it all to judicious affection . The embraces , tears , and promises of [the parting fair ones]2598-the parting fair ones may be fancied . CHAPTER 20 [Mr.]2599-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen were sorry to lose [[their]2595-the lovers young friend]2600-their young friend , whose good humour and cheerfulness had made [her]2600-their young friend [a valuable companion]2601-a valuable companion , and in the promotion of whose enjoyment [their]2595-the lovers own had been gently increased . [Her]2600-their young friend happiness in going with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , however , prevented [their]2595-the lovers wishing it otherwise ; and , as [they]2595-the lovers were to remain only one more week in [Bath]1824-bath [themselves]2595-the lovers , [her]2600-their young friend quitting [them]2595-the lovers now would not long be felt . [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen attended [her]2600-their young friend to [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , where [she]2600-their young friend was to breakfast , and saw [her]2600-their young friend seated with the kindest welcome among [[her]2600-their young friend new friends]2603-her new friends ; but so great was [her]2600-their young friend agitation in finding [herself]2600-their young friend as [one of [the family]1904-the family]2604-one of the family , and so fearful was [she]2600-their young friend of not doing exactly what was right , and of not being able to preserve [their]2595-the lovers good opinion , that , in the embarrassment of the first five minutes , [she]2600-their young friend could almost have wished to return with [him]85-mr. allen to [Pulteney Street]8-pulteney street . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s manners and [Henry]95-henry ’s smile soon did away some of [her]2600-their young friend unpleasant feelings ; but still [she]2600-their young friend was far from being at ease ; nor could the incessant attentions of [the General]2216-the general [himself]2216-the general entirely reassure [her]2600-their young friend . Nay , perverse as it seemed , [she]2600-their young friend doubted whether [she]2600-their young friend might not have felt less , had [she]2600-their young friend been less attended to . [His]2216-the general anxiety for [her]2600-their young friend comfort — [his]2216-the general continual solicitations that [she]2600-their young friend would eat , and [his]2216-the general often - expressed fears of [her]2600-their young friend seeing nothing to [her]2600-their young friend taste — though never in [her]2600-their young friend life before had [she]2600-their young friend beheld half such variety on a breakfast - table — made it impossible for [her]2600-their young friend to forget for a moment that [she]2600-their young friend was [a visitor]2607-a visitor . [She]2600-their young friend felt utterly unworthy of such respect , and knew not how to reply to it . [Her]2600-their young friend tranquillity was not improved by [the General]2216-the general ’s impatience for the appearance of [[his]2216-the general eldest son]2609-his eldest son , nor by the displeasure [he]2216-the general expressed at [his]2216-the general laziness when [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney at last came down . [She]2600-their young friend was quite pained by the severity of [[his]2609-his eldest son father]2286-his father ’s reproof , which seemed disproportionate to the offence ; and much was [her]2600-their young friend concern increased when [she]2600-their young friend found [herself]2600-their young friend the principal cause of the lecture , and that [his]2216-the general tardiness was chiefly resented from being disrespectful to [her]2600-their young friend . This was placing [her]2600-their young friend in a very uncomfortable situation , and [she]2600-their young friend felt great compassion for [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , without being able to hope for [his]2216-the general goodwill . [He]2609-his eldest son listened to [[his]2609-his eldest son father]2286-his father in silence , and attempted not any defence , which confirmed [her]2600-their young friend in fearing that the inquietude of [his]2216-the general mind , on [Isabella]103-isabella ’s account , might , by keeping [him]2216-the general long sleepless , have been the real cause of [his]2216-the general rising late . It was the first time of [her]2600-their young friend being decidedly in [his]2216-the general company , and [she]2600-their young friend had hoped to be now able to form [her]2600-their young friend opinion of [him]2216-the general ; but [she]2600-their young friend scarcely heard [his]2216-the general voice while [[his]2609-his eldest son father]2286-his father remained in [the room]1765-the room ; and even afterwards , so much were [his]2216-the general spirits affected , [she]2600-their young friend could distinguish nothing but these words , in a whisper to [Eleanor]143-eleanor , “[103-isabella] How glad [I]0-i shall be when [you]1237-you are all off . ” The bustle of going was not pleasant . The clock struck ten while the trunks were carrying down , and [the General]2216-the general had fixed to be out of [Milsom Street]15-milsom street by that hour . [His]2216-the general greatcoat , instead of being brought for [him]2216-the general to put on directly , was spread out in the curricle in which [he]2216-the general was to accompany [[his]2216-the general son]824-his son . The middle seat of the chaise was not drawn out , though there were [three people to go in it]2616-three people to go in it , and [[[his]2216-the general daughter]598-his daughter ’s maid]2618-his daughter ’s maid had so crowded it with parcels that [Miss Morland]86-miss morland would not have room to sit ; and , so much was [he]2216-the general influenced by this apprehension when [he]2216-the general handed [her]86-miss morland in , that [she]86-miss morland had some difficulty in saving [her]86-miss morland own new writing - desk from being thrown out into [the street]1894-the street . At last , however , the door was closed upon [the three females]2620-the three females , and [they]2620-the three females set off at the sober pace in which the handsome , highly fed four horses of [a gentleman]1839-a gentleman usually perform a journey of thirty miles : such was the distance of [Northanger]62-northanger from [Bath]6-bath , to be now divided into two equal stages . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s spirits revived as [they]2620-the three females drove from the door ; for with [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney [she]86-miss morland felt no restraint ; and , with the interest of [a road entirely new to [her]86-miss morland]2622-a road entirely new to her , of [an abbey]2540-an abbey before , and a curricle behind , [she]86-miss morland caught the last view of [Bath]6-bath without any regret , and met with every milestone before [she]86-miss morland expected it . The tediousness of a two hours ’ wait at [Petty France]63-petty france , in which there was nothing to be done but to eat without being hungry , and loiter about without anything to see , next followed — and [her]86-miss morland admiration of the style in which [they]2620-the three females travelled , of the fashionable chaise and [four — postilions]2624-four — postilions handsomely liveried , rising so regularly in [their]2620-the three females stirrups , and numerous outriders properly mounted , sunk a little under this consequent inconvenience . Had [[their]2620-the three females party]2077-their party been perfectly agreeable , the delay would have been nothing ; but [General Tilney]139-general tilney , though so charming [a man]403-a man , seemed always a check upon [[his]139-general tilney children]2485-his children ’s spirits , and scarcely anything was said but by [himself]139-general tilney ; the observation of which , with [his]139-general tilney discontent at whatever [the inn]2628-the inn afforded , and [his]139-general tilney angry impatience at [the waiters]2629-the waiters , made [Catherine]76-catherine grow every moment more in awe of [him]139-general tilney , and appeared to lengthen the two hours into four . At last , however , the order of release was given ; and much was [Catherine]76-catherine then surprised by [the General]2216-the general ’s proposal of [her]1239-her taking [his]1238-his place in [[his]1238-his son]824-his son ’s curricle for the rest of the journey : “[1238-his] the day was fine , and [he]1238-his was anxious for [her]1239-her seeing as much of [the country]246-the country as possible . ” The remembrance of [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen ’s opinion , respecting [young men]1976-young men ’s open carriages , made [her]1239-her blush at the mention of such a plan , and [her]1239-her first thought was to decline it ; but [her]1239-her second was of greater deference for [General Tilney]139-general tilney ’s judgment ; [he]139-general tilney could not propose anything improper for [her]1239-her ; and , in the course of a few minutes , [she]1239-her found [herself]1239-her with [Henry]95-henry in [the curricle]2633-the curricle , as happy a being as ever existed . A very short trial convinced [her]1239-her that [a curricle]2634-a curricle was the prettiest equipage in [the world]215-the world ; the chaise and four wheeled off with some grandeur , to be sure , but it was a heavy and troublesome business , and [she]1239-her could not easily forget its having stopped two hours at [Petty France]63-petty france . Half the time would have been enough for the curricle , and so nimbly were the light horses disposed to move , that , had not [the General]2216-the general chosen to have [[his]139-general tilney own carriage]2637-his own carriage lead the way , [they]1976-young men could have passed [it]2637-his own carriage with ease in half a minute . But the merit of [the curricle]2633-the curricle did not all belong to the horses ; [Henry]95-henry drove so well — so quietly — without making any disturbance , without parading to [her]1239-her , or swearing at [them]1976-young men : so different from [the only gentleman - coachman whom it was in [her]1239-her power to compare [him]95-henry with]2639-the only gentleman - coachman whom it was in her power to compare him with ! and then [his]95-henry hat sat so well , and the innumerable capes of [his]95-henry greatcoat looked so becomingly important ! to be driven by [him]95-henry , next to being dancing with [him]95-henry , was certainly the greatest happiness in [the world]215-the world . In addition to every other delight , [she]1239-her had now that of listening to [her]1239-her own praise ; of being thanked at least , on [[his]95-henry sister]356-his sister ’s account , for [her]356-his sister kindness in thus becoming [[her]356-his sister visitor]2452-her visitor ; of hearing it ranked as real friendship , and described as creating real gratitude . [[His]95-henry sister]356-his sister , [he]95-henry said , was uncomfortably circumstanced — [she]356-his sister had [no female companion]2644-no female companion — and , in the frequent absence of [[her]356-his sister father]205-her father , was sometimes without [any companion at all]2646-any companion at all . “[1238-his] But how can that be ? ” said [Catherine]76-catherine . “[1238-his] Are not [you]1241-you with [her]1242-her ? ” “[1238-his] [Northanger]62-northanger is not more than half [[my]0-i home]1243-my home ; [I]0-i have [an establishment at [[my]0-i own house]1245-my own house in [Woodston]64-woodston]1244-an establishment at my own house in woodston , which is nearly twenty miles from [[my]0-i father]629-my father ’s , and some of [my]0-i time is necessarily spent [there]1848-there . ” “[1241-you] How sorry [you]1241-you must be for that ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am always sorry to leave [Eleanor]143-eleanor . ” “[143-eleanor] Yes ; but besides [your]143-eleanor affection for [her]1242-her , [you]143-eleanor must be so fond of [the abbey]1248-the abbey ! after being used to [such a home as [the abbey]1248-the abbey]1249-such a home as the abbey , [an ordinary parsonage - house]1251-an ordinary parsonage - house must be very disagreeable . ” [He]0-i smiled , and said , “[143-eleanor] [You]143-eleanor have formed a very favourable idea of [the abbey]1248-the abbey . ” “[0-i] To be sure , [I]0-i have . Is not it [a fine old place]1253-a fine old place , just like what one reads about ? ” “[0-i] And are [you]143-eleanor prepared to encounter all the horrors that [a building]1254-a building such as ‘ what one reads about ’ may produce ? Have [you]143-eleanor a stout heart ? Nerves fit for sliding panels and tapestry ? ” “[0-i] Oh ! yes — [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i should be easily frightened , because there would be so many people in [the house]238-the house — and besides , [it]238-the house has never been uninhabited and left deserted for years , and then [the family]1904-the family come back to [it]238-the house unawares , without giving any notice , as generally happens . ” “[143-eleanor] No , certainly . [We]1904-the family shall not have to explore [our]1904-the family way into [a hall dimly lighted by the expiring embers of a wood fire]1257-a hall dimly lighted by the expiring embers of a wood fire — nor be obliged to spread [our]1904-the family beds on the floor of [a room]1258-a room without windows , doors , or furniture . But [you]143-eleanor must be aware that when [a young lady]1707-a young lady is ( by whatever means ) introduced into [a dwelling of this kind]1260-a dwelling of this kind , [she]1707-a young lady is always lodged apart from [the rest of [the family]1904-the family]456-the rest of the family . While [they]456-the rest of the family snugly repair to [[their]456-the rest of the family own end of [the house]238-the house]1263-their own end of the house , [she]1707-a young lady is formally conducted by [Dorothy]165-dorothy , [the ancient housekeeper]1265-the ancient housekeeper , up [a different staircase]1266-a different staircase , and along [many gloomy passages]1267-many gloomy passages , into [an apartment never used since [some cousin or kin]1269-some cousin or kin died in [it]1268-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before about twenty years before]1268-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before . Can [you]143-eleanor stand such a ceremony as this ? Will not [your]143-eleanor mind misgive [you]143-eleanor when [you]143-eleanor find [yourself]143-eleanor in [this gloomy chamber]1270-this gloomy chamber — too lofty and extensive for [you]143-eleanor , with only the feeble rays of a single lamp to take in [its]1270-this gloomy chamber size — [its]1270-this gloomy chamber walls hung with tapestry exhibiting figures as large as life , and the bed , of dark green stuff or purple velvet , presenting even a funereal appearance ? Will not [your]143-eleanor heart sink within [you]143-eleanor ? ” “[143-eleanor] Oh ! but this will not happen to [me]0-i , [I]0-i am sure . ” “[143-eleanor] How fearfully will [you]143-eleanor examine the furniture of [[your]143-eleanor apartment]1271-your apartment ! and what will [you]143-eleanor discern ? Not tables , toilettes , wardrobes , or drawers , but on one side perhaps the remains of a broken lute , on the other a ponderous chest which no efforts can open , and over the fireplace the portrait of [some handsome warrior]1272-some handsome warrior , whose features will so incomprehensibly strike [you]143-eleanor , that [you]143-eleanor will not be able to withdraw [your]143-eleanor eyes from it . [Dorothy]165-dorothy , meanwhile , no less struck by [your]143-eleanor appearance , gazes on [you]143-eleanor in great agitation , and drops a few unintelligible hints . To raise [your]143-eleanor spirits , moreover , [she]165-dorothy gives [you]143-eleanor reason to suppose that the part of [the abbey [you]143-eleanor inhabit]1273-the abbey you inhabit is undoubtedly haunted , and informs [you]143-eleanor that [you]143-eleanor will not have a single domestic within call . With this parting cordial [she]165-dorothy curtsies off — [you]143-eleanor listen to the sound of [her]165-dorothy receding footsteps as long as the last echo can reach [you]143-eleanor — and when , with fainting spirits , [you]143-eleanor attempt to fasten [your]143-eleanor door , [you]143-eleanor discover , with increased alarm , that it has no lock . ” “[143-eleanor] Oh ! [mr . Tilney]143-eleanor , how frightful ! this is just like a book ! but it can not really happen to [me]0-i . [I]0-i am sure [[your]143-eleanor housekeeper]1274-your housekeeper is not really [Dorothy]165-dorothy . Well , what then ? ” “[165-dorothy] Nothing further to alarm perhaps may occur the first night . After surmounting [your]143-eleanor _ unconquerable _ horror of the bed , [you]143-eleanor will retire to rest , and get a few hours ’ unquiet slumber . But on the second , or at farthest the _ third _ night after [your]143-eleanor arrival , [you]143-eleanor will probably have a violent storm . Peals of thunder so loud as to seem to shake the edifice to its foundation will roll round [the neighbouring mountains]1275-the neighbouring mountains — and during the frightful gusts of wind which accompany it , [you]143-eleanor will probably think [you]143-eleanor discern ( for [your]143-eleanor lamp is not extinguished ) one part of the hanging more violently agitated than the rest . Unable of course to repress [your]143-eleanor curiosity in so favourable a moment for indulging it , [you]143-eleanor will instantly arise , and throwing [your]143-eleanor dressing - gown around [you]143-eleanor , proceed to examine this mystery . After a very short search , [you]143-eleanor will discover a division in the tapestry so artfully constructed as to defy the minutest inspection , and on opening it , a door will immediately appear — which door , being only secured by massy bars and a padlock , [you]143-eleanor will , after a few efforts , succeed in opening — and , with [your]143-eleanor lamp in [your]143-eleanor hand , will pass through it into [a small vaulted room]1276-a small vaulted room . ” “[0-i] No , indeed ; [I]0-i should be too much frightened to do any such thing . ” “[0-i] What ! not when [Dorothy]165-dorothy has given [you]143-eleanor to understand that there is a secret subterraneous communication between [[your]143-eleanor apartment]1271-your apartment and [the chapel of St. Anthony]1278-the chapel of st. anthony , scarcely two miles off . Could [you]143-eleanor shrink from so simple an adventure ? No , no , [you]143-eleanor will proceed into [this small vaulted room]1279-this small vaulted room , and through this into several others , without perceiving anything very remarkable in either . In one perhaps there may be a dagger , in another a few drops of blood , and in a third the remains of some instrument of torture ; but there being nothing in all this out of the common way , and [your]143-eleanor lamp being nearly exhausted , [you]143-eleanor will return towards [[your]143-eleanor own apartment]1280-your own apartment . In repassing through [the small vaulted room]1281-the small vaulted room , however , [your]143-eleanor eyes will be attracted towards a large , old - fashioned cabinet of ebony and gold , which , though narrowly examining the furniture before , [you]143-eleanor had passed unnoticed . Impelled by an irresistible presentiment , [you]143-eleanor will eagerly advance to [it]1281-the small vaulted room , unlock its folding doors , and search into every drawer — but for some time without discovering anything of importance — perhaps nothing but a considerable hoard of diamonds . At last , however , by touching a secret spring , an inner compartment will open — a roll of paper appears — [you]143-eleanor seize it — it contains many sheets of manuscript — [you]143-eleanor hasten with the precious treasure into [[your]143-eleanor own chamber]1282-your own chamber , but scarcely have [you]143-eleanor been able to decipher ‘ Oh [thou]1283-thou , whomsoever [thou]1283-thou mayst be , into whose hands these memoirs of [the wretched Matilda]1284-the wretched matilda may fall’—when [your]143-eleanor lamp suddenly expires in the socket , and leaves [you]143-eleanor in total darkness . ” “[1284-the wretched matilda] Oh , no , no ; do not say so . Well , go on . ” But [Henry]95-henry was too much amused by the interest [he]95-henry had raised to be able to carry it farther ; [he]95-henry could no longer command solemnity either of subject or voice , and was obliged to entreat [her]1284-the wretched matilda to use [her]1284-the wretched matilda own fancy in the perusal of [Matilda]166-matilda ’s woes . [Catherine]76-catherine , recollecting [herself]76-catherine , grew ashamed of [her]1284-the wretched matilda eagerness , and began earnestly to assure [him]95-henry that [her]1284-the wretched matilda attention had been fixed without the smallest apprehension of really meeting with what [he]95-henry related . “[92-miss tilney] [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , [she]1284-the wretched matilda was sure , would never put [her]1284-the wretched matilda into such a chamber as [he]92-miss tilney had described ! [she]1284-the wretched matilda was not at all afraid . ” As [they]2647-they drew near the end of [their]2647-they journey , [her]1284-the wretched matilda impatience for a sight of [the abbey]1248-the abbey — for some time suspended by [his]95-henry conversation on subjects very different — returned in full force , and every bend in [the road]645-the road was expected with solemn awe to afford a glimpse of [its]1248-the abbey massy walls of grey stone , rising amidst a grove of ancient oaks , with the last beams of the sun playing in beautiful splendour on [its]1248-the abbey high Gothic windows . But so low did [the building]2650-the building stand , that [she]1284-the wretched matilda found [herself]1284-the wretched matilda passing through the great gates of [the lodge]2651-the lodge into [the very grounds of [Northanger]62-northanger]2652-the very grounds of northanger , without having discerned even an antique chimney . [She]1284-the wretched matilda knew not that [she]1284-the wretched matilda had any right to be surprised , but there was a something in this mode of approach which [she]1284-the wretched matilda certainly had not expected .
