But [her]607-my mother memory endears it now . ” “[607-my mother] And ought it not , ” reflected [Catherine]76-catherine , “[607-my mother] to endear it to [[her]607-my mother husband]2226-her husband ? Yet [the General]2216-the general would not enter it . ” [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney continuing silent , [she]607-my mother ventured to say , “[2216-the general] [Her]607-my mother death must have been a great affliction ! ” “[1362-a great and increasing one] [A great and increasing one]1362-a great and increasing one , ” replied [the other]1863-the other , in a low voice . “[1362-a great and increasing one] [I]0-i was only thirteen when it happened ; and though [I]0-i felt [my]0-i loss perhaps as strongly as [one so young]1363-one so young could feel it , [I]0-i did not , [I]0-i could not , then know what a loss it was . ” [She]607-my mother stopped for a moment , and then added , with great firmness , “[0-i] [I]0-i have [no sister]1364-no sister , [you]1365-you know — and though [Henry]95-henry — though [[my]0-i brothers]1366-my brothers are very affectionate , and [Henry]95-henry is a great deal here , which [I]0-i am most thankful for , it is impossible for [me]0-i not to be often solitary . ” “[885-a mother] To be sure [you]1365-you must miss [him]95-henry very much . ” “[885-a mother] [A mother]885-a mother would have been always present . [A mother]885-a mother would have been [a constant friend]1369-a constant friend ; [her]885-a mother influence would have been beyond all other . ” “[885-a mother] Was [she]885-a mother [a very charming woman]1370-a very charming woman ? Was [she]885-a mother handsome ? Was there any picture of [her]885-a mother in [the abbey]1248-the abbey ? And why had [she]885-a mother been so partial to that grove ? Was it from dejection of spirits?”—were questions now eagerly poured forth ; [the first three]2804-the first three received a ready affirmative , [the two others]2117-the two others were passed by ; and [Catherine]76-catherine ’s interest in [the deceased Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney augmented with every question , whether answered or not . Of [her]885-a mother unhappiness in marriage , [she]885-a mother felt persuaded . [The General]2216-the general certainly had been [an unkind husband]2807-an unkind husband . [He]2216-the general did not love [her]885-a mother walk : could [he]2216-the general therefore have loved [her]885-a mother ? And besides , handsome as [he]2216-the general was , there was a something in the turn of [his]2216-the general features which spoke [his]2216-the general not having behaved well to [her]885-a mother . “[885-a mother] [Her]885-a mother picture , [I]0-i suppose , ” blushing at the consummate art of [her]885-a mother own question , “[0-i] hangs in [[[your]0-i father]821-your father ’s room]1373-your father ’s room ? ” “[885-a mother] No ; it was intended for [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room ; but [[my]0-i father]629-my father was dissatisfied with the painting , and for some time it had no place . Soon after [her]885-a mother death [I]0-i obtained it for [my]0-i own , and hung it in [[my]0-i bed - chamber]1376-my bed - chamber — where [I]0-i shall be happy to show it [you]0-i ; it is very like . ” Here was another proof . A portrait — very like — of [a departed wife]2808-a departed wife , not valued by [the husband]2809-the husband ! [he]2216-the general must have been dreadfully cruel to [her]885-a mother ! [Catherine]76-catherine attempted no longer to hide from [herself]76-catherine the nature of the feelings which , in spite of all [his]2216-the general attentions , [he]2216-the general had previously excited ; and what had been terror and dislike before , was now absolute aversion . Yes , aversion ! [his]2216-the general cruelty to [such a charming woman]2810-such a charming woman made [him]2216-the general odious to [her]885-a mother . [She]885-a mother had often read of such characters , characters which [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen had been used to call unnatural and overdrawn ; but here was proof positive of the contrary . [She]885-a mother had just settled this point when the end of the path brought them directly upon [the General]2216-the general ; and in spite of all [her]885-a mother virtuous indignation , [she]885-a mother found [herself]885-a mother again obliged to walk with [him]2216-the general , listen to [him]2216-the general , and even to smile when [he]2216-the general smiled . Being no longer able , however , to receive pleasure from the surrounding objects , [she]885-a mother soon began to walk with lassitude ; [the General]2216-the general perceived it , and with a concern for [her]885-a mother health , which seemed to reproach [her]885-a mother for [her]885-a mother opinion of [him]2216-the general , was most urgent for returning with [[his]2216-the general daughter]598-his daughter to [the house]238-the house . [He]2216-the general would follow [them]2815-them in a quarter of an hour . Again [they]2815-them parted — but [Eleanor]143-eleanor was called back in half a minute to receive a strict charge against taking [[her]885-a mother friend]1769-her friend round [the abbey]1248-the abbey till [his]2216-the general return . This second instance of [his]2216-the general anxiety to delay what [she]885-a mother so much wished for struck [Catherine]76-catherine as very remarkable . CHAPTER 23 An hour passed away before [the General]2216-the general came in , spent , on the part of [[his]2216-the general young guest]2819-his young guest , in no very favourable consideration of [his]2216-the general character . “[0-i] This lengthened absence , these solitary rambles , did not speak a mind at ease , or a conscience void of reproach . ” At length [he]2216-the general appeared ; and , whatever might have been the gloom of [his]2216-the general meditations , [he]2216-the general could still smile with _ [them]2820-them _ . [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , understanding in part [[her]885-a mother friend]1769-her friend ’s curiosity to see [the house]238-the house , soon revived the subject ; and [[her]885-a mother father]205-her father being , contrary to [Catherine]76-catherine ’s expectations , unprovided with any pretence for further delay , beyond that of stopping five minutes to order refreshments to be in [the room]1765-the room by [their]2825-they return , was at last ready to escort [them]2825-they . [They]2825-they set forward ; and , with a grandeur of air , a dignified step , which caught the eye , but could not shake the doubts of [the well - read Catherine]2826-the well - read catherine , [he]2216-the general led the way across [the hall]2659-the hall , through [the common drawing - room]2662-the common drawing - room and [one useless antechamber]2829-one useless antechamber , into [a room magnificent both in size and furniture]2830-a room magnificent both in size and furniture — [the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence]2831-the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence . [It]2830-a room magnificent both in size and furniture was very noble — very grand — very charming!—was all that [Catherine]76-catherine had to say , for [her]2826-the well - read catherine indiscriminating eye scarcely discerned the colour of the satin ; and all minuteness of praise , all praise that had much meaning , was supplied by [the General]2216-the general : the costliness or elegance of [any room]2833-any room ’s fitting - up could be nothing to [her]2826-the well - read catherine ; [she]2826-the well - read catherine cared for no furniture of a more modern date than the fifteenth century . When [the General]2216-the general had satisfied [his]2216-the general own curiosity , in a close examination of every well - known ornament , [they]2825-they proceeded into [the library]2835-the library , [an apartment , in [its]2830-a room magnificent both in size and furniture way]2836-an apartment , in its way , of equal magnificence , exhibiting a collection of books , on which [an humble man]2837-an humble man might have looked with pride . [Catherine]76-catherine heard , admired , and wondered with more genuine feeling than before — gathered all that [she]2826-the well - read catherine could from this storehouse of knowledge , by running over the titles of half a shelf , and was ready to proceed . But [suites of apartments]2838-suites of apartments did not spring up with [her]2826-the well - read catherine wishes . Large as was [the building]2650-the building , [she]2826-the well - read catherine had already visited the greatest part ; though , on being told that , with the addition of [the kitchen]2840-the kitchen , [the six or seven rooms]2841-the six or seven rooms [she]2826-the well - read catherine had now seen surrounded [three sides of [the court]2843-the court]2842-three sides of the court , [she]2826-the well - read catherine could scarcely believe it , or overcome the suspicion of there being many [chambers secreted]2844-chambers secreted . It was some relief , however , that [they]2825-they were to return to [the rooms in common use]2845-the rooms in common use , by passing through a few of less importance , looking into [the court]2843-the court , which , with occasional passages , not wholly unintricate , connected the different sides ; and [she]2826-the well - read catherine was further soothed in [her]2826-the well - read catherine progress by being told that [she]2826-the well - read catherine was treading what had once been [a cloister]2847-a cloister , having traces of [cells]2848-cells pointed out , and observing several doors that were neither opened nor explained to [her]2826-the well - read catherine — by finding [herself]2826-the well - read catherine successively in [a billiard - room]2849-a billiard - room , and in [[the General]2216-the general ’s private apartment]2851-the general ’s private apartment , without comprehending [their]2825-they connection , or being able to turn aright when [she]2826-the well - read catherine left [them]2825-they ; and lastly , by passing through [a dark little room]2852-a dark little room , owning [Henry]95-henry ’s authority , and strewed with [his]2216-the general litter of books , guns , and greatcoats . From [the dining - room]2853-the dining - room , of which , though already seen , and always to be seen at five o’clock , [the General]2216-the general could not forgo the pleasure of pacing out the length , for the more certain information of [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , as to what [she]2826-the well - read catherine neither doubted nor cared for , [they]2825-they proceeded by quick communication to [the kitchen]2840-the kitchen — [the ancient kitchen of [the convent]2857-the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present]2856-the ancient kitchen of the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present . [The General]139-general tilney ’s improving hand had not loitered [here]1743-here : every modern invention to facilitate the labour of [the cooks]2859-the cooks had been adopted within this , [[their]2825-they spacious theatre]2860-their spacious theatre ; and , when the genius of others had failed , [his]2216-the general own had often produced the perfection wanted . [His]2216-the general endowments of this spot alone might at any time have placed [him]2216-the general high among [the benefactors of [the convent]2857-the convent]2861-the benefactors of the convent . With the walls of [the kitchen]2840-the kitchen ended all the antiquity of [the abbey]1248-the abbey ; the fourth side of [the quadrangle]2774-the quadrangle having , on account of [its]2774-the quadrangle decaying state , been removed by [[the General]2216-the general ’s father]2867-the general ’s father , and the present erected in [its]2774-the quadrangle place . All that was venerable ceased [here]1743-here . [The new building]2869-the new building was not only new , but declared [itself]2869-the new building to be so ; intended only for [offices]2870-offices , and enclosed behind by [stable - yards]2871-stable - yards , no uniformity of architecture had been thought necessary . [Catherine]76-catherine could have raved at the hand which had swept away what must have been beyond the value of all the rest , for the purposes of mere domestic economy ; and would willingly have been spared the mortification of a walk through scenes so fallen , had [the General]2216-the general allowed it ; but if [he]2216-the general had a vanity , it was in the arrangement of [[his]2216-the general offices]2873-his offices ; and as [he]2216-the general was convinced that , to a mind like [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ’s , a view of the accommodations and comforts by which the labours of [[her]86-miss morland inferiors]2874-her inferiors were softened , must always be gratifying , [he]2216-the general should make no apology for leading [her]86-miss morland on . [They]2875-they took a slight survey of all ; and [Catherine]76-catherine was impressed , beyond [her]86-miss morland expectation , by [their]2875-they multiplicity and [their]2875-they convenience . The purposes for which a few shapeless pantries and a comfortless scullery were deemed sufficient at [Fullerton]4-fullerton , were [here]1743-here carried on in appropriate divisions , commodious and roomy . The number of [servants]2877-servants continually appearing did not strike [her]86-miss morland less than the number of [[their]2875-they offices]2878-their offices . Wherever [they]2875-they went , [some pattened girl]2879-some pattened girl stopped to curtsy , or [some footman in dishabille]2880-some footman in dishabille sneaked off . Yet this was [an abbey]2540-an abbey ! how inexpressibly different in these domestic arrangements from such as [she]86-miss morland had read about — from [abbeys]2542-abbeys and [castles]2541-castles , in which , though certainly larger than [Northanger]62-northanger , all the dirty work of [the house]238-the house was to be done by two pair of female hands at the utmost . How [they]2875-they could get through it all had often amazed [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen ; and , when [Catherine]76-catherine saw what was necessary [here]1743-here , [she]86-miss morland began to be amazed [herself]76-catherine . [They]2875-they returned to [the hall]2659-the hall , that the chief staircase might be ascended , and the beauty of [its]2659-the hall wood , and ornaments of rich carving might be pointed out : having gained the top , [they]2875-they turned in an opposite direction from the gallery in which [[her]86-miss morland room]2729-her room lay , and shortly entered one on the same plan , but superior in length and breadth . [She]86-miss morland was here shown successively into three large bed - chambers , with [[their]2875-they dressing - rooms]2888-their dressing - rooms , most completely and handsomely fitted up ; everything that money and taste could do , to give comfort and elegance to [apartments]2889-apartments , had been bestowed on these ; and , being furnished within the last five years , [they]2875-they were perfect in all that would be generally pleasing , and wanting in all that could give pleasure to [Catherine]76-catherine . As [they]2875-they were surveying the last , [the General]2216-the general , after slightly naming a few of [the distinguished characters by whom [they]2875-they had at times been honoured]2891-the distinguished characters by whom they had at times been honoured , turned with a smiling countenance to [Catherine]76-catherine , and ventured to hope that henceforward [some of [[their]2875-they earliest tenants]2893-their earliest tenants]2892-some of their earliest tenants might be “[0-i] [[our]1377-our friends from [Fullerton]4-fullerton]1378-our friends from fullerton . ” [She]86-miss morland felt the unexpected compliment , and deeply regretted the impossibility of thinking well of [a man so kindly disposed towards [herself]86-miss morland , and so full of civility to [all [her]86-miss morland family]2895-all her family]2894-a man so kindly disposed towards herself , and so full of civility to all her family . [The gallery]2736-the gallery was terminated by folding doors , which [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , advancing , had thrown open , and passed through , and seemed on the point of doing the same by the first door to the left , in another long reach of [gallery]2897-gallery , when [the General , coming forwards]2898-the general , coming forwards , called [her]86-miss morland hastily , and , as [Catherine]76-catherine thought , rather angrily back , demanding whither [she]86-miss morland were going?—And what was there more to be seen?—Had not [Miss Morland]86-miss morland already seen all that could be worth [her]86-miss morland notice?—And did [she]86-miss morland not suppose [[her]86-miss morland friend]1769-her friend might be glad of some refreshment after so much exercise ? [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney drew back directly , and the heavy doors were closed upon [the mortified Catherine]76-catherine , who , having seen , in a momentary glance beyond [them]2900-them , [a narrower passage]2901-a narrower passage , more numerous openings , and symptoms of [a winding staircase]2902-a winding staircase , believed [herself]76-catherine at last within the reach of something worth [her]86-miss morland notice ; and felt , as [she]86-miss morland unwillingly paced back [the gallery]2736-the gallery , that [she]86-miss morland would rather be allowed to examine that end of [the house]238-the house than see all the finery of all the rest . [The General]2216-the general ’s evident desire of preventing such an examination was an additional stimulant . Something was certainly to be concealed ; [her]86-miss morland fancy , though it had trespassed lately once or twice , could not mislead [her]86-miss morland here ; and what that something was , a short sentence of [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s , as [they]2906-they followed [the General]2216-the general at some distance [downstairs]2119-downstairs , seemed to point out : “[0-i] [I]0-i was going to take [you]1379-you into what was [[[my]0-i mother]607-my mother ’s room]1381-my mother ’s room — [the room in which [she]607-my mother died]1382-the room in which she died — ” were all [her]86-miss morland words ; but few as they were , they conveyed pages of intelligence to [Catherine]76-catherine . It was no wonder that [the General]2216-the general should shrink from the sight of such objects as [that room]2910-that room must contain ; [a room in all probability never entered by [him]2216-the general since the dreadful scene had passed]2911-a room in all probability never entered by him since the dreadful scene had passed , which released [[his]2216-the general suffering wife]2912-his suffering wife , and left [him]2216-the general to the stings of conscience . [She]86-miss morland ventured , when next alone with [Eleanor]143-eleanor , to express [her]86-miss morland wish of being permitted to see it , as well as [all the rest of that side of [the house]238-the house]2913-all the rest of that side of the house ; and [Eleanor]143-eleanor promised to attend [her]86-miss morland [there]1848-there , whenever [they]2916-they should have a convenient hour . [Catherine]76-catherine understood [her]86-miss morland : [the General]2216-the general must be watched from [home]482-home , before [that room]2910-that room could be entered . “[0-i] It remains as it was , [I]0-i suppose ? ” said [she]86-miss morland , in a tone of feeling . “[0-i] Yes , entirely . ” “[0-i] And how long ago may it be that [[your]0-i mother]1383-your mother died ? ” “[1383-your mother] [She]1383-your mother has been dead these nine years . ” And nine years , [Catherine]76-catherine knew , was a trifle of time , compared with what generally elapsed after the death of [an injured wife]2920-an injured wife , before [[her]1383-your mother room]2729-her room was put to rights . “[1383-your mother] [You]0-i were with [her]1383-your mother , [I]0-i suppose , to the last ? ” “[0-i] No , ” said [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , sighing ; “[0-i] [I]0-i was unfortunately from [home]482-home . [Her]1383-your mother illness was sudden and short ; and , before [I]0-i arrived it was all over . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s blood ran cold with the horrid suggestions which naturally sprang from these words . Could it be possible ? Could [[Henry]95-henry ’s father]2484-henry ’s father — ? And yet how many were the examples to justify even the blackest suspicions ! and , when [she]86-miss morland saw [him]2484-henry ’s father in the evening , while [she]86-miss morland worked with [[her]86-miss morland friend]1769-her friend , slowly pacing [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room for an hour together in silent thoughtfulness , with downcast eyes and contracted brow , [she]86-miss morland felt secure from all possibility of wronging [him]2484-henry ’s father . It was the air and attitude of [a Montoni]170-a montoni ! what could more plainly speak the gloomy workings of a mind not wholly dead to every sense of humanity , in its fearful review of past scenes of guilt ? [Unhappy man]2925-unhappy man ! and the anxiousness of [her]86-miss morland spirits directed [her]86-miss morland eyes towards [his]2484-henry ’s father figure so repeatedly , as to catch [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s notice . “[629-my father] [[My]0-i father]629-my father , ” [she]86-miss morland whispered , “[629-my father] often walks about [the room]1765-the room in this way ; it is nothing unusual . ” “[629-my father] So much the worse ! ” thought [Catherine]76-catherine ; such ill - timed exercise was of a piece with the strange unseasonableness of [his]2484-henry ’s father morning walks , and boded nothing good . After an evening , the little variety and seeming length of which made [her]86-miss morland peculiarly sensible of [Henry]95-henry ’s importance among [them]2926-them , [she]86-miss morland was heartily glad to be dismissed ; though it was a look from [the General]2216-the general not designed for [her]86-miss morland observation which sent [[his]0-i daughter]598-his daughter to the bell . When [the butler]2929-the butler would have lit [[his]2929-the butler master]550-his master ’s candle , however , [he]2929-the butler was forbidden . [The latter]214-the latter was not going to retire . “[0-i] [I]0-i have many pamphlets to finish , ” said [he]0-i to [Catherine]76-catherine , “[0-i] before [I]0-i can close [my]0-i eyes , and perhaps may be poring over the affairs of [the nation]2396-the nation for hours after [you]1388-she are asleep . Can either of [us]1389-us be more meetly employed ? _ [My]0-i _ eyes will be blinding for the good of [others]1832-others , and _ [yours]1388-she _ preparing by rest for future mischief . ” But neither the business alleged , nor the magnificent compliment , could win [Catherine]76-catherine from thinking that some very different object must occasion so serious a delay of proper repose . To be kept up for hours , after [the family]1904-the family were in bed , by stupid pamphlets was not very likely . There must be some deeper cause : something was to be done which could be done only while [the household]2933-the household slept ; and the probability that [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney yet lived , shut up for causes unknown , and receiving from the pitiless hands of [[her]129-mrs. tilney husband]2226-her husband a nightly supply of coarse food , was the conclusion which necessarily followed . Shocking as was the idea , it was at least better than a death unfairly hastened , as , in the natural course of things , [she]129-mrs. tilney must ere long be released . The suddenness of [her]129-mrs. tilney reputed illness , the absence of [[her]129-mrs. tilney daughter]1729-her daughter , and probably of [[her]129-mrs. tilney other children]2936-her other children , at the time — all favoured the supposition of [her]129-mrs. tilney imprisonment . Its origin — jealousy perhaps , or wanton cruelty — was yet to be unravelled . In revolving these matters , while [she]1388-she undressed , it suddenly struck [her]1388-she as not unlikely that [she]1388-she might that morning have passed near [the very spot of [this unfortunate woman]2938-this unfortunate woman ’s confinement]2937-the very spot of this unfortunate woman ’s confinement — might have been within a few paces of [the cell in which [she]129-mrs. tilney languished out [her]129-mrs. tilney days]2939-the cell in which she languished out her days ; for what part of [the abbey]1248-the abbey could be more fitted for the purpose than that which yet bore the traces of monastic division ? In the high - arched passage , paved with stone , which already [she]1388-she had trodden with peculiar awe , [she]1388-she well remembered the doors of which [the General]2216-the general had given no account . To what might not those doors lead ? In support of the plausibility of this conjecture , it further occurred to [her]1388-she that [the forbidden gallery , in which lay [the apartments of [the unfortunate Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney]2943-the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney]2942-the forbidden gallery , in which lay the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney , must be , as certainly as [her]1388-she memory could guide [her]1388-she , exactly over [this suspected range of cells]2944-this suspected range of cells , and the staircase by the side of [those apartments of which [she]1388-she had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with [those cells]2946-those cells]2945-those apartments of which she had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with those cells , might well have favoured the barbarous proceedings of [[her]1388-she husband]2226-her husband . Down that staircase [she]1388-she had perhaps been conveyed in a state of well - prepared insensibility ! [Catherine]76-catherine sometimes started at the boldness of [her]1388-she own surmises , and sometimes hoped or feared that [she]1388-she had gone too far ; but they were supported by such appearances as made [their]2948-their dismissal impossible . The side of [the quadrangle]2774-the quadrangle , in which [she]1388-she supposed the guilty scene to be acting , being , according to [her]1388-she belief , just opposite [her]1388-she own , it struck [her]1388-she that , if judiciously watched , some rays of light from [the General]2216-the general ’s lamp might glimmer through the lower windows , as [he]2216-the general passed to [the prison of [[his]2216-the general wife]1799-his wife]2951-the prison of his wife ; and , twice before [she]1388-she stepped into bed , [she]1388-she stole gently from [[her]1388-she room]2729-her room to the corresponding window in [the gallery]2736-the gallery , to see if it appeared ; but all abroad was dark , and it must yet be too early . The various ascending noises convinced [her]1388-she that [the servants]2955-the servants must still be up . Till midnight , [she]1388-she supposed it would be in vain to watch ; but then , when the clock had struck twelve , and all was quiet , [she]1388-she would , if not quite appalled by darkness , steal out and look once more . The clock struck twelve — and [Catherine]76-catherine had been half an hour asleep . CHAPTER 24 The next day afforded no opportunity for the proposed examination of [the mysterious apartments]2956-the mysterious apartments . It was Sunday , and the whole time between morning and afternoon service was required by [the General]2216-the general in exercise abroad or eating cold meat at [home]482-home ; and great as was [Catherine]76-catherine ’s curiosity , [her]1388-she courage was not equal to a wish of exploring them after dinner , either by the fading light of the sky between six and seven o’clock , or by the yet more partial though stronger illumination of a treacherous lamp . The day was unmarked therefore by anything to interest [her]1388-she imagination beyond the sight of a very elegant monument to the memory of [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney , which immediately fronted the family pew . By that [her]1388-she eye was instantly caught and long retained ; and the perusal of the highly strained epitaph , in which every virtue was ascribed to [her]1388-she by [the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other [her]1388-she destroyer]2959-the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other her destroyer , affected [her]1388-she even to tears . That [the General , having erected such a monument]2960-the general , having erected such a monument , should be able to face it , was not perhaps very strange , and yet that [he]2216-the general could sit so boldly collected within [its]2960-the general , having erected such a monument view , maintain so elevated an air , look so fearlessly around , nay , that [he]2216-the general should even enter [the church]1012-the church , seemed wonderful to [Catherine]76-catherine . Not , however , that many instances of [beings equally hardened in guilt]2962-beings equally hardened in guilt might not be produced . [She]1388-she could remember dozens who had persevered in every possible vice , going on from crime to crime , murdering whomsoever [they]2216-the general [chose , without any feeling of humanity or remorse]2963-chose , without any feeling of humanity or remorse ; till a violent death or a religious retirement closed [their]2216-the general black career . The erection of the monument itself could not in the smallest degree affect [her]1388-she doubts of [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney ’s actual decease . Were [she]1388-she even to descend into [the family vault where [her]1388-she ashes were supposed to slumber]2964-the family vault where her ashes were supposed to slumber , were [she]1388-she to behold the coffin in which [they]2965-they were said to be enclosed — what could it avail in such a case ? [Catherine]76-catherine had read too much not to be perfectly aware of the ease with which [a waxen figure]2966-a waxen figure might be introduced , and a supposititious funeral carried on . The succeeding morning promised something better . [The General]139-general tilney ’s early walk , ill - timed as it was in every other view , was favourable [here]1743-here ; and when [she]1388-she knew [him]2216-the general to be out of [the house]238-the house , [she]1388-she directly proposed to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney the accomplishment of [her]1388-she promise . [Eleanor]143-eleanor was ready to oblige [her]1388-she ; and [Catherine]76-catherine reminding [her]1388-she as [they]2969-they went of another promise , [their]2969-they first visit in consequence was to the portrait in [[her]1388-she bed - chamber]2970-her bed - chamber . It represented [a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance]2971-a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance , justifying , so far , the expectations of [its new observer]2972-its new observer ; but they were not in every respect answered , for [Catherine]76-catherine had depended upon meeting with features , hair , complexion , that should be the very counterpart , the very image , if not of [Henry]95-henry ’s , of [Eleanor’s]171-eleanor’s — the only portraits of which [she]1388-she had been in the habit of thinking , bearing always an equal resemblance of [mother]206-mother and [child]2974-child . A face once taken was taken for generations . But here [she]1388-she was obliged to look and consider and study for a likeness . [She]1388-she contemplated it , however , in spite of this drawback , with much emotion , and , but for a yet stronger interest , would have left it unwillingly . [Her]1388-she agitation as [they]2969-they entered [the great gallery]2975-the great gallery was too much for any endeavour at discourse ; [she]1388-she could only look at [[her]1388-she companion]2014-her companion . [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s countenance was dejected , yet sedate ; and its composure spoke [her]1388-she inured to all the gloomy objects to which [they]2969-they were advancing . Again [she]1388-she passed through the folding doors , again [her]1388-she hand was upon the important lock , and [Catherine]76-catherine , hardly able to breathe , was turning to close the former with fearful caution , when [the figure , the dreaded figure of [the General]2216-the general [himself]2216-the general at the further end of [the gallery]2736-the gallery]2977-the figure , the dreaded figure of the general himself at the further end of the gallery , stood before [her]1388-she ! the name of “[143-eleanor] [Eleanor]143-eleanor ” at the same moment , in [his]2216-the general loudest tone , resounded through [the building]2650-the building , giving to [[his]2216-the general daughter]598-his daughter the first intimation of [his]2216-the general presence , and to [Catherine]76-catherine terror upon terror . An attempt at concealment had been [her]1388-she first instinctive movement on perceiving [him]2216-the general , yet [she]1388-she could scarcely hope to have escaped [his]2216-the general eye ; and when [[her]1388-she friend]1769-her friend , who with an apologizing look darted hastily by [her]1388-she , had joined and disappeared with [him]2216-the general , [she]1388-she ran for safety to [[her]1388-she own room]2983-her own room , and , locking [herself]1388-she in , believed that [she]1388-she should never have courage to go down again . [She]1388-she remained [there]1848-there at least an hour , in the greatest agitation , deeply commiserating the state of [[her]1388-she poor friend]2985-her poor friend , and expecting a summons [herself]1388-she from [the angry General]2986-the angry general to attend [him]2216-the general in [[his]2216-the general own apartment]2987-his own apartment . No summons , however , arrived ; and at last , on seeing [a carriage]2110-a carriage drive up to [the abbey]1248-the abbey , [she]1388-she was emboldened to descend and meet [him]2216-the general under the protection of [visitors]2990-visitors . [The breakfast - room]2756-the breakfast - room was gay with [company]1042-company ; and [she]1388-she was named to [them]1042-company by [the General]2216-the general as [the friend of [[his]2216-the general daughter]598-his daughter]2994-the friend of his daughter , in a complimentary style , which so well concealed [his]2216-the general resentful ire , as to make [her]1388-she feel secure at least of life for the present . And [Eleanor]143-eleanor , with a command of countenance which did honour to [her]1388-she concern for [his]2216-the general character , taking an early occasion of saying to [her]1388-she , “[629-my father] [[My]0-i father]629-my father only wanted [me]0-i to answer a note , ” [she]1388-she began to hope that [she]1388-she had either been unseen by [the General]2216-the general , or that from some consideration of policy [she]1388-she should be allowed to suppose [herself]1388-she so . Upon this trust [she]1388-she dared still to remain in [his]2216-the general presence , after [the company]1800-the company left [them]2998-them , and nothing occurred to disturb it . In the course of this morning ’s reflections , [she]1388-she came to a resolution of making [her]1388-she next attempt on the forbidden door alone . It would be much better in every respect that [Eleanor]143-eleanor should know nothing of the matter . To involve [her]1388-she in the danger of a second detection , to court [her]1388-she into [an apartment which must wring [her]1388-she heart]2999-an apartment which must wring her heart , could not be [the office of [a friend]1896-a friend]3000-the office of a friend . [The General]2216-the general ’s utmost anger could not be to [herself]1388-she what it might be to [a daughter]3003-a daughter ; and , besides , [she]1388-she thought the examination itself would be more satisfactory if made without [any companion]3004-any companion . It would be impossible to explain to [Eleanor]143-eleanor the suspicions , from which [the other]1863-the other had , in all likelihood , been hitherto happily exempt ; nor could [she]1388-she therefore , in _ [her]1388-she _ presence , search for those proofs of [the General]2216-the general ’s cruelty , which however they might yet have escaped discovery , [she]1388-she felt confident of somewhere drawing forth , in the shape of some fragmented journal , continued to the last gasp . Of the way to [the apartment]2343-the apartment [she]1388-she was now perfectly mistress ; and as [she]1388-she wished to get it over before [Henry]95-henry ’s return , who was expected on the morrow , there was no time to be lost . The day was bright , [her]1388-she courage high ; at four o’clock , the sun was now two hours above the horizon , and it would be only [her]1388-she retiring to dress half an hour earlier than usual . It was done ; and [Catherine]76-catherine found [herself]76-catherine alone in [the gallery]2736-the gallery before the clocks had ceased to strike . It was no time for thought ; [she]1388-she hurried on , slipped with the least possible noise through the folding doors , and without stopping to look or breathe , rushed forward to the one in question . The lock yielded to [her]1388-she hand , and , luckily , with no sullen sound that could alarm [a human being]3009-a human being . On tiptoe [she]1388-she entered ; [the room]1765-the room was before [her]1388-she ; but it was some minutes before [she]1388-she could advance another step . [She]1388-she beheld what fixed [her]1388-she to the spot and agitated every feature . [She]1388-she saw [a large , well - proportioned apartment]3011-a large , well - proportioned apartment , [an handsome dimity bed , arranged as unoccupied with [an housemaid]3013-an housemaid ’s care]3012-an handsome dimity bed , arranged as unoccupied with an housemaid ’s care , a bright Bath stove , mahogany wardrobes , and neatly painted chairs , on which the warm beams of a western sun gaily poured through two sash windows ! [Catherine]76-catherine had expected to have [her]1388-she feelings worked , and worked they were . Astonishment and doubt first seized them ; and a shortly succeeding ray of common sense added some bitter emotions of shame . [She]1388-she could not be mistaken as to [the room]1765-the room ; but how grossly mistaken in everything else!—in [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney ’s meaning , in [her]1388-she own calculation ! [this apartment , to which [she]1388-she had given a date so ancient]3015-this apartment , to which she had given a date so ancient , a position so awful , proved to be one end of what [[the General]2216-the general ’s father]2867-the general ’s father had built . There were two other doors in [the chamber]3018-the chamber , leading probably into [dressing - closets]3019-dressing - closets ; but [she]1388-she had no inclination to open either . Would the veil in which [Mrs. Tilney]129-mrs. tilney had last walked , or the volume in which [she]1388-she had last read , remain to tell what nothing else was allowed to whisper ? No : whatever might have been [the General]2216-the general ’s crimes , [he]2216-the general had certainly too much wit to let [them]3021-them sue for detection . [She]1388-she was sick of exploring , and desired but to be safe in [[her]1388-she own room]2983-her own room , with [her]1388-she own heart only privy to its folly ; and [she]1388-she was on the point of retreating as softly as [she]1388-she had entered , when the sound of footsteps , [she]1388-she could hardly tell where , made [her]1388-she pause and tremble . To be found [there]1848-there , even by [a servant]2112-a servant , would be unpleasant ; but by [the General]2216-the general ( and [he]2216-the general seemed always at hand when least wanted ) , much worse ! [she]1388-she listened — the sound had ceased ; and resolving not to lose a moment , [she]1388-she passed through and closed the door . At that instant a door underneath was hastily opened ; [someone]3026-someone seemed with swift steps to ascend the stairs , by the head of which [she]1388-she had yet to pass before [she]1388-she could gain [the gallery]2736-the gallery . [She]1388-she had no power to move . With a feeling of terror not very definable , [she]1388-she fixed [her]1388-she eyes on the staircase , and in a few moments it gave [Henry]95-henry to [her]1388-she view . “[95-henry] [Mr. Tilney]95-henry ! ” [she]1388-she exclaimed in a voice of more than common astonishment . [He]95-henry looked astonished too . “[95-henry] [Good God]128-god ! ” [she]1388-she continued , not attending to [his]95-henry address . “[95-henry] How came [you]95-henry here ? How came [you]95-henry up that staircase ? ” “[95-henry] How came [I]0-i up that staircase ! ” [he]95-henry replied , greatly surprised . “[0-i] Because it is [my]0-i nearest way from [the stable - yard]1392-the stable - yard to [[my]0-i own chamber]1393-my own chamber ; and why should [I]0-i not come up [it]1394-it ? ” [Catherine]76-catherine recollected [herself]76-catherine , blushed deeply , and could say no more . [He]95-henry seemed to be looking in [her]1388-she countenance for that explanation which [her]1388-she lips did not afford . [She]1388-she moved on towards [the gallery]2736-the gallery . “[0-i] And may [I]0-i not , in [my]0-i turn , ” said [he]95-henry , as [he]95-henry pushed back the folding doors , “[0-i] ask how _ [you]0-i _ came [here]1743-here ? [This passage]1396-this passage is at least as extraordinary a road from [the breakfast - parlour]2745-the breakfast - parlour to [[your]0-i apartment]1271-your apartment , as that staircase can be from [the stables]1399-the stables to [mine]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have been , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , looking down , “[0-i] to see [[[your]0-i mother]1383-your mother ’s room]1401-your mother ’s room . ” “[0-i] [[[My]0-i mother]607-my mother ’s room]1381-my mother ’s room ! is there anything extraordinary to be seen [there]1848-there ? ” “[0-i] No , nothing at all . [I]0-i thought [you]0-i did not mean to come back till to - morrow . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did not expect to be able to return sooner , when [I]0-i went away ; but three hours ago [I]0-i had the pleasure of finding nothing to detain [me]0-i . [You]0-i have had a very fine day for [your]0-i ride . ” “[0-i] Very ; and does [Eleanor]143-eleanor leave [you]0-i to find [your]0-i way into [all the rooms in [the house]238-the house]1408-all the rooms in the house by [yourself]0-i ? ” “[1410-her] Oh no ! [she]1410-her showed [me]0-i over the greatest part on Saturday — and [we]1411-we were coming here to [these rooms]1412-these rooms — but only , ” dropping [her]1410-her voice , “[1410-her] [[your]0-i father]821-your father was with [us]1411-we . ” “[1410-her] And that prevented [you]0-i , ” said [Henry]95-henry , earnestly regarding [her]1410-her . “[1410-her] Have [you]0-i looked into all [the rooms in that passage]1414-the rooms in that passage ? ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i only wanted to see — Is not it very late ? [I]0-i must go and dress . ” “[0-i] It is only a quarter past four , ” showing [his]95-henry watch ; “[0-i] and [you]0-i are not now in [Bath]6-bath . [No theatre]1415-no theatre , [no rooms to prepare for]1416-no rooms to prepare for . Half an hour at [Northanger]62-northanger must be enough . ” [She]1410-her could not contradict it , and therefore suffered [herself]1410-her to be detained , though [her]1410-her dread of further questions made [her]1410-her , for the first time in [their]3029-their acquaintance , wish to leave [him]95-henry . [They]3029-their walked slowly up [the gallery]2736-the gallery . “[0-i] Have [you]0-i had any letter from [Bath]6-bath since [I]0-i saw [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] No , and [I]0-i am very much surprised . [Isabella]103-isabella promised so faithfully to write directly . ” “[103-isabella] Promised so faithfully ! a faithful promise ! that puzzles [me]0-i . [I]0-i have heard of a faithful performance . But a faithful promise — the fidelity of promising ! it is a power little worth knowing , however , since it can deceive and pain [you]0-i . [[[My]0-i mother]607-my mother ’s room]1381-my mother ’s room is very commodious , is it not ? Large and cheerful - looking , and the dressing - closets so well disposed ! It always strikes [me]0-i as [the most comfortable apartment in [the house]238-the house]1419-the most comfortable apartment in the house , and [I]0-i rather wonder that [Eleanor]143-eleanor should not take [it]1381-my mother ’s room for [her]607-my mother own . [She]607-my mother sent [you]0-i to look at [it]1381-my mother ’s room , [I]0-i suppose ? ” “[607-my mother] No . ” “[607-my mother] It has been [your]0-i own doing entirely ? ” [Catherine]76-catherine said nothing . After a short silence , during which [he]0-i had closely observed [her]607-my mother , [he]0-i added , “[607-my mother] As there is nothing in [the room]1765-the room in [itself]1765-the room to raise curiosity , this must have proceeded from a sentiment of respect for [[my]0-i mother]607-my mother ’s character , as described by [Eleanor]143-eleanor , which does honour to [her]607-my mother memory . [The world]215-the world , [I]0-i believe , never saw [a better woman]1424-a better woman . But it is not often that virtue can boast an interest such as this . The domestic , unpretending merits of [a person never known]1425-a person never known do not often create that kind of fervent , venerating tenderness which would prompt a visit like [yours]1426-you . [Eleanor]143-eleanor , [I]0-i suppose , has talked of [her]607-my mother a great deal ? ” “[143-eleanor] Yes , a great deal . That is — no , not much , but what [she]607-my mother did say was very interesting . [Her]607-my mother dying so suddenly ” ( slowly , and with hesitation it was spoken ) , “[1426-you] and [you]1426-you — none of [you]1426-you being at [home]482-home — and [[your]1426-you father]821-your father , [I]0-i thought — perhaps had not been very fond of [her]607-my mother . ” “[0-i] And from these circumstances , ” [he]0-i replied ( [his]0-i quick eye fixed on [hers]1426-you ) , “[0-i] [you]1426-you infer perhaps the probability of some negligence — some”—(involuntarily [she]607-my mother shook [her]607-my mother head)—“or[0-i] it may be — of something still less pardonable . ” [She]1426-you raised [her]1426-you eyes towards [him]0-i more fully than [she]1426-you had ever done before . “[0-i] [[My]0-i mother]607-my mother ’s illness , ” [he]0-i continued , “[0-i] the seizure which ended in [her]607-my mother death , _ was _ sudden . The malady itself , one from which [she]607-my mother had often suffered , a bilious fever — its cause therefore constitutional . On the third day , in short , as soon as [she]607-my mother could be prevailed on , [a physician]1430-a physician attended [her]607-my mother , [a very respectable man]209-a very respectable man , and one in whom [she]607-my mother had always placed great confidence . Upon [his]1430-a physician opinion of [her]607-my mother danger , [two others]1432-two others were called in the next day , and remained in almost constant attendance for four and twenty hours . On the fifth day [she]607-my mother died . During the progress of [her]607-my mother disorder , [Frederick]77-captain tilney and [I]0-i ( _ [we]1433-we _ were both at [home]482-home ) saw [her]607-my mother repeatedly ; and from [our]1433-we own observation can bear witness to [her]607-my mother having received every possible attention which could spring from the affection of those about [her]607-my mother , or which [her]607-my mother situation in life could command . [Poor Eleanor]172-poor eleanor was absent , and at such a distance as to return only to see [[her]172-poor eleanor mother]211-her mother in [her]607-my mother coffin . ” “[821-your father] But [[your]0-i father]821-your father , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , “[821-your father] was _ [he]821-your father _ afflicted ? ” “[821-your father] For a time , greatly so . [You]0-i have erred in supposing [him]821-your father not attached to [her]607-my mother . [He]821-your father loved [her]607-my mother , [I]0-i am persuaded , as well as it was possible for [him]821-your father to — [we]1433-we have not all , [you]0-i know , the same tenderness of disposition — and [I]0-i will not pretend to say that while [she]607-my mother lived , [she]607-my mother might not often have had much to bear , but though [his]821-your father temper injured [her]607-my mother , [his]821-your father judgment never did . [His]821-your father value of [her]607-my mother was sincere ; and , if not permanently , [he]821-your father was truly afflicted by [her]607-my mother death . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am very glad of it , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine ; “[0-i] it would have been very shocking ! ” “[0-i] If [I]0-i understand [you]0-i rightly , [you]0-i had formed a surmise of such horror as [I]0-i have hardly words to — [Dear Miss Morland]86-miss morland , consider the dreadful nature of the suspicions [you]0-i have entertained . What have [you]0-i been judging from ? Remember [the country]246-the country and the age in which [we]1438-we live . Remember that [we]1438-we are English , that [we]1438-we are [Christians]1439-christians . Consult [your]0-i own understanding , [your]0-i own sense of the probable , [your]0-i own observation of what is passing around [you]0-i . Does [our]1438-we education prepare [us]1438-we for such atrocities ? Do [our]1438-we laws connive at [them]1440-them ? Could they be perpetrated without being known , in [a country]1441-a country like this , where social and literary intercourse is on such a footing , where [every man]1442-every man is surrounded by [a neighbourhood of voluntary spies]1443-a neighbourhood of voluntary spies , and where [roads and newspapers lay everything open]1444-roads and newspapers lay everything open ? [Dearest Miss Morland]86-miss morland , what ideas have [you]0-i been admitting ? ” [They]1438-we had reached the end of [the gallery]2736-the gallery , and with tears of shame [she]86-miss morland ran off to [[her]86-miss morland own room]2983-her own room . CHAPTER 25 The visions of romance were over . [Catherine]76-catherine was completely awakened . [Henry]95-henry ’s address , short as it had been , had more thoroughly opened [her]86-miss morland eyes to the extravagance of [her]86-miss morland late fancies than all [their]1438-we several disappointments had done . Most grievously was [she]86-miss morland humbled . Most bitterly did [she]86-miss morland cry . It was not only with [herself]86-miss morland that [she]86-miss morland was sunk — but with [Henry]95-henry . [Her]86-miss morland folly , which now seemed even criminal , was all exposed to [him]95-henry , and [he]95-henry must despise [her]86-miss morland forever . The liberty which [her]86-miss morland imagination had dared to take with the character of [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father — could [he]95-henry ever forgive it ? The absurdity of [her]86-miss morland curiosity and [her]86-miss morland fears — could they ever be forgotten ? [She]86-miss morland hated [herself]86-miss morland more than [she]86-miss morland could express . [He]95-henry had — [she]86-miss morland thought [he]95-henry had , once or twice before this fatal morning , shown something like affection for [her]86-miss morland . But now — in short , [she]86-miss morland made [herself]86-miss morland as miserable as possible for about half an hour , went down when the clock struck five , with a broken heart , and could scarcely give an intelligible answer to [Eleanor]172-poor eleanor ’s inquiry if [she]86-miss morland was well . [The formidable Henry]95-henry soon followed [her]86-miss morland into [the room]1765-the room , and the only difference in [his]95-henry behaviour to [her]86-miss morland was that [he]95-henry paid [her]86-miss morland rather more attention than usual . [Catherine]76-catherine had never wanted comfort more , and [he]95-henry looked as if [he]95-henry was aware of it . The evening wore away with no abatement of this soothing politeness ; and [her]86-miss morland spirits were gradually raised to a modest tranquillity . [She]86-miss morland did not learn either to forget or defend the past ; but [she]86-miss morland learned to hope that it would never transpire farther , and that it might not cost [her]86-miss morland [Henry]95-henry ’s entire regard . [Her]86-miss morland thoughts being still chiefly fixed on what [she]86-miss morland had with such causeless terror felt and done , nothing could shortly be clearer than that it had been all a voluntary , self - created delusion , each trifling circumstance receiving importance from an imagination resolved on alarm , and everything forced to bend to one purpose by a mind which , before [she]86-miss morland entered [the abbey]1248-the abbey , had been craving to be frightened . [She]86-miss morland remembered with what feelings [she]86-miss morland had prepared for a knowledge of [Northanger]62-northanger . [She]86-miss morland saw that the infatuation had been created , the mischief settled , long before [her]86-miss morland quitting Bath , and it seemed as if the whole might be traced to the influence of that sort of reading which [she]86-miss morland had there indulged . Charming as were all [Mrs. Radcliffe]123-mrs. radcliffe ’s works , and charming even as were the works of [all [her]86-miss morland imitators]3036-all her imitators , it was not in [them]3036-all her imitators perhaps that human nature , at least in [the Midland counties of England]3037-the midland counties of england , was to be looked for . Of [the Alps]67-the alps and [Pyrenees]68-pyrenees , with [their]67-the alps pine forests and [their]67-the alps vices , [they]67-the alps might give a faithful delineation ; and [Italy]54-italy , [Switzerland]69-switzerland , and [the south of [France]52-france]887-the south of france might be as fruitful in horrors as they were there represented . [Catherine]76-catherine dared not doubt beyond [[her]86-miss morland own country]3039-her own country , and even of that , if hard pressed , would have yielded [the northern and western extremities]3040-the northern and western extremities . But in [the central part of [England]3-england]3041-the central part of england there was surely some security for the existence even of [a wife not beloved]3042-a wife not beloved , in the laws of [the land]3043-the land , and the manners of the age . Murder was not tolerated , [servants]2877-servants were not [slaves]3045-slaves , and neither poison nor sleeping potions to be procured , like rhubarb , from [every druggist]3046-every druggist . Among [the Alps and Pyrenees]3047-the alps and pyrenees , perhaps , there were [no mixed characters]3048-no mixed characters . There , [such as were not as spotless as an angel]3049-such as were not as spotless as an angel might have the dispositions of [a fiend]3050-a fiend . But in [England]3-england it was not so ; among [the English]3051-the english , [she]86-miss morland believed , in [their]3051-the english hearts and habits , there was a general though unequal mixture of good and bad . Upon this conviction , [she]86-miss morland would not be surprised if even in [Henry]95-henry and [Eleanor Tilney]143-eleanor , some slight imperfection might hereafter appear ; and upon this conviction [she]86-miss morland need not fear to acknowledge some actual specks in the character of [[their]3047-the alps and pyrenees father]2482-their father , who , though cleared from the grossly injurious suspicions which [she]86-miss morland must ever blush to have entertained , [she]86-miss morland did believe , upon serious consideration , to be not perfectly amiable . [Her]86-miss morland mind made up on these several points , and [her]86-miss morland resolution formed , of always judging and acting in future with the greatest good sense , [she]86-miss morland had nothing to do but to forgive [herself]86-miss morland and be happier than ever ; and the lenient hand of time did much for [her]86-miss morland by insensible gradations in the course of another day . [Henry]95-henry ’s astonishing generosity and nobleness of conduct , in never alluding in the slightest way to what had passed , was of the greatest assistance to [her]86-miss morland ; and sooner than [she]86-miss morland could have supposed it possible in the beginning of [her]86-miss morland distress , [her]86-miss morland spirits became absolutely comfortable , and capable , as heretofore , of continual improvement by anything [he]95-henry said . There were still some subjects , indeed , under which [she]86-miss morland believed [they]3047-the alps and pyrenees must always tremble — the mention of a chest or a cabinet , for instance — and [she]86-miss morland did not love the sight of japan in any shape : but even _ [she]86-miss morland _ could allow that an occasional memento of past folly , however painful , might not be without use . The anxieties of common life began soon to succeed to the alarms of romance . [Her]86-miss morland desire of hearing from [Isabella]103-isabella grew every day greater . [She]86-miss morland was quite impatient to know how the Bath world went on , and how [the rooms]251-the rooms were attended ; and especially was [she]86-miss morland anxious to be assured of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s having matched some fine netting - cotton , on which [she]103-isabella had left [her]103-isabella intent ; and of [her]103-isabella continuing on the best terms with [James]105-james . [Her]86-miss morland only dependence for information of any kind was on [Isabella]103-isabella . [James]105-james had protested against writing to [her]103-isabella till [his]105-james return to [Oxford]11-oxford ; and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen had given [her]103-isabella no hopes of a letter till [she]103-isabella had got back to [Fullerton]4-fullerton . But [Isabella]103-isabella had promised and promised again ; and when [she]103-isabella promised a thing , [she]103-isabella was so scrupulous in performing it ! this made it so particularly strange ! For nine successive mornings , [Catherine]76-catherine wondered over the repetition of a disappointment , which each morning became more severe : but , on the tenth , when [she]103-isabella entered [the breakfast - room]2756-the breakfast - room , [her]103-isabella first object was a letter , held out by [Henry]95-henry ’s willing hand . [She]103-isabella thanked [him]95-henry as heartily as if [he]95-henry had written it [himself]95-henry . “[0-i] ’ Tis only from [James]105-james , however , ” as [she]103-isabella looked at the direction . [She]103-isabella opened it ; it was from [Oxford]11-oxford ; and to this purpose : “[105-james] [Dear Catherine]174-dear catherine , “ Though , [God]128-god knows , with little inclination for writing , [I]174-dear catherine think it [my]174-dear catherine duty to tell [you]174-dear catherine that everything is at an end between [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe and [me]174-dear catherine . [I]174-dear catherine left [her]97-miss thorpe and [Bath]1824-bath yesterday , never to see either again . [I]174-dear catherine shall not enter into particulars — they would only pain [you]174-dear catherine more . [You]174-dear catherine will soon hear enough from another quarter to know where lies the blame ; and [I]174-dear catherine hope will acquit [[your]174-dear catherine brother]474-your brother of everything but the folly of too easily thinking [his]474-your brother affection returned . Thank [God]128-god ! [i]174-dear catherine am undeceived in time ! but it is a heavy blow ! after [[my]174-dear catherine father]629-my father ’s consent had been so kindly given — but no more of this . [She]97-miss thorpe has made [me]174-dear catherine miserable forever ! let [me]174-dear catherine soon hear from [you]174-dear catherine , dear [Catherine]174-dear catherine ; [you]174-dear catherine are [[my]174-dear catherine only friend]3058-my only friend ; _ [your]174-dear catherine _ love [I]174-dear catherine do build upon . [I]174-dear catherine wish [your]174-dear catherine visit at [Northanger]62-northanger may be over before [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney makes [his]77-captain tilney engagement known , or [you]174-dear catherine will be uncomfortably circumstanced . [Poor Thorpe]175-poor thorpe is in [town]427-town : [I]174-dear catherine dread the sight of [him]175-poor thorpe ; [his]175-poor thorpe honest heart would feel so much . [I]174-dear catherine have written to [him]175-poor thorpe and [[my]174-dear catherine father]629-my father . [Her]3061-her duplicity hurts [me]174-dear catherine more than all ; till the very last , if [I]174-dear catherine reasoned with [her]3061-her , [she]3061-her declared [herself]3061-her as much attached to [me]174-dear catherine as ever , and laughed at [my]174-dear catherine fears . [I]174-dear catherine am ashamed to think how long [I]174-dear catherine bore with it ; but if ever [man]2190-man had reason to believe [himself]2190-man loved , [I]174-dear catherine was [that man]3063-that man . [I]174-dear catherine can not understand even now what [she]3061-her would be at , for there could be no need of [my]174-dear catherine being played off to make [her]3061-her secure of [Tilney]77-captain tilney . [We]3064-we parted at last by mutual consent — happy for [me]174-dear catherine had [we]3064-we never met ! [i]174-dear catherine can never expect to know [such another woman]3065-such another woman ! [Dearest Catherine]76-catherine , beware how [you]76-catherine give [your]76-catherine heart . “[174-dear catherine] Believe [me]0-i , ” & c. [Catherine]76-catherine had not read three lines before [her]3061-her sudden change of countenance , and short exclamations of sorrowing wonder , declared [her]3061-her to be receiving unpleasant news ; and [Henry]95-henry , earnestly watching [her]3061-her through the whole letter , saw plainly that it ended no better than it began . [He]95-henry was prevented , however , from even looking [his]95-henry surprise by [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father ’s entrance . [They]3064-we went to breakfast directly ; but [Catherine]76-catherine could hardly eat anything . Tears filled [her]3061-her eyes , and even ran down [her]3061-her cheeks as [she]3061-her sat . The letter was one moment in [her]3061-her hand , then in [her]3061-her lap , and then in [her]3061-her pocket ; and [she]3061-her looked as if [she]3061-her knew not what [she]3061-her did . [The General]2216-the general , between [his]2216-the general cocoa and [his]2216-the general newspaper , had luckily no leisure for noticing [her]3061-her ; but to [the other two]2013-the other two [her]3061-her distress was equally visible . As soon as [she]3061-her dared leave the table [she]3061-her hurried away to [[her]3061-her own room]2983-her own room ; but [the housemaids]3070-the housemaids were busy in [it]2983-her own room , and [she]3061-her was obliged to come down again . [She]3061-her turned into [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room for privacy , but [Henry]95-henry and [Eleanor]143-eleanor had likewise retreated thither , and were at that moment deep in consultation about [her]3061-her . [She]3061-her drew back , trying to beg [their]3070-the housemaids pardon , but was , with gentle violence , forced to return ; and [the others]353-the others withdrew , after [Eleanor]143-eleanor had affectionately expressed a wish of being of use or comfort to [her]3061-her . After half an hour ’s free indulgence of grief and reflection , [Catherine]76-catherine felt equal to encountering [[her]3061-her friends]2225-her friends ; but whether [she]3061-her should make [her]3061-her distress known to [them]2225-her friends was another consideration . Perhaps , if particularly questioned , [she]3061-her might just give an idea — just distantly hint at it — but not more . To expose [a friend]1896-a friend , [such a friend as [Isabella]103-isabella]3075-such a friend as isabella had been to [her]3061-her — and then [[their]3070-the housemaids own brother]3076-their own brother so closely concerned in it ! [She]3061-her believed [she]3061-her must waive the subject altogether . [Henry]95-henry and [Eleanor]143-eleanor were by [themselves]3070-the housemaids in [the breakfast - room]2756-the breakfast - room ; and [each]670-each , as [she]3061-her entered [it]2756-the breakfast - room , looked at [her]3061-her anxiously . [Catherine]76-catherine took [her]3061-her place at the table , and , after a short silence , [Eleanor]143-eleanor said , “[174-dear catherine] No bad news from [Fullerton]4-fullerton , [I]0-i hope ? [Mr.]1445-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland — [[your]1446-you brothers]1447-your brothers and [sisters]1861-sisters — [I]0-i hope [they]1449-they are none of [them]1449-they ill ? ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i thank [you]1446-you ” ( sighing as [she]80-mrs. morland spoke ) ; “[1446-you] [they]1449-they are all very well . [My]0-i letter was from [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother at [Oxford]11-oxford . ” Nothing further was said for a few minutes ; and then speaking through [her]80-mrs. morland tears , [she]80-mrs. morland added , “[419-my brother] [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i shall ever wish for a letter again ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry , ” said [Henry]95-henry , closing the book [he]0-i had just opened ; “[0-i] if [I]0-i had suspected the letter of containing anything unwelcome , [I]0-i should have given it with very different feelings . ” “[0-i] It contained something worse than [anybody]216-anybody could suppose ! poor [James]105-james is so unhappy ! [you]1446-you will soon know why . ” “[1446-you] To have so kind - hearted , so affectionate [a sister]2070-a sister , ” replied [Henry]95-henry warmly , “[1446-you] must be a comfort to [him]105-james under any distress . ” “[1446-you] [I]0-i have one favour to beg , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , shortly afterwards , in an agitated manner , “[1446-you] that , if [[your]1446-you brother]474-your brother should be coming [here]1743-here , [you]1446-you will give [me]0-i notice of it , that [I]0-i may go away . ” “[1446-you] [[Our]1455-our brother]1456-our brother ! frederick ! ” “[1446-you] Yes ; [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i should be very sorry to leave [you]1446-you so soon , but something has happened that would make it very dreadful for [me]0-i to be in [the same house]1457-the same house with [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney . ” [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s work was suspended while [she]1446-you gazed with increasing astonishment ; but [Henry]95-henry began to suspect the truth , and something , in which [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s name was included , passed [his]95-henry lips . “[77-captain tilney] How quick [you]1446-you are ! ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine : “[1446-you] [you]1446-you have guessed it , [I]0-i declare ! And yet , when [we]1458-we talked about it in [Bath]6-bath , [you]1446-you little thought of its ending so . [Isabella]103-isabella — no wonder _ now _ [I]0-i have not heard from [her]103-isabella — [Isabella]103-isabella has deserted [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , and is to marry [yours]1446-you ! could [you]1446-you have believed there had been such inconstancy and fickleness , and everything that is bad in [the world]215-the world ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hope , so far as concerns [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , [you]1446-you are misinformed . [I]0-i hope [he]419-my brother has not had any material share in bringing on [Mr. Morland]105-james ’s disappointment . [His]419-my brother marrying [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe is not probable . [I]0-i think [you]1446-you must be deceived so far . [I]0-i am very sorry for [Mr. Morland]105-james — sorry that anyone [you]1446-you love should be unhappy ; but [my]0-i surprise would be greater at [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s marrying [her]97-miss thorpe than at any other part of the story . ” “[177-stay] It is very true , however ; [you]1446-you shall read [James]105-james ’s letter [yourself]1446-you . [Stay]177-stay — There is one part — ” recollecting with a blush the last line . “[177-stay] Will [you]1446-you take the trouble of reading to [us]1462-us the passages which concern [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother ? ” “[1446-you] No , read it [yourself]1446-you , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , whose second thoughts were clearer . “[1446-you] [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i was thinking of ” ( blushing again that [she]1446-you had blushed before ) ; “[0-i] [James]105-james only means to give [me]0-i good advice . ” [He]105-james gladly received the letter , and , having read it through , with close attention , returned it saying , “[105-james] Well , if it is to be so , [I]0-i can only say that [I]0-i am sorry for it . [Frederick]77-captain tilney will not be [the first man who has chosen [a wife]2069-a wife with less sense than [[his]77-captain tilney family]1879-his family expected . [I]0-i do not envy [his]77-captain tilney situation , either as [a lover]1842-a lover or [a son]1468-a son]1464-the first man who has chosen a wife with less sense than his family expected . i do not envy his situation , either as a lover or a son . ” [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , at [Catherine]76-catherine ’s invitation , now read the letter likewise , and , having expressed also [her]1469-her concern and surprise , began to inquire into [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s connections and fortune . “[0-i] [[Her]1469-her mother]211-her mother is [a very good sort of woman]1471-a very good sort of woman , ” was [Catherine]76-catherine ’s answer . “[1471-a very good sort of woman] What was [[her]1469-her father]205-her father ? ” “[1473-a lawyer] [A lawyer]1473-a lawyer , [I]0-i believe . [They]1474-they live at [Putney]60-putney . ” “[1474-they] Are [they]1474-they [a wealthy family]1475-a wealthy family ? ” “[1475-a wealthy family] No , not very . [I]0-i do not believe [Isabella]103-isabella has any fortune at all : but that will not signify in [[your]0-i family]1476-your family . [[Your]0-i father]821-your father is so very liberal ! [He]821-your father told [me]0-i the other day that [he]821-your father only valued money as it allowed [him]821-your father to promote the happiness of [[his]821-your father children]2485-his children . ” [The brother]1055-the brother and [sister]2160-sister looked at [each other]1792-each other . “[821-your father] But , ” said [Eleanor]143-eleanor , after a short pause , “[821-your father] would it be to promote [his]821-your father happiness , to enable [him]821-your father to marry [such a girl]1479-such a girl ? [She]1479-such a girl must be [an unprincipled one]1480-an unprincipled one , or [she]1479-such a girl could not have used [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother so . And how strange an infatuation on [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s side ! [a girl who , before [his]77-captain tilney eyes , is violating an engagement voluntarily entered into with [another man]1202-another man]1482-a girl who , before his eyes , is violating an engagement voluntarily entered into with another man ! is not it inconceivable , [Henry]95-henry ? [Frederick]77-captain tilney too , who always wore [his]77-captain tilney heart so proudly ! who found [no woman good enough to be loved]1484-no woman good enough to be loved ! ” “[77-captain tilney] That is the most unpromising circumstance , the strongest presumption against [him]77-captain tilney . When [I]0-i think of [his]77-captain tilney past declarations , [I]0-i give [him]77-captain tilney up . Moreover , [I]0-i have too good an opinion of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ’s prudence to suppose that [she]1479-such a girl would part with [one gentleman]393-one gentleman before the other was secured . It is all over with [Frederick]77-captain tilney indeed ! [he]77-captain tilney is [a deceased man]1486-a deceased man — defunct in understanding . Prepare for [[your]95-henry sister - in - law]1487-your sister - in - law , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , and [such a sister - in - law]1488-such a sister - in - law as [you]95-henry must delight in ! open , candid , artless , guileless , with affections strong but simple , forming no pretensions , and knowing no disguise . ” “[1488-such a sister - in - law] [Such a sister - in - law]1488-such a sister - in - law , [Henry]95-henry , [I]0-i should delight in , ” said [Eleanor]143-eleanor with a smile . “[95-henry] But perhaps , ” observed [Catherine]76-catherine , “[95-henry] though [she]1479-such a girl has behaved so ill by [[our]1490-our family]1491-our family , [she]1479-such a girl may behave better by [yours]95-henry . Now [she]1479-such a girl has really got [the man [she]1479-such a girl likes]1492-the man she likes , [she]1479-such a girl may be constant . ” “[1479-such a girl] Indeed [I]0-i am afraid [she]1479-such a girl will , ” replied [Henry]95-henry ; “[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [she]1479-such a girl will be very constant , unless [a baronet]1698-a baronet should come in [her]1479-such a girl way ; that is [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s only chance . [I]0-i will get the Bath paper , and look over the arrivals . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i think it is all for ambition , then ? And , upon [my]0-i word , there are some things that seem very like it . [I]0-i can not forget that , when [she]1479-such a girl first knew what [[my]0-i father]629-my father would do for [them]1495-them , [she]1479-such a girl seemed quite disappointed that it was not more . [I]0-i never was so deceived in [anyone]1080-anyone ’s character in [my]0-i life before . ” “[1479-such a girl] Among all the great variety that [you]0-i have known and studied . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i own disappointment and loss in [her]1479-such a girl is very great ; but , as for [poor James]105-james , [I]0-i suppose [he]105-james will hardly ever recover it . ” “[0-i] [[Your]0-i brother]474-your brother is certainly very much to be pitied at present ; but [we]1498-we must not , in [our]1498-we concern for [his]474-your brother sufferings , undervalue [yours]0-i . [You]0-i feel , [I]0-i suppose , that in losing [Isabella]103-isabella , [you]0-i lose half [yourself]0-i : [you]0-i feel a void in [your]0-i heart which nothing else can occupy . Society is becoming irksome ; and as for the amusements in which [you]0-i were wo nt to share at [Bath]6-bath , the very idea of [them]1499-them without [her]103-isabella is abhorrent . [You]0-i would not , for instance , now go to a ball for [the world]215-the world . [You]0-i feel that [you]0-i have no longer [any friend to whom [you]0-i can speak with unreserve , on whose regard [you]0-i can place dependence , or whose counsel , in any difficulty , [you]0-i could rely on]1501-any friend to whom you can speak with unreserve , on whose regard you can place dependence , or whose counsel , in any difficulty , you could rely on . [You]0-i feel all this ? ” “[0-i] No , ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , after a few moments ’ reflection , “[0-i] [I]0-i do not — ought [I]0-i ? To say the truth , though [I]0-i am hurt and grieved , that [I]0-i can not still love [her]103-isabella , that [I]0-i am never to hear from [her]103-isabella , perhaps never to see [her]103-isabella again , [I]0-i do not feel so very , very much afflicted as [one]305-one would have thought . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i feel , as [you]0-i always do , what is most to the credit of human nature . Such feelings ought to be investigated , that [they]1503-they may know [themselves]1503-they . ” [Catherine]76-catherine , by some chance or other , found [her]3082-her spirits so very much relieved by this conversation that [she]3082-her could not regret [her]3082-her being led on , though so unaccountably , to mention the circumstance which had produced it . CHAPTER 26 From this time , the subject was frequently canvassed by [the three young people]3083-the three young people ; and [Catherine]76-catherine found , with some surprise , that [[her]3082-her two young friends]3084-her two young friends were perfectly agreed in considering [Isabella]103-isabella ’s want of consequence and fortune as likely to throw great difficulties in the way of [her]103-isabella marrying [[their]3084-her two young friends brother]3085-their brother . [Their]3084-her two young friends persuasion that [the General]2216-the general would , upon this ground alone , independent of the objection that might be raised against [her]3082-her character , oppose the connection , turned [her]3082-her feelings moreover with some alarm towards [herself]3082-her . [She]103-isabella was as insignificant , and perhaps as portionless , as [Isabella]103-isabella ; and if [the heir of the Tilney property]3087-the heir of the tilney property had not grandeur and wealth enough in [himself]3087-the heir of the tilney property , at what point of interest were the demands of [[his]3087-the heir of the tilney property younger brother]3088-his younger brother to rest ? The very painful reflections to which this thought led could only be dispersed by a dependence on the effect of that particular partiality , which , as [she]103-isabella was given to understand by [his]3085-their brother words as well as [his]3085-their brother actions , [she]103-isabella had from the first been so fortunate as to excite in [the General]2216-the general ; and by a recollection of some most generous and disinterested sentiments on the subject of money , which [she]103-isabella had more than once heard [him]3085-their brother utter , and which tempted [her]103-isabella to think [his]3085-their brother disposition in such matters misunderstood by [[his]3085-their brother children]2485-his children . [They]3091-they were so fully convinced , however , that [[their]3091-they brother]3085-their brother would not have the courage to apply in person for [[his]3085-their brother father]2286-his father ’s consent , and so repeatedly assured [her]103-isabella that [he]3085-their brother had never in [his]3085-their brother life been less likely to come to [Northanger]62-northanger than at the present time , that [she]103-isabella suffered [her]103-isabella mind to be at ease as to the necessity of any sudden removal of [her]103-isabella own . But as it was not to be supposed that [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , whenever [he]77-captain tilney made [his]77-captain tilney application , would give [[his]77-captain tilney father]2286-his father any just idea of [Isabella]103-isabella ’s conduct , it occurred to [her]103-isabella as highly expedient that [Henry]95-henry should lay the whole business before [him]77-captain tilney as it really was , enabling [the General]2216-the general by that means to form a cool and impartial opinion , and prepare [his]77-captain tilney objections on a fairer ground than inequality of situations . [She]103-isabella proposed it to [him]77-captain tilney accordingly ; but [he]77-captain tilney did not catch at the measure so eagerly as [she]103-isabella had expected . “[1503-they] No , ” said [he]77-captain tilney , “[1503-they] [[my]0-i father]629-my father ’s hands need not be strengthened , and [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s confession of folly need not be forestalled . [He]77-captain tilney must tell [his]77-captain tilney own story . ” “[77-captain tilney] But [he]77-captain tilney will tell only half of it . ” “[77-captain tilney] A quarter would be enough . ” A day or two passed away and brought no tidings of [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney . [[His]77-captain tilney brother]2494-his brother and [sister]2160-sister knew not what to think .
