Sometimes it appeared to [them]3098-them as if [his]77-captain tilney silence would be the natural result of the suspected engagement , and at others that it was wholly incompatible with it . [The General]2216-the general , meanwhile , though offended every morning by [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s remissness in writing , was free from any real anxiety about [him]77-captain tilney , and had no more pressing solicitude than that of making [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ’s time at [Northanger]62-northanger pass pleasantly . [He]77-captain tilney often expressed [his]77-captain tilney uneasiness on this head , feared the sameness of [every day ’s society]3100-every day ’s society and employments would disgust [her]86-miss morland with [the place]284-the place , wished [the Lady Frasers]178-the lady frasers had been in [the country]246-the country , talked every now and then of having a large party to dinner , and once or twice began even to calculate the number of [young dancing people]3103-young dancing people in [the neighbourhood]1697-the neighbourhood . But then it was such a dead time of year , no wild - fowl , no game , and [the Lady Frasers]178-the lady frasers were not in [the country]246-the country . And it all ended , at last , in [his]77-captain tilney telling [Henry]95-henry one morning that when [he]77-captain tilney next went to [Woodston]64-woodston , [they]3106-they would take [him]77-captain tilney by surprise there some day or other , and eat [their]3106-they mutton with [him]77-captain tilney . [Henry]95-henry was greatly honoured and very happy , and [Catherine]76-catherine was quite delighted with the scheme . “[77-captain tilney] And when do [you]1505-you think , [sir]285-sir , [I]0-i may look forward to this pleasure ? [I]0-i must be at [Woodston]64-woodston on Monday to attend the parish meeting , and shall probably be obliged to stay two or three days . ” “[1505-you] Well , well , [we]1507-we will take [our]1507-we chance some one of those days . There is no need to fix . [You]1508-you are not to put [yourself]1508-you at all out of [your]1508-you way . Whatever [you]1508-you may happen to have in [the house]238-the house will be enough . [I]0-i think [I]0-i can answer for [the young ladies]2005-the young ladies making allowance for [a bachelor]1511-a bachelor ’s table . Let [me]0-i see ; Monday will be a busy day with [you]1508-you , [we]1507-we will not come on Monday ; and Tuesday will be a busy one with [me]0-i . [I]0-i expect [[my]0-i surveyor]1512-my surveyor from [Brockham]179-brockham with [his]1512-my surveyor report in the morning ; and afterwards [I]0-i can not in decency fail attending [the club]1513-the club . [I]0-i really could not face [my]0-i acquaintance if [I]0-i stayed away now ; for , as [I]0-i am known to be in [the country]246-the country , it would be taken exceedingly amiss ; and it is a rule with [me]0-i , [Miss Morland]86-miss morland , never to give offence to [any of [[my]0-i neighbours]1516-my neighbours]1515-any of my neighbours , if a small sacrifice of time and attention can prevent it . [They]1517-they are [a set of very worthy men]1518-a set of very worthy men . [They]1517-they have half a buck from [Northanger]62-northanger twice a year ; and [I]0-i dine with [them]1517-they whenever [I]0-i can . Tuesday , therefore , [we]1519-we may say is out of the question . But on Wednesday , [I]0-i think , [Henry]95-henry , [you]95-henry may expect [us]1519-we ; and [we]1519-we shall be with [you]95-henry early , that [we]1519-we may have time to look about [us]1519-we . Two hours and three quarters will carry [us]1519-we to [Woodston]64-woodston , [I]0-i suppose ; [we]1519-we shall be in [the carriage]2004-the carriage by ten ; so , about a quarter before one on Wednesday , [you]95-henry may look for [us]1519-we . ” A ball itself could not have been more welcome to [Catherine]76-catherine than this little excursion , so strong was [her]1726-young ladies desire to be acquainted with [Woodston]64-woodston ; and [her]1726-young ladies heart was still bounding with joy when [Henry]95-henry , about an hour afterwards , came booted and greatcoated into [the room where [she]1726-young ladies and [Eleanor]143-eleanor were sitting]3107-the room where she and eleanor were sitting , and said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am come , [young ladies]1726-young ladies , in a very moralizing strain , to observe that [our]1519-we pleasures in [this world]832-this world are always to be paid for , and that [we]1519-we often purchase them at a great disadvantage , giving ready - monied actual happiness for a draft on the future , that may not be honoured . Witness [myself]0-i , at this present hour . Because [I]0-i am to hope for the satisfaction of seeing [you]95-henry at [Woodston]64-woodston on Wednesday , which bad weather , or twenty other causes , may prevent , [I]0-i must go away directly , two days before [I]0-i intended it . ” “[0-i] Go away ! ” said [Catherine]76-catherine , with a very long face . “[0-i] And why ? ” “[0-i] Why ! how can [you]95-henry ask the question ? Because no time is to be lost in frightening [[my]0-i old housekeeper]1523-my old housekeeper out of [her]1523-my old housekeeper wits , because [I]0-i must go and prepare a dinner for [you]95-henry , to be sure . ” “[0-i] Oh ! not seriously ! ” “[0-i] Aye , and sadly too — for [I]0-i had much rather stay . ” “[0-i] But how can [you]95-henry think of such a thing , after what [the General]2216-the general said ? When [he]2216-the general so particularly desired [you]95-henry not to give [yourself]95-henry any trouble , because _ anything _ would do . ” [Henry]95-henry only smiled . “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure it is quite unnecessary upon [[your]95-henry sister]325-your sister ’s account and [mine]0-i . [You]95-henry must know it to be so ; and [the General]2216-the general made such a point of [your]95-henry providing nothing extraordinary : besides , if [he]2216-the general had not said half so much as [he]2216-the general did , [he]2216-the general has always such an excellent dinner at [home]482-home , that sitting down to a middling one for one day could not signify . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could reason like [you]95-henry , for [his]2216-the general sake and [my]0-i own . Good - bye . As to - morrow is Sunday , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , [I]0-i shall not return . ” [He]0-i went ; and , it being at any time a much simpler operation to [Catherine]76-catherine to doubt [her]325-your sister own judgment than [Henry]95-henry ’s , [she]325-your sister was very soon obliged to give [him]0-i credit for being right , however disagreeable to [her]325-your sister [his]0-i going . But the inexplicability of [the General]2216-the general ’s conduct dwelt much on [her]325-your sister thoughts . That [he]0-i was very particular in [his]0-i eating , [she]325-your sister had , by [her]325-your sister own unassisted observation , already discovered ; but why [he]0-i should say one thing so positively , and mean another all the while , was most unaccountable ! how were [people]1782-people , at that rate , to be understood ? Who but [Henry]95-henry could have been aware of what [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father was at ? From Saturday to Wednesday , however , [they]1782-people were now to be without [Henry]95-henry . This was the sad finale of every reflection : and [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ’s letter would certainly come in [his]0-i absence ; and Wednesday [she]325-your sister was very sure would be wet . The past , present , and future were all equally in gloom . [[Her]325-your sister brother]355-her brother so unhappy , and [her]325-your sister loss in [Isabella]103-isabella so great ; and [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s spirits always affected by [Henry]95-henry ’s absence ! what was there to interest or amuse [her]325-your sister ? [She]325-your sister was tired of [the woods]3112-the woods and [the shrubberies]1331-the shrubberies — always so smooth and so dry ; and [the abbey]1248-the abbey in [itself]1248-the abbey was no more to [her]325-your sister now than [any other house]3115-any other house . The painful remembrance of the folly it had helped to nourish and perfect was the only emotion which could spring from a consideration of [the building]2650-the building . What a revolution in [her]325-your sister ideas ! [she]325-your sister , who had so longed to be in [an abbey]2540-an abbey ! now , there was nothing so charming to [her]325-your sister imagination as the unpretending comfort of [a well - connected parsonage]3118-a well - connected parsonage , something like [Fullerton]4-fullerton , but better : [Fullerton]4-fullerton had its faults , but [Woodston]64-woodston probably had none . If [Wednesday]181-wednesday should ever come ! It did come , and exactly when it might be reasonably looked for . It came — it was fine — and [Catherine]76-catherine trod on air . By ten o’clock , the chaise and four conveyed [the trio]3119-the trio from [the abbey]1248-the abbey ; and , after an agreeable drive of almost twenty miles , [they]3119-the trio entered [Woodston]64-woodston , [a large and populous village]3121-a large and populous village , in a situation not unpleasant . [Catherine]76-catherine was ashamed to say how pretty [she]325-your sister thought it , as [the General]2216-the general seemed to think an apology necessary for the flatness of [the country]246-the country , and the size of [the village]1713-the village ; but in [her]325-your sister heart [she]325-your sister preferred it to [any place [she]325-your sister had ever been at]3125-any place she had ever been at , and looked with great admiration at [every neat house above the rank of [a cottage]3127-a cottage]3126-every neat house above the rank of a cottage , and at [all [the little chandler]3129-the little chandler ’s shops which [they]3119-the trio passed]3128-all the little chandler ’s shops which they passed . At [the further end of [the village]1713-the village]3130-the further end of the village , and tolerably disengaged from [the rest of [it]1713-the village]3132-the rest of it , stood [the parsonage]3133-the parsonage , [a new - built substantial stone house , with [its]3133-the parsonage semicircular sweep and green gates]3134-a new - built substantial stone house , with its semicircular sweep and green gates ; and , as [they]3119-the trio drove up to the door , [Henry]95-henry , with [the friends of [his]95-henry solitude]3135-the friends of his solitude , [a large Newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers]3136-a large newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers , was ready to receive and make much of them . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s mind was too full , as [she]325-your sister entered [the house]238-the house , for [her]325-your sister either to observe or to say a great deal ; and , till called on by [the General]2216-the general for [her]325-your sister opinion of [it]238-the house , [she]325-your sister had very little idea of [the room in which [she]325-your sister was sitting]3139-the room in which she was sitting . Upon looking round [it]3139-the room in which she was sitting then , [she]325-your sister perceived in a moment that [it]3139-the room in which she was sitting was [the most comfortable room in [the world]215-the world]3140-the most comfortable room in the world ; but [she]325-your sister was too guarded to say so , and the coldness of [her]325-your sister praise disappointed [him]3142-his . “[143-eleanor] [We]1528-we are not calling it [a good house]1529-a good house , ” said [he]3142-his . “[1528-we] [We]1528-we are not comparing it with [Fullerton]4-fullerton and [Northanger]62-northanger — [we]1528-we are considering [it]1530-it as [a mere parsonage]1531-a mere parsonage , small and confined , [we]1528-we allow , but decent , perhaps , and habitable ; and altogether not inferior to the generality ; or , in other words , [I]0-i believe there are few [country parsonages]1532-country parsonages in [England]3-england half so good . It may admit of improvement , however . Far be it from [me]0-i to say otherwise ; and anything in reason — a bow thrown out , perhaps — though , between [ourselves]1528-we , if there is one thing more than another [my]0-i aversion , it is a patched - on bow . ” [Catherine]76-catherine did not hear enough of this speech to understand or be pained by it ; and other subjects being studiously brought forward and supported by [Henry]95-henry , at the same time that a tray full of refreshments was introduced by [[his]3142-his servant]3143-his servant , [the General]2216-the general was shortly restored to [his]3142-his complacency , and [Catherine]76-catherine to all [her]3145-she usual ease of spirits . [The room in question]3146-the room in question was of a commodious , well - proportioned size , and handsomely fitted up as [a dining - parlour]3147-a dining - parlour ; and on [their]1528-we quitting it to walk round [the grounds]2769-the grounds , [she]3145-she was shown , first into [a smaller apartment]3149-a smaller apartment , belonging peculiarly to [the master of [the house]238-the house]3150-the master of the house , and made unusually tidy on the occasion ; and afterwards into what was to be [the drawing - room]1895-the drawing - room , with the appearance of which , though unfurnished , [Catherine]76-catherine was delighted enough even to satisfy [the General]2216-the general . It was [a prettily shaped room]3154-a prettily shaped room , the windows reaching to the ground , and the view from [them]3155-them pleasant , though only over [green meadows]3156-green meadows ; and [she]3145-she expressed [her]3145-she admiration at the moment with all the honest simplicity with which [she]3145-she felt it . “[1533-she] Oh ! why do not [you]1533-she fit up [this room]303-this room , [Mr. Tilney]95-henry ? What a pity not to have [it]303-this room fitted up ! it is [the prettiest room [I]0-i ever saw]1535-the prettiest room i ever saw ; it is [the prettiest room in [the world]215-the world]1536-the prettiest room in the world ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i trust , ” said [the General]2216-the general , with a most satisfied smile , “[0-i] that [it]303-this room will very speedily be furnished : [it]303-this room waits only for [a lady]2073-a lady ’s taste ! ” “[1533-she] Well , if [it]303-this room was [[my]0-i house]1539-my house , [I]0-i should never sit anywhere else . Oh ! what [a sweet little cottage]1540-a sweet little cottage there is among the trees — apple trees , too ! [it]1540-a sweet little cottage is [the prettiest cottage]1541-the prettiest cottage ! ” “[1533-she] [You]1533-she like [it]1540-a sweet little cottage — [you]1533-she approve it as an object — it is enough . [Henry]95-henry , remember that [Robinson]182-robinson is spoken to about [it]1540-a sweet little cottage . [The cottage]1542-the cottage remains . ” Such a compliment recalled all [Catherine]76-catherine ’s consciousness , and silenced [her]1533-she directly ; and , though pointedly applied to by [the General]2216-the general for [her]1533-she choice of the prevailing colour of the paper and hangings , nothing like an opinion on the subject could be drawn from [her]1533-she . The influence of fresh objects and fresh air , however , was of great use in dissipating these embarrassing associations ; and , having reached the ornamental part of [the premises]1218-the premises , consisting of a walk round two sides of [a meadow]3160-a meadow , on which [Henry]95-henry ’s genius had begun to act about half a year ago , [she]1533-she was sufficiently recovered to think it prettier than [any pleasure - ground [she]1533-she had ever been in before]3161-any pleasure - ground she had ever been in before , though there was not a shrub in [it]1540-a sweet little cottage higher than the green bench in the corner . A saunter into [other meadows]3162-other meadows , and through [part of [the village]1713-the village]3163-part of the village , with a visit to [the stables]1399-the stables to examine some improvements , and a charming game of play with a litter of puppies just able to roll about , brought [them]3166-them to four o’clock , when [Catherine]76-catherine scarcely thought it could be three . At four [they]3166-them were to dine , and at six to set off on [their]3166-them return . Never had any day passed so quickly ! [She]1533-she could not but observe that the abundance of the dinner did not seem to create the smallest astonishment in [the General]2216-the general ; nay , that [he]2216-the general was even looking at the side - table for cold meat which was not there . [[His]2216-the general son]824-his son and [daughter]2335-daughter ’s observations were of a different kind . [They]3166-them had seldom seen [him]2216-the general eat so heartily at any table but [his]2216-the general own , and never before known [him]2216-the general so little disconcerted by the melted butter ’s being oiled . At six o’clock , [the General]2216-the general having taken [his]2216-the general coffee , [the carriage]2004-the carriage again received [them]3166-them ; and so gratifying had been the tenor of [his]2216-the general conduct throughout the whole visit , so well assured was [her]1533-she mind on the subject of [his]2216-the general expectations , that , could [she]1533-she have felt equally confident of the wishes of [[his]2216-the general son]824-his son , [Catherine]76-catherine would have quitted [Woodston]64-woodston with little anxiety as to the How or the When [she]1533-she might return to [it]64-woodston . CHAPTER 27 The next morning brought the following very unexpected letter from [Isabella]103-isabella : _ [Bath]6-bath , April _ [[My]182-robinson dearest]366-my dearest [Catherine]76-catherine , [I]182-robinson received [your]76-catherine two kind letters with the greatest delight , and have a thousand apologies to make for not answering them sooner . [I]182-robinson really am quite ashamed of [my]182-robinson idleness ; but in [this horrid place]3174-this horrid place [one]305-one can find time for nothing . [I]182-robinson have had [my]182-robinson pen in [my]182-robinson hand to begin a letter to [you]76-catherine almost every day since [you]76-catherine left [Bath]6-bath , but have always been prevented by [some silly trifler or other]3176-some silly trifler or other . Pray write to [me]182-robinson soon , and direct to [[my]182-robinson own home]701-my own home . Thank [God]128-god , [we]3178-we leave [this vile place]3179-this vile place to - morrow . Since [you]76-catherine went away , [I]182-robinson have had no pleasure in it — the dust is beyond anything ; and [everybody one]3180-everybody one cares for is gone . [I]182-robinson believe if [I]182-robinson could see [you]76-catherine [I]182-robinson should not mind the rest , for [you]76-catherine are dearer to [me]182-robinson than [anybody]216-anybody can conceive . [I]182-robinson am quite uneasy about [[your]76-catherine dear brother]1004-your dear brother , not having heard from [him]1004-your dear brother since [he]1004-your dear brother went to [Oxford]11-oxford ; and am fearful of some misunderstanding . [Your]76-catherine kind offices will set all right : [he]1004-your dear brother is [the only man [I]182-robinson ever did or could love]3183-the only man i ever did or could love , and [I]182-robinson trust [you]76-catherine will convince [him]1004-your dear brother of it . The spring fashions are partly down ; and the hats the most frightful [you]76-catherine can imagine . [I]182-robinson hope [you]76-catherine spend [your]76-catherine time pleasantly , but am afraid [you]76-catherine never think of [me]182-robinson . [I]182-robinson will not say all that [I]182-robinson could of [the family [you]76-catherine are with]3184-the family you are with , because [I]182-robinson would not be ungenerous , or set [you]76-catherine against those [you]76-catherine esteem ; but it is very difficult to know whom to trust , and [young men]1976-young men never know [their]1976-young men minds two days together . [I]182-robinson rejoice to say that [the young man whom , of all others]3186-the young man whom , of all others , [I]182-robinson particularly abhor , has left [Bath]6-bath . [You]76-catherine will know , from this description , [I]182-robinson must mean [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , who , as [you]76-catherine may remember , was amazingly disposed to follow and tease [me]182-robinson , before [you]76-catherine went away . Afterwards [he]77-captain tilney got worse , and became quite [my]182-robinson shadow . [Many girls]3187-many girls might have been taken in , for never were such attentions ; but [I]182-robinson knew the fickle sex too well . [He]77-captain tilney went away to [[his]77-captain tilney regiment]1234-his regiment two days ago , and [I]182-robinson trust [I]182-robinson shall never be plagued with [him]77-captain tilney again . [He]77-captain tilney is [the greatest coxcomb [I]182-robinson ever saw]3189-the greatest coxcomb i ever saw , and amazingly disagreeable . The last two days [he]77-captain tilney was always by the side of [Charlotte Davis]183-charlotte davis : [I]182-robinson pitied [his]77-captain tilney taste , but took no notice of [him]77-captain tilney . The last time [we]3190-we met was in [Bath Street]71-bath street , and [I]182-robinson turned directly into [a shop]3191-a shop that [he]77-captain tilney might not speak to [me]182-robinson ; [I]182-robinson would not even look at [him]77-captain tilney . [He]77-captain tilney went into [the pump - room]1820-the pump - room afterwards ; but [I]182-robinson would not have followed [him]77-captain tilney for all [the world]215-the world . Such a contrast between [him]77-captain tilney and [[your]3194-your brother]474-your brother ! pray send [me]182-robinson some news of [the latter]214-the latter — [I]182-robinson am quite unhappy about [him]77-captain tilney ; [he]77-captain tilney seemed so uncomfortable when [he]77-captain tilney went away , with a cold , or something that affected [his]77-captain tilney spirits . [I]182-robinson would write to [him]77-captain tilney [myself]182-robinson , but have mislaid [his]77-captain tilney direction ; and , as [I]182-robinson hinted above , am afraid [he]77-captain tilney took something in [my]182-robinson conduct amiss . Pray explain everything to [his]77-captain tilney satisfaction ; or , if [he]77-captain tilney still harbours any doubt , a line from [himself]77-captain tilney to [me]182-robinson , or a call at [Putney]60-putney when next in [town]427-town , might set all to rights . [I]182-robinson have not been to the Rooms this age , nor to the play , except going in last night with [the Hodges]3198-the hodges , for a frolic , at half price : [they]3198-the hodges teased [me]182-robinson into it ; and [I]182-robinson was determined [they]3198-the hodges should not say [I]182-robinson shut [myself]182-robinson up because [Tilney]77-captain tilney was gone . [We]3199-we happened to sit by [the Mitchells]142-the mitchells , and [they]142-the mitchells pretended to be quite surprised to see [me]182-robinson out . [I]182-robinson knew [their]142-the mitchells spite : at one time [they]142-the mitchells could not be civil to [me]182-robinson , but now [they]142-the mitchells are all friendship ; but [I]182-robinson am not such [a fool]793-a fool as to be taken in by [them]142-the mitchells . [You]3201-you know [I]182-robinson have a pretty good spirit of [my]182-robinson own . [Anne Mitchell]184-anne mitchell had tried to put on a turban like [mine]182-robinson , as [I]182-robinson wore it the week before at the Concert , but made wretched work of it — it happened to become [my]182-robinson odd face , [I]182-robinson believe , at least [Tilney]77-captain tilney told [me]182-robinson so at the time , and said every eye was upon [me]182-robinson ; but [he]77-captain tilney is the last man whose word [I]182-robinson would take . [I]182-robinson wear nothing but purple now : [I]182-robinson know [I]182-robinson look hideous in it , but no matter — it is [[your]3201-you dear brother]1004-your dear brother ’s favourite colour . Lose no time , [[my]182-robinson dearest]366-my dearest , sweetest [Catherine]76-catherine , in writing to [him]77-captain tilney and to [me]182-robinson , Who ever am , etc . Such a strain of shallow artifice could not impose even upon [Catherine]76-catherine . Its inconsistencies , contradictions , and falsehood struck [her]1543-her from the very first . [She]1543-her was ashamed of [Isabella]103-isabella , and ashamed of having ever loved [her]103-isabella . [Her]1543-her professions of attachment were now as disgusting as [her]1543-her excuses were empty , and [her]1543-her demands impudent . “[182-robinson] Write to [James]105-james on [her]1543-her behalf ! no , [James]105-james should never hear [Isabella]103-isabella ’s name mentioned by [her]1543-her again . ” On [Henry]95-henry ’s arrival from [Woodston]64-woodston , [she]1543-her made known to [him]95-henry and [Eleanor]143-eleanor [[their]1544-their brother]3085-their brother ’s safety , congratulating [them]1544-their with sincerity on it , and reading aloud the most material passages of [her]1543-her letter with strong indignation . When [she]103-isabella had finished it—“So[103-isabella] much for [Isabella]103-isabella , ” [she]1543-her cried , “[103-isabella] and for all [our]1544-their intimacy ! [she]103-isabella must think [me]0-i [an idiot]1545-an idiot , or [she]103-isabella could not have written so ; but perhaps this has served to make [her]103-isabella character better known to [me]0-i than [mine]0-i is to [her]103-isabella . [I]0-i see what [she]103-isabella has been about . [She]103-isabella is [a vain coquette]1546-a vain coquette , and [her]103-isabella tricks have not answered . [I]0-i do not believe [she]103-isabella had ever any regard either for [James]105-james or for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had never known [her]103-isabella . ” “[103-isabella] It will soon be as if [you]0-i never had , ” said [Henry]95-henry . “[0-i] There is but one thing that [I]0-i can not understand . [I]0-i see that [she]103-isabella has had designs on [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , which have not succeeded ; but [I]0-i do not understand what [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney has been about all this time . Why should [he]77-captain tilney pay [her]103-isabella such attentions as to make [her]103-isabella quarrel with [[my]0-i brother]419-my brother , and then fly off [himself]77-captain tilney ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have very little to say for [Frederick]77-captain tilney ’s motives , such as [I]0-i believe them to have been . [He]77-captain tilney has [his]77-captain tilney vanities as well as [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe , and the chief difference is , that , having a stronger head , [they]1548-they have not yet injured [himself]77-captain tilney . If the _ effect _ of [his]77-captain tilney behaviour does not justify [him]77-captain tilney with [you]0-i , [we]1549-we had better not seek after the cause . ” “[0-i] Then [you]0-i do not suppose [he]77-captain tilney ever really cared about [her]103-isabella ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am persuaded that [he]77-captain tilney never did . ” “[77-captain tilney] And only made believe to do so for mischief ’s sake ? ” [Henry]95-henry bowed [his]95-henry assent . “[77-captain tilney] Well , then , [I]0-i must say that [I]0-i do not like [him]77-captain tilney at all . Though it has turned out so well for [us]1549-we , [I]0-i do not like [him]77-captain tilney at all . As it happens , there is no great harm done , because [I]0-i do not think [Isabella]103-isabella has any heart to lose . But , suppose [he]77-captain tilney had made [her]103-isabella very much in love with [him]77-captain tilney ? ” “[77-captain tilney] But [we]1549-we must first suppose [Isabella]103-isabella to have had a heart to lose — consequently to have been [a very different creature]1550-a very different creature ; and , in that case , [she]103-isabella would have met with very different treatment . ” “[0-i] It is very right that [you]0-i should stand by [[your]0-i brother]474-your brother . ” “[0-i] And if [you]0-i would stand by _ [yours]0-i _ , [you]0-i would not be much distressed by the disappointment of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe . But [your]0-i mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity , and therefore not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality , or a desire of revenge . ” [Catherine]76-catherine was complimented out of further bitterness . [Frederick]77-captain tilney could not be unpardonably guilty , while [Henry]95-henry made [himself]95-henry so agreeable . [She]103-isabella resolved on not answering [Isabella]103-isabella ’s letter , and tried to think no more of it . CHAPTER 28 Soon after this , [the General]2216-the general found [himself]2216-the general obliged to go to [London]12-london for a week ; and [he]2216-the general left [Northanger]62-northanger earnestly regretting that any necessity should rob [him]2216-the general even for an hour of [Miss Morland]86-miss morland ’s company , and anxiously recommending the study of [her]86-miss morland comfort and amusement to [[his]2216-the general children]2485-his children as [their]2485-his children chief object in [his]2216-the general absence . [His]2216-the general departure gave [Catherine]76-catherine the first experimental conviction that a loss may be sometimes a gain . The happiness with which [their]3207-their time now passed , every employment voluntary , every laugh indulged , every meal a scene of ease and good humour , walking where [they]3207-their liked and when [they]3207-their liked , [their]3207-their hours , pleasures , and fatigues at [their]3207-their own command , made [her]86-miss morland thoroughly sensible of the restraint which [the General]2216-the general ’s presence had imposed , and most thankfully feel [their]3207-their present release from it . Such ease and such delights made [her]86-miss morland love [the place]284-the place and [the people]3210-the people more and more every day ; and had it not been for a dread of its soon becoming expedient to leave [the one]3211-the one , and an apprehension of not being equally beloved by the other , [she]86-miss morland would at each moment of each day have been perfectly happy ; but [she]86-miss morland was now in the fourth week of [her]86-miss morland visit ; before [the General]2216-the general came [home]482-home , the fourth week would be turned , and perhaps it might seem an intrusion if [she]86-miss morland stayed much longer . This was a painful consideration whenever it occurred ; and eager to get rid of such a weight on [her]86-miss morland mind , [she]86-miss morland very soon resolved to speak to [Eleanor]143-eleanor about it at once , propose going away , and be guided in [her]86-miss morland conduct by the manner in which [her]86-miss morland proposal might be taken . Aware that if [she]86-miss morland gave [herself]86-miss morland much time , [she]86-miss morland might feel it difficult to bring forward so unpleasant a subject , [she]86-miss morland took the first opportunity of being suddenly alone with [Eleanor]143-eleanor , and of [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s being in the middle of a speech about something very different , to start forth [her]86-miss morland obligation of going away very soon . [Eleanor]143-eleanor looked and declared [herself]143-eleanor much concerned . [She]1552-her had “[0-i] hoped for the pleasure of [her]1552-her company for a much longer time — had been misled ( perhaps by [her]1552-her wishes ) to suppose that a much longer visit had been promised — and could not but think that if [Mr.]1553-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland were aware of the pleasure it was to [her]1552-her to have [her]1552-her [there]1848-there , [they]1555-them would be too generous to hasten [her]1552-her return . ” [Catherine]76-catherine explained : “[1555-them] Oh ! as to _ that _ , [Papa]137-papa and [Mamma]138-mamma were in no hurry at all . As long as [she]1552-her was happy , [they]1555-them would always be satisfied . ” “[1555-them] Then why , might [she]1552-her ask , in such a hurry [herself]1552-her to leave [them]1555-them ? ” “[1552-her] Oh ! because [she]1552-her had been [there]1848-there so long . ” “[1552-her] Nay , if [you]1557-you can use such a word , [I]0-i can urge [you]1557-you no farther . If [you]1557-you think it long — ” “[1557-you] Oh ! no , [I]0-i do not indeed . For [my]0-i own pleasure , [I]0-i could stay with [you]1557-you as long again . ” And it was directly settled that , till [she]1552-her had , [her]1552-her leaving [them]1555-them was not even to be thought of . In having this cause of uneasiness so pleasantly removed , the force of the other was likewise weakened . The kindness , the earnestness of [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s manner in pressing [her]1552-her to stay , and [Henry]95-henry ’s gratified look on being told that [her]1552-her stay was determined , were such sweet proofs of [her]1552-her importance with [them]1555-them , as left [her]1552-her only just so much solicitude as [the human mind]3214-the human mind can never do comfortably without . [She]1552-her did — almost always — believe that [Henry]95-henry loved [her]1552-her , and quite always that [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father and [sister]2160-sister loved and even wished [her]1552-her to belong to [them]1555-them ; and believing so far , [her]1552-her doubts and anxieties were merely sportive irritations . [Henry]95-henry was not able to obey [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father ’s injunction of remaining wholly at [Northanger]62-northanger in attendance on [the ladies]1776-the ladies , during [his]95-henry absence in [London]12-london , the engagements of [[his]95-henry curate]3219-his curate at [Woodston]64-woodston obliging [him]95-henry to leave [them]1555-them on Saturday for a couple of nights . [His]95-henry loss was not now what it had been while [the General]2216-the general was at [home]482-home ; it lessened [their]1555-them gaiety , but did not ruin [their]1555-them comfort ; and [the two girls]3222-the two girls agreeing in occupation , and improving in intimacy , found [themselves]3222-the two girls so well sufficient for the time to [themselves]3222-the two girls , that it was eleven o’clock , rather a late hour at [the abbey]1248-the abbey , before [they]3222-the two girls quitted [the supper - room]3224-the supper - room on the day of [Henry]95-henry ’s departure . [They]3222-the two girls had just reached the head of the stairs when it seemed , as far as the thickness of the walls would allow [them]3222-the two girls to judge , that [a carriage]2110-a carriage was driving up to the door , and the next moment confirmed the idea by the loud noise of the house - bell . After the first perturbation of surprise had passed away , in a “[0-i] Good heaven ! what can be the matter ? ” it was quickly decided by [Eleanor]143-eleanor to be [[her]3226-her eldest brother]1876-her eldest brother , whose arrival was often as sudden , if not quite so unseasonable , and accordingly [she]3226-her hurried down to welcome [him]1876-her eldest brother . [Catherine]76-catherine walked on to [[her]3226-her chamber]3228-her chamber , making up [her]3226-her mind as well as [she]3226-her could , to a further acquaintance with [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney , and comforting [herself]3226-her under the unpleasant impression [his]1876-her eldest brother conduct had given [her]3226-her , and the persuasion of [his]1876-her eldest brother being by far too fine [a gentleman]1839-a gentleman to approve of [her]3226-her , that at least [they]3222-the two girls should not meet under such circumstances as would make [their]3222-the two girls meeting materially painful . [She]3226-her trusted [he]1876-her eldest brother would never speak of [Miss Thorpe]97-miss thorpe ; and indeed , as [he]1876-her eldest brother must by this time be ashamed of the part [he]1876-her eldest brother had acted , there could be no danger of it ; and as long as all mention of Bath scenes were avoided , [she]3226-her thought [she]3226-her could behave to [him]1876-her eldest brother very civilly . In such considerations time passed away , and it was certainly in [his]1876-her eldest brother favour that [Eleanor]143-eleanor should be so glad to see [him]1876-her eldest brother , and have so much to say , for half an hour was almost gone since [his]1876-her eldest brother arrival , and [Eleanor]143-eleanor did not come up . At that moment [Catherine]76-catherine thought [she]3226-her heard [her]3226-her step in [the gallery]2736-the gallery , and listened for its continuance ; but all was silent . Scarcely , however , had [she]3226-her convicted [her]3226-her fancy of error , when the noise of something moving close to [her]3226-her door made [her]3226-her start ; it seemed as if [someone]3026-someone was touching the very doorway — and in another moment a slight motion of the lock proved that some hand must be on it . [She]3226-her trembled a little at the idea of [anyone]1080-anyone ’s approaching so cautiously ; but resolving not to be again overcome by trivial appearances of alarm , or misled by a raised imagination , [she]3226-her stepped quietly forward , and opened the door . [Eleanor]143-eleanor , and only [Eleanor]143-eleanor , stood there . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s spirits , however , were tranquillized but for an instant , for [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s cheeks were pale , and [her]3226-her manner greatly agitated . Though evidently intending to come in , it seemed an effort to enter [the room]1765-the room , and a still greater to speak when there . [Catherine]76-catherine , supposing some uneasiness on [Captain Tilney]77-captain tilney ’s account , could only express [her]3226-her concern by silent attention , obliged [her]3226-her to be seated , rubbed [her]3226-her temples with lavender water , and hung over [her]3226-her with affectionate solicitude . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine must not — [you]76-catherine must not indeed — ” were [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s first connected words . “[76-catherine] [I]0-i am quite well . This kindness distracts [me]0-i — [I]0-i can not bear it — [I]0-i come to [you]76-catherine on such an errand ! ” “[0-i] Errand ! to [me]0-i ! ” “[0-i] How shall [I]0-i tell [you]76-catherine ! oh ! how shall [I]0-i tell [you]76-catherine ! ” A new idea now darted into [Catherine]76-catherine ’s mind , and turning as pale as [[her]3234-her friend]1769-her friend , [she]3234-her exclaimed , “[0-i] ’ Tis [a messenger from [Woodston]64-woodston]1559-a messenger from woodston ! ” “[76-catherine] [You]76-catherine are mistaken , indeed , ” returned [Eleanor]143-eleanor , looking at [her]3234-her most compassionately ; “[76-catherine] it is [[no one]1822-no one from [Woodston]64-woodston]1561-no one from woodston . It is [[my]0-i father]629-my father [himself]629-my father . ” [Her]3234-her voice faltered , and [her]3234-her eyes were turned to the ground as [she]3234-her mentioned [his]629-my father name . [His]629-my father unlooked - for return was enough in itself to make [Catherine]76-catherine ’s heart sink , and for a few moments [she]3234-her hardly supposed there were anything worse to be told . [She]3234-her said nothing ; and [Eleanor]143-eleanor , endeavouring to collect [herself]143-eleanor and speak with firmness , but with eyes still cast down , soon went on . “[629-my father] [You]76-catherine are too good , [I]0-i am sure , to think the worse of [me]0-i for the part [I]0-i am obliged to perform . [I]0-i am indeed [a most unwilling messenger]1563-a most unwilling messenger . After what has so lately passed , so lately been settled between [us]1564-we — how joyfully , how thankfully on [my]0-i side!—as to [your]76-catherine continuing here as [I]0-i hoped for many , many weeks longer , how can [I]0-i tell [you]76-catherine that [your]76-catherine kindness is not to be accepted — and that the happiness [your]76-catherine company has hitherto given [us]1564-we is to be repaid by — But [I]0-i must not trust [myself]0-i with words . [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , [we]1564-we are to part . [[My]0-i father]629-my father has recollected an engagement that takes [[our]1564-we whole family]1567-our whole family away on Monday . [We]1564-we are going to [[Lord Longtown]185-lord longtown ’s]1568-lord longtown ’s , near [Hereford]72-hereford , for a fortnight . Explanation and apology are equally impossible . [I]0-i can not attempt either . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear [Eleanor]143-eleanor , ” cried [Catherine]76-catherine , suppressing [her]253-my dear feelings as well as [she]253-my dear could , “[0-i] do not be so distressed . A second engagement must give way to a first . [I]0-i am very , very sorry [we]1564-we are to part — so soon , and so suddenly too ; but [I]0-i am not offended , indeed [I]0-i am not . [I]0-i can finish [my]0-i visit [here]1743-here , [you]143-eleanor know , at any time ; or [I]0-i hope [you]143-eleanor will come to [me]0-i . Can [you]143-eleanor , when [you]143-eleanor return from [this lord]1571-this lord ’s , come to [Fullerton]4-fullerton ? ” “[143-eleanor] It will not be in [my]0-i power , [Catherine]76-catherine . ” “[143-eleanor] Come when [you]143-eleanor can , then . ” [Eleanor]143-eleanor made no answer ; and [Catherine]76-catherine ’s thoughts recurring to something more directly interesting , [she]3236-she added , thinking aloud , “[143-eleanor] Monday — so soon as Monday ; and [you]143-eleanor _ all _ go . Well , [I]0-i am certain of — [I]0-i shall be able to take leave , however . [I]0-i need not go till just before [you]143-eleanor do , [you]143-eleanor know . Do not be distressed , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , [I]0-i can go on Monday very well . [[My]0-i father]629-my father and [mother]206-mother ’s having no notice of it is of very little consequence . [The General]2216-the general will send [a servant]2112-a servant with [me]0-i , [I]0-i dare say , half the way — and then [I]0-i shall soon be at [Salisbury]9-salisbury , and then [I]0-i am only nine miles from [home]482-home . ” “[0-i] Ah , [Catherine]76-catherine ! were it settled so , it would be somewhat less intolerable , though in such common attentions [you]76-catherine would have received but half what [you]76-catherine ought . But — how can [I]0-i tell you?—to - morrow morning is fixed for [your]76-catherine leaving [us]1577-us , and not even the hour is left to [your]76-catherine choice ; [the very carriage]1578-the very carriage is ordered , and will be here at seven o’clock , and [no servant]1579-no servant will be offered [you]76-catherine . ” [Catherine]76-catherine sat down , breathless and speechless . “[0-i] [I]0-i could hardly believe [my]0-i senses , when [I]0-i heard it ; and no displeasure , no resentment that [you]76-catherine can feel at this moment , however justly great , can be more than [I]0-i [myself]0-i — but [I]0-i must not talk of what [I]0-i felt . Oh ! that [I]0-i could suggest anything in extenuation ! [good God]1580-good god ! what will [[your]76-catherine father]821-your father and [mother]206-mother say ! after courting [you]76-catherine from the protection of [real friends]1583-real friends to this — almost double distance from [[your]76-catherine home]1584-your home , to have [you]76-catherine driven out of [the house]238-the house , without the considerations even of decent civility ! dear , [dear Catherine]76-catherine , in being the bearer of such a message , [I]0-i seem guilty [myself]0-i of all its insult ; yet , [I]0-i trust [you]76-catherine will acquit [me]0-i , for [you]76-catherine must have been long enough in [this house]1586-this house to see that [I]0-i am but [a nominal mistress of it]1587-a nominal mistress of it , that [my]0-i real power is nothing . ” “[76-catherine] Have [I]0-i offended [the General]2216-the general ? ” said [Catherine]76-catherine in a faltering voice . “[76-catherine] Alas ! for [my]0-i feelings as [a daughter]3003-a daughter , all that [I]0-i know , all that [I]0-i answer for , is that [you]76-catherine can have given [him]2216-the general no just cause of offence . [He]2216-the general certainly is greatly , very greatly discomposed ; [I]0-i have seldom seen [him]2216-the general more so . [His]2216-the general temper is not happy , and something has now occurred to ruffle it in an uncommon degree ; some disappointment , some vexation , which just at this moment seems important , but which [I]0-i can hardly suppose [you]76-catherine to have any concern in , for how is it possible ? ” It was with pain that [Catherine]76-catherine could speak at all ; and it was only for [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s sake that [she]3237-she attempted it . “[0-i] [I]0-i am sure , ” said [she]3237-she , “[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry if [I]0-i have offended [him]2216-the general . It was the last thing [I]0-i would willingly have done . But do not be unhappy , [Eleanor]143-eleanor . An engagement , [you]76-catherine know , must be kept . [I]0-i am only sorry it was not recollected sooner , that [I]0-i might have written [home]482-home . But it is of very little consequence . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hope , [I]0-i earnestly hope , that to [your]76-catherine real safety it will be of none ; but to everything else it is of the greatest consequence : to comfort , appearance , propriety , to [[your]76-catherine family]1476-your family , to [the world]215-the world . Were [[your]76-catherine friends]1593-your friends , [the Allens]106-the allens , still in [Bath]6-bath , [you]76-catherine might go to [them]1593-your friends with comparative ease ; a few hours would take [you]76-catherine [there]1848-there ; but a journey of seventy miles , to be taken post by [you]76-catherine , at [your]76-catherine age , alone , unattended ! ” “[76-catherine] Oh , the journey is nothing . Do not think about that . And if [we]1595-they are to part , a few hours sooner or later , [you]76-catherine know , makes no difference . [I]0-i can be ready by seven . Let [me]0-i be called in time . ” [Eleanor]143-eleanor saw that [she]3238-her wished to be alone ; and believing it better for [each]670-each that [they]1595-they should avoid any further conversation , now left [her]3238-her with , “[0-i] [I]0-i shall see [you]76-catherine in the morning . ” [Catherine]76-catherine ’s swelling heart needed relief . In [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s presence friendship and pride had equally restrained [her]3238-her tears , but no sooner was [she]3238-her gone than they burst forth in torrents . Turned from [the house]238-the house , and in such a way ! without any reason that could justify , any apology that could atone for the abruptness , the rudeness , nay , the insolence of it . [Henry]95-henry at a distance — not able even to bid [him]95-henry farewell . Every hope , every expectation from [him]95-henry suspended , at least , and who could say how long ? Who could say when [they]1595-they might meet again ? And all this by [such a man as [General Tilney]139-general tilney]3241-such a man as general tilney , so polite , so well bred , and heretofore so particularly fond of [her]3238-her ! it was as incomprehensible as it was mortifying and grievous . From what it could arise , and where it would end , were considerations of equal perplexity and alarm . The manner in which it was done so grossly uncivil , hurrying [her]3238-her away without any reference to [her]3238-her own convenience , or allowing [her]3238-her even the appearance of choice as to the time or mode of [her]3238-her travelling ; of two days , the earliest fixed on , and of that almost the earliest hour , as if resolved to have [her]3238-her gone before [he]95-henry was stirring in the morning , that [he]95-henry might not be obliged even to see [her]3238-her . What could all this mean but an intentional affront ? By some means or other [she]3238-her must have had the misfortune to offend [him]95-henry . [Eleanor]143-eleanor had wished to spare [her]3238-her from so painful a notion , but [Catherine]76-catherine could not believe it possible that any injury or any misfortune could provoke such ill will against [a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it]3242-a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it . Heavily passed the night . Sleep , or repose that deserved the name of sleep , was out of the question . [That room]2910-that room , in which [her]3238-her disturbed imagination had tormented [her]3238-her on [her]3238-her first arrival , was again the scene of agitated spirits and unquiet slumbers . Yet how different now the source of [her]3238-her inquietude from what it had been then — how mournfully superior in reality and substance ! [her]3238-her anxiety had foundation in fact , [her]3238-her fears in probability ; and with a mind so occupied in the contemplation of actual and natural evil , the solitude of [her]3238-her situation , the darkness of [[her]3238-her chamber]3228-her chamber , the antiquity of [the building]2650-the building , were felt and considered without the smallest emotion ; and though the wind was high , and often produced strange and sudden noises throughout [the house]238-the house , [she]3238-her heard it all as [she]3238-her lay awake , hour after hour , without curiosity or terror . Soon after six [Eleanor]143-eleanor entered [[her]3238-her room]2729-her room , eager to show attention or give assistance where it was possible ; but very little remained to be done . [Catherine]76-catherine had not loitered ; [she]3238-her was almost dressed , and [her]3238-her packing almost finished . The possibility of some conciliatory message from [the General]2216-the general occurred to [her]3238-her as [[his]2216-the general daughter]598-his daughter appeared . What so natural , as that anger should pass away and repentance succeed it ? And [she]3238-her only wanted to know how far , after what had passed , an apology might properly be received by [her]3238-her . But the knowledge would have been useless here ; it was not called for ; neither clemency nor dignity was put to the trial — [Eleanor]143-eleanor brought no message . Very little passed between [them]3250-they on meeting ; [each]670-each found [her]670-each greatest safety in silence , and few and trivial were the sentences exchanged while [they]3250-they remained [upstairs]1893-upstairs , [Catherine]76-catherine in busy agitation completing [her]3238-her dress , and [Eleanor]143-eleanor with more goodwill than experience intent upon filling the trunk . When everything was done [they]3250-they left [the room]1765-the room , [Catherine]76-catherine lingering only half a minute behind [[her]3238-her friend]1769-her friend to throw a parting glance on [every well - known , cherished object]3255-every well - known , cherished object , and went down to [the breakfast - parlour]2745-the breakfast - parlour , where breakfast was prepared . [She]3238-her tried to eat , as well to save [herself]3238-her from the pain of being urged as to make [[her]3238-her friend]1769-her friend comfortable ; but [she]3238-her had no appetite , and could not swallow many mouthfuls . The contrast between this and [her]3238-her last breakfast in [that room]2910-that room gave [her]3238-her fresh misery , and strengthened [her]3238-her distaste for everything before [her]3238-her . It was not four and twenty hours ago since [they]3250-they had met [there]1848-there to the same repast , but in circumstances how different ! with what cheerful ease , what happy , though false , security , had [she]3238-her then looked around [her]3238-her , enjoying everything present , and fearing little in future , beyond [Henry]95-henry ’s going to [Woodston]64-woodston for a day ! happy , happy breakfast ! for [Henry]95-henry had been [there]1848-there ; [Henry]95-henry had sat by [her]3238-her and helped [her]3238-her . These reflections were long indulged undisturbed by any address from [[her]3238-her companion]2014-her companion , who sat as deep in thought as [herself]3238-her ; and the appearance of [the carriage]2004-the carriage was the first thing to startle and recall them to the present moment . [Catherine]76-catherine ’s colour rose at the sight of it ; and the indignity with which [she]3238-her was treated , striking at that instant on [her]3238-her mind with peculiar force , made [her]3238-her for a short time sensible only of resentment . [Eleanor]143-eleanor seemed now impelled into resolution and speech . “[0-i] [You]1596-her _ must _ write to [me]0-i , [Catherine]76-catherine , ” [she]3238-her cried ; “[1596-her] [you]1596-her _ must _ let [me]0-i hear from [you]1596-her as soon as possible . Till [I]0-i know [you]1596-her to be safe at [home]482-home , [I]0-i shall not have an hour ’s comfort . For _ one _ letter , at all risks , all hazards , [I]0-i must entreat . Let [me]0-i have the satisfaction of knowing that [you]1596-her are safe at [Fullerton]4-fullerton , and have found [[your]1596-her family]1476-your family well , and then , till [I]0-i can ask for [your]1596-her correspondence as [I]0-i ought to do , [I]0-i will not expect more . Direct to [me]0-i at [[Lord Longtown]185-lord longtown ’s]1568-lord longtown ’s , and , [I]0-i must ask it , under cover to [Alice]186-alice . ” “[143-eleanor] No , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , if [you]1596-her are not allowed to receive a letter from [me]0-i , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i had better not write . There can be no doubt of [my]0-i getting [home]482-home safe . ” [Eleanor]143-eleanor only replied , “[0-i] [I]0-i can not wonder at [your]1596-her feelings . [I]0-i will not importune [you]1596-her . [I]0-i will trust to [your]1596-her own kindness of heart when [I]0-i am at a distance from [you]1596-her . ” But this , with the look of sorrow accompanying it , was enough to melt [Catherine]76-catherine ’s pride in a moment , and [she]1596-her instantly said , “[0-i] Oh , [Eleanor]143-eleanor , [I]0-i _ will _ write to [you]143-eleanor indeed . ” There was yet another point which [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney was anxious to settle , though somewhat embarrassed in speaking of . It had occurred to [her]1596-her that after so long an absence from [home]482-home , [Catherine]76-catherine might not be provided with money enough for the expenses of [her]1596-her journey , and , upon suggesting it to [her]1596-her with most affectionate offers of accommodation , it proved to be exactly the case . [Catherine]76-catherine had never thought on the subject till that moment , but , upon examining [her]1596-her purse , was convinced that but for this kindness of [[her]1596-her friend]1769-her friend , [she]1596-her might have been turned from [the house]238-the house without even the means of getting [home]482-home ; and the distress in which [she]1596-her must have been thereby involved filling the minds of both , scarcely another word was said by either during the time of [their]3267-their remaining together . Short , however , was that time . [The carriage]2004-the carriage was soon announced to be ready ; and [Catherine]76-catherine , instantly rising , a long and affectionate embrace supplied the place of language in bidding [each other]1792-each other adieu ; and , as [they]3267-their entered [the hall]2659-the hall , unable to leave [the house]238-the house without some mention of [one whose name had not yet been spoken by either]3272-one whose name had not yet been spoken by either , [she]1596-her paused a moment , and with quivering lips just made it intelligible that [she]1596-her left “[1601-her] [her]1601-her kind remembrance for [[her]1601-her absent friend]1602-her absent friend . ” But with this approach to [his]1769-her friend name ended all possibility of restraining [her]1596-her feelings ; and , hiding [her]1596-her face as well as [she]1596-her could with [her]1596-her handkerchief , [she]1596-her darted across [the hall]2659-the hall , jumped into the chaise , and in a moment was driven from the door . CHAPTER 29 [Catherine]76-catherine was too wretched to be fearful . The journey in itself had no terrors for [her]1596-her ; and [she]1596-her began it without either dreading its length or feeling its solitariness . Leaning back in one corner of [the carriage]2004-the carriage , in a violent burst of tears , [she]1596-her was conveyed some miles beyond the walls of [the abbey]1248-the abbey before [she]1596-her raised [her]1596-her head ; and the highest point of ground within [the park]2781-the park was almost closed from [her]1596-her view before [she]1596-her was capable of turning [her]1596-her eyes towards [it]2781-the park . Unfortunately , [the road [she]1596-her now travelled]3277-the road she now travelled was the same which only ten days ago [she]1596-her had so happily passed along in going to and from [Woodston]64-woodston ; and , for fourteen miles , every bitter feeling was rendered more severe by the review of objects on which [she]1596-her had first looked under impressions so different . Every mile , as it brought [her]1596-her nearer [Woodston]64-woodston , added to [her]1596-her sufferings , and when within the distance of five , [she]1596-her passed the turning which led to [it]2781-the park , and thought of [Henry]95-henry , so near , yet so unconscious , [her]1596-her grief and agitation were excessive . The day which [she]1596-her had spent at [that place]3278-that place had been one of the happiest of [her]1596-her life . It was there , it was on that day , that [the General]2216-the general had made use of such expressions with regard to [Henry]95-henry and [herself]1596-her , had so spoken and so looked as to give [her]1596-her the most positive conviction of [his]95-henry actually wishing [their]3280-their marriage . Yes , only ten days ago had [he]95-henry elated [her]1596-her by [his]95-henry pointed regard — had [he]95-henry even confused [her]1596-her by [his]95-henry too significant reference ! and now — what had [she]1596-her done , or what had [she]1596-her omitted to do , to merit such a change ? The only offence against [him]95-henry of which [she]1596-her could accuse [herself]1596-her had been such as was scarcely possible to reach [his]95-henry knowledge . [Henry]95-henry and [her]1596-her own heart only were privy to the shocking suspicions which [she]1596-her had so idly entertained ; and equally safe did [she]1596-her believe [her]1596-her secret with each . Designedly , at least , [Henry]95-henry could not have betrayed [her]1596-her . If , indeed , by any strange mischance [[his]95-henry father]2286-his father should have gained intelligence of what [she]1596-her had dared to think and look for , of [her]1596-her causeless fancies and injurious examinations , [she]1596-her could not wonder at any degree of [his]95-henry indignation . If aware of [her]1596-her having viewed [him]95-henry as [a murderer]3282-a murderer , [she]1596-her could not wonder at [his]95-henry even turning [her]1596-her from [[his]95-henry house]3283-his house . But a justification so full of torture to [herself]1596-her , [she]1596-her trusted , would not be in [his]95-henry power . Anxious as were all [her]1596-her conjectures on this point , it was not , however , the one on which [she]1596-her dwelt most . There was a thought yet nearer , a more prevailing , more impetuous concern . How [Henry]95-henry would think , and feel , and look , when [he]95-henry returned on the morrow to [Northanger]62-northanger and heard of [her]1596-her being gone , was a question of force and interest to rise over every other , to be never ceasing , alternately irritating and soothing ; it sometimes suggested the dread of [his]95-henry calm acquiescence , and at others was answered by the sweetest confidence in [his]95-henry regret and resentment . To [the General]2216-the general , of course , [he]95-henry would not dare to speak ; but to [Eleanor]143-eleanor — what might [he]95-henry not say to [Eleanor]143-eleanor about [her]1596-her ? In this unceasing recurrence of doubts and inquiries , on any one article of which [her]1596-her mind was incapable of more than momentary repose , the hours passed away , and [her]1596-her journey advanced much faster than [she]1596-her looked for . The pressing anxieties of thought , which prevented [her]1596-her from noticing anything before [her]1596-her , when once beyond [the neighbourhood of [Woodston]64-woodston]3285-the neighbourhood of woodston , saved [her]1596-her at the same time from watching [her]1596-her progress ; and though no object on [the road]645-the road could engage a moment ’s attention , [she]1596-her found no stage of it tedious . From this , [she]1596-her was preserved too by another cause , by feeling no eagerness for [her]1596-her journey ’s conclusion ; for to return in such a manner to [Fullerton]4-fullerton was almost to destroy the pleasure of a meeting with those [she]1596-her loved best , even after an absence such as [hers]1596-her — an eleven weeks ’ absence . What had [she]1596-her to say that would not humble [herself]1596-her and pain [[her]1596-her family]1735-her family , that would not increase [her]1596-her own grief by the confession of it , extend an useless resentment , and perhaps involve [the innocent]3288-the innocent with [the guilty]3289-the guilty in undistinguishing ill will ? [She]1596-her could never do justice to [Henry]95-henry and [Eleanor]143-eleanor ’s merit ; [she]1596-her felt it too strongly for expression ; and should a dislike be taken against [them]3290-them , should [they]3290-them be thought of unfavourably , on [[their]3290-them father]2482-their father ’s account , it would cut [her]1596-her to the heart . With these feelings , [she]1596-her rather dreaded than sought for the first view of that well - known spire which would announce [her]1596-her within twenty miles of [home]482-home . Salisbury [she]1596-her had known to be [her]1596-her point on leaving [Northanger]62-northanger ; but after the first stage [she]1596-her had been indebted to [the post - masters]3293-the post - masters for the names of the places which were then to conduct [her]1596-her to [it]3294-it ; so great had been [her]1596-her ignorance of [her]1596-her route . [She]1596-her met with nothing , however , to distress or frighten [her]1596-her . [Her]1596-her youth , civil manners , and liberal pay procured [her]1596-her all the attention that [a traveller]3295-a traveller like [herself]1596-her could require ; and stopping only to change horses , [she]1596-her travelled on for about eleven hours without accident or alarm , and between six and seven o’clock in the evening found [herself]1596-her entering [Fullerton]4-fullerton . [A heroine]248-a heroine returning , at the close of [her]1596-her career , to [[her]1596-her native village]3297-her native village , in all the triumph of recovered reputation , and all the dignity of [a countess]3298-a countess , with a long train of noble relations in [[their]3293-the post - masters several phaetons]3299-their several phaetons , and three waiting - maids in a travelling chaise and four , behind [her]1596-her , is an event on which the pen of [the contriver]3300-the contriver may well delight to dwell ; it gives credit to every conclusion , and [the author]197-the author must share in the glory [she]197-the author so liberally bestows . But [my]1601-her affair is widely different ; [I]1601-her bring back [[my]1601-her heroine]2201-my heroine to [[her]2201-my heroine home]3303-her home in solitude and disgrace ; and no sweet elation of spirits can lead [me]1601-her into minuteness . [A heroine in a hack post - chaise]3304-a heroine in a hack post - chaise is such a blow upon sentiment , as no attempt at grandeur or pathos can withstand . Swiftly therefore shall [her]1596-her post - boy drive through [the village]1713-the village , amid the gaze of [Sunday groups]187-sunday groups , and speedy shall be [her]1596-her descent from [it]1713-the village . But , whatever might be the distress of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s mind , as [she]1596-her thus advanced towards [the parsonage]3133-the parsonage , and whatever the humiliation of [[her]1596-her biographer]3307-her biographer in relating it , [she]1596-her was preparing enjoyment of no everyday nature for those to whom [she]1596-her went ; first , in the appearance of [[her]1596-her carriage]3308-her carriage — and secondly , in [herself]1596-her . The chaise of [a traveller]3295-a traveller being a rare sight in [Fullerton]4-fullerton , [the whole family]3310-the whole family were immediately at the window ; and to have it stop at the sweep - gate was a pleasure to brighten every eye and occupy every fancy — a pleasure quite unlooked for by all but [the two youngest children]3311-the two youngest children , [a boy]3312-a boy and [girl of six and four years old]3313-girl of six and four years old , who expected [a brother or sister]3314-a brother or sister in [every carriage]3315-every carriage . Happy the glance that first distinguished [Catherine]76-catherine ! happy the voice that proclaimed the discovery ! but whether such happiness were the lawful property of [George]91-george or [Harriet]188-harriet could never be exactly understood . [[Her]1596-her father]205-her father , [mother]206-mother , [Sarah]79-sarah , [George]91-george , and [Harriet]188-harriet , all assembled at the door to welcome [her]1596-her with affectionate eagerness , was a sight to awaken the best feelings of [Catherine]76-catherine ’s heart ; and in the embrace of each , as [she]1596-her stepped from [the carriage]2004-the carriage , [she]1596-her found [herself]1596-her soothed beyond anything that [she]1596-her had believed possible . So surrounded , so caressed , [she]1596-her was even happy ! in the joyfulness of family love everything for a short time was subdued , and the pleasure of seeing [her]1596-her , leaving [them]3319-they at first little leisure for calm curiosity , [they]3319-they were all seated round the tea - table , which [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland had hurried for the comfort of [the poor traveller , whose pale and jaded looks soon caught [her]1596-her notice , before any inquiry so direct as to demand a positive answer was addressed to [her]1596-her]3320-the poor traveller , whose pale and jaded looks soon caught her notice , before any inquiry so direct as to demand a positive answer was addressed to her . Reluctantly , and with much hesitation , did [she]1596-her then begin what might perhaps , at the end of half an hour , be termed , by the courtesy of [[her]1596-her hearers]3321-her hearers , an explanation ; but scarcely , within that time , could [they]3319-they at all discover the cause , or collect the particulars , of [her]1596-her sudden return . [They]3319-they were far from being [an irritable race]3322-an irritable race ; far from any quickness in catching , or bitterness in resenting , affronts : but here , when the whole was unfolded , was an insult not to be overlooked , nor , for the first half hour , to be easily pardoned . Without suffering any romantic alarm , in the consideration of [[their]3319-they daughter]2533-their daughter ’s long and lonely journey , [Mr.]3324-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland could not but feel that it might have been productive of much unpleasantness to [her]1596-her ; that it was what [they]3319-they could never have voluntarily suffered ; and that , in forcing [her]1596-her on such a measure , [General Tilney]139-general tilney had acted neither honourably nor feelingly — neither as [a gentleman]1839-a gentleman nor as [a parent]3326-a parent . Why [he]139-general tilney had done it , what could have provoked [him]139-general tilney to such a breach of hospitality , and so suddenly turned all [his]139-general tilney partial regard for [[their]3319-they daughter]2533-their daughter into actual ill will , was a matter which [they]3319-they were at least as far from divining as [Catherine]76-catherine [herself]76-catherine ; but it did not oppress [them]3319-they by any means so long ; and , after a due course of useless conjecture , that “[1601-her] it was a strange business , and that [he]1603-he must be [a very strange man]1604-a very strange man , ” grew enough for all [their]3319-they indignation and wonder ; though [Sarah]79-sarah indeed still indulged in the sweets of incomprehensibility , exclaiming and conjecturing with youthful ardour . “[1603-he] [[My]0-i dear]253-my dear , [you]253-my dear give [yourself]253-my dear a great deal of needless trouble , ” said [[her]79-sarah mother]211-her mother at last ; “[253-my dear] depend upon it , it is something not at all worth understanding . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can allow for [his]1603-he wishing [Catherine]76-catherine away , when [he]1603-he recollected this engagement , ” said [Sarah]79-sarah , “[253-my dear] but why not do it civilly ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry for [the young people]2472-the young people , ” returned [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland ; “[0-i] [they]2472-the young people must have a sad time of it ; but as for anything else , it is no matter now ; [Catherine]76-catherine is safe at [home]482-home , and [our]1608-our comfort does not depend upon [General Tilney]139-general tilney . ” [Catherine]76-catherine sighed . “[139-general tilney] Well , ” continued [[her]253-my dear philosophic mother]3329-her philosophic mother , “[139-general tilney] [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i did not know of [your]76-catherine journey at the time ; but now it is all over , perhaps there is no great harm done . It is always good for [young people]478-young people to be put upon exerting [themselves]478-young people ; and [you]76-catherine know , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear [Catherine]76-catherine , [you]76-catherine always were [a sad little scatter - brained creature]1611-a sad little scatter - brained creature ; but now [you]76-catherine must have been forced to have [your]76-catherine wits about [you]76-catherine , with so much changing of chaises and so forth ; and [I]0-i hope it will appear that [you]76-catherine have not left anything behind [you]76-catherine in any of the pockets . ” [Catherine]76-catherine hoped so too , and tried to feel an interest in [her]253-my dear own amendment , but [her]253-my dear spirits were quite worn down ; and , to be silent and alone becoming soon [her]253-my dear only wish , [she]253-my dear readily agreed to [[her]253-my dear mother]211-her mother ’s next counsel of going early to bed . [[Her]253-my dear parents]3331-her parents , seeing nothing in [her]253-my dear ill looks and agitation but the natural consequence of mortified feelings , and of the unusual exertion and fatigue of such a journey , parted from [her]253-my dear without any doubt of [their]3331-her parents being soon slept away ; and though , when [they]3331-her parents all met the next morning , [her]253-my dear recovery was not equal to [their]3331-her parents hopes , [they]3331-her parents were still perfectly unsuspicious of there being any deeper evil . [They]3331-her parents never once thought of [her]253-my dear heart , which , for [the parents of [a young lady of seventeen]3333-a young lady of seventeen , just returned from [her]253-my dear first excursion from [home]482-home]3332-the parents of a young lady of seventeen , just returned from her first excursion from home , was odd enough ! As soon as breakfast was over , [she]253-my dear sat down to fulfil [her]253-my dear promise to [Miss Tilney]92-miss tilney , whose trust in the effect of time and distance on [[her]253-my dear friend]1769-her friend ’s disposition was already justified , for already did [Catherine]76-catherine reproach [herself]76-catherine with having parted from [Eleanor]143-eleanor coldly , with having never enough valued [her]253-my dear merits or kindness , and never enough commiserated [her]253-my dear for what [she]253-my dear had been yesterday left to endure . The strength of these feelings , however , was far from assisting [her]253-my dear pen ; and never had it been harder for [her]253-my dear to write than in addressing [Eleanor Tilney]143-eleanor . To compose a letter which might at once do justice to [her]253-my dear sentiments and [her]253-my dear situation , convey gratitude without servile regret , be guarded without coldness , and honest without resentment — a letter which [Eleanor]143-eleanor might not be pained by the perusal of — and , above all , which [she]253-my dear might not blush [herself]253-my dear , if [Henry]95-henry should chance to see , was an undertaking to frighten away all [her]253-my dear powers of performance ; and , after long thought and much perplexity , to be very brief was all that [she]253-my dear could determine on with any confidence of safety . The money therefore which [Eleanor]143-eleanor had advanced was enclosed with little more than grateful thanks , and the thousand good wishes of [a most affectionate heart]3336-a most affectionate heart . “[88-mrs. allen] This has been a strange acquaintance , ” observed [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland , as the letter was finished ; “[88-mrs. allen] soon made and soon ended . [I]0-i am sorry it happens so , for [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen thought [[them]1612-them very pretty kind of [young people]478-young people]1613-them very pretty kind of young people ; and [you]1615-you were sadly out of luck too in [your]1615-you Isabella . Ah ! poor [James]105-james ! well , [we]1616-we must live and learn ; and [the next new friends [you]1615-you make [I]0-i hope]1617-the next new friends you make i hope will be better worth keeping . ” [Catherine]76-catherine coloured as [she]253-my dear warmly answered , “[0-i] [No friend]1618-no friend can be better worth keeping than [Eleanor]143-eleanor . ” “[143-eleanor] If so , [[my]0-i dear]253-my dear , [I]0-i dare say [you]253-my dear will meet again some time or other ; do not be uneasy . It is ten to one but [you]253-my dear are thrown together again in the course of a few years ; and then what a pleasure it will be ! ” [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland was not happy in [her]80-mrs. morland attempt at consolation . The hope of meeting again in the course of a few years could only put into [Catherine]76-catherine ’s head what might happen within that time to make a meeting dreadful to [her]253-my dear . [She]253-my dear could never forget [Henry Tilney]95-henry , or think of [him]95-henry with less tenderness than [she]253-my dear did at that moment ; but [he]95-henry might forget [her]253-my dear ; and in that case , to meet — ! [her]253-my dear eyes filled with tears as [she]253-my dear pictured [her]253-my dear acquaintance so renewed ; and [[her]253-my dear mother]211-her mother , perceiving [her]211-her mother comfortable suggestions to have had no good effect , proposed , as another expedient for restoring [her]211-her mother spirits , that [they]1620-we should call on [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen . [The two houses]3338-the two houses were only a quarter of a mile apart ; and , as [they]1620-we walked , [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland quickly dispatched all that [she]80-mrs. morland felt on the score of [James]105-james ’s disappointment . “[1620-we] [We]1620-we are sorry for [him]1621-him , ” said [she]80-mrs. morland ; “[1620-we] but otherwise there is no harm done in the match going off ; for it could not be a desirable thing to have [him]1621-him engaged to [a girl whom [we]1620-we had [not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune]1623-not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune]1622-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune ; and now , after such behaviour , [we]1620-we can not think at all well of [her]1622-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune . Just at present it comes hard to poor [James]105-james ; but that will not last forever ; and [I]0-i dare say [he]1621-him will be [a discreeter man]1624-a discreeter man all [his]1621-him life , for the foolishness of [his]1621-him first choice . ” This was just such a summary view of the affair as [Catherine]76-catherine could listen to ; another sentence might have endangered [her]80-mrs. morland complaisance , and made [her]80-mrs. morland reply less rational ; for soon were all [her]80-mrs. morland thinking powers swallowed up in the reflection of [her]80-mrs. morland own change of feelings and spirits since last [she]80-mrs. morland had trodden [that well - known road]3339-that well - known road . It was not three months ago since , wild with joyful expectation , [she]80-mrs. morland had there run backwards and forwards some ten times a day , with an heart light , gay , and independent ; looking forward to pleasures untasted and unalloyed , and free from the apprehension of evil as from the knowledge of it . Three months ago had seen [her]80-mrs. morland all this ; and now , how altered [a being]3340-a being did [she]80-mrs. morland return ! [She]80-mrs. morland was received by [the Allens]3341-the allens with all the kindness which [her]80-mrs. morland unlooked - for appearance , acting on a steady affection , would naturally call forth ; and great was [their]3341-the allens surprise , and warm [their]3341-the allens displeasure , on hearing how [she]80-mrs. morland had been treated — though [Mrs. Morland]80-mrs. morland ’s account of it was no inflated representation , no studied appeal to [their]3341-the allens passions . “[76-catherine] [Catherine]76-catherine took [us]1625-us quite by surprise yesterday evening , ” said [she]80-mrs. morland . “[76-catherine] [She]1626-her travelled all the way post by [herself]1626-her , and knew nothing of coming till Saturday night ; for [General Tilney]139-general tilney , from some odd fancy or other , all of a sudden grew tired of having [her]1626-her [there]1848-there , and almost turned [her]1626-her out of [the house]238-the house . Very unfriendly , certainly ; and [he]139-general tilney must be [a very odd man]1629-a very odd man ; but [we]1625-us are so glad to have [her]1626-her amongst [us]1625-us again ! and it is a great comfort to find that [she]1626-her is not a poor helpless creature , but can shift very well for [herself]1626-her . ” [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen expressed [himself]85-mr. allen on the occasion with the reasonable resentment of [a sensible friend]3342-a sensible friend ; and [Mrs. Allen]88-mrs. allen thought [his]85-mr. allen expressions quite good enough to be immediately made use of again by [herself]88-mrs. allen . [His]85-mr. allen wonder , [his]85-mr. allen conjectures , and [his]85-mr. allen explanations became in succession [hers]88-mrs. allen , with the addition of this single remark—“I[2216-the general] really have not patience with [the General”—to]189-the general”—to fill up every accidental pause . And , “[0-i] [I]0-i really have not patience with [the General]2216-the general , ” was uttered twice after [Mr. Allen]85-mr. allen left [the room]1765-the room , without any relaxation of anger , or any material digression of thought .
